ValueDefinition.Name: AudioText
ValueDefinition.Description: A single audio text for this pool

ValueDefinition.Name: Group
ValueDefinition.Description: A group of audio texts for this pool

Property.Name: Position
Property.Description: A 3D world position

ValueDefinition.Name: Name
ValueDefinition.Description: Internal name of the asset

ValueDefinition.Name: WikiPage
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the page after https://wiki.related-designs.de/wiki/display/MMHO/

ValueDefinition.Name: Creator
ValueDefinition.Description: Creator of this profile

ValueDefinition.Name: CreationTime
ValueDefinition.Description: time when this asset was created

ValueDefinition.Name: Comments
ValueDefinition.Description: List of comments for this asset

ValueDefinition.Name: LastChangeUser
ValueDefinition.Description: user who made the last change

ValueDefinition.Name: LastChangeTime
ValueDefinition.Description: last time when this asset was changed

ValueDefinition.Name: ID
ValueDefinition.Description: ID used to identify this GUID. A constant int will be generated which can be used by programmers

ValueDefinition.Name: Comment
ValueDefinition.Description: Comment used to describe this asset

ValueDefinition.Name: InfoDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Description fluff of the object, used with [ToolOneHelper InfoDescription([RefGuid])]

ValueDefinition.Name: GraphViewConfig
ValueDefinition.Description: The GraphView config to use when opening this asset in the graph view

ValueDefinition.Name: OasisId
ValueDefinition.Description: This text is shown in the Infotip (Example: When you hover over a Governor Decision option, you see the infotip with a preview of the outcome/consequence of this decision).

ValueDefinition.Name: Text
ValueDefinition.Description: A single text for this pool

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: The probability that this text will be chosen.

ValueDefinition.Name: Group
ValueDefinition.Description: A group of texts for this pool

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: The probability that this group will be chosen. Inside the group every text has the same weight.

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: The probability that this pool will be chosen.

ValueDefinition.Name: Component
ValueDefinition.Description: The component where the location info gets pulled from. Needs to be part of the same Storyline!

ValueDefinition.Name: RestrictByParentLocations
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, any parent condition with a LocationFilter will narrow down the own allowed locations by only allowing the intersecting locations as a result

ValueDefinition.Name: WriteTagsForTargetLocation
TagTargetSession
ValueDefinition.Description: If a tag was set here, then the condition will tag one of the valid sessions (chosen at random!) at the time the condition is fulfilled with the given tag

ValueDefinition.Name: TagTargetArea
ValueDefinition.Description: If a tag was set here, then the condition will tag one of the valid areas (chosen at random!) at the time the condition is fulfilled with the given tag

ValueDefinition.Name: TagScope
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines if the tag from TagTargetSession and TagTargetArea is a global or storyline specific tag. If the scope is storyline, the tag will only exist inside the storyline and can only accessed from quest components inside that storyline. Will be ignored if the tag is empty.
If anything gets configured here tags will be created/overwritten with the resulting locations of the condition

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowAllLocations
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, all possible locations will be checked to find the set of locations that fulfill a condition

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowProcessingParticipantControlledAreas
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if all areas that are controlled by the processing participant are valid for the filter

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowProcessingParticipantEnteredSessions
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if all sessions that were entered by the processing participant are valid for the filter

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowProcessingSession
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if the processing session is valid for the filter. 'Processing' means that the code is being executed in context of this session. This hardly depends on the code flow and should only be used when you are sure about it. In doubt please ask GPP about your use case and if the correct processing session is set in that case

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowProcessingArea
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if the processing area is valid for the filter. Processing means that the code is being executed in context of this area. This hardly depends on the code flow and should only be used when you are sure about it. In doubt please ask GPP about your use case and if the correct processing area is set in that case

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowOwnComponentLocation
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if the location of the parent component of this LocationFilter should be a valid target

ValueDefinition.Name: FixLocations
SessionOrRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: A session or region asset that defines the locations where certain conditions/actions might work in
A list of sessions/regions that defines the locations where certain conditions/actions might work in

ValueDefinition.Name: ReadTaggedLocations
Tag
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the tag that was given to an area/session
A list of tagged sessions/areas that are valid locations for this asset

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectLocations
AddObjectAreas
ValueDefinition.Description: True if the areas of all objects should be added to the LocationFilter. False if the sessions of all objects should be added instead

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectFilter
ValueDefinition.Description: The ObjectFilter that defines the criteria for objects that should be referenced here
Allow locations of the given objects

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalLocationFilter
ValueDefinition.Description: In here you can define another location filter that will be combined with your previous one. The final result gives you all resulting locations that match all of your location filters combined

ValueDefinition.Name: ReadObjectLabelOrTag
ValueDefinition.Description: Object label of a single object or group label for a group of objects, may also be a quest system tag

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: finds all objects with this GUID (performance critical!)

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckObjectOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, either specify FilterObjectOwner or UseProcessingProfileForOwnerCheck to additionally check the owner of the objects

ValueDefinition.Name: UseProcessingProfileForOwnerCheck
ValueDefinition.Description: use together with ObjectGUID, only used if CheckObjectOwner is active

ValueDefinition.Name: FilterObjectOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: use together with ObjectGUID, only used if CheckObjectOwner and not UseProcessingProfileForOwnerCheck

ValueDefinition.Name: Island
ValueDefinition.Description: Labaled islands in the quest editor can be referenced here to get results with objects only in this areas

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectStates
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines what state the object should have set. Selecting multiple states here will check if the object has at least one of the states!

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectTypes
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the type of the objects we are looking for. E.g. Editorobject or Gameobject

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxObjectCount
ValueDefinition.Description: If > 0 this will set an upper limit for the number of filtered objects. Objects will be chosen at random from the filtered object list

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectLocations
ValueDefinition.Description: Narrows down the search for the Object. If "EmptyAutoCreateValue" is chosen, all locations are valid. If a "LocationFilter" is chosen, it is possible to further filter the objects. E.g. Only allow objects on a certain Island.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestComponentResultObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: Result objects are the objects that were needed in the last step of a quest, e.g. the ship that was required to deliver goods. Define the Quest Component where the objects will be requested from

ValueDefinition.Name: ExcludedObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to ObjectFilter, all objects defined by this filter will be excluded from the results of the current ObjectFilter

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestComponentExaminedObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: Examined objects are the objects that were inspected in a condition and met the requirements of it. Define the Quest Component where the objects will be requested from

ValueDefinition.Name: Matcher
ValueDefinition.Description: (Optional) Additional match criteria that every object has to meet in order for a valid outcome

ValueDefinition.Name: UseContextObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: If true and context objects are given, those will be used as input and only filtered down by the remaining settings of the ObjectFilter Currently only ItemsWithBoost support the socket object as context object.

ValueDefinition.Name: Object
ValueDefinition.Description: The object of interest.

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: The exact amount of objects. If this amount is set MinAmount and MaxAmount will be ignored.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: If Amount is not set, the amount will be generated randomly. This value defines the minimum.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: If Amount is not set, the amount will be generated randomly. This value defines the maximum.

ValueDefinition.Name: UseProcessingParticipantAsOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the processing participant will be the owner of the spawned object

ValueDefinition.Name: OwnerProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the owner of the spawned object. Will be ignored if UseProcessingParticipantAsOwner Is set to true

ValueDefinition.Name: VisualOwnerProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is not empty it will change the visual owner of the spawned object. i.e. the object looks as if it belongs to a different player. If not set, visual owner is the same as the real owner

ValueDefinition.Name: Asset
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as CargoAsset but more of that :)

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of goods for this entry

Property.Name: ParticipantRelation
Property.Description: Property that provides information on a source-target relation between two participants

ValueDefinition.Name: SourceIsOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the source participant should be the owner of this condition (in quests this would be the quest receiver)

ValueDefinition.Name: SourceProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: The participant that is the source of the relation (its state is checked against or of target)

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetIsOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the target participant should be the owner of this condition (in quests this would be the quest receiver)

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: The target participant of the relation

ValueDefinition.Name: TradingStationBringItem
ValueDefinition.Description: Which item needs to be brought to this Destination Target.

ValueDefinition.Name: TradingStationRetrieveItem
ValueDefinition.Description: The item that the player gets at this trading station

ValueDefinition.Name: TradingStationAllowedLayers
ValueDefinition.Description: Sets the path planner layers of ships that can complete the smuggle

ValueDefinition.Name: TradingStationAttackerObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines which ships should spawn at destination points and attack and pursue the player ship having the Quest Item onboard. Attacker spawn immediately after a new destination point has been activated. Attacker Objects despawn after the Quest completion.

ValueDefinition.Name: TradingStationAttackerMinDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the minimum distance from the destination object where the attacker ships will spawn.

ValueDefinition.Name: TradingStationAttackerMaxDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the maximum distance from the destination object where the attacker ships will spawn.

ValueDefinition.Name: OnTradingStationVisited
ValueDefinition.Description: Will be triggered when this trading station was reached and items were exchanged successfully

ValueDefinition.Name: Owner
ValueDefinition.Description: If anything is configured here, the owner of the objects/island will be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: ContextSession
ValueDefinition.Description: If anything is configured here, only the filtered sessions will be used. If neither sessions nor regions are configured, all loaded sessions will be used

ValueDefinition.Name: ContextRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: If anything is configured here, only the filtered regions will be used. If neither sessions nor regions are configured, all loaded sessions will be used

ValueDefinition.Name: Priorities
Context
Context
ValueDefinition.Description: Define how the context for this priority should be found. Will be ignored if any GUID is provided as preset below

ValueDefinition.Name: ContextPreset
ValueDefinition.Description: In case you use the same context multiple times, it might be smart to make a "preset asset" out of it, and use that preset for all spawn actions with the same context
Contexts can be either objects, islands, or sessions

ValueDefinition.Name: Location
DummyName
ValueDefinition.Description: If present, a dummy with this name will be searched, and if it exists, the dummy position will be used as spawn position

ValueDefinition.Name: UseContextPosition
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, "Distance" and blocking will be ignored. The Object will be spawned at the exact same position as the context object

ValueDefinition.Name: Min
ValueDefinition.Description: Exclusive. 0 meaning "exactly next to the context object"

ValueDefinition.Name: Max
ValueDefinition.Description: Inclusive. Must be larger than "MinDistance"

ValueDefinition.Name: StaticSpawnArea
ValueDefinition.Description: Static Spawn Areas are predefined areas by level art. Use "ConstructionArea" if you want to spawn anywhere on the island, or clarify with level art if you need special areas

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowedLocations
ValueDefinition.Description: At which border should of the map should the object spawn (or at map center?)

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceToLocation
Min
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum Distance to location

ValueDefinition.Name: Max
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum Distance to Location. Needs to be greater than "Min"
How far away from the location the spawnpoint should be
Locations define "where" to spawn at the context. Only configure one depending on the context type
Priorities will be checked from top to bottom. Each priority tries to find valid spawn positions, and if not enough were found the next priority will be used

ValueDefinition.Name: RelativeToQuestStart
ValueDefinition.Description: True: Counting from current condition start - False: Counting from 0.

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowAbsoluteValues
ValueDefinition.Description: If RelativeToQuestStart is set, this value defines if absolute or relative values should be shown

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowInvertedValues
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the player counter values shown in the questtracker should be inverted

ValueDefinition.Name: StartsAtZero
ValueDefinition.Description: If the PlayerCounter is referring to something that starts at zero when counting e.g. milestones, check this box so the Achievement will show the correct milestone.

ValueDefinition.Name: Type
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how we trigger a notification: "DefaultPamsy" - Will trigger the Pamsy for the left participant towards the player "Custom Pamsy" - A pamsy trigger and initiator + target needs to be configured and a NPC can react to the trigger and therefore talk "Custon Notification" - A notification asset needs to be configured which will be triggered when the screen opens and therefore a portrait can talk "None" - No character notification or pamsy will be triggered -> no portrait is talking

ValueDefinition.Name: CustomCharacterNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: If Type == CustomNotification. This character notificaiton will be triggered.

ValueDefinition.Name: CustomPamsyTrigger
ValueDefinition.Description: If Type == CustomPamsy. A pamsy with this trigger type will be triggered.

ValueDefinition.Name: CustomPamsyInitiator
ValueDefinition.Description: If Type == CustomPamsy. A pamsy with this initiator will be triggered. Inside a Decision some special Variables are possible: {ActiveEmperor, QuestAssignee, LeftParticipant, RightParticipant}

ValueDefinition.Name: CustomPamsyTarget
ValueDefinition.Description: If Type == CustomPamsy. A pamsy with this target will be triggered. Inside a Decision some special Variables are possible: {ActiveEmperor, QuestAssignee, LeftParticipant, RightParticipant}

ValueDefinition.Name: CustomPamsyContext
ValueDefinition.Description: If Type == CustomPamsy. A pamsy with this context will be triggered.

Property.Name: FloatVariableOrValue
Property.Description: Property that provides a value either as a plain value or through a variable

ValueDefinition.Name: FloatValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The value of the variable if this is a constant

ValueDefinition.Name: FloatVariableName
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is not empty the value of this variable will be get dynamically. If this is empty the FloatValue will be used. The VariableName needs to refer to a existing Variable!!!

ValueDefinition.Name: IntValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The value of the variable if this is a constant

ValueDefinition.Name: IntVariableName
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is not empty the value of this variable will be get dynamically. If this is empty the FloatValue will be used. The VariableName needs to refer to a existing Variable!!!

ValueDefinition.Name: BoolValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The value of the variable if this is a constant

ValueDefinition.Name: BoolVariableName
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is not empty the value of this variable will be get dynamically. If this is empty the FloatValue will be used. The VariableName needs to refer to a existing Variable!!!

ValueDefinition.Name: AssetValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The value of the variable if this is a constant

ValueDefinition.Name: AssetVariableName
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is not empty the value of this variable will be get dynamically. If this is empty the AssetValue will be used. The VariableName needs to refer to a existing Variable!!!

ValueDefinition.Name: StringValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The value of the variable if this is a constant

ValueDefinition.Name: StringVariableName
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is not empty the value of this variable will be get dynamically. If this is empty the StringValue will be used. The VariableName needs to refer to a existing Variable!!!

ValueDefinition.Name: Min
ValueDefinition.Description: Variable will be set to a random int value in [Min, Max], including both.

ValueDefinition.Name: Max
ValueDefinition.Description: Variable will be set to a random int value in [Min, Max], including both.

ValueDefinition.Name: Pool
ValueDefinition.Description: The variable will be set to one random entry from this pool.

ValueDefinition.Name: EntryNeedsToBeUnlocked
ValueDefinition.Description: If true one random unlocked entry of the pool is choosen. If no entry is unlocked the variable will benot changed!

ValueDefinition.Name: EntryNeedsToBeAnActiveParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: Chooses one random entry from the pool that also is a participant and currently in the game

ValueDefinition.Name: EntryNeedsToBeProducable
ValueDefinition.Description: Chooses one random entry of the pool that can be already produced by the player. The entries in the pool need to be goods for this to work!

ValueDefinition.Name: StartValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The final value is the StartValue * Modifier

ValueDefinition.Name: ModifierByProgressLevel
Factor
ValueDefinition.Description: Will be multiplicated with the StartValue
StartValue is multiplied with the Modifier from the entry of the Progress level of the processing participant (during quests its the quest assignee)

ValueDefinition.Name: SpecialValue
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the value for the variable.

Group.Name: ConditionObjectType - Do not configure default values here!

ValueDefinition.Name: Infolayer
ValueDefinition.Description: the infolayer icon above the quest object

ValueDefinition.Name: SelectOnJumpTo
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the object will automatically be selected when the jump-to is used

ValueDefinition.Name: ReadPrebuiltObjectLabelOrTag
ValueDefinition.Description: Objects will be looked up by this tag or label

ValueDefinition.Name: PrebuiltObjectCheckOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: Use together with PrebuiltObject to filter results by owner

ValueDefinition.Name: PrebuiltUseProcessingParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the owner should be resolved dynamically by code depending on the context of use

ValueDefinition.Name: PrebuiltObjectOwnerProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: Use together with PrebuiltObject to filter results by owner

ValueDefinition.Name: PrebuiltObjectSpecifiySession
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the session of the prebuilt object(s) should be specified

ValueDefinition.Name: PrebuiltObjectUseProcessingSession
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates that the processing session should be used as constraint for the prebuilt object(s). In quests this is the session where the quest is about to start.

ValueDefinition.Name: PrebuiltObjectSession
ValueDefinition.Description: Session guid that the prebuilt objects should be looked for in

ValueDefinition.Name: WritePrebuiltObjectTag
ValueDefinition.Description: All found prebuilt objects will be tagged with this text

ValueDefinition.Name: TagScope
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines if the tag from WriteObjectGroupTag is a global or storyline specific tag. If the scope is storyline, the tag will only exist inside the storyline and can only accessed from quest components inside that storyline. Will be ignored if the tag is empty.

ValueDefinition.Name: ExecutionObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Accepts Assets and AssetPools

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectOwnerProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: The owner of the spawned object

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnTiming
ValueDefinition.Description: Choose the time when these objects should be spawned during the quest

ValueDefinition.Name: DoSetVisualObjectOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, you will visually override the owner of the object, i.e. the object looks as if it belongs to a different player. If false, visual owner is the same as the real owner

ValueDefinition.Name: VisualObjectOwnerProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: Visually override the owner of the object, i.e. the object looks as if it belongs to a different player. If false, visual owner is the same as the real owner

ValueDefinition.Name: WriteObjectGroupTag
ValueDefinition.Description: If a text is given the spawned object will be added to a group with the text as tag. If the group did not exist before, it will be created

ValueDefinition.Name: TagScope
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines if the tag from WriteObjectGroupTag is a global or storyline specific tag. If the scope is storyline, the tag will only exist inside the storyline and can only accessed from quest components inside that storyline. Will be ignored if the tag is empty.

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectIsInvincible
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the object will be invincible

Group.Name: Conditions - Do not configure default values here!

ValueDefinition.Name: ActiveSession
ValueDefinition.Description: The session which has to be active. If no session is given then any session triggers this condition.

ValueDefinition.Name: ConditionActiveSessionUseActiveSession
ValueDefinition.Description: Will override ActiveSession

ValueDefinition.Name: BlueprintBuildingType
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is set to something other than Invalid GUID, it will only count the blueprints for that procided GUID

ValueDefinition.Name: CameraMovementDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance is in meters

ValueDefinition.Name: StartDistanceTrackingOnFirstEvaluation
ValueDefinition.Description: Should the distance of the camera action be tracked when the condition was evaluated for the first time or when the tracking for this participant started.

ValueDefinition.Name: VariableToCheck
ValueDefinition.Description: The variable we want to check. It needs to exist and be of the same type as the SecondVariable

ValueDefinition.Name: SecondVariable
ValueDefinition.Description: The second variable/constant we want to check against.

Property.Name: ConditionDiplomacyState

ValueDefinition.Name: IsProfile1QuestOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: When true, the profile1 is overriden by the quest owner

ValueDefinition.Name: Profile2
ValueDefinition.Description: The profile (or pool of profiles) to be compared against. If there is a pool of profiles given, the range property defines how these should be interpreted

ValueDefinition.Name: DesiredState
ValueDefinition.Description: The desired state between profile1 and profile2

Property.Description: Checks if the diplomacy state between two profiles equals a certain state

ValueDefinition.Name: DesiredSubState
ValueDefinition.Description: If not empty also the sub state need to match. Be careful to only configure valid state and substate combos (E.g. war and trade rights are not possible together)

ValueDefinition.Name: AllianceCount
ValueDefinition.Description: if != 0, counts active alliances of the participant

ValueDefinition.Name: TreatyCount
ValueDefinition.Description: if != 0, counts active treaties of the participant

ValueDefinition.Name: StartAmountTrackingOnFirstEvaluation
ValueDefinition.Description: Should the number of times the game pad action is pressed be tracked when the condition was evaluated for the first time or when the tracking for this participant started.

ValueDefinition.Name: GoodsInRangeType
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of goodsInRange check that should be performed. See Dataset entries for more information

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowKontors
ValueDefinition.Description: True if ships and kontors are valid to bring goods in range, False if only ships can do so

ValueDefinition.Name: InStorageGoods
ValueDefinition.Description: List of goods that are checked by the condition

ValueDefinition.Name: Product
ValueDefinition.Description: The product that gets checked

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of the product that needs to be reached

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckQuestAreaKontor
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, storage of all areas in <TargetAreas> will be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: IrrigatedModulesRange
ValueDefinition.Description: Select range of modules which should be irrigated. CAUTION: Farms without any modules will be ignored in this condition

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckNonIrrigated
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if you want to check the non-irrigated modules instead of the irrigated modules

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckCampaignIsActive
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the condition will check if the campaign is currently active. If false, the condition will check if the game was STARTED as a campaign game. In that case it doesn't matter if the campaign has been finished or not

Property.Name: ConditionIsDiscovered
Property.Description: Condition that checks whether a given participant has discovered another participant

ValueDefinition.Name: DLCAssetList
ValueDefinition.Description: List of DLCs that should be checked for activation

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The percentage of islands that is being checked

ValueDefinition.Name: FertilityContext
ValueDefinition.Description: can only support one fertility

ValueDefinition.Name: MultiplayerMode
ValueDefinition.Description: This condition will return true if the current game mode equals this choice here. If you want to know if we are playing a competitive MP match choose "CompetitiveMultiplayer" If you want to know if we are either singleplayer or Coop also use "CompetitiveMultilpayer" but negate the condition!

ValueDefinition.Name: InGameProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: Checks if a participant was selected in the game setup.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsObjectPaused
ValueDefinition.Description: True if you want to check for paused buildings, False otherwise

ValueDefinition.Name: IsPauseRangeOp
ValueDefinition.Description: Define which of the configured buildings need to match the paused state

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetItem
ValueDefinition.Description: Item (or pool of items) the player has to activate or to socket

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of items the player has to activate or to socket

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemNeedsActivation
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if the item nees to be equipped AND activated

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemCountCalculation
ValueDefinition.Description: Select how the item count should be calculated

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedsAllTargetItems
ValueDefinition.Description: If true and TargetItem is a pool, then ALL items from that pool need to be found for <ItemAmount> times. If false, then the sum of any pool item found needs to be at least <ItemAmount>

ValueDefinition.Name: SocketLocationCount
ValueDefinition.Description: If > 0, then the items need to be found in at least <SocketLocationCount> different locations, i.e. areas or game objects

Property.Name: ConditionModuleCount
Property.Description: Compares the current amount of modules built per building with a given percentage

ValueDefinition.Name: ModuleComparison
ValueDefinition.Description: The comparsion that should be used to compare the percentage of modules existing

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckAbsoluteCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether an absolute number of modules or a percentage of modules should be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: RestrictToMandatoryModules
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the absolute module count should be capped at the mandatory amount and ignore addional modules built for visuals

ValueDefinition.Name: ModulePercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The percentage (0 = 0%, 1 = 100%) of modules that the current amount should be compared to

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckIrrigatedModulesOnly
ValueDefinition.Description: ignores the module type and only checks for irrigated main modules!

ValueDefinition.Name: MonumentProgress
ValueDefinition.Description: uses the construction progress of a single stage as percental value [0..100]

ValueDefinition.Name: Radius
ValueDefinition.Description: an object is considered as at a target if its distance is less than this radius

ValueDefinition.Name: AllObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: is it sufficient to have one of the objects at one of the targets, or are all objects checked?

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlyOneTarget
ValueDefinition.Description: when all objects are checked, do they need to be at the same target object?

ValueDefinition.Name: ExpectObjectExists
ValueDefinition.Description: If existence is expected and the object does not exist, the quest will auto resolve. Otherwise it will wait until the object exists

ValueDefinition.Name: ExpectTargetExists
ValueDefinition.Description: If existence is expected and the target does not exist, the quest will fail. Otherwise it will wait until the target exists

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreSelectionBeforeActivation
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this condition needs the selection to happen _after_ it was activated (e.g. the parent condition was fulfilled). If false, previous selections also count

ValueDefinition.Name: WriteSelectedObjectsTag
ValueDefinition.Description: If any text is given the condition will tag the selected objects afterwards

ValueDefinition.Name: TagScope
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines if the tag from WriteSelectedObjectTag is a global or storyline specific tag. If the scope is storyline, the tag will only exist inside the storyline and can only accessed from quest components inside that storyline. Will be ignored if the tag is empty.

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredSelectedObjectCount
ValueDefinition.Description: If > 1, then that many objects that match the criteria of the condition need to be selected at once

ValueDefinition.Name: StagedPhotography
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this picture will be shown instead of the actual screenshot made by the player

ValueDefinition.Name: CircleAreaPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The percentage of the area that the circle around the object has in relation to the total screen space. Toggle quest hint cheat during photography quest to see details

ValueDefinition.Name: ScreenBorderPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The object has to be inside a smaller rectangle than the screen itself. This is the percentage of the area that is reduced from each border to define the inner rectangle

ValueDefinition.Name: PlayerCounter
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of this player counter

ValueDefinition.Name: Context
ValueDefinition.Description: The context info for the player counter. If MoneyGifted: put the Guid of the participant it was gifted to. If WorkforceDelat: put the Guid of the Workforce type.

ValueDefinition.Name: ContextAllowAny
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, all counters will be summed up, ignoring the context

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterContextEvaluation
ValueDefinition.Description: Only used when <ContextAllowAny> is set. Defines how counters with different context will be evaluated

ValueDefinition.Name: ComparisonOp
ValueDefinition.Description: The comparison operator for counter value and desired value

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The desired value the counter should match

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterScope
ValueDefinition.Description: The scope of the counter

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterScopeContext
ValueDefinition.Description: Context information for the counter scope, i.e. GUID of a region or session or GUID of an island asset

ValueDefinition.Name: SpecialCounterScopeSelection
ValueDefinition.Description: If configured, only a single scope matching the given criterium is singled out of all checked CounterScopes

ValueDefinition.Name: ReadTaggedLocation
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the tag that was given to an area/session

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterScopeContextUseProcessingContext
ValueDefinition.Description: Use the processing scope for this counter

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterScopeContextUseActiveSession
ValueDefinition.Description: Only used if Scope==Session! Indicates whether the session that is taken as context is the active session of the player. Only works if CounterScope is set to session!

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterScopeContextKeepFirstFound
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the first time this condition gets evaluated and a scope context was found it will be kept forever (e.g. You don't know in which session this coindition will be started, but once it was started it should keep looking in that session). Otherwise the scope context will be checked continuously (e.g. You want to keep checking in the given session, used for quest preconditions for example)

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterValueType
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines if the MIN the MAX or the CURRENT value should be returned.

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckSpecificParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, not the condition owner will be checked but the participant that is specified under <CheckedParticipant>

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckedProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: if <CheckSpecificParticipant> is true, then this defines the participant to check

ValueDefinition.Name: Good_CP
ValueDefinition.Description: The Good that should be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductivityRequired
ValueDefinition.Description: The required percentage of productivity

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductionRequired
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of production per minute of the required good

ValueDefinition.Name: EveryPoolMustBeRunning
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether every pool of the vector list should be running a quest. If false, the condition will be true if ANY quest pool is running a quest.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestPoolsToCheck
ValueDefinition.Description: The list of quest pools to check

ValueDefinition.Name: ResidentsBuildingRangeOP
ValueDefinition.Description: All Found Buildings need to reach the amount, any, or none?

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionToCheck
ValueDefinition.Description: Session to check season for. If empty all sessions will be checked.

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: A time limit for the timer.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsPaused
ValueDefinition.Description: True, when the timer is currently not ticking

ValueDefinition.Name: TimerID
ValueDefinition.Description: An ID by which the timer can be referenced from other conditions or actions.

ValueDefinition.Name: KeepTimerOnUnregister
ValueDefinition.Description: timer value is not reset when condition is unregistered

ValueDefinition.Name: CountComparisonOp
ValueDefinition.Description: Comparison operator the is used to check the current count, i.e. (CurrentGameValue) (ComparisonOPerator) (TradeRouteCount)

ValueDefinition.Name: FilterTradeRouteTransportationType
ValueDefinition.Description: Only routes with the given transportation type will be counted. Will be skipped if no flag is set

ValueDefinition.Name: FilterAssignedTradeRouteObjectOrPool
ValueDefinition.Description: Only routes with the given assigned objects will be counted. Will be skipped if no asset or pool is set

ValueDefinition.Name: FilterTradeRoutesWithoutWarnings
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, only trade routes without warnings will be counted

ValueDefinition.Name: FilterTradedGoods
ValueDefinition.Description: List of Products needed to be on this trade route. Will be ignored if empty. !Careful this could impact performance in big savegames!

ValueDefinition.Name: FilterTradeRouteStations
IslandByAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: A Island defined by an Island Asset. !Use either IslandByAsset, ReadIslandTag or Province per Station entry!

ValueDefinition.Name: ReadIslandTag
ValueDefinition.Description: An Island defined by a Tag !Use either IslandByAsset, ReadIslandTag or Province per Station entry!

ValueDefinition.Name: Province
ValueDefinition.Description: At least one station in this province is needed. !Use either IslandByAsset, ReadIslandTag or Province per Station entry!
List of stations which the trade route need to have.

ValueDefinition.Name: FilterTradeRouteStationCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Number of stations which the route needs to have. If =0 then this filter will be skipped

ValueDefinition.Name: RestrictByParentLocations
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, any location of a parent condition with location infos will be used as a required route station

ValueDefinition.Name: Priority
ValueDefinition.Description: If multiple of these conditions are active at the same time, only the highest priority would show a highlight.

ValueDefinition.Name: HintType
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of hint that should be displayed

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowedInputTypes
ValueDefinition.Description: Condition will be skipped if the active input mode is not checked here

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowScrollHintWhenOffscreen
ValueDefinition.Description: True = When the hinted object is offscreen, show a marked in that direction. False = Don't.

ValueDefinition.Name: TutorialConditionType
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of interaction that should be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: NegateTutorialConditionType
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the tutorial condition type should be negated to succeed (NOT selected, NOT visible, etc.)

ValueDefinition.Name: HintEndCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: The condition that has to be fulfilled to hide the hint

ValueDefinition.Name: HintDisplayTime
ValueDefinition.Description: The duration the hint should be displayed before it disappears automatically

ValueDefinition.Name: HintAnchor
ValueDefinition.Description: Describes the direction of the arrow pointing of to the tutorial element. The box will be positioned accordingly

ValueDefinition.Name: HeaderText
ValueDefinition.Description: An additional header text that can be shown in the ui hint box

ValueDefinition.Name: HintText
ValueDefinition.Description: The text that should be displayed in the ui hint box

ValueDefinition.Name: HintTextGamePad
ValueDefinition.Description: The text that should be displayed in the ui hint box in case we have a gamepad connected

ValueDefinition.Name: TutorialUiCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: The category of the tutorial that is used to reference phoenix objects

ValueDefinition.Name: RefGuid
ValueDefinition.Description: The RefGUID of the phoenix element that should be highlighted

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalRefGuids
ValueDefinition.Description: The additional RefGUID of the phoenix elements that should be highlighted

ValueDefinition.Name: PortraitProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: The profile asset of the portrait that should be displayed

ValueDefinition.Name: HidePortrait
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the speech bubble should have a portrait or not (false = show portrait)

ValueDefinition.Name: UIStateVisibleConditionFlow
ValueDefinition.Description: Configure additional screens here that are also part of the flow.

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockNeeded
ValueDefinition.Description: Can references anything that has the "Locked" Property. You can check the T9 entries (if it has the "DefaultLockedState" entry). There is also a DebugInfoPage, called "Unlock", that shows you a list of all locked things

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockRangeOperator
ValueDefinition.Description: If multiple unlocks are given as an argument (e.g. via AssetPool) then this attribute will check how the comparison is performed

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckUnlockForAllFirstParties
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this unlock asset will be checked for all first parties in the game

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckUnlockForAllSecondParties
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this unlock asset will be checked for all second parties in the game

ValueDefinition.Name: UseGlobalSum
ValueDefinition.Description: global attributes (knowledge, prestige, belief) can check their sum

ValueDefinition.Name: TechState
ValueDefinition.Description: The state the tech should be.

ValueDefinition.Name: TechGuid
ValueDefinition.Description: The guid you want to check

ValueDefinition.Name: IsAnyTechResearched
ValueDefinition.Description: Ignores all other settings and the condition will fulfill once any tech is or was reserached!

ValueDefinition.Name: IsAnyResearchInProgress
ValueDefinition.Description: Ignores all other settings and the condition will fulfill once any techis currently being researched

ValueDefinition.Name: IsVisible
ValueDefinition.Description: Set to false if this condition should not be highlighted on the tech tree (hidden quest)

Property.Name: ConditionTimeSinceIncident

ValueDefinition.Name: ElapsedTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Time that must have been elapsed since the last found incident to be true

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckAnyMajorIncident
ValueDefinition.Description: Priority 1 | If this is set the time since the last major incident will be checked. "CheckedIncident" and "CheckedIncidentType" will be ignored

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckedIncident
ValueDefinition.Description: Priority 2 | If this is set only this particular incident will be checked. "CheckedIncidentType" will be ignored.

Property.Description: Condition to check for incidents of the evaluation participant

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckedIncidentType
ValueDefinition.Description: Priority 3 | Check for the elapsed time of the last incident of this type

ValueDefinition.Name: InfectionType
ValueDefinition.Description: Type we want to check the objects for if they are infectable

ValueDefinition.Name: InfectionObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Objects we want to check for infectability

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckedAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount to check for

ValueDefinition.Name: ActiveIncidentType
ValueDefinition.Description: Priority 1 | If set all incidents of this type will be considered. "ActiveIncidentCategory" and "ActiveIncidentScale" will be ignored

ValueDefinition.Name: ActiveIncidentCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: Priority 2 | If set all incidents of this category will be considered. "ActiveIncidentScale" will be ignored.

ValueDefinition.Name: ActiveIncidentScale
ValueDefinition.Description: Priority 3 | If set all incidents of this scale will be considered

ValueDefinition.Name: PopulationLevels
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines which residences should be checked. Allowed are population level assets and population group assets as well as pools of those. If left empty, all residences will be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: Categories
ValueDefinition.Description: The need categories that should be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: CategoriesRangeOp
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how the category list should be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The target percentage fulfillment in a range of [0, 100] of a given need category

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetComparisonOp
ValueDefinition.Description: Operator that is used to compare for the target value: <runtime fulfillment value> <targetComparisonOp> <targetValue>

ValueDefinition.Name: ValueCalculation
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the way how the internal values are calculated.

ValueDefinition.Name: AddFakeMinimapPingsForCheckedObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: Adds minimap pings for objects that are used fulfill the condition. Currently only implemented for ValueCalculation = Max

ValueDefinition.Name: PatronGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: Condition becomes fulfilled if the current Participant of this Condition has this dominant patron

ValueDefinition.Name: OtherParticipantGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: Condition becomes fulfilled if this Participant has the same dominant patron as the current Participant of this Condition.

ValueDefinition.Name: AlsoWhenBelowThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The condition can also be fullfiled by a patron with most devotion even if below dominant threshold

ValueDefinition.Name: OtherAlsoWhenBelowThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The condition can also be fullfiled by a patron with most devotion even if below dominant threshold for participant we compare to

ValueDefinition.Name: ProviderGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: Participant for whom we resolved the contracts

ValueDefinition.Name: DesiredAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: Number of required contracts resolved for us

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeFrame
ValueDefinition.Description: Contracts older than this dont count anymore (0 means entire history counts)

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowedSpecialStates
ValueDefinition.Description: Which special state should the participant have with the emperor. Will be ignored if none is selected

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowedZones
ValueDefinition.Description: In which reputation zone should the participant be with the emperor. Will be ignored if none is selected

ValueDefinition.Name: UseCustomRange
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, a custom reputation range can be defined instead of the predefined zones

ValueDefinition.Name: CustomRangeLowerBound
ValueDefinition.Description: The lower bound of the custom range. Bound is included in this range! If UseCustomRange is true and the reputation is in [lowerBound; upperBound], this condition is true

ValueDefinition.Name: CustomRangeUpperBound
ValueDefinition.Description: The upper bound of the custom range. Bound is included in this range! If UseCustomRange is true and the reputation is in [lowerBound; upperBound], this condition is true

ValueDefinition.Name: ReligionAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: This condition will be true if all configured areas have this religion.

ValueDefinition.Name: RoadTypes
RoadGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: guid of this road type

ValueDefinition.Name: AddToPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: should this road type get added to the percentage?

ValueDefinition.Name: AddToCount
ValueDefinition.Description: should this road type get counted?
list all relevant road qualities here

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimalPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: Condition turns true if this percentage is achieved (put 0 to disable)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimalCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Condition turns true if this count is achieved (put 0 to disable)

ValueDefinition.Name: CustomIslandName
ValueDefinition.Description: The Island name set by the player we check against. If left empty we can basically check that the player did not enter a custom name

ValueDefinition.Name: EmperorParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: Condition will be true if this participant is the active emperor

ValueDefinition.Name: Pirate
ValueDefinition.Description: The Pirate (or AssetPool of Pirates) who started the Raid

ValueDefinition.Name: VictimParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The Participant (or AssetPool of Participants) that the raid is targeted towards (empty means processing participant)

ValueDefinition.Name: PirateRaidState
ValueDefinition.Description: Condition is true while the raid is ongoing / when the raid succeeded / when the raid was defended against

ValueDefinition.Name: LandRaid
ValueDefinition.Description: Should Landraids be considered for this condition

ValueDefinition.Name: SeaRaid
ValueDefinition.Description: Should Searaids be considered for this condition

ValueDefinition.Name: Needs
ValueDefinition.Description: The need or pool of needs that is checked for this condition

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedsRangeOp
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how the list of needs should be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: PopulationLevels
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines which residences should be checked. Allowed are population level assets and population group assets as well as pools of those. If left empty, all residences will be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The target percentage fulfillment in a range of [0, 100] of a given need

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetComparisonOp
ValueDefinition.Description: Operator that is used to compare for the target value: <runtime fulfillment value> <targetComparisonOp> <targetValue>

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: The number that we compare the found objects against

ValueDefinition.Name: ComparisonOp
ValueDefinition.Description: The operator to compare the number of objects with the <Amount>

ValueDefinition.Name: Session
ValueDefinition.Description: The session that should be checked. If no session is given then the global percentage will be calculated

ValueDefinition.Name: ComparisonOperator
ValueDefinition.Description: The operator to compare the number of objects with the <Amount>

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The percentage of the map that is compared against

ValueDefinition.Name: FailIfStartWithMapRevealed
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this condition fails when the game was started with revealed map setting

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetCoverageRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: The target ratio of modules / island space that we compare the current one against

ValueDefinition.Name: ComparisonOperator
ValueDefinition.Description: The operator to compare the coverage ratio of modules with <TargetCoverageRatio>

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetModuleOwners
ValueDefinition.Description: The module owner assets that are being checked

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The romanization value that is compared against

ValueDefinition.Name: ComparisonOperator
ValueDefinition.Description: The operator to compare the romanization value with the <TargetValue>

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckSessionValue
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if the session romanization value should be checked instead of the area value. Needs to be checked if any comparison mode is active and only a single session must be configured to be checked!

ValueDefinition.Name: Notification
ValueDefinition.Description: The notification that is being checked for

ValueDefinition.Name: Count
ValueDefinition.Description: Number of notifications that we want to count from the given type

ValueDefinition.Name: Count
ValueDefinition.Description: Number of objects in a selection group that we want to count

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckFullInventoryPurchase
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if it should be checked if the whole inventory was bought

ValueDefinition.Name: Count
ValueDefinition.Description: Number of inforcorners to be clicked

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The target participant for the comparison to the processing participant

ValueDefinition.Name: WarTypes
ValueDefinition.Description: The condition will fail if none of the selected war types is currently active

ValueDefinition.Name: WarStates
ValueDefinition.Description: The condition will fail if none of the selected war states is currently active from the perspective of the condition owner

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetWarScore
ValueDefinition.Description: The target score to be compared against

ValueDefinition.Name: WarScoreComparator
ValueDefinition.Description: The operator to compare the war score with <TargetWarScore>

ValueDefinition.Name: WarScoreTypes
ValueDefinition.Description: Types of possible war scores to test. All checked scores will be sumed up

ValueDefinition.Name: UseActiveScores
ValueDefinition.Description: If true active war score values will be used, otherwise only passive war score values will be used

ValueDefinition.Name: Needs
ValueDefinition.Description: Need(s) that will be checked for this condition. Residences are also possible and will take all configured needs from them. Pools are also allowed

ValueDefinition.Name: AllNeedsFromHighestTier
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, <Needs> will be ignored and instead all Needs from the highest tier of the inspected area will be taken

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedRange
ValueDefinition.Description: The range of needs required to fulfill this condition

ValueDefinition.Name: StartThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The satisfaction threshold at which goods starts being tracked

ValueDefinition.Name: EndThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The satisfaction threshold at which a tracked good fulfills the condition

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: Compares maintenance on island with x% of positive income on one island

ValueDefinition.Name: Good
ValueDefinition.Description: Condition will resolve if the given good can be produced by the condition owner. Produced means a building is unlocked that has this good as output. This needs to be an asset of type Product or any pool with Assets of type Product.

ValueDefinition.Name: PoolCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: If "Good" is an pool with products, this defines if all, any or none of the prodcuts need to be producible

Property.Name: Condition

ValueDefinition.Name: SubConditionCompletionOrder
ValueDefinition.Description: Parallel: All sub conditions can be solved at any time. Linear: The sub conditions have to be completed in order. Mutually Exclusive: Only one sub condition has to be completed and the sub conditions are solvable before the main condition.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsOptional
ValueDefinition.Description: Set to true, if it is not needed to satisfy this condition to satisfy the parent condition

ValueDefinition.Name: CountForAchievementProgress
ValueDefinition.Description: If true and part of an achievement condition, this condition will count towards the achievement progress

Property.Description: If true, this condition is used to

ValueDefinition.Name: ExecutionPlace
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is not set to anywhere, the objective will get another step where the player needs to go to the specified object to end the quest. (E.g. deliver proof)

ValueDefinition.Name: ExecutionPlaceFullText
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the full description text for this objective if it can be shown in a single line. Can include textsources with special replacement to achive dynamic text. (e.g. "Build houses 2 / 5").

ValueDefinition.Name: ExecutionPlaceHeadlineText
ValueDefinition.Description: If the objective text consists of several steps, this headline text will be shown first. TextHeadline and TextStep will replace TextFull in that case!

ValueDefinition.Name: ExecutionPlaceStepText
ValueDefinition.Description: If the objective text consists of several steps, this text will be shown for each step. TextHeadline and TextStep will replace TextFull in that case!

ValueDefinition.Name: ExecutionPlaceConfirmOnReached
ValueDefinition.Description: if true, triggers a message when goods are delivered that needs to be accepted to continue

ValueDefinition.Name: ExecutionPlaceInteractionWindow
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the QuestInteractionUI of the execution place.

ValueDefinition.Name: NegateCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: Negate the result (success/still checking) of this condition

ValueDefinition.Name: ComparisonMode
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines if and how a comparison should take place

ValueDefinition.Name: CompareToParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The participant that is being compared to

ValueDefinition.Name: DoRelativeCompare
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the offset will interpreted as procentual value of the comparison participant instead of an absolute value. 100 is being interpreted as 100% in that case E.g the offset is set to 50 and the comparing participant value is 20 then 10 is the absolute value that is compared to: 20 * 50% = 10

ValueDefinition.Name: CompareToRank
ValueDefinition.Description: The rank of all participants that is being compared to

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoRegisterTrigger
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if this trigger should be registered and evaluated on game start

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoSelfUnlock
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if this trigger should execute an unlock action on its own GUID when the conditions are fulfilled

ValueDefinition.Name: UsedByFirstParties
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this trigger will be created for all first party players (=human players)

ValueDefinition.Name: UsedBySecondParties
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this trigger will be created for all second party players (=Rivals)

ValueDefinition.Name: UsedByThirdParties
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this trigger will be created for _most_ third party players (= only traders, pirates and emperosr)

Property.Name: TriggerProgress
Property.Description: Actions that should be performed when progress of condition is changed by ProgressStep

Group.Name: ConditionObjectives - Do not configure default values here!

ValueDefinition.Name: VehicleLabel
ValueDefinition.Description: Which vehicle is moved? If left empty, the command vehicle needs to be moved by player command.

ValueDefinition.Name: VehicleDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Needed distance between vehicle and context object. If 0 the interaction distance of both objects will be used

ValueDefinition.Name: RangeIndicator
ValueDefinition.Description: The mesh of this asset will be used as a range indicator. Requirements: Has to be size of 1 and scalable to correctly show the range

ValueDefinition.Name: HoldPositionTimer
ValueDefinition.Description: If any time is configured here, the player needs to stay in the target position for the given time

ValueDefinition.Name: KeepHoldPositionTimerOnRadiusLeft
ValueDefinition.Description: If false, the timer will be reset to the original time when the radius was left, otherwise it will continue from the last remaining time

ValueDefinition.Name: HoldPositionTimerText
ValueDefinition.Description: The text that is displayed in the quest tracker to show the remianing time

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestCameraMovementDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance is in meters

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestStartDistanceTrackingOnFirstEvaluation
ValueDefinition.Description: Should the distance of the camera action be tracked when the condition was evaluated for the first time or when the tracking for this participant started.

ValueDefinition.Name: Asset
ValueDefinition.Description: A product or item or unit, or ship configuration that should be delivered. If it is a ship configuration the ship needs to have the same hull and at least the modules from the configuration (e.g. needs trireme and 1 archer, but its ok to have 2 archers)

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of this good. Can be a value or variable name

ValueDefinition.Name: Indefinite
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, Amount will be ignored and the goal is to deliver as many goods as possible

ValueDefinition.Name: DeliveryOutputVariable
ValueDefinition.Description: If the output amount is set to indefinite, the actually transferred amount of goods will be written to an int variable with this name to be used later on

ValueDefinition.Name: DeliveryType
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of delivery for this quest. See the dataset <GoodsInRangeType> for more information on the available options

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowKontorsToDeliver
ValueDefinition.Description: True if ships and kontors of the player are valid objects to deliver wares, False if only ships can deliver

ValueDefinition.Name: DeliveryExecutionPlace
ValueDefinition.Description: Depends on <DeliveryType> Ship: this will be the place where the goods need to be brought. Area: same as Meta but also the goods will be removed from the island storage of <DeliveryTargetArea> Meta: it will only be used for the selection reminder message AND only if not starter object is configured

ValueDefinition.Name: DeliveryTargetArea
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines an area where the goods should be removed from. If multiple areas are possible by the LocationFilter a random one will be chosen

ValueDefinition.Name: ConfirmOnReach
ValueDefinition.Description: if true, triggers a message when goods are delivered that needs to be accepted to continue

ValueDefinition.Name: DeliveryInteractionWindow
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the QuestInteractionWindow for this delivery objective.

ValueDefinition.Name: DestroyObjectsPrebuilt
ValueDefinition.Description: List of prebuilt objects that should be destroyed

ValueDefinition.Name: DestroyFinishObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the object that will spawn right at the place where the last destroy ship sunk. The object should have an infolayer and should be unsinkable.

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowShipToCancelMovementToDefendItself
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, the destroy object will cancel its movement commands when attacked and attack the attacker. If not, it will follow its movement command and onlty auto attack

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortObjects
EscortObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Which objects the player has to escort. Each List entry contains an exact amount of objects to escort.
Objects that will be spawned for this quest and need to be protected by the player

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortObjectsPrebuilt
ValueDefinition.Description: Objects that already exists in the gameworld and will be needed to protected by the player

ValueDefinition.Name: MinSurvivors
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the minimum amount of escorted ships that should survive, otherwise the Quest will fail.

ValueDefinition.Name: ContextAndLocation
ValueDefinition.Description: Additional info for spawning the EscortObjects. Defines where the objects will spawn

ValueDefinition.Name: Destinations
MoveDirection
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the target where the escorted ships move to. TargetObject will spawn a new object as destination. PrebuiltObject will use an existing object as destination. MapBoarder will use the opposite site map boarder as destination. PlayerKontor will use a random player kontor.

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Only Used if MoveDirection = TargetObject! Defines the target object where the escorted objects should move to. The Target Object will be newly spawned.

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: Only Used if MoveDirection = TargetObject! Defines the owner of the spawned target object

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetContextAndLocation
ValueDefinition.Description: Only Used if MoveDirection = TargetObject! The info where to spawn the target object the escort ships need to move to

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetObjectDespawn
ValueDefinition.Description: Only Used if MoveDirection = TargetObject!

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetObjectDamage
ValueDefinition.Description: Only Used if MoveDirection = TargetObject! Initial damage of target ships in percent [0..1]

ValueDefinition.Name: PrebuiltObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Only Used if MoveDirection = PrebuildObject! Defines the existing object the escort objects need to move to
Configuration where the EscortObjects will move after the quest started. If multiple entries are created in this vector they will be processed one after the other

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortObjectDamage
ValueDefinition.Description: Initial damage of escort ships in percent [0..1]

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortObjectDespawn
ValueDefinition.Description: The way how the escort object should despawn after the quest ended

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackerObjectDespawn
ValueDefinition.Description: The way how the attacker object should despawn after the quest ended

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackerObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines which objects should spawn and attack the escorted ship(s).

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackerList
ValueDefinition.Description: At list of attacker settings that are spawned during the escort quest

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnTime
ValueDefinition.Description: The time at which this attacker should spawn relativ to quest activation

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackerObjectList
ValueDefinition.Description: List of attacker objects that should be spawned at this time interval

ValueDefinition.Name: HasEndlessAttacker
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the escort will spawn attacker indefintely. This will be used after the last entry of the attacker list has been spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackerEndlessSpawn
ValueDefinition.Description: The attacker objects that should be spawned as endless attacker

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackerEndlessInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: The time interval at which the endless attacker should be regularly spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: MinAttackerDistanceFromObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum distance in tiles the attacker needs spawn away from escort objects

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxAttackerDistanceFromObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum distance in tiles the attacker needs spawn away from escort objects

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackerSpawnInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the interval after which the first and all following attacker waves will spawn. Attacker waves spawn until the escorted ship is destroyed or leaves the map.

ValueDefinition.Name: StarterFullText
ValueDefinition.Description: The single line objective text used when there is a ship nearby

ValueDefinition.Name: StarterHeadlineText
ValueDefinition.Description: The headline objective text used when there is a ship nearby

ValueDefinition.Name: StarterStepText
ValueDefinition.Description: The single step objective text used when there is a ship nearby

ValueDefinition.Name: StarterFullTextWithoutShip
ValueDefinition.Description: The single line objective text used when there is no ship nearby

ValueDefinition.Name: StarterHeadlineTextWithoutShip
ValueDefinition.Description: The headline objective text used when there is no ship nearby

ValueDefinition.Name: StarterStepTextWithoutShip
ValueDefinition.Description: The single step objective text used when there is no ship nearby

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetMapBorderFullText
ValueDefinition.Description: The full text version that is used when the destination is the map border

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetMapBorderHeadlineText
ValueDefinition.Description: The headline version that is used when the destination is the map border

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetMapBorderStepText
ValueDefinition.Description: The single step text version that is used when the destination is the map border

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedsShipInRange
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether there has to be a ship near the escort objects to be able to start the escort. Uses the "EscortBeginRadius" to check for ships nearby. Cannot be active at the same time as "StartImmediately"

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortBeginRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: The radius in what a player ship has to be to start the escort. In game, this is dynamic: 11 + colliderShipA + colliderShipB. It would be better if this was dynamically calculated, but we have not data about the colliders at the time of the check. So for now, a range of 32 should be sufficient for even the longest ships. Also note, that as of now, this value is never overwritten.

ValueDefinition.Name: StartImmediately
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the escort ship will start moving when the quests starts. If this is false it waits until the player activates the escort via the quest interaction window.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsReverseEscort
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the escort ships need to escort the player ship instead of the player ship escorts the quest ships. This will only work if the "NeedsShipInRange" is true or a ship is given via "ReadPlayerShipTag", as we need to find player ships to escort. If the escort command is canceled (e.g. the player ship is destroyed), the quest will fail!

ValueDefinition.Name: ReadPlayerShipTag
ValueDefinition.Description: A tag of a player ship. Used if "IsReverseEscort" is true to let the npc ships follow the tagged ship

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortShipsWaitForPlayer
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the escort ships will wait until a player ship is in range to continue moving. !Will not work together with "IsReverseEscort" flag

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortContinueRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: How close the player ships need to be for the escort ships to keep moving. Will only work if "EscortShipsWaitForPlayer" is true!

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortFinishDistanceOverwrite
ValueDefinition.Description: If not 0, this will overwrite the distance at which the escort objective is finished (of the npc ship to the target). Normaly it is around 20.

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortStartInteractionWindow
ValueDefinition.Description: If "StartImmediately" is not true, this window will be shown to start the escorting part of the objective.

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortFinishObjects
EscortFinishObject
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the objects that will spawn right at the place where the last escort ship reached it's destination.
Defines the object spawned after the escort objects where successfully protected. Used as proof of the success and needs to be delivered to the execution place

ValueDefinition.Name: FullText
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the full description text for this objective if it can be shown in a single line. Can include textsources with special replacement to achive dynamic text. (e.g. "Build houses 2 / 5").

ValueDefinition.Name: DisplayStyle
ValueDefinition.Description: The UI style of this line in the quest tracker. E.g. Style Headline adds a diamond infront, Objective will add the icon infront, GenericEntry has no icon infront. GenericEntry can be used for Fluff text by also using html to make the text italic.

ValueDefinition.Name: RangeWarningText
ValueDefinition.Description: This text will be shown if the ship is too near or too far away from the target ship

ValueDefinition.Name: StartPosition
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines either a preplaced or spawned Object. The player needs a unit next to to start the following part of the objective.

ValueDefinition.Name: StartFollowingInteractionWindow
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the layout of the quest interaction window that is used to start the following part of this objective

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetObject
ValueDefinition.Description: The TargetObject (can be land unit or ship unit). The player needs to follow this unit with its own unit, without beeing to near or to far away.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinRange
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance of player ship and target ship must not fall below this value

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxRange
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance of player ship and target ship must not exceed this value

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetPositions
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the positions the target object will move to

ValueDefinition.Name: UseItems
ValueDefinition.Description: Which Items the player has to activate/socket and how often

ValueDefinition.Name: Item
ValueDefinition.Description: Item the player has to activate or to socket

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of items the player has to activate or to socket

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemCountCalculation
ValueDefinition.Description: Select how the item count should be calculated

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedsActivation
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if the item nees to be equipped AND activated

ValueDefinition.Name: IsOnlyDecoration
ValueDefinition.Description: If true: These objects will not count towards the quest goal. They are only decoys.

ValueDefinition.Name: Behaviour
ValueDefinition.Description: Different behaviours of spawned objects. 'Static': Objects will be placed and stand still, 'Mob': Special behaviour for moving mobs.

ValueDefinition.Name: PathLabel
ValueDefinition.Description: Only used when Behaviour is set to 'Mob'. Use it if you have a predefined path that the mob should take

ValueDefinition.Name: PathIsland
ValueDefinition.Description: Only used when Behaviour is set to 'Mob'. Use to define on which island the mob should spawn on

ValueDefinition.Name: IsOnlyDecoy
ValueDefinition.Description: If true: These objects will not count towards the quest goal. They are only decoys.

ValueDefinition.Name: MobTryStreetPath
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the mob tries to use only streets

ValueDefinition.Name: MobOverwriteUnitType
ValueDefinition.Description: The units spawned in houses to join the mob will all have this unit type. (If set to invalid the unit type of inhabitants of the spawning building are used)

ValueDefinition.Name: SelectObjects
Object
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the Object that needs to be selected for this quest to be completed
List of objects that need to be selected for the objective to be completed. If multiple objects are given all of them need to be selected (after each other in random order)

ValueDefinition.Name: BuyerParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The participant that the player has to sell an object to

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectToSell
ValueDefinition.Description: The object that the player has to sell to the participant

ValueDefinition.Name: SellAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount the player has to sell to the buying participant

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededShipModules
ShipModule
ValueDefinition.Description: The ship module asset
If the ObjectToSell is a ship, this vector can define what ship modules are needed to fulfill the quest

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxObjectiveCount
ValueDefinition.Description: If there is a pool used as a context, this value can restrict the number of generated objectives. This value is only used when AutoSpawnConditionsPerObject is true.

ValueDefinition.Name: LimitToQuestArea_SQ
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the player counter should only be checked on the current quest area. Note, that the player counter must match AREA in order to use this.

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckAnyPoolAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates if the player counter should be checked for ANY or ALL assets from a given asset pool. Can be ignored if context guid is not an asset pool

ValueDefinition.Name: CombinePoolAssets
ValueDefinition.Description: If TRUE, the sum of all context pool results will be added and compared. In that case <CheckAnyPoolAsset> has no effect. Can be ignored if context guid is not an asset pool

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowSignsAndFeedback
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the signs and feedback of the objective will be used for all objects matching the given Context. StatusQuo objectives do not show signs and feedback per default

ValueDefinition.Name: BestAreaIsHighestValue
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the area with the highest counter among all areas will be returned. Otherwise the lowest

ValueDefinition.Name: InteractionFlowGamepad
ValueDefinition.Description: Is used when we are in gamepad mode and there are some interactions configured

ValueDefinition.Name: TutorialInteraction
ValueDefinition.Description: Is used when we are in gamepad mode and there are some interactions configured

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredTrackedQuestEntry
ValueDefinition.Description: If a quest entry is linked here, then this entry will have tu be tracked currently for the tutorial bubble to be shown

ValueDefinition.Name: StarterObjectObject
ValueDefinition.Description: The object that needs to be selected to start the quest. A valid ContextAndLocation info needs to be defined for spawning. If MoveToDockingPlace is true, this object (=ship) will need to move into position first

ValueDefinition.Name: MoveToDockingPlace
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if the StarterObjectObject should move towards a defined docking place. It will only offer the quest once it reached the docking place. False, if the StarterObjectObject should be selectable from the very beginning

ValueDefinition.Name: DockingPlaceDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: If MoveToDockingPlace is true, then the StarterObjectObject tries to come near StarterObjectDockingPlace, respecting this distance

ValueDefinition.Name: StarterObjectDockingPlace
ValueDefinition.Description: The place where the StarterObjectObject tries to move to, when MoveToDockingPlace is true

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationOnStarterSelection
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the notification which will be triggered if the player selects the starter object. (can be left empty to not trigger a notification)

ValueDefinition.Name: StarterInteractionWindow
