ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the layout of the quest interaction window when selecting the starter object

ValueDefinition.Name: OtherParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The profile of the other participant.

ValueDefinition.Name: DesiredState
ValueDefinition.Description: The desired diplomacy state between the quest owner and the other participant

ValueDefinition.Name: DesiredSubState
ValueDefinition.Description: If not empty the substate to the other participant also needs to match! Make sure to only configure valid combos (e.g. war state plus trade rights substate is never possible)

ValueDefinition.Name: Condition
ValueDefinition.Description: The condition, which needs to be true to fulfill this objective.

ValueDefinition.Name: EvacuationTargetObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: A ObjectFilter used to define the possible targets for the evacuate position.The correct amount of objects will be picked from this list of objects

ValueDefinition.Name: ParallelEvacuations
ValueDefinition.Description: How many objects need to be evacuated at the same time

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededEvacuations
ValueDefinition.Description: How many evacuations are needed to complete the objective

ValueDefinition.Name: StartProgress
ValueDefinition.Description: The start progress of the progress bar, needs to be smaller then the MaxProgress

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxProgress
ValueDefinition.Description: Each evacution building has a progress bar if it reaches this max progress the building will be destroyed

ValueDefinition.Name: ProgressPerSecond
ValueDefinition.Description: How much the progress bar advances every second towards max progress

ValueDefinition.Name: ProgressReductionPerSecond
ValueDefinition.Description: How much the progress bar gets reduced per second if a unit is in range

ValueDefinition.Name: InteractionRange
ValueDefinition.Description: How close the units need to be for the evacuation to start

ValueDefinition.Name: EvacuationObjectVisualEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: A VFX asset which will be spawned on the evacuation building

ValueDefinition.Name: WriteTagEvacuatedBuilding
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is set we will add this tag to all evacuated buildings. Tag is in storyline scope

ValueDefinition.Name: UsedByMajorFireIncident
ValueDefinition.Description: Only mark this as true if the quest is used by a major fire incident. It will enable some special logic like infecting buildings and applying countermeasures

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentCounterMeasure
ValueDefinition.Description: The countermeasure to decrease the major incidient time on evacuation of a single building. Only used if "UsedByMajorFireIncident" is true

ValueDefinition.Name: ParallelPickups
ValueDefinition.Description: How many moving mobs we have at the same time

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededPickups
ValueDefinition.Description: How many mobs need to be collected to finish this objective

ValueDefinition.Name: MobObject
ValueDefinition.Description: The Mob object that will move around, should have the template MovingMobDummy!

ValueDefinition.Name: MobFeedbackUnit
ValueDefinition.Description: The FeedbackUnitClass used to spawn other feedback units around the mob object

ValueDefinition.Name: MobFeedbackUnitAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: How many feedback units we spawn around the mob object

ValueDefinition.Name: MobSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: How fast the mob can move

ValueDefinition.Name: MobUsesOnlyStreet
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the mob tries to only walk on street

ValueDefinition.Name: PathDefiningObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: This is an objectfilter which should return the buildings where the mobs can spawn and move between. E.g. if all residences are configured here the mob can spawn next to residences and will move between residences

ValueDefinition.Name: InteractionRange
ValueDefinition.Description: How close the troops need to be for the pickup

ValueDefinition.Name: UsedByMajorIllnessIncident
ValueDefinition.Description: Only mark this as true if the quest is used by a major illness incident. It will enable some special logic like applying countermeasures

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentCounterMeasure
ValueDefinition.Description: The countermeasure to decrease the major incidient time on the collection of a single mob. Only used if "UsedByMajorIllnessIncident" is true

ValueDefinition.Name: FlyoutText
ValueDefinition.Description: The text of the flyout on collecting of a mob

ValueDefinition.Name: Participant
ValueDefinition.Description: The owner of the units that need to be destroyed.

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: How many units need to be destroyed.

ValueDefinition.Name: LinkedQuestEntry
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is set we will link this objective to the quest entry and show the objective text there.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestEntryObjectiveOperator
ValueDefinition.Description: The operator displayed infront of this objective text. AND will be implicit in the quest book. OR will show a text between two objectives with the OR text. So players know that they have to fulfill one or the other objective

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestEntryObjectivePriority
ValueDefinition.Description: Used to sort the objectives inside a quest entry. Higher Value means Higher Prio means first in the list of objectives.

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectiveTextFull
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the full description text for this objective if it can be shown in a single line. Can include textsources with special replacement to achive dynamic text. (e.g. "Build houses 2 / 5"). TextFull will replace TextHeadline and TextStep!

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectiveTextHeadline
ValueDefinition.Description: If the objective text consists of several steps, this headline text will be shown first. TextHeadline and TextStep will replace TextFull in that case!

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectiveTextStep
ValueDefinition.Description: If the objective text consists of several steps, this text will be shown for each step. TextHeadline and TextStep will replace TextFull in that case!

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectiveTextDisplay
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how the objective text should be displayed: - Automatic (SplitText if there is more than a single step, otherwise FullText) - FullText (Only ObjectiveTextFull is shown with an icon. If the objective contains of multiple steps, then every step will show the ObjectiveTextFull) - SplitText (ObjectiveTextHeadline at first and then a single ObjectiveTextStep for every step of the objective)

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectiveQuestTrackerIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: If a value is given, this icon will overwrite the default icon that is provided by the objective type if there is any

ValueDefinition.Name: FakeMinimapPings
ValueDefinition.Description: Mininmappings that are not related to the objective can be defined here

ValueDefinition.Name: JumpToVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the visibility of the jump-to button for this objective

ValueDefinition.Name: GatherExaminedObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, conditions that support it will be checked for their examined objects and the outcome will be stored in the inventory. Only works for a few conditions/objectives!

ValueDefinition.Name: DurationVariable
ValueDefinition.Description: A name of an int variable to use as duration instead of the duration field. Value is in ms

ValueDefinition.Name: Duration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long the condition should be sustained in order to be satisfied

ValueDefinition.Name: ShouldResetDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: If yes, the timer will be reset to the original duration in case the condition is not met any longer. Otherwise the timer will continue from the last duration

ValueDefinition.Name: SustainObjectiveText
ValueDefinition.Description: The text displayed in the quest tracker when the sustain part is active

Group.Name: Actions - Do not configure default values here!

ValueDefinition.Name: Good
ValueDefinition.Description: The Product or Item which should be added/removed

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: How much of the good/item should be added/removed

ValueDefinition.Name: SetGoodPoolLimitToAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: This value only makes sense for AssetPools as Good. If false: Amount specifies the amount per good in that pool. If true: Amount specifies the total amount that may be transferred, probably leaving out some goods from the pool.

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemContainerObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: The objects in here need either PropertyItemContainer or PropertyClaimingBuilding !

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowFallbackSpawning
ValueDefinition.Description: if true, the action will spawn flotsam objects with the resources if they could not be transferred otherwise

ValueDefinition.Name: MemorizeBank
ValueDefinition.Description: .memBnk File that was exported from Editor

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandTarget
ValueDefinition.Description: Island that the memorized objects/Streets should be applied to. Has to be compatible with map that exported the .memBnk

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionTarget
ValueDefinition.Description: Look for target Island in this session

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnOverTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Should the Objects and Streets be spawned instantanously or over time?

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnOverTimeDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long until the last object/street was spawned?

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnOverTimeCenterObjectLabel
ValueDefinition.Description: Which object (label) should be the center of the circle which marks the spawn spreading

ValueDefinition.Name: EffectAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The effect that should be started or ended. For "Meta", "ObjectsInMeta", "AreasInMeta" or "Local" effects leave "ReadTaggedLocation" empty. For "Session", "ObjectsInSession", "Areas", "ObjectsInAreas" the "ReadTaggedLocation" needs to be set correctly with a tag to the location. For Local Effects the TargetObjectForLocalEffect object filter needs to be configured!

ValueDefinition.Name: StartEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the effect should be started or removed (true = start)

ValueDefinition.Name: AffectProcessingParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this effect should affect the processing participant or a specific participant

ValueDefinition.Name: AffectedParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The participant that should be affected if AffectProcessingParticpant is false

ValueDefinition.Name: ReadTaggedLocation
ValueDefinition.Description: A Tag which describes a location (either an Island or Province). For Effects with Scope Meta, ObjectsInMeta or AreasInMeta effects leave it empty. For Session, ObjectsInSession, Areas, ObjectsInAreas the Tag needs to be set correctly to the location

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetObjectForLocalEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: If the Effect has the scope Local a object needs to be defined which should be targeted. This objectfilter can be used to define the target object. The effect will only be created if the target is one singular object!

ValueDefinition.Name: LinkEffectLifetimeToStoryline
ValueDefinition.Description: If this action is used inside a storyline (quests), this flag can be used to link the lifetime of the effect to the existence of the storyline. This way the effect will be automatically removed once the storylien ends, even in an abort case where the storyline gets aborted.

ValueDefinition.Name: SetOwnerParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the owner will be changed by this action

ValueDefinition.Name: NewOwnerParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: change owner of objects

ValueDefinition.Name: SetVisualOwnerParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the visual owner can be specified, if false, the visual owner will be identical to the new owner

ValueDefinition.Name: NewVisualOwnerParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The new visual owner provile of the object

ValueDefinition.Name: Variable
ValueDefinition.Description: The Variable which is used if the UseVariableAsDelay bool is set

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: The item or asset pool that should be removed from the game

ValueDefinition.Name: SpecificSession
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be used to specify a session where the item(s) should be removed

ValueDefinition.Name: UseProcessingSourceParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if the processing participant (mostly the owner of the parent condition) should be used as the source participant

ValueDefinition.Name: DiscoverSourceProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the participant who discovers someone

ValueDefinition.Name: DiscoverTargetProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the participant being discovered

ValueDefinition.Name: DiscoverParticipantOmitWelcomeMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the welcome message will not be triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: EnableTicks
ValueDefinition.Description: True if the game should be paused, False otherwise. Use with care!

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetSession
ValueDefinition.Description: The session that should be entered. This session has to be loaded already!

ValueDefinition.Name: DiplomacyAction
ValueDefinition.Description: The diplomatic action that should be executed

ValueDefinition.Name: DiplomaticSourceUseProcessingParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the source of the diplomatic action should be the processing participant. (Useful in Multiplayer)

ValueDefinition.Name: DiplomaticSourceProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: The source participant who started the diplomatic action

ValueDefinition.Name: DiplomaticTargetUseProcessingParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the target of the diplomatic action should be the processing participant. (Useful in Multiplayer)

ValueDefinition.Name: DiplomaticTargetProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: The target who is affected by the diplomatic action

ValueDefinition.Name: ScriptFileName
ValueDefinition.Description: The script file that should be executed

Property.Name: ActionFinishMemorization
Property.Description: Makes sure that all (desired) Pending Memorizations were finished. This allows for referencing those.

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionTarget_
ValueDefinition.Description: Required Parameter. In which session should Memorization be finished

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlyEntitiesInGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, no objects/streets are affected that are not part of this group

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlyEntitiesWithGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, no objects/streets are affected that are not part of this GUID

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlyEntitiesOnIsland
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, no objects/streets are affected that are not to be memorized on the given island

ValueDefinition.Name: LoadSession
ValueDefinition.Description: the session to load

ValueDefinition.Name: DoChangeDefaultVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: True, to also set the default visibility of the menu

ValueDefinition.Name: SetDefaultVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: The new default visibility. Only used when DoChangeDefaultVisibility is true

ValueDefinition.Name: VariableName
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the Variable we want to modify.

ValueDefinition.Name: Modifier
ValueDefinition.Description: The modifier that should be used on the variable

ValueDefinition.Name: ModifierVariable
ValueDefinition.Description: The variable/constant we use to modifiy the Variable. Needs to be from the same type.

ValueDefinition.Name: UseDangerLayer
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the unit will avoid the danger based on the danger layer of its owning participant

ValueDefinition.Name: PerformIntegrityCheck
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the notification should only be triggered if the profile has been discovered/defeated/etc.

ValueDefinition.Name: Movie
ValueDefinition.Description: Link to a movie asset that should be enqueued

ValueDefinition.Name: UnregisterTrigger
ValueDefinition.Description: If false, the trigger will be created. CAUTION: If it is already created it will be reset to its origin state. If true, the trigger will be unregistered instead of registered

ValueDefinition.Name: UseTriggerSecondPartySettings
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is true and we register a new trigger we will use the setup of the trigger to check if we will start the trigger for second parties

Property.Name: ActionSetCamera
Property.Description: Sets the game camera to a certain position marker in the game

ValueDefinition.Name: PositionMarker
ValueDefinition.Description: Asset that represents a position marker placed in world through the anno editor. If left empty the action will instead return the position of the first object found by the object filter

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: The session where the position marker should be found in. Only used for the position marker, not for the object filter

ValueDefinition.Name: UseInteractingPeer
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be used to define a previous quest component of the same storyline. When the camera position will be set the previous component will be asked for the peer which interacted with it and only this peer will change the camera. E.g. only the peer that pressed the button in a decision will change the camera if this field is set to the guid of the decision root.

ValueDefinition.Name: NewIslandName
ValueDefinition.Description: The new name of the island. It will be applied to all islands found by the location filter

ValueDefinition.Name: ChangeInvincibleFlag
ValueDefinition.Description: Set to true, if you want <IsInvincible> to have an effect

ValueDefinition.Name: IsInvincible
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the object(s) will gain invicibility, otherwise they will lose it

ValueDefinition.Name: ApplyDirectionFromTargetObject
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the direction of the target object will also be applied to the source object

ValueDefinition.Name: Visibility
ValueDefinition.Description: The new object visibility

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: Show construction or deconstruction effect (after deconstruction, the object will be invisible forever)

ValueDefinition.Name: SuppressSettingVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: This action can affect more than just visibility, i.e. changing GameLogic state. If these effects are desired without a change of visibility, you should set this flag. Unfortunately we canno name it "ModifyVisibility" with a default value of TRUE because of savegame compatibility.

ValueDefinition.Name: VisualDamagePercent
ValueDefinition.Description: The damage of the object in the range [0..100]

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlyDeselect
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, current selection will be cleared and nothing selected

ValueDefinition.Name: WeatherTypes
ValueDefinition.Description: Set weather types you want to trigger

ValueDefinition.Name: ChangeMirageEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, you can start/stop the Miarge effect via SetMirageEffect

ValueDefinition.Name: SetMirageEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: Works only if ChangeMirageEffect = true! If true mirage effect will be startet, false to stop

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnObjectGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: The guid of the object that should be spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnObjectAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of objects that should be spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: DoSetVisualSpawnOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, you will visually override the owner of the object, i.e. the object looks as if it belongs to a different player. If false, visual owner is the same as the real owner

ValueDefinition.Name: VisualSpawnOwnerProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: Visually override the owner of the object, i.e. the object looks as if it belongs to a different player. If false, visual owner is the same as the real owner

ValueDefinition.Name: Highlight
ValueDefinition.Description: Highlights the spawn assets with an outline

ValueDefinition.Name: UseSignsAndFeedback
ValueDefinition.Description: true, if the spawned objects should show minimap ping and infolayer

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnInfolayer
ValueDefinition.Description: spawned objects will show this infolayer

ValueDefinition.Name: WriteSpawnObjectGroupTag
ValueDefinition.Description: If a text is given the spawned object will be added to a group with the text as tag. If the tag did not exist before, it will be created

ValueDefinition.Name: TagScope
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines if the tag from WriteSpawnObjectGroupTag is a global or storyline specific tag. If the scope is storyline, the tag will only exist inside the storyline and can only accessed from quest components inside that storyline. Will be ignored if the tag is empty.

ValueDefinition.Name: LinkObjectLifetimeToStoryline
ValueDefinition.Description: If this action is used inside a storyline (quest), this flag defines the lifetime of the spawned Object. If the flag is set to true the spawned object will be deleted once the storyline ends, even if the storyline is aborted.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsInvincible
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the object will be invincible

ValueDefinition.Name: SetLocalFeedbackSequence
ValueDefinition.Description: True if local feedback should also be set

ValueDefinition.Name: StartLocalFeedbackSequence
ValueDefinition.Description: The local feedback sequence that should override the default behaviour

ValueDefinition.Name: OverwriteLocalFeedback
ValueDefinition.Description: Play StartLocalFeedbackSequence until next ChangeGUID

ValueDefinition.Name: TreasureSessionOrRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: The session where this quest should be started or a region(= list of sessions) where a session is randomly chosen from if the player entered that session already

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalTimerTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Time that will be added to the timer with a given ID. Use a negative time to subtract time from the timer.

ValueDefinition.Name: PingDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long should the ping be visible

ValueDefinition.Name: UnloadSession
ValueDefinition.Description: the session that should be unloaded

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockAssets
ValueDefinition.Description: Assets get unlocked

ValueDefinition.Name: UnhideAssets
ValueDefinition.Description: Assets get visible

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockGroups
ValueDefinition.Description: Assets in these groups get unlocked

ValueDefinition.Name: UnhideGroups
ValueDefinition.Description: Assets in these groups get visible

ValueDefinition.Name: SeasonToOverwriteWith
ValueDefinition.Description: The season that will overwrite the "next" season. Is the next season is already an overwriting season, this season will be queued.

ValueDefinition.Name: OverwriteSeasonPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: A default overwrite season has priority 0 and will only be queued based on the time it was added. If priority > 0 then it might be the next season immediately.

ValueDefinition.Name: NewSeasonPool
ValueDefinition.Description: Sets a new season pool from which next seasons will be chosen from

ValueDefinition.Name: NewSelectability
ValueDefinition.Description: true, if the object should be selectable, false otherwise

Property.Name: ActionStartStoryline

ValueDefinition.Name: StorylineAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The storyline, which should be started.

Property.Description: Action to start a Storyline for the processing participant. It is not linked to any quest area

ValueDefinition.Name: NoLocationRequired
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, all location settings in the LocationFilter will be ignored and the storyline is not linked to any location

ValueDefinition.Name: Island
ValueDefinition.Description: Island Asset which defines the label of an Island. The label needs to be also set by level art

ValueDefinition.Name: PropsetName
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the propset for the vegetation

ValueDefinition.Name: Label
ValueDefinition.Description: The label of the Ambient Area object

ValueDefinition.Name: EnableAmbientArea
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the ambient area will be enabled, if false disabled

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectiveComponent
ValueDefinition.Description: The objective component asset which should end. This action needs to be part of the same storyline as the objective!!

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectiveOutput
ValueDefinition.Description: What output path should the quest system take after the objective ended.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestPool
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the pool where a quest should be started from immediately if preconditions are fulfilled. Sub pools will also be considered

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestEntry
ValueDefinition.Description: The quest entry we want to modify. If it does not yet exist it will be created and modified afterwards

ValueDefinition.Name: MarkAsUpdated
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the quest entry will have a updated icon, so the player knows something changed. The icon will vanish after the player has read the quest entry.

ValueDefinition.Name: DeleteQuestEntry
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is true the quest entry will be deleted and all other settings will be ignored.

ValueDefinition.Name: TrackQuestEntry
ValueDefinition.Description: If true we force to track the current quest entry in the quest tracker

ValueDefinition.Name: ModifyProvince
ValueDefinition.Description: If true we will replace the existing quest province with the new one

ValueDefinition.Name: Province
ValueDefinition.Description: The quest province displayed in the quest entry

ValueDefinition.Name: ClearChapterSummaryTextBefore
ValueDefinition.Description: If True the existing summary text of the current text group will be cleared before this new text will be added

ValueDefinition.Name: ClearAllSummaryTextBefore
ValueDefinition.Description: If True, all the existing summary text of all text groups will be cleared before this new text will be added

ValueDefinition.Name: AddSummaryText
ValueDefinition.Description: This text will be added to the summary text of the quest entry. Will be ignored if empty

ValueDefinition.Name: CreateNewChapter
ValueDefinition.Description: Texts are grouped together. If this is true we will create a new group and add the newly added text to this new group. Makes only sense if there is text in AddSummaryText

ValueDefinition.Name: ModifyCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: If true we will change the category of the Quest Entry

ValueDefinition.Name: Category
ValueDefinition.Description: The new category

ValueDefinition.Name: ModifyPortrait
ValueDefinition.Description: If true we will change the participant for the portrait.

ValueDefinition.Name: Participant
ValueDefinition.Description: The participant asset used for the portrait.

ValueDefinition.Name: ModifyBackground
ValueDefinition.Description: If true we change the background image.

ValueDefinition.Name: BackgroundImage
ValueDefinition.Description: The new background image filepath

ValueDefinition.Name: ModifyQuestHint
ValueDefinition.Description: If true we change the quest hint

ValueDefinition.Name: HintText
ValueDefinition.Description: The new quest hint text replacing the current one.

ValueDefinition.Name: ModifyImage
ValueDefinition.Description: If true we chagne the image

ValueDefinition.Name: Image
ValueDefinition.Description: The filepath to the image, if empty no image will be displayed

ValueDefinition.Name: ModifyVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: If true we change the visibility of the quest entry

ValueDefinition.Name: VisibleInQuestTracker
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the quest entry is visible in the quest tracker

ValueDefinition.Name: ModifyName
ValueDefinition.Description: If true we will replace the existing quest name with the new one

ValueDefinition.Name: NewName
ValueDefinition.Description: The new quest name

ValueDefinition.Name: ModifyIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: If true we will replace the existing quest entry icon with the new one

ValueDefinition.Name: IconAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The new icon for the quest entry

ValueDefinition.Name: ModifyAudio
ValueDefinition.Description: If true we will replace the existing quest entry audio with the new one

ValueDefinition.Name: Audio
ValueDefinition.Description: The new audio for the quest entry

ValueDefinition.Name: ModifyVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: If true we change the visibility of the quest tracker

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestTrackerVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the quest tracker is visible

ValueDefinition.Name: ModifyExplainerPopup
ValueDefinition.Description: If true we change the explainer pop up of the quest entry

ValueDefinition.Name: ExplainerPopup
ValueDefinition.Description: The explainer pop up asset that defines the pop that should open in the quest book

ValueDefinition.Name: Participant
ValueDefinition.Description: Active Emperor reputation changes towards this participant. Can be a participant asset or a variable name.

ValueDefinition.Name: UseProcessingParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the active emperor reputation changes towards the currently processing participant instead.

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of the reputation change. Can either be a constant value or a variable name

ValueDefinition.Name: AmountIsADelta
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the RepuationChangeAmount will be added to the current reputation. If this is false the RepuationChangeAmount will be set as the new reputation.

ValueDefinition.Name: EmperorTrait
ValueDefinition.Description: If the ReputationChangeAmount is empty it is possible to define a EmperorTrait here. The reputation change will then be calculated based on the trait and the trait intesity.

ValueDefinition.Name: TraitIntensity
ValueDefinition.Description: Intensity is a modifier to the Emperor Trait system. It will multiplicate the gain/loss of reputation.

ValueDefinition.Name: NewSpecialState
ValueDefinition.Description: The new special state the processing participant will get.

ValueDefinition.Name: WriteTag
ValueDefinition.Description: The tag of the tagged location that should be modified. If multiple

ValueDefinition.Name: RemoveTag
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the tag will be removed

ValueDefinition.Name: TagArea
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, an area is tagged by the given parameters from the location filter, if false, a session is tagged. If there is more than a single area/session possible, one will be chosen at random

ValueDefinition.Name: TagScope
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines if the tag from WriteTag is a global or storyline specific tag. If the scope is storyline, the tag will only exist inside the storyline and can only accessed from quest components inside that storyline. Will be ignored if the tag is empty.

ValueDefinition.Name: WriteTag
ValueDefinition.Description: The tag of the tagged object or object grpoup that should be modified.

ValueDefinition.Name: RemoveTag
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the tag will be removed

ValueDefinition.Name: TagScope
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines if the tag from WriteTag is a global or storyline specific tag. If the scope is storyline, the tag will only exist inside the storyline and can only accessed from quest components inside that storyline. Will be ignored if the tag is empty.

ValueDefinition.Name: ChangeTagMandatoryState
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, <IsTagMandatory> will be used to update the mandatory state of a tag

ValueDefinition.Name: IsTagMandatory
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the object(s) behind the tag will be monitored and if _all_ objects of a tag get destroyed (i.e. the tag becomes empty), the storyline will be aborted and the start counter reset for it to be called again later

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoOpenNarrativeSequenceCampaignOnly
ValueDefinition.Description: Special flag to automatically open the narrative sequence UI for all peers. Only works in Campaign. Try to use it as little as possible

ValueDefinition.Name: UseInteractingPeerForUIOpening
ValueDefinition.Description: The given asset will be used to get the interacting peer of that objective and open the narrative sequence UI for this peer only. !Make sure the given asset is a component in the same storyline and it was completed and immideatly before this one!

ValueDefinition.Name: IsFollowUpNarrativeSequence
ValueDefinition.Description: Use Carefully!! If this is true the NarrativeSequence UI, will stay open and display this decision.

ValueDefinition.Name: BackgroundConfig
BackgroundType
ValueDefinition.Description: Select the type of background for this narrative sequence

ValueDefinition.Name: BackgroundPicturePath
ValueDefinition.Description: If not empty this path is used for a background image

ValueDefinition.Name: RotatingCamera
CameraPosition
ValueDefinition.Description: Optional: An initial action to move the camera to a specific spot

ValueDefinition.Name: Speed
ValueDefinition.Description: Rotation speed in degrees per second. Negative speed turns the camera counterclockwise

ValueDefinition.Name: Distance
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance from camera to look-at position
Details for the rotating camera

ValueDefinition.Name: CameraSequence
CameraPosition
ValueDefinition.Description: Optional: an initial acrtion to move the camera sequence to another spot

ValueDefinition.Name: Sequence
ValueDefinition.Description: A camera sequence asset that should be played
Info about a camera sequence that should be played in the background

ValueDefinition.Name: BackgroundAudio
ValueDefinition.Description: A sound file playing in the background while this narrative sequence is open. Makre sure the soundfile is a looping sound! Can be left empty.
Configures the background of the narrative sequence

ValueDefinition.Name: LeftPortraitParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: Participant asset used to define the portrait on the left side.

ValueDefinition.Name: RightPortraitParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: Participant asset used to define the portrait on the right side.

ValueDefinition.Name: RightParticipantIsTalking
ValueDefinition.Description: True if the right participant is saying the text, false if the left one is talking.

ValueDefinition.Name: OverrideSpeakerName
ValueDefinition.Description: If not empty this text will be the name of the current speaker. If empty the name will be the name of the speaking participant

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalAudio
ValueDefinition.Description: An sound file that will played additionaly to the talking character. Make sure the sound file is not looping! Can be left empty.

ValueDefinition.Name: NewChapter
ValueDefinition.Description: Changes the campaign to the new chapter (eg. switch to act 2)

ValueDefinition.Name: EmperorParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The participant for whom this reason should be displayed

ValueDefinition.Name: PowerGain
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of power gain shown next to the reason text

ValueDefinition.Name: ReasonText
ValueDefinition.Description: A text displayed next to the power gain. To explain the reasoning behind the power gain

ValueDefinition.Name: Name
ValueDefinition.Description: Text that should be used as the new name for the specified objects

ValueDefinition.Name: ExplainerPopup
ValueDefinition.Description: The explainer popup that should be shown

ValueDefinition.Name: GovernorRequest
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is set to a governor request we will trigger a governor request which needs to be accepted before the explainer pop up opens

ValueDefinition.Name: VariableName
ValueDefinition.Description: The name of the variable which shall be set to a new value

ValueDefinition.Name: SetVariableTo
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how the variable will be set with a new value! Make sure the type of the variable is the same as the sething method!

ValueDefinition.Name: NewStance
ValueDefinition.Description: The new stance for all configured objects

ValueDefinition.Name: Radius
ValueDefinition.Description: The radius that should be discovered

ValueDefinition.Name: SourceObjectPos
ValueDefinition.Description: The object where the position will be discovered

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetObjectPos
ValueDefinition.Description: If configured, a line from source to target object will be discovered

ValueDefinition.Name: Trigger
ValueDefinition.Description: The participant message trigger. AI participants can react on this trigger with a defined reaction

ValueDefinition.Name: InitiatorParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The target participant of the pamsy. Can be a asset or variable. Use special variable "ActiveEmperor" to get the currently active emperor, of "ProcessingParticipant" to get the player

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The target participant of the pamsy. Can be a asset or variable. Use special variable "ActiveEmperor" to get the currently active emperor, of "ProcessingParticipant" to get the player

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardList
Asset
ValueDefinition.Description: The asset used for the icon

ValueDefinition.Name: Infotip
ValueDefinition.Description: Infotip shown in the character notification. Leave empty for default infotip.

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of the asset
A list of rewards that will be forwarded to the notification system and shown in the character notification

ValueDefinition.Name: SpecialAction
ValueDefinition.Description: The special action that should be executed. E.g. Kill Lucius to make Calidus emperor. !Works only in campaign!

ValueDefinition.Name: SpecialAction
ValueDefinition.Description: We can trigger some special code paths depending on the choice made here.

ValueDefinition.Name: Rival
ValueDefinition.Description: If SpecialAction == "AllowRivalSettlePermission" or "DenyRivalSettlePermission" this field defines the Rival.

ValueDefinition.Name: EndPendingDecisions
ValueDefinition.Description: If true all pending festival decisions will also be aborted

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: The item that gets rewarded

ValueDefinition.Name: ParticipantGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: The participant who gets this item

ValueDefinition.Name: SpeechBubbleOriginAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the GUID where the speechbubble originated from

ValueDefinition.Name: ComboboxEnabledTextsource
ValueDefinition.Description: TextSource to enable/disable the element. If the textsource returns false, the elements gets disabled and is not interactable

ValueDefinition.Name: SliderEnabledTextsource
ValueDefinition.Description: TextSource to enable/disable the element. If the textsource returns false, the elements gets disabled and is not interactable

ValueDefinition.Name: TextTextsource
ValueDefinition.Description: Textsource which returns the text next to the slider. Use >> percentage for (0-100) or >> optionValue for (0-1.0)

ValueDefinition.Name: Audio
ValueDefinition.Description: Audio that is played when the slider is hovered or focused

ValueDefinition.Name: ToggleEnabledTextsource
ValueDefinition.Description: TextSource to enable/disable the element. If the textsource returns false, the elements gets disabled and is not interactable

ValueDefinition.Name: ActivatedText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text that is shown when the setting is turned on

ValueDefinition.Name: DeactivatedText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text that is shown when the setting is turned off

Property.Name: OptionGamepadButtonMapping
Property.Description: Used as a placeholder to dynamically add a list of gamepad button remappings

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectBlacklist
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the

ValueDefinition.Name: UseProcessingParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether the owner should be chosen dynamically by the current context (e.g. quest asignee)

ValueDefinition.Name: PropertyBlacklist
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether game object should or should not have the property

ValueDefinition.Name: Infolayer
ValueDefinition.Description: An infolayer GUID that the object needs to have active

ValueDefinition.Name: Negate
ValueDefinition.Description: Check, if you want to check for objects that don't have the given infolayer

ValueDefinition.Name: Negate
ValueDefinition.Description: Check, if you want to check for objects that don't have the given infolayer

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipConfiguration
ValueDefinition.Description: The ship configuration that is being checked against

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredModuleCount
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this will check if the given object has at least so many modules

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredMilitaryModuleCount
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this will check if the given object has at least so many military modules

ValueDefinition.Name: Negate
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if you want to test for objects _NOT_ having the given configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: Negate
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if you want to test for objects _NOT_ having the given state

ValueDefinition.Name: SecondarySorting
ValueDefinition.Description: In case mutliple islands have the same value, they will be sorted by this secondary counter

ValueDefinition.Name: RangeAttack_BtB
ValueDefinition.Description: BorderToBorder; Distance in which this element can attack its target

ValueDefinition.Name: DefenderTypes
ValueDefinition.Description: Defender types this override works against

ValueDefinition.Name: Perks
ValueDefinition.Description: List of perks this attack behavior has (only shown in infotips)

ValueDefinition.Name: RangeSelfDefense_MtM
ValueDefinition.Description: MidToMid; Distance in which this elements considers enemy elements as threats. Elements that are considered threats are attacked via melee attacks, taking precedence over other attack behaviors this element supports

ValueDefinition.Name: Speed
ValueDefinition.Description: Percentage of unit speed; Speed the element has when moving in melee combat behavior

ValueDefinition.Name: SpeedBackline
ValueDefinition.Description: Percentage of unit speed; Speed the element has when moving in melee combat behavior while being in the backline. This is the speed that is used to fill holes or that backline elements use to wrap around the fight.

ValueDefinition.Name: DragAggro
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of world-space-units this element can be pushed per tick due to collisions, while moving towards their target

ValueDefinition.Name: DragEngaged
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of world-space-units this element can be pushed per tick due to collisions, while already engaged in combat (both in frontline and in backline)

ValueDefinition.Name: LineOfSightType
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of line of sight this ranged attack behavior is using

ValueDefinition.Name: SalvoSpread
ValueDefinition.Description: Duraiton over which one salvo is spread. 0 = all attack at the exact time, 200 = all attack within 200ms, AttackCooldown = no salvos visible

ValueDefinition.Name: IsStationaryAttacker
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this element has to become stationary to attack

ValueDefinition.Name: DragEngaged
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of world-space-units this element can be pushed per tick due to collisions while already engaged in combat

ValueDefinition.Name: Accuracy
ValueDefinition.Description: [0;100] Base chance that this ranged attack hits a target in the context of accuracy calculations

ValueDefinition.Name: LineOfSightType
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of line of sight this ranged attack behavior is using

ValueDefinition.Name: SalvoSpread
ValueDefinition.Description: Duraiton over which one salvo is spread. 0 = all attack at the exact time, 200 = all attack within 200ms, AttackCooldown = no salvos visible

ValueDefinition.Name: IsStationaryAttacker
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this element has to become stationary to attack

ValueDefinition.Name: DragEngaged
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of world-space-units this element can be pushed per tick due to collisions while already engaged in combat

ValueDefinition.Name: Speed
ValueDefinition.Description: Percentage of unit speed; Speed the element has when charging at an enemy

ValueDefinition.Name: Drag
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of world-space-units this element can be pushed per tick due to collisions, while charging towards a target

ValueDefinition.Name: IntervalStartOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: Interval the Scaling Value starts adding Rewards

ValueDefinition.Name: Interval
ValueDefinition.Description: Interval Size

ValueDefinition.Name: IntervalIncreasePercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: Increase of the Interval Size

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardPerInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Reward added for each Interval

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardIncrease
ValueDefinition.Description: Value by how much the Reward Increases for each Interval

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardMaximum
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum amount of reward in total

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: Initial value for the reward at the start

ValueDefinition.Name: HidePropsRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: While in build mode, hide props in this radius

ValueDefinition.Name: DeletePropsRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: When constructing, remove props in this radius additionally to the blocking rect

ValueDefinition.Name: OverbuildPlaza
ValueDefinition.Description: Enable this setting to allow this building to be placed on top of an existing ornamental polygon plaza (buildings with property ornamental will do this automatically!)

ValueDefinition.Name: RemovePreviousGroundPolygon
ValueDefinition.Description: Instead of placing a ground polygon this option will completely remove any ground polygons build before, do not activate for ornaments and similar as those will already replace the poygon with the GUID specified at GroundPolygonAsset

ValueDefinition.Name: UseQuayAreaForGroundPoly
ValueDefinition.Description: either use quay area or complete build blocker

ValueDefinition.Name: GroundDecalAssetExtra
ValueDefinition.Description: some building need three different ground plates, use this setting in that case

ValueDefinition.Name: OverwriteGroundDecalWithRegionQuay
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to true the GroundDecal as well as the GroundDecalInvisible are replaced with the quay decals defined in the associated region asset.

ValueDefinition.Name: StreetOutside
ValueDefinition.Description: should a street be generated at the outside

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildDecalOutside
ValueDefinition.Description: true, if the ground decal should be placed outside of construction areas

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockWater
ValueDefinition.Description: should only be true for objects which are placed completly alone outside of island zones and cannot trap ships

ValueDefinition.Name: HasBuildingBaseTiles
ValueDefinition.Description: BuildingBaseTiles will be build if dummies are configured

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableDefaultTrafficFeedback
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the feedback layer will not get stamped into the pathplanner. This is used for special feedback for e.g. farms where we dont want public traffic feedback but still need the feedback layer for specuial feedback.

ValueDefinition.Name: RemoveGrass
ValueDefinition.Description: You can disable the grass removal with this flag

ValueDefinition.Name: BlocksBuilding
ValueDefinition.Description: if set to false, other buildings can be placed here. How the ovelap of the two objects is handled will be left to the developer

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockWhileInvisible
ValueDefinition.Description: Some systems ingore invisible blockers. Overwrite this behaviour.

ValueDefinition.Name: HasBuildableTilesBelowArch
ValueDefinition.Description: TLDR: Set True for gates. If this is true and our BuildBlocker is more complex then our BuildBlockerAABB, then all buildable tiles within AABB are only buildable for some other Buildings (see [BelowArchBuildHeight]). If false, those tiles are buildable for all buildings. This should be set to True for Gate-Buildings to prevent HugeOrnamentals or other Gate-Buildings to be built within. This should be false for L-shape buildings, as they can be intertwined without problems.

ValueDefinition.Name: SuppressesRoundStreetCurves
ValueDefinition.Description: When this Object is placed in the inner side of a street curve, will the street be forced to have an angular corner instead of a rounded corner there?

ValueDefinition.Name: ArchHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: If [HasBuildableTilesBelowArch] is set, this value determines the height of the arch, so only tiles with a height lower or equal can be built below

ValueDefinition.Name: OverwriteBelowArchBuildHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the height of this building (when checked against another Arch building (see [ArchHeight])) is not taken from CFG-BoundingBox, but overwritten with [BelowArchBuildHeight]

ValueDefinition.Name: BelowArchBuildHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: See [ArchHeight] and [OverwriteBelowArchBuildHeight]

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalBlockRectSize
ValueDefinition.Description: the pathplanner update increases the update rect by this size to allow blockings outside of build blocker

ValueDefinition.Name: CreateBorderRect
ValueDefinition.Description: Set the types of Mesh Graph which will create a border rect around this asset

ValueDefinition.Name: EditorLineOfSightBlocking
ValueDefinition.Description: Marks this object as an editor preplaced building, using its full hit box heights for line of sight calculations

ValueDefinition.Name: Destructable
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, player can destruct this building with destruction mode

ValueDefinition.Name: Movable
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, player can move this building with move mode

ValueDefinition.Name: PickingAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: when copying with pipette, start buildmode with this guid instead

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionMenuText
ValueDefinition.Description: overrides the title in construction menu, if set

ValueDefinition.Name: SnapRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: tells the buildmode how far this object can be snapped

ValueDefinition.Name: SnapRadiusAlternativeOverwrite
ValueDefinition.Description: If this value is not zero and gamepad input is active, this value will be used as the snap radius.

ValueDefinition.Name: DestructionConfirmation
ValueDefinition.Description: When destroying via shortcut or destruction mode, the player has to confirm the destruction

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildModeRandomRotation
ValueDefinition.Description: if multiple buildings are placed (continued building or drawing a rect), this controls how subsequent buildings are rotated (0 -> same rotation, 90/180 -> random rotation in 90/180 steps)

ValueDefinition.Name: AssociatedRegions
ValueDefinition.Description: The regions in which this building can be placed.

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: relative weight for random, 0 = 1

ValueDefinition.Name: DeactivateHideWhenClippingIntoCamera
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this building will not get invisible when clipping into the camera

ValueDefinition.Name: SecondPartyRelevant
ValueDefinition.Description: AI will ignore irrelevant buildings. If a building is flagged as SecondPartyRelevant this does not mean that the AI will necessarily parse the building, there are a couple of additional conditions which need to be met.

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildModeStartDirectionOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: when starting buildmode of harbor object, the direction of nearest coastline is used. This offset is only needed to point the harbor blocker in the intended direction

ValueDefinition.Name: KeepRotationInBlock
ValueDefinition.Description: BuildingBlocks are not allowed to rotate this building, e.g. because it has harbour blockers

ValueDefinition.Name: VariationIcons
ValueDefinition.Description: only fill if variations should have own icons in their object menu (e.g. hedge system)

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowCodeToControlRotation
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the code will decide if this building can be rotated with . / , while selected. If set to false this building cannot be rotated once build.

ValueDefinition.Name: OwnerChangeTarget
ValueDefinition.Description: Replace building with target GUID in takeover situations. 0 keeps the GUID. Use `OwnerChangeDestroy` to destroy it.

ValueDefinition.Name: OwnerChangeDestroy
ValueDefinition.Description: Destroy building in takeover situations.

ValueDefinition.Name: ModuleParentType
ValueDefinition.Description: When building this module from construction menu, automatically select the area unique parent building

ValueDefinition.Name: FunctionalEffects
ValueDefinition.Description: While the building is unpaused, it has these effects

ValueDefinition.Name: SteepnessMaxHeightDiff
ValueDefinition.Description: LargeBuildings can specify a maximum height difference between lowest and heighest terrain point under the building. set to 0 to ignore this steepness test

Property.Name: BuildingModule
Property.Description: Addon to a production building

ValueDefinition.Name: PlazaSize
ValueDefinition.Description: >0 allows drag build of farmfields

ValueDefinition.Name: ModuleType
ValueDefinition.Description: which limit is used?

ValueDefinition.Name: ModuleMoodImage
ValueDefinition.Description: Background for Module object menu

ValueDefinition.Name: UniqueType
ValueDefinition.Description: If != none there can only be one building of all the buildings with the same uniqueType build per island

Property.Name: Constructable
Property.Description: Defines how this object will be constructed.

ValueDefinition.Name: DestructionCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: Category for destruction mode

ValueDefinition.Name: DestructionType
ValueDefinition.Description: if more than one object should be added to a destruction type, select one asset of that type and set it as DestructionType for every asset, leave it empty otherwise

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreBlueprintPlacement
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this asset will never be placed as a blueprint, even when e.g. in blueprint mode

ValueDefinition.Name: CultureSpawnGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: Has this building a spawngroup behaviour (resident feedback)?

ValueDefinition.Name: UndiscoveredSet
ValueDefinition.Description: if an item set has not been discovered, this name is shown

ValueDefinition.Name: ModuleListHeader
ValueDefinition.Description: the module overview in culture main building popup has this header

ValueDefinition.Name: OpenSetPages
ValueDefinition.Description: Text is shown on Button in ObjectmenuCulture

ValueDefinition.Name: HasPollution
ValueDefinition.Description: If this building has negative attractiveness (or gets negative by items), show a pollution effect

ValueDefinition.Name: Feedback_AllowSpawnAtEntranceComing
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, units will spawn at entrance and also on surrounding buildings. If false, the feedback units will not spawn at the entrance dummies but only on surrounding buildings. Used when entrance is clearly visible and we don't want to show a lot of spawning units out of nowhere.

ValueDefinition.Name: NumOfPiers
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how many loading slots are available on this building

ValueDefinition.Name: LoadingSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how long the building needs to load or unload the goods on a ship (in tons per second), can be changed by LoadingSpeedFactor of ship

ValueDefinition.Name: MinLoadingTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how long a ship at least should stay in the loading pier. Can be overwritten by ships if needed

ValueDefinition.Name: ModuleLimits
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum allowed amount of building modules (set to 0 for unlimited modules)

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalModule
ValueDefinition.Description: Extra module that can be applied to this module owner. (i.e. Bright Harvest Tractor)

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalModuleMustBeMainBuildingAdjacent
ValueDefinition.Description: e.g. Tractor / Silo module with special build rules different to other modules

ValueDefinition.Name: AdjustModuleOrientationOnceSpecialModuleWasPlaced
ValueDefinition.Description: If the main modules should be axis oriented if a tractor / silo / fertilizer module was added. Used for vehicle feedback on farms

ValueDefinition.Name: ModuleBuildRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: set to 0 if modules have to be build adjacent

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowModulesInSameHarbor
ValueDefinition.Description: Modules can be build free like with ModuleBuildRadius, but the build area is defined by the coastline

ValueDefinition.Name: AddModuleLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: Holding shift while building modules increases the module limit for ModuleType_Main

ValueDefinition.Name: UseSingleModuleUpgrading
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is set then only the selected module will be upgraded after clicking on the upgrade from blueprint button. Otherwise all will be upgraded at once (farm fields for example)

ValueDefinition.Name: BlueprintModuleOption
ModuleButtonIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: owners with multiple construction options should configure the module button for the blueprint menu. If not configured, the first construction option is used (default for farms)

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowRemainingModuleCount
ValueDefinition.Description: the module popup can show the remaining module count
for the blueprint menu: how should the module button look like and is there a popup with multiple options?

ValueDefinition.Name: BaseAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: Monument with PhaseNumber 1

ValueDefinition.Name: UpgradeTarget
ValueDefinition.Description: The next phase of the monument. 0 if this is the final state (completed)

ValueDefinition.Name: UseReplaceInsteadOfChangeGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is set instead of changing the GUID on upgrade, the object is destroyed and a new one is created. Is used when properties have to change on upgrade.

ValueDefinition.Name: MicrophaseCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of microphases.Each microphase is a production cycle configured in FactoryBase

ValueDefinition.Name: ShutdownText
ValueDefinition.Description: Message is shown in Monument event screen if monument is in shutdown state

ValueDefinition.Name: FakePrerequisites
ValueDefinition.Description: Campaign tunnel needs demolition expert

ValueDefinition.Name: FinishButtonText
ValueDefinition.Description: The button to finish this phase has this text

ValueDefinition.Name: EventSelection
ValueDefinition.Description: Background showing in EventSelection state of MonumentEvents

ValueDefinition.Name: ConnectToLogistics
ValueDefinition.Description: disables that a monument is connected to the logistics, this will break normal monuments but is in use for some special monuments in GGJ

ValueDefinition.Name: HideInfolayerBeforeProgress
ValueDefinition.Description: Hides the initial pause infolayer and the missing connection until progress is started

ValueDefinition.Name: InfolayerWhileWorking
ValueDefinition.Description: if set this is shown while the monument is constructed (and blocks the initial pause infolayer, so a default infolayer with low prio should be set!)

ValueDefinition.Name: AccessEventText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text for small monument object menu describing what happens when you click on the start event button

Property.Name: MonumentEventBuilding

ValueDefinition.Name: CooldownText
ValueDefinition.Description: is shown instead of AccessEventText if Event is on cooldown

ValueDefinition.Name: EventConclusionText
ValueDefinition.Description: when collecting the reward this text explains where the reward is coming from

ValueDefinition.Name: RandomIdleVariations
VariationSoundSwitch
ValueDefinition.Description: Sound switch of the EventTypeSwitchGroup that will be set if this variation is chosen
first entry is the standard variation, duration of a variation is chosen randomly between MinDuration and MaxDuration

Property.Description: Final phase of a monument can host events

ValueDefinition.Name: OnRecruitEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: Effect is applied to all units that are recruited on the island where a monument event building has reached this reward level

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardEffectDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: gets reduced by missing preparation goods and missing aqueduct connection

ValueDefinition.Name: EffectEndWarning
ValueDefinition.Description: Warning notification is triggered when this time is still left before effect level is decreased

ValueDefinition.Name: PlazaSize
ValueDefinition.Description: if above 0 you can draw a plaza out of this elements, one dimension of it restricted by this number

ValueDefinition.Name: OrnamentUnit
ValueDefinition.Description: grid size of this ornament, used in prestige calculation

ValueDefinition.Name: RepairDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: when switching to a new target, wait some time until start repairing

ValueDefinition.Name: HealBuildingsPerMinute
ValueDefinition.Description: when repairing buildings, this rate is used. Set to 0 if no buildings should be targeted

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumRepairTargets
ValueDefinition.Description: How many targets can be repaired at the same time from this crane

ValueDefinition.Name: TutorialID
ValueDefinition.Description: ID to find this button from the tutorial component

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalTabData
HideTabsIfDLCNotActive
ValueDefinition.Description: If one of the following DLCs is not active we should hide the tabs. Tabs will only be shown if there is an AssemblyFilter
Tab in UI will only be shown if this asset is unlocked

ValueDefinition.Name: SnapsToSlot
ValueDefinition.Description: Is this a slot or does this building need a slot to snap to?

ValueDefinition.Name: SlotType
ValueDefinition.Description: What kind of slot is this / is needed

ValueDefinition.Name: WorkArea
ValueDefinition.Description: which workarea is attached to this slot building?

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoChangeVariation
ValueDefinition.Description: if you snap to this slot, the variation changes automatically

ValueDefinition.Name: HighlightOnSelection
ValueDefinition.Description: Should the WorkArea be highlighted when the complex is selected?

ValueDefinition.Name: SlotCategoryName
ValueDefinition.Description: BuildingCategory in Objectmenu of slot buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: WorkAreaSupportsLogistic
ValueDefinition.Description: Can Logicist transporter use WorkArea as target additional to main building?

ValueDefinition.Name: IdleTime
ValueDefinition.Description: If the thirdparty menu is visible and no message was triggered for this time than the idle message will be triggered.

ValueDefinition.Name: PossibleUpgrades
UpgradeMode
ValueDefinition.Description: If the building doesn't change its template / properties after the upgrade use "Change". Otherwise use "Replace"
For Residences: First entry should be the roman variant, second entry should be region varian

ValueDefinition.Name: OwnerChangeGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: put a guid bigger than 0 here to not destroy this completly but just downgrade to that GUID when the owner changes

ValueDefinition.Name: CanBePlacedOnNonMarsh
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this building is allowed to be placed on marsh as well as on non-marsh land

ValueDefinition.Name: WaterVolumeSupply
ValueDefinition.Description: This value is the supplied water pressure.

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockToActivateConsumption
ValueDefinition.Description: Optional consumers normally require a tech to activate the consumption (leave empty if no unlock is required)

ValueDefinition.Name: WaterConsumption
ValueDefinition.Description: How much water is this distributor consuming by itself

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: The minimum possible height of aqueduct segments

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: the maximum possible height of aqueduct segments

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumHeightDifference
ValueDefinition.Description: the maximum height difference a tower can have

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumSourceConnectionHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: the maximum height of the source building

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumSlopePercent
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum slope of the aqueduct. A value of one means one percent of slope, so per 100 units in game, the height will vary by 1 unit

ValueDefinition.Name: IsBridgeStyle
ValueDefinition.Description: Set to true if this wall style should be handled as a bridge

Property.Name: Threatable
Property.Description: building that can be threatened by incident or enemy military

ValueDefinition.Name: Population
ValueDefinition.Description: If this objects creates population via attributes, which PopulationLevel does it belong to

Property.Name: Romanization
Property.Description: For objects that contribute to the romanization value

ValueDefinition.Name: RelativeProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: The higher, the likelier that this CFG is spawned more often. Do not need to add up to one.

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoSpawn_AmbientZones
ValueDefinition.Description: If AutoSpawning: In which ambient zones do we find this animal?

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoSpawn_Regions
ValueDefinition.Description: If AutoSpawning: In which regions do these animals spawn?

ValueDefinition.Name: UnitCountMin
ValueDefinition.Description: If AutoSpawning: How many units are in this group at minimum?

ValueDefinition.Name: UnitCountMax
ValueDefinition.Description: If AutoSpawning: How many units are in this group at maximum?

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoSpawn_RelativeProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: If autospawning: how likely is it to spawn this unit compared to others?

ValueDefinition.Name: ScaleFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: As animal CFGs are used both in AnimalSystem and in FeedbackEditor, and they often get a custom scale factor in FeedbackEditor, we also need one in AnimalSystem

ValueDefinition.Name: ScaleDeviationFactorMin
ValueDefinition.Description: To have slight size-variations within the same herd, we additionally multiply every size with this factor. Allow every scale between ScaleDeviationMin*ScaleFactor and ScaleDeviationMax*ScaleFactor.

ValueDefinition.Name: ScaleDeviationFactorMax
ValueDefinition.Description: To have slight size-variations within the same herd, we additionally multiply every size with this factor. Allow every scale between ScaleDeviationMin*ScaleFactor and ScaleDeviationMax*ScaleFactor.

Property.Name: AnimalFlock
Property.Description: Flock of animals, used for birds and fishes

ValueDefinition.Name: Speed
ValueDefinition.Description: The speed with which the single units fly

ValueDefinition.Name: HardBoundingBoxConstraint
ValueDefinition.Description: True: never ever leaves bounding box. A tiny bit less smooth movement. False: May leave bounding box to a small extent.

ValueDefinition.Name: Underwater
ValueDefinition.Description: Makes sure the units are never higher than the water surface.

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoSpawnOverWholeMap
ValueDefinition.Description: Should some AutoSpawned Flocks fly over whole map?

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoSpawnOverIsland
ValueDefinition.Description: Should some AutoSpawned Flocks be bound to certain Islands?

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoSpawnAtCoasts
ValueDefinition.Description: Should some AutoSpawned Flocks fly in circles around the Harbor?

ValueDefinition.Name: CatchesFishes
ValueDefinition.Description: Bird Flock can fly down and catch FlockFishes

ValueDefinition.Name: IsCatchableFish
ValueDefinition.Description: Other Bird Flocks can fly down to this fish flock and catch fishes

ValueDefinition.Name: MinHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: MinHeight above ground

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: Max Height above ground

ValueDefinition.Name: LandingConfig
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines where this flock is allowed to land. Objects means it can land on dummies placed on buildings, LandLayer means it is allowed to land on terrain, and Marsh means its allowed to land in the marsh

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowedSpawnAreas
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines where this herd is allowed to spawn. If marsh is true it can spawn in marsh, if meadow is true it can spawn on grassland

ValueDefinition.Name: LikesToRunAround
ValueDefinition.Description: Should Running (instead of only walking) be triggered now and then? If false, herd only runs when it is fleeing.

ValueDefinition.Name: StandTogetherRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: How far away from herd center are individual animals allowed stand around.

ValueDefinition.Name: GroupPositionChangeInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: In which interval does the whole Herd try to find another center position

ValueDefinition.Name: IndividualPositionChangeInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: In which interval do individual units do small movements within StandTogetherRadius?

ValueDefinition.Name: Attacks
ValueDefinition.Description: If animals of this herd should attack other herds

ValueDefinition.Name: Attackable
ValueDefinition.Description: If this Herd can be attacked by another Herd

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlyAutoSpawnNearRiverspots
ValueDefinition.Description: Should we suppress auto-spawning for herd areas without a river spot?

ValueDefinition.Name: GotoRiverSpotInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Herd will search a River Spot target at this interval

ValueDefinition.Name: RiverSpotStayDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: After finding a river spot target, how long until moving on

ValueDefinition.Name: RiverSpotInteractionProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: How many of the herd units will interact with the river spot, how many will just stand around like there was no river spot

ValueDefinition.Name: FogOfWarSpecialDiscovery
ValueDefinition.Description: CAUTION: THIS IS EXPENSIVE AND ONLY MAKES SENSE FOR REGROWING FOG_OF_WAR SPECIAL CASES. Will continuously undiscover a circle around the object with given radius as long as the object is alive for the ProcessingParticipant when this object is spawned by a ActionSpawnObject.

Property.Name: MeshGraphEdgeSelection
Property.Description: Can be spawned per edge to enable edge selections

ValueDefinition.Name: HitBoxReferenceCfg
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this cfg will be used as reference for hit box calculations

ValueDefinition.Name: DamagedEdgeHitboxHeightReduction
ValueDefinition.Description: If this edge is damaged, how much of the hitbox height should be reduced relatively

Property.Name: MeshGraphEdgeHealth
Property.Description: Used to determine health on a one-tile-length subsegment basis. Is not affected by node changes in the underlying mesh graph

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnAdditionalGenericRuins
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this mesh graph dummy will spawn generic ruins when entering ruin state

Property.Name: MeshGraphStyle
Property.Description: The style of a graph edge (e.g. dirt road / stone road / dirt bridge / ...)

ValueDefinition.Name: ConfigFile
ValueDefinition.Description: Path to the config file

ValueDefinition.Name: OptionalDiagonalConfigFile
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be used to replace the cfg in diagonal placements

ValueDefinition.Name: Position
ValueDefinition.Description: Relative position on the edge between 0.0 and 1.0

ValueDefinition.Name: Length
ValueDefinition.Description: Edge length (from start to end tile) of the config.

ValueDefinition.Name: UseForUnitPlacement
ValueDefinition.Description: TBD: If true, this cfg is used for placing units on e.g. a gate

ValueDefinition.Name: MaintenancePerUnitLength
ValueDefinition.Description: How much Maintenance-Money does this cost per edge of length 1

ValueDefinition.Name: IsSpecialGateStyle
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, gate placement rules apply and build costs are not multiplied with the edge length, but instead calculated per edge

ValueDefinition.Name: BoundingRectBorder
ValueDefinition.Description: (tiles) connection tool will create a border rect around the path setup and only acoid obstacles within this area, this define how big the border around the path setup is

ValueDefinition.Name: FollowPriorityFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: (percent) connection tool will try to follow exactly the path setup if possible, this defines how strong this property of the path is weighted

ValueDefinition.Name: LengthPriorityFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: (percent) connection tool will try to construct a short path, this defines how strong this property of the path is weighted

ValueDefinition.Name: ProximityPriorityFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: (percent) connection tool will try to construct a path in the proximity of the path setup, this defines how strong this property of the path is weighted

ValueDefinition.Name: LateDiversionPriorityFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: (percent) connection tool will try to construct a path which diverge als late as possible from the path setup, this defines how strong this property of the path is weighted

ValueDefinition.Name: NoBuildingTouchedPenalty
ValueDefinition.Description: (percent) Every tile of the connection which is not touching a building has a certain penalty according to this value.

ValueDefinition.Name: Radius
ValueDefinition.Description: radius of the direction prediction circle

ValueDefinition.Name: DiagonalAngle
ValueDefinition.Description: diagonal direction prediction angle (if active)

ValueDefinition.Name: StartPointRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: radius in which the connection tools scans for a valid connection start point

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetPointRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: radius in which the connection tools scans for a valid connection target point

ValueDefinition.Name: FilePath1x1Preview
ValueDefinition.Description: When previewing single tiles (which are not supported to build yet), we draw this CFG. (Not as part of the meshgraph system, but as seperate cfg)

Property.Name: Unit
Property.Description: Describes an object in the UnitSystem that is controllable as one thing. Not every unit has to support every functionality a unit can have, such as the ability to move or attack. To be confirmed (07/2023): A unit is also always part of the CombatSystem.

ValueDefinition.Name: DiscoveryRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: 0 = Disable Discover

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableEscort
ValueDefinition.Description: (This was ported from 1800 and may be removed / reworked)

ValueDefinition.Name: ThreatRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Ships and Troops can be a threat to enemy construction area

ValueDefinition.Name: ApplyThreatOnlyInCombat
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, the threat radius is only applied while this unit is in combat

ValueDefinition.Name: NeutralDetectionRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Inside this radius, this unit will detect units and targets and react to that

ValueDefinition.Name: AggressiveDetectionRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Inside this radius, this unit will detect units and targets and react to that aggressivly

ValueDefinition.Name: AddHighestAttackRangeToDetectionRanges
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, the stance radii are added ontop of the highest attack range instead of being the static value balanced here in T9

ValueDefinition.Name: AggressiveChaseRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Aggressive units will chase their target until they are this far away to where they started the chase from. When moving farther away, they will abort the chase and return to the initial position

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardMoneyPerDestroyedBuilding
ValueDefinition.Description: How much money does the player get when destroying any opponents building

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardMoneyPerDestroyedShip
ValueDefinition.Description: How much money does the player get when destroying any opponents ship

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowAttackRange
ValueDefinition.Description: Whether this unit should show its attack range(s) when picked, selected, ...

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_Defense
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of defense buff. Value will be add on absolute terms to DefenseValue

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_Armor
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of armor buff. Value will be add on absolute terms to ArmorValue

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_Shield
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of shield buff. Value will be add on absolute terms to ShieldValue

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_Accuracy
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of accuracy buff. Value will be add on absolute terms to accuracy value (which itself is already a percentage)

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_Accuracy_ArcherModule
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of accuracy buff for the archer module. Value will be add on absolute terms to accuracy value (which itself is already a percentage)

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_Accuracy_CatapultModule
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of accuracy buff for the catapult module. Value will be add on absolute terms to accuracy value (which itself is already a percentage)

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_Accuracy_BallistaModule
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of accuracy buff for the ballista module. Value will be add on absolute terms to accuracy value (which itself is already a percentage)

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_DistanceAttackRange_Percent
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of distance attack range buff. Value is interpreted as a percentage of how the attack range is changed.

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_DistanceAttackRange_ArcherModule_Percent
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of distance attack range buff for the archer module. Value is interpreted as a percentage of how the attack range is changed.

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_DistanceAttackRange_CatapultModule_Percent
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of distance attack range buff for the catapult module. Value is interpreted as a percentage of how the attack range is changed.

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_DistanceAttackRange_BallistaModule_Percent
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of distance attack range buff for the ballista module. Value is interpreted as a percentage of how the attack range is changed.

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_Offense_Melee
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of melee offense value buff. Value will be add on absolute terms to OffenseValue, capping at 20

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_Offense_Charge
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of charge offense value buff. Value will be add on absolute terms to OffenseValue, capping at 20

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_Offense_Ranged
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of ranged offense value buff. Value will be add on absolute terms to OffenseValue, capping at 20

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_Offense_ArcherModule_Ranged
