ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of archer module ranged offense value buff. Value will be add on absolute terms to OffenseValue, capping at 20

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_Offense_CatapultModule_Ranged
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of catapult module ranged offense value buff. Value will be add on absolute terms to OffenseValue, capping at 20

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_Offense_BallistaModule_Ranged
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of ballista module ranged offense value buff. Value will be add on absolute terms to OffenseValue, capping at 20

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_AttackSpeed_Ranged_Percent
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of attack speed buff, affecting ranged behavior (aimed at troops). Value will be taken as a percentual increase/decrease

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_AttackSpeed_Torch_Percent
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of attack speed buff, affecting torch behavior (aimed at troops). Value will be taken as a percentual increase/decrease

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_AttackSpeed_ArcherModule_Percent
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of attack speed buff for the archer module, affecting ranged and torch behavior. Value will be taken as a percentual increase/decrease

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_AttackSpeed_CatapultModule_Percent
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of attack speed buff for the catapult module, affecting ranged and torch behavior. Value will be taken as a percentual increase/decrease

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBase_AttackSpeed_BallistaModule_Percent
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value of attack speed buff for the ballista module, affecting ranged and torch behavior. Value will be taken as a percentual increase/decrease

ValueDefinition.Name: BaseHealth
ValueDefinition.Description: Does not apply to Land Units. They use DetachedElement.GamePlay.BaseHealth instead

ValueDefinition.Name: PausedTimeIfAttacked
ValueDefinition.Description: buildings get shutdown if under attack

ValueDefinition.Name: AlertRange
ValueDefinition.Description: If this attackable is attacked (or attacks) an enemy, it sends an alert to all ally units within this range. 0 = no alerts

ValueDefinition.Name: DefenseByAIFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: how will the AI defend this? 0 - never defend, 100 - defend with normal calculation, 200 - defend with higher prio, even if 2:1 outnumbered

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockBuildActionsAfterAttackDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: building actions: repair, move, destruct, upgrade are blocked after damaged by an attacker

ValueDefinition.Name: HasRuinState
ValueDefinition.Description: When buildings loose their last Hitpoints, they are change to ruin state

ValueDefinition.Name: UsedRuinStateBehavior
ValueDefinition.Description: Which ruin state behavior should be triggered if the object goes into ruin state. ReplaceWithCustomMesh requires the object to have the property DynamicVariation with the ruin state replacement config!

ValueDefinition.Name: CustomRuinStateCfg
ValueDefinition.Description: Is spawned instead of the objects cfg, if the ReplaceWithCustomMesh ruin state behavior is selected

ValueDefinition.Name: DamagedRenderConditions
EqualOrBelowHealth
ValueDefinition.Description: [0.0 - 1.0] Condition is used if current health percentage is equal or below this value
Defines render condition requirements, which are used if the AnimateWithRenderConditions ruin state behavior is selected

ValueDefinition.Name: GenericRuinsOverwriteRuinTypeRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: If generic ruins are used, this can overwrite the regional ruin cfgs that are used. Meta = "use current region"

ValueDefinition.Name: RuinSmokeParticles
ValueDefinition.Description: The smoke particles that will be spawned during ruin state

ValueDefinition.Name: RuinSmokeParticlesMin
ValueDefinition.Description: Min amount of smoke particles during ruin state

ValueDefinition.Name: RuinSmokeParticlesMax
ValueDefinition.Description: Max amount of smoke particles during ruin state

ValueDefinition.Name: RuinSmokeParticleRectBorderPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: The smoke particles spawn on the whole building bounding box minus a border area - this value states how big of a percentage this border is on each of the 4 sides.

ValueDefinition.Name: ExplosionEffects
ValueDefinition.Description: When the building enters ruin state, one of the cfgs in here will be played

ValueDefinition.Name: ExplosionEffectsMin
ValueDefinition.Description: Min amount of explosion effects that will play on enter ruin state

ValueDefinition.Name: ExplosionEffectsMax
ValueDefinition.Description: Max amount of explosion effects that will play on enter ruin state

ValueDefinition.Name: SelfHealPerHealTick
ValueDefinition.Description: building heals this amount of HP per Heal tick (currently 1 per second)

ValueDefinition.Name: SelfHealPausedTimeIfAttacked
ValueDefinition.Description: building starts self repair after this time if not under attack anymore

ValueDefinition.Name: PassiveRuinRepairTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long it takes until a building that entered ruin state is automatically repaired again

ValueDefinition.Name: PassiveRuinRepairSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: A modifier applied to the "PassiveRuinRepairTime". Speed=2 equals half the repair time. Needed for buffs

ValueDefinition.Name: DestructionWarScore
ValueDefinition.Description: How much WarScore the attacker will gain, when destroying this object

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipwreckedUnitDamage
Damage
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of damage that gets applied to shipwrecked units

ValueDefinition.Name: Timeout
ValueDefinition.Description: Time between applying damage to shipwrecked units

ValueDefinition.Name: InitialTimeout
ValueDefinition.Description: Time it takes before shipwrecked units take damage the first time
Damage configuration if this asset is a shipwrecked unit

ValueDefinition.Name: AccuracySize100
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 100]. The object covers this percentage of the area of the biggest accuracy circle in the context of accuracy calculations

ValueDefinition.Name: UnderAttackEffectHealthThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Spawns the UnderAttackEffectConfig when health falls below this threshold

ValueDefinition.Name: UnderAttackEffectConfig
ValueDefinition.Description: Which effect config is spawned when the object falls below the UnderAttackEffectHealthThreshold

Property.Name: Movement
Property.Description: Describes an object in the UnitSystem that can move.

ValueDefinition.Name: UsesDrifting
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this unit will drift away other units and be drifted away by other units

ValueDefinition.Name: UsesAvoidance
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this unit will adapt its seped to avoid other units

ValueDefinition.Name: Layer
ValueDefinition.Description: The path planner layer this unit moves on

ValueDefinition.Name: BaseSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: How many world space units this unit can move per second. Different situations (e.g. catching up, charge speed, ...) can be balanced relative to this value

ValueDefinition.Name: Acceleration
ValueDefinition.Description: How many world units this unit can accellerate per second

ValueDefinition.Name: Deceleration
ValueDefinition.Description: How many world units this unit can decelerate per second

ValueDefinition.Name: TurnCornerRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: When a units path contains a corner, how much should it be rounded? This specifies the corner-radius in world space units

ValueDefinition.Name: TurnDecelerationFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 1]: In turns, units decellerate based on curve sharpness and their desired turn radius. This factor defines how much the calculated turn deceleration affects this unit. 0 = does not affect this unit at all, 1 = does fully affect this unit

ValueDefinition.Name: RotationSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: When a unit turns along a curve, this defines how many degrees per second the unit can turn around the Y-Axis.

ValueDefinition.Name: SpotTurnRotationSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: When a unit turns on the spot (in place), this defines how many degrees per second the unit can turn around the Y-Axis.

ValueDefinition.Name: TurnAroundCircleRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: When a unit starts a new path in a different direction, a turn circle is added to the start of the path. This defines the radius of the turn around circle radius in world space units. 0 = turn in place instead

ValueDefinition.Name: RotateWhileMovingFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 100] When a unit starts a new path in a different direction, it has the ability to rotate while already moving. 0 = Rotate in place, then move. 100 = Move, even if you do not look in the right direction yet. [1-99] = Mixture of both

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBaseSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Overall multiplier for the movement speed in percent

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffTransferSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Overall multiplier for the session transfer speed in percent

ValueDefinition.Name: AffectedByWind
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this units speed is affected by how it is placed raletive to the wind

ValueDefinition.Name: SpeedFactorAtFavorableWind_MovingStraight
ValueDefinition.Description: When moving in a straight line at favorable wind, this is the speed factor the unit will get

ValueDefinition.Name: SpeedFactorAtFavorableWind_DuringTurn
ValueDefinition.Description: When moving in a turn at favorable wind, this is the speed factor the unit will get

ValueDefinition.Name: SpeedFactorAtUnfavorableWind_MovingStraight
ValueDefinition.Description: When moving in a straight line against unfavorable wind, this is the speed factor the unit will get

ValueDefinition.Name: SpeedFactorAtUnfavorableWind_DuringTurn
ValueDefinition.Description: When moving in a turn against unfavorable wind, this is the speed factor the unit will get

ValueDefinition.Name: FavorableWindAngle
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 180] The angle between wind and unit movement direction until which we consider the wind to be favorable

ValueDefinition.Name: AffectedByCargo
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this units speed is affected by how much cargo it is carrying

ValueDefinition.Name: Threshold
ValueDefinition.Description: [0;100]: At which percentage of loaded cargo does speed affected by cargo kick in?

ValueDefinition.Name: SpeedFactorAtThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: When loading just as much cargo as the threshold defines, this is the speed factor to unit will get

ValueDefinition.Name: SpeedFactorAtFullLoad
ValueDefinition.Description: When loading as much cargo as possible, this is the speed factor to unit will get

ValueDefinition.Name: Threshold
ValueDefinition.Description: [0;100]: At which percentage of lost HP does speed affected by damage kick in?

ValueDefinition.Name: SpeedFactorAtThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: When being damaged just as as the threshold defines, this is the speed factor to unit will get

ValueDefinition.Name: SpeedFactorAtFullDamage
ValueDefinition.Description: When being fully damaged (0HP), this is the speed factor to unit will get

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffReduceCargoImpact
ValueDefinition.Description: [0;100] Buffable value that makes the effects of cargo caused speed changes by that much % less effective

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffReduceDamageImpact
ValueDefinition.Description: [0;100] Buffable value that makes the effects of damage caused speed changes by that much % less effective

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffReduceNegativeWindImpact
ValueDefinition.Description: [0;100] Buffable value that makes the effects of negative wind caused speed changes by that much % less effective

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffReducePositiveWindImpact
ValueDefinition.Description: [0;100] Buffable value that makes the effects of positive wind caused speed changes by that much % less effective

ValueDefinition.Name: UsesDrifting
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this unit will drift away other units and be drifted away by other units

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumRotationalDrift
ValueDefinition.Description: How many degrees this unit can rotate due to drifting per tick

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumPositionalDrift
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance this unit can be pushed due to drifting per tick

ValueDefinition.Name: UsesAvoidance
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this unit will adapt its seped to avoid other units

ValueDefinition.Name: ColliderInnerLength
ValueDefinition.Description: Length of the line that forms the base of the capsule collider of this unit.

ValueDefinition.Name: ColliderRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Radius around ColliderInnerLength to form the collider. At the longest point, the collider will have dimensions (2 * ColliderRadius + ColliderInnerLength ) x (2 * ColliderRadius)

ValueDefinition.Name: LeansInwards
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this object will lean inwards when affected by leaning

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumLeaningAngleDegrees
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum angle this unit can lean, in degrees

ValueDefinition.Name: LeaningSmoothingFactor100
ValueDefinition.Description: [1; 100] Everytime the leaning change s(new leaning applied, returning to 0 leaning over time), this number decides how fast we go to the desired leaning. 1 = super slow, 100 = instantly

Property.Name: MovementFeedback
Property.Description: This property changes the movement into a simpler version which can save a lot of processing time and memory for every asset where it is added. It is also easier to control for artists as it will exactly hit any waypoints they manually add. As for now it just takes things away from normal movement there are no options you can edit here.

ValueDefinition.Name: DestroyOnCollect
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, delete object on collect

ValueDefinition.Name: OnCollect
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of actions that will be executed when collecting this object.

ValueDefinition.Name: CollectableType
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines type of this collectable. Used to distinguish e.g. different types of allowed collectors

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckOwner
ValueDefinition.Description: If selected, this can only be picked up by the owner

ValueDefinition.Name: NotCollactableIfTargetStoragePartiallyFull
ValueDefinition.Description: Collection is blocked if not enough storage capacity in target

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowedToCollect
ValueDefinition.Description: All types of collectables that this collector is allowed to collect

Property.Name: DayNightReaction
Property.Description: Is not needed for a Local Feedback Unit, but gives additional meta information

ValueDefinition.Name: UnitNightBehavior
ValueDefinition.Description: Overwrites the building night behavior for this unit if not default

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: After creating or moving, the building is paused for this time

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: block upgrade wile delayed contsruction is in progress

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockDowngrade
ValueDefinition.Description: block downgrade while delayed contsruction is in progress

ValueDefinition.Name: PauseMeshSequence
ValueDefinition.Description: SequenceSpeed of Mesh-Sequence is paused instead of changed to idle

ValueDefinition.Name: UpdateMeshSequence
ValueDefinition.Description: productivity changes automatically lead to mesh sequence changes

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreIncidents
ValueDefinition.Description: do not disable feedback for incidents (make sure that no persons are walking where flames appear)

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableOnAttack
ValueDefinition.Description: disable feedback if building has been recently attacked (PausedTimeOnAttack is needed)

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableOnIslandWar
ValueDefinition.Description: disable feedback if island war is active

ValueDefinition.Name: StopOldSequenceWhenStartingNewOne
ValueDefinition.Description: I true, the old sequence is reset when a new sequence is started.

ValueDefinition.Name: Time
ValueDefinition.Description: 0 means life forever

ValueDefinition.Name: FlyDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for flotsam spawned from airships on land, determines the time it takes for the flotsam to land

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlyVisibleInEditor
ValueDefinition.Description: Only visible in Editor

ValueDefinition.Name: InitialVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: false = Object is set to invisible on map load (first session enter)

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionEffectDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: 0 for no construction effect

ValueDefinition.Name: DeconstructionEffectDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: 0 for no deconstruction effect

ValueDefinition.Name: MoveEffectDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: used for construct and deconstruct effect when moving buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: ChangeGUIDEffectDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Effect Duration when upgrading, set to 0 if no effect should be shown

ValueDefinition.Name: ForbidCollapseEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: The collapse shader looks shitty on some rare meshes. Rnd cant easily fix that so we try to replace it with something similar like a simple fadeout

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreDamageDesaturation
ValueDefinition.Description: In rare cases, units get a destruction-texture assigned, that should not appear desaturated, so damage only results in flames, not in flames+meshDesaturation

ValueDefinition.Name: SetCompanyLogo
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the company logo from the player will be added to the TextureAtlas and set for the RenderObject

ValueDefinition.Name: UnderwaterOutlineIfOwnedOrAllianceMember
ValueDefinition.Description: Outline for underwater objects (e.g. sea mines) visible for owner and alliance members

ValueDefinition.Name: LocalFeedbackObjectSizeCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: If this object is used as local feedback, whit should its camer clipping attributes be

ValueDefinition.Name: TokenAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: Icon that is displayed on the minimap

ValueDefinition.Name: Filter
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the associated minimap filter that toggles the visibility of these kind of tokens

ValueDefinition.Name: Tooltip
ValueDefinition.Description: Only relevant if 'Interactive' is false

ValueDefinition.Name: NamePreset
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, the nameable will spawn with this name. Else, it will take the name from the unit name pool

ValueDefinition.Name: Variations
ValueDefinition.Description: Vector of variations.

ValueDefinition.Name: Filename
ValueDefinition.Description: path of the .cfg file;

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultSkinName
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the Default skin in the infotip

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultSkinDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Fluff text of the default skin in the infotip

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultSkinCategoryName
ValueDefinition.Description: Description of the category a skin belongs to. Like name of a CDLC

ValueDefinition.Name: OverrideDefaultIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: Optional Parameter: If this path is set it overrides the standard icon for the Default Skin

ValueDefinition.Name: SkinList
ValueDefinition.Description: List of skin assets

ValueDefinition.Name: AssignDefaultProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: True = When the object is placed in the editor. The assigned participant will be based on this asset configuration, not on the current editor state.

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: The role of a participant that is assigned to this object by default when placed in the editor.

ValueDefinition.Name: AddToObjectGroups
ValueDefinition.Description: Editor Feature: True = object is assigned to an object group/folder on creation in editor

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreForMinimapGeneration
ValueDefinition.Description: if set to true, the object is invisible while generating the minimap image

ValueDefinition.Name: CanPauseManually
ValueDefinition.Description: Can the player pause this object

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoomIDFixedCam
ValueDefinition.Description: The zoom ID of that should be applied if the user is using the fixed cam

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoomIDFreeCam
ValueDefinition.Description: The zoom ID of that should be applied if the user is using the free cam

ValueDefinition.Name: ProjectileSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Projectile will move this many units per second. Changing the alters the speed at different stages of flight, but does not change the overall air time

ValueDefinition.Name: ShotAngle
ValueDefinition.Description: Angle at which the projectile will be shot. Should somehow match the angle of the LineOfSight type the angle is used in, but does not have to

ValueDefinition.Name: RotationMode
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how the projectile rotates during launch and while in the air

ValueDefinition.Name: RandomRotationOnImpact
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, the projectile will have a random rotation on impact. Usefull if the projectile plays impact VFX and we want to show them from a diferent direction every time

ValueDefinition.Name: InnerDamageRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Elements closer to the impact position than this value will be damaged by InnerDamage

ValueDefinition.Name: InnerDamage
ValueDefinition.Description: Is applied to all elements that are closer to the impact position than InnerDamageRadius

ValueDefinition.Name: OuterDamageRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Elements closer to the impact position than this value will be damaged by the linear interpolated damage between InnerDamage and OuterDamage

ValueDefinition.Name: OuterDamage
ValueDefinition.Description: Is applied to all elements that are further to he impact than InnerDamageRadius but closer than OuterDamageRadius

ValueDefinition.Name: InterpolateOuterDamage
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, outer damage is interpolated based on the inner, outer and impact distance

ValueDefinition.Name: DebrisForceX
ValueDefinition.Description: The force applied to the X-Axis

ValueDefinition.Name: DebrisForceY
ValueDefinition.Description: The force applied to the Y-Axis

ValueDefinition.Name: DebrisForceZ
ValueDefinition.Description: The force applied to the Z-Axis

ValueDefinition.Name: DebrisCount
ValueDefinition.Description: The number of objects spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: PiercingRadiusAgainstObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: The radius this projectile has on impact against objects (buildings, ships)

ValueDefinition.Name: StunDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of time detached elements inside the OuterRadius are stunned after impact

ValueDefinition.Name: CausedLeaningOnImpact
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 100] If the target can lean, the projectile applies this much percent of the maximum leaning of the target to the target if it impacts from broadside

ValueDefinition.Name: UseRandomRotation
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, the impact effects caused by this projectile will have a random rotation around the y-axis. Otherwise, they will have their +x facing in the impact direction

ValueDefinition.Name: ImpactEffects
ValueDefinition.Description: For each type of impact we have, configures which impact config file(s) can be spawned on impact

ValueDefinition.Name: CanCausePlunderMechanic
ValueDefinition.Description: Does this projectile trigger the plundering mechanic

ValueDefinition.Name: HerdBlocking
ValueDefinition.Description: Does this prop block herd-animals? Passabel = blocking is ignored (use for bushes). PassableWhenSparse = single objects area passable, groups of objects not. Only center of object blocks (use for trees). NeverPassable = always blocking with full bounding box (use for rocks)

ValueDefinition.Name: VegetationType
ValueDefinition.Description: is this prop usable by a woodcutter?

ValueDefinition.Name: RespectDummySpawnerMap
ValueDefinition.Description: Set this value to 1 to IGNORE the dummy spawner map. Set to < 1 to place dummies only on positions which are valid in the dummy spawner map

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: Chance between 0 and 1 to spawn a dummy at a certain position. Independent of the RespectDummySpawnerMap value

ValueDefinition.Name: ActivateAll
ValueDefinition.Description: Slots of this type are always active and are removed from the MapGeneratorSlotCount of FixReplacement

ValueDefinition.Name: SlotBlocker
ValueDefinition.Description: Will be placed instead of the mine slot if a slot is not considered active during map generation

ValueDefinition.Name: ActivateAllSlot
ValueDefinition.Description: remove the occurrences of this slot from the MapGeneratorSlotCount

ValueDefinition.Name: OMHeaderImage
ValueDefinition.Description: Image that will be shown in the header of an objectmenu if we don't show a portrait

ValueDefinition.Name: StaticHelpEntryPoint
ValueDefinition.Description: Where to enter the static help page when opened from the selected object

ValueDefinition.Name: IsMultiSelectionType
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines if an object can be added to a multi selection. If so it can only be added to multi selections of objects with the same MultiSelectionType

ValueDefinition.Name: DestructSelectable
ValueDefinition.Description: Safeguard attribute for objects that should be deletable but not selectable (like bridges). If selectable is set, this value will be ignored.

ValueDefinition.Name: SelectionPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: CAUTION: Should really be called [SelectionRectPriority]. When drawing a selection rect and multiple non-multi-select-compatible objects are within (e.g. a ship and a feedback unit), the priority determins which will be selected.

ValueDefinition.Name: OnSelection
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of actions that will be executed when selecting this object.

ValueDefinition.Name: InteractionDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: When this object is the part of an interaction, how far away should the Bounding spheres of Source and Target Spheres at least be? (only the maximum of source and target is used)

ValueDefinition.Name: ParticipantMessageTrigger
ValueDefinition.Description: The pamsy trigger that is fired once this building is selected. If not [NONE], this overwrites the target participant for the message.

ValueDefinition.Name: InfoCorner
ValueDefinition.Description: Infotip that is shown on infocorner (clear to hide infocorner)

ValueDefinition.Name: InfoCornerNotOwned
ValueDefinition.Description: Infotip that is shown on infocorner if the selected object is not owned by you (clear to hide infocorner)

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowedDragType
ValueDefinition.Description: Which drag operations may be dropped to this object?

ValueDefinition.Name: SelectableOnStart
ValueDefinition.Description: If Selectable=true, there is a second check at runtime if an object may be selected. This value defines the starting value of that runtime check. This can be reverted later on via an action or similar

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowHighlightSubTileRect
ValueDefinition.Description: this asset uses its sub tile triangle to display highlights like selections

ValueDefinition.Name: Baseprice
ValueDefinition.Description: The baseprice might be modified by factors (e.g. the damage percentage)

ValueDefinition.Name: Resource
ValueDefinition.Description: Metaresources only

ValueDefinition.Name: CanBeSoldToTrader
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to false the ship can not be actively sold to the trader

ValueDefinition.Name: SellPriceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: This factor is multiplied to the base price when the ship is beeing sold.

ValueDefinition.Name: ExcludeShipModuleCosts
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, potential ship modules will not be added to the sell price

Property.Name: Skin
Property.Description: Asset Data Property for the cfg file for skins

ValueDefinition.Name: SkinName
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the skin displayed in the infotip

ValueDefinition.Name: SkinDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Description of the skin displayed in the infotip

ValueDefinition.Name: SkinCategoryDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Description of the category a skin belongs to. Like name of a CDLC

ValueDefinition.Name: SkinCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the category of a skin. Categories define a group of skins which will presented to the user in the UI, so only skins of the current group will be available to the player and another group might be selected via code in certain circumstances

ValueDefinition.Name: DefensiveReturnDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for the PassiveDefense & ActiveDefense stance - The range ships will chase an enemy they started to attack before returning to where they stood in the bgeinning. Aggressive Stance will chase infinitly

ValueDefinition.Name: LoadingSpeedFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: actual Loading Speed consists of two factors: Loading speed of LoadingPier of building and Loading speed of trade route ship

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumLoadingTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the minimum time the ship has to wait while trading goods (in seconds) Will override the minimum loading time of a pier, if this one is longer

Property.Name: Trailer
Property.Description: Adds another object behind the main object

ValueDefinition.Name: TrailerType
ValueDefinition.Description: With what Type of connection is the linked object Connected to its parent?

ValueDefinition.Name: TrailerEndPartCfgVariations
ValueDefinition.Description: Which objects are linked to this object?

ValueDefinition.Name: CfgVariation
ValueDefinition.Description: Config File for Mesh that is carried around

ValueDefinition.Name: RelativeProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: How Likely to pick this LinkedCFG out of all configured

ValueDefinition.Name: Stiffness
ValueDefinition.Description: 0: Angle between parent and child object is not constrainted. 1: Child object always has same rotation as Parent Object

ValueDefinition.Name: StartScale
ValueDefinition.Description: new planted trees can start as saplings

ValueDefinition.Name: RelevantSkinGUIDs
ValueDefinition.Description: Skin GUIDS of the skins that are relevant for influencing the music. If empty, all skins are relevant.

Property.Name: Polygon
Property.Description: creates a polygon area

ValueDefinition.Name: Path
ValueDefinition.Description: path to cfgs of polygon system

ValueDefinition.Name: PathDiagonal
ValueDefinition.Description: path to cfgs of polygon system for diagonal elements

ValueDefinition.Name: FencePath
ValueDefinition.Description: Keep empty if no fence is needed around the polygon

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedsPathsToAllSessions
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the worldmap will create paths between this asset and all other sessions

ValueDefinition.Name: Visuals
ValueDefinition.Description: The cfg which should be shown on the worldmap

ValueDefinition.Name: Infotip
ValueDefinition.Description: The infotip which should be shown on mouse over

ValueDefinition.Name: Unit
ValueDefinition.Description: Either a ship configuration or a land unit

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of the units

ValueDefinition.Name: IsTransportUnit
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines if the given unit should transport other units. Should be only used if the unit is a ship and has cargo slots

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnCFGAutoDeleteAfterTime
ValueDefinition.Description: 0 = never

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowRetriggerAfter
ValueDefinition.Description: 0 = never

Property.Name: DynamicVariation
Property.Description: Property for objects that choose .cfg during runtime

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowAutoTargetDisabledMatches
ValueDefinition.Description: If disabled matches should be considered for default auto target modes

ValueDefinition.Name: ValidFrom
ValueDefinition.Description: Value at which the selected text should be chosen. Ignored for the first entry in the list, so all values below map to this one.

ValueDefinition.Name: Name
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the variable. Needs to be unique so it can be referenced later.

ValueDefinition.Name: StartValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The default value of the variable when it gets created

ValueDefinition.Name: Comment
ValueDefinition.Description: Describes the usage of this variable

ValueDefinition.Name: Name
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the variable. Needs to be unique so it can be referenced later.

ValueDefinition.Name: StartValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The default value of the variable when it gets created

ValueDefinition.Name: Comment
ValueDefinition.Description: Describes the usage of this variable

ValueDefinition.Name: Name
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the variable. Needs to be unique so it can be referenced later.

ValueDefinition.Name: StartValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The default value of the variable when it gets created

ValueDefinition.Name: Comment
ValueDefinition.Description: Describes the usage of this variable

ValueDefinition.Name: Name
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the variable. Needs to be unique so it can be referenced later.

ValueDefinition.Name: StartValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The default value of the variable when it gets created

ValueDefinition.Name: Comment
ValueDefinition.Description: Describes the usage of this variable

ValueDefinition.Name: Name
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the variable. Needs to be unique so it can be referenced later.

ValueDefinition.Name: StartValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The default value of the variable when it gets created

ValueDefinition.Name: Comment
ValueDefinition.Description: Describes the usage of this variable

ValueDefinition.Name: Name
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the variable. Needs to be unique so it can be referenced later.

ValueDefinition.Name: StartValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The default value of the variable when it gets created

ValueDefinition.Name: Comment
ValueDefinition.Description: Describes the usage of this variable

ValueDefinition.Name: Name
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the variable. Needs to be unique so it can be referenced later.

ValueDefinition.Name: StartValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The default value of the variable when it gets created

ValueDefinition.Name: Comment
ValueDefinition.Description: Describes the usage of this variable

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowSceneDelayMS
ValueDefinition.Description: Duration in MS in which scenes are rendered off the screen to preload images

Property.Name: AmbientArea
Property.Description: Describes Local Light Variations

Property.Name: MusicArea
Property.Description: Plays Music when camera enters a given Radius

ValueDefinition.Name: Playlist
ValueDefinition.Description: Which Playlist should be played when camera comes into radius?

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeBeforeStartPlay
ValueDefinition.Description: When Radius is entered, the music is only played when we stay at least that time within

ValueDefinition.Name: CooldownBeforeNextPlay
ValueDefinition.Description: After we started playing, we wait until this timespan elapsed before we check radius-critera for replay

Property.Name: WorkAreaPath
Property.Description: handles the "Workarea Rollercoaster"

Property.Name: UnitSpawnMarker
Property.Description: Marks a spot at which a unit can be spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: UnitAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The gameobject that will be spawned at this marker

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlySpawnForVideo
ValueDefinition.Description: if set to true, the unit at this marker will only be spawned when the script is explicitly stating that video only units should also be spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: Building
ValueDefinition.Description: Building

ValueDefinition.Name: SoundFadeOutDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: How Long does an emitter sound (vehicle that goes out of camera / disappears) fade out?

ValueDefinition.Name: TrafficSoundEmitterCount
ValueDefinition.Description: How many SoundEmitters do we have simultanously to represent all visible vehicles

ValueDefinition.Name: FeedbackLeaning
ValueDefinition.Description: Basic value for all feedback leanings (further modified by speed and per-asset-value)

ValueDefinition.Name: ClippingInfos
ValueDefinition.Description: How are Traffic and Local Feedback Units Clipped?

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeRange
ValueDefinition.Description: Over which Range (distance to clip-distance) do the units start to fade out before they clip

ValueDefinition.Name: ClipDistances
ValueDefinition.Description: At which distance do the units clip?

ValueDefinition.Name: ClipDistanceMin
ValueDefinition.Description: Unit Clip Distance is a random Value between DistanceMin and DistanceMax

ValueDefinition.Name: ClipDistanceMax
ValueDefinition.Description: Unit Clip Distance is a random Value between DistanceMin and DistanceMax

ValueDefinition.Name: ApproachInDummyDirection
ValueDefinition.Description: E.g. a fishing-dummy is directed towards the water. So we have to approach it from the land, i.e. in dummy direction. A sit-dummy is facing from the benchback to the area in front of the bench, so we have to approach it against dummy direction.

ValueDefinition.Name: UnitCountFactorByQualitySetting
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of units tied to the quality setting. 0 = Low, 1 = Medium, 2 = High, 3 = Very High, 4 = Ultra High

ValueDefinition.Name: Limit
ValueDefinition.Description: How much units total can be spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: Category
ValueDefinition.Description: On which level the limit is applied (session, area, spawn group, ...)

ValueDefinition.Name: DespawnUnitsOnLimitPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: Start despawning out of frustum units when current limit is at chosen percent of total limit

ValueDefinition.Name: DespawnFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Despawn chosen amount of units at once

ValueDefinition.Name: KeepUnitsCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Do not despawn this amount of out of frustum units to avoid empty map

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxUnitSpawnPerAreaPerTick
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to anything > 0, this is the limit of how many units can be spawned per area per tick

ValueDefinition.Name: DeleteInactiveSessionUnitsAfter
ValueDefinition.Description: If more than 0 all feedback units will be killed in inactive session after set delay

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetUnitCountFactor_OutOfFrustum
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 1] determines a factor on the desired target unit count of out of frustum spawn groups

ValueDefinition.Name: ListenersPerDemagogueBase
ValueDefinition.Description: The base amount of listeners per demagogue

ValueDefinition.Name: ListenersPerDemagogueIncreaseRate
ValueDefinition.Description: Every x intensity [0..100] of the associated building an additional Listener is called (where x is this value)

ValueDefinition.Name: DemagogueBuildingSizeFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: How many demagouges should be spawned based per tile of building size

ValueDefinition.Name: DurationUntilMaxIntensityReached
ValueDefinition.Description: The time that has to pass until the riot feedback will be to its full intensity. Except for major incidents. There it is hardcoded.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinLooks
ValueDefinition.Description: How many things a visitor should see on one visit (minimum)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxLooks
ValueDefinition.Description: How many things a visitor should see on one visit (maximum)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinLookDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long should a visitor take a look on an object (minimum)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxLookDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long should a visitor take a look on an object (maximum)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinVisitorsCultural
ValueDefinition.Description: How many visitors do culturals attract at 0 attractivity -> No built modules / items

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxVisitorsCultural
ValueDefinition.Description: How many visitors do culturals attract at "max attractivity" (other balancing value)

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsiderIslandVisitorFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the amount of island visitors will have an impact on the attracted monument visitors

ValueDefinition.Name: BaseSpawnRange
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum range in which the visitors are spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxSpawnRange
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum range in which the visitors are spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: MinSpawnBuildingsToExpand
ValueDefinition.Description: If the system finds less spawn buildings in the range than this value, it will expand the range

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxSpawnBuildingsToShrink
ValueDefinition.Description: If the system finds more spawn buildings in the range than this value, it will decrease the range

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnRangeIncreaseRate
ValueDefinition.Description: Range in which the spawn area is shrinking/expanding

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxAttractiveness
ValueDefinition.Description: If the set amount of attractiveness is reached, 100% of MaxVisitors are spawned.

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnResidenceEntranceRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Range 0-1. On 0 all the visitors will spawn at the entrance. On 1 all the visitors will spawn at surrounding residence buildings. 0.5 means 50% spawn at residence, 50% spawn at the entrance.

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnTouristsResidenceRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Range 0-1. On 0 all visitors are residence persons. On 1 all the visitors will be tourists. 0.5 means 50% tourists, 50% residence persons

ValueDefinition.Name: MinHappiness
ValueDefinition.Description: The given mood is choosen when the happiness is bigger or equal than the given value

ValueDefinition.Name: InteractionDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: How far apart the two feedback units will be while interacting

ValueDefinition.Name: MinWorkPlaces
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines on how many places every unit should work at least

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxWorkPlaces
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines on how many places every unit should work at maximum

ValueDefinition.Name: MinWorkDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how long an unit should work on a single place (minimum)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxWorkDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how long an unit should work on a single place (maximum)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxSearchRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: How far the units should search for a new workplace

ValueDefinition.Name: MilitaryTakeoverUnitCountFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor for how many units there will be during military takeover. E.g. 0.5 -> Only 59% of the units will spawn.

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the time span between the spawning of two units

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnIntervalDerivation
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the random time derivation of SpawnInterval

ValueDefinition.Name: usesPerlingNoise
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to true, props will spawn using the perling distribution, otherwise they will be evenly distributed

ValueDefinition.Name: PerlingFrequency
ValueDefinition.Description: if using Perling noise, the frequency of the noise

ValueDefinition.Name: PerlingThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: if using Perling noise, the threshold of the noise

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: Which class is chosen depends on the weight. So if there are 2 classes, Class1 with weight 30 and Class2 with weight 70 it's more likely that Class2 is chosen (with 70% probability)

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: Which class is chosen depends on the weight. So if there are 2 classes, Class1 with weight 30 and Class2 with weight 70 it's more likely that Class2 is chosen (with 70% probability)

ValueDefinition.Name: TourismBuildings
ValueDefinition.Description: Buildings in this list will be considered tourism buildings and therefore only spawn feedback units from the tourism pool.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinWaterAvailSizeToSpawn
ValueDefinition.Description: When trying to spawn the water avail has to be this size minimum before a unit will be spawned. Used to not spawn ships in very small water areas. !!!! Don't use big numbers here!! This is quire performance heavy!!!

ValueDefinition.Name: CollectionDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: How far has the collector to stay away from the collectable to play its animation

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount_Default
ValueDefinition.Description: UnitCount, when the building is non motorized and has 100% productivity? (is scaled up and down in a hardcoded way, depending on productivity and field count)

ValueDefinition.Name: WorkingSequenceTimeMin
ValueDefinition.Description: in ms

ValueDefinition.Name: WorkingSequenceTimeMax
ValueDefinition.Description: in ms

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount_BaseModulesCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Unit Count when [CurFarmFieldCount] == [FarmFieldCount_NonMotorized]

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount_AdditionalModulesCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Unit Count when [CurFarmFieldCount] >= [FarmFieldCount_Motorized]

ValueDefinition.Name: DrivesRegularPattern
ValueDefinition.Description: Are Target positions picked randomly or in a Right-Down-Left-Down-Right-Down Pattern

ValueDefinition.Name: DrivesRectengularInGrid
ValueDefinition.Description: Does the tractor only drive in 0 90 180 270 degree angles or also diagonally?

ValueDefinition.Name: MinParadeDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum distance from the first row of spectators to the parade

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredSpace
ValueDefinition.Description: Size of the reserved square space for each spectator

ValueDefinition.Name: PercentageSpawnOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: How random it is the position inside the required space for an espectator (zero means in the center of the square)

ValueDefinition.Name: DensityRows
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how many rows of spectators and with which density they are

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeToSpawnBeforeParade
ValueDefinition.Description: To make sure the specators don't miss the parade they need to start going to the parade before the parade is there, this time is used for that.

ValueDefinition.Name: OnInfectedObjectResolver
ConfigPath
ValueDefinition.Description: Path for the spawned config on adapting dummies. Should adapt to terrain

ValueDefinition.Name: ConfigPathFixed
ValueDefinition.Description: Path for the spawned config on fixed dummies. Should not adapt to terrain
Cfg that is spawned on the infected object "incident" dummies

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentDummyUsageRate
ValueDefinition.Description: How many incident dummies of the objects will be used to spawn a resolver unit. Min 1 unit is spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: AmountUnitsPerBuildingTile
ValueDefinition.Description: How many units do we want to spawn at max based on the objects size for repair

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Time span between the spawning of two units

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnIntervalDerivation
ValueDefinition.Description: Random time derivation of SpawnInterval

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowedReactions
ValueDefinition.Description: In contrast to @FeedbackClassFlags allowed reactions are common and therefore true for most units. The reactions this unit is allowed to perform. E.g. to listen to a priest the reaction "listen" is required.

ValueDefinition.Name: ClassFlags
ValueDefinition.Description: In contrast to @FeedbackReaction class flags very special and therefore false for most units.

ValueDefinition.Name: UseSpecialPathPlannerLayer_Deprecated
ValueDefinition.Description: Does the unit use Special-Blocking information e.g. Fisherboat or FarmWorker

ValueDefinition.Name: HappyEventDates
ValueDefinition.Description: When a HappyEvent is set this unit class will only be shown if this happy event is currently active. If none is set it will always be active

ValueDefinition.Name: OverwriteSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: -1 : take speed from sequence speed

ValueDefinition.Name: ClipDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: In which distance from camera does an Animal Group get Clipped

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeRange
ValueDefinition.Description: How far in front of the clip distance does the Group start to fade out

ValueDefinition.Name: OverseaDensity
ValueDefinition.Description: How many Bird Flocks are there that fly over the whole map? (Default : 1)

ValueDefinition.Name: InnerIslandDensity
ValueDefinition.Description: How many Bird Flocks are there that stay within island bounds? (Default : 1)

ValueDefinition.Name: CoastDensity
ValueDefinition.Description: How many Bird Flocks are there that circle around a coast line? (1 = every coast)

ValueDefinition.Name: CityBuildingsPerDynamicFlock
ValueDefinition.Description: Roughly every x residences in a city spawn a flock above the city

ValueDefinition.Name: CoastBuildingsPerDynamicFlock
ValueDefinition.Description: Roughly every x coast buildings at a harbour spawn a flock above the harbour

ValueDefinition.Name: HerdDensity
ValueDefinition.Description: How many Herds are there? (Default : 1)

ValueDefinition.Name: FishFlockOverseaDensity
ValueDefinition.Description: How many FishFlocks are there that run the BirdFlock algorithm and are placed overseas? (Default : 1)

ValueDefinition.Name: FishFlockCoastDensity
ValueDefinition.Description: How many FishFlocks are there that run the BirdFlock algorithm and are placed near Coasts? (Default : 1)

ValueDefinition.Name: OverseaDensity
ValueDefinition.Description: How many FishShoals are there that travel around the whole map? (Default : 1)

ValueDefinition.Name: SlotsForBuy
ValueDefinition.Description: How many slots can be used in the active trade for buying?

ValueDefinition.Name: SlotsForSell
ValueDefinition.Description: How many slots can be used in the active trade for selling?

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededUnlockForDefaultItemReroll
ValueDefinition.Description: This asset needs to be unlocked for a player to be able to use the default item reroll option

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededUnlockForItemNicheReroll
ValueDefinition.Description: This asset needs to be unlocked for a player to be able to use the niche item reroll option

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededUnlockForItemRarityReroll
ValueDefinition.Description: This asset needs to be unlocked for a player to be able to use the rarity item reroll option

ValueDefinition.Name: EmbargoAssetAllTraders
ValueDefinition.Description: An Asset that indicates that the participant which has unlocked it cannot trade with any 3rd party trader.

ValueDefinition.Name: EmbargoAssetEmperorRepresentatives
ValueDefinition.Description: An Asset that indicates that the participant which has unlocked it cannot trade with any emperor representative trader.

ValueDefinition.Name: BetterPriceAssetAllTraders
ValueDefinition.Description: An Asset that indicates that the participant which has unlocked it gets better prices with any 3rd party trader.

ValueDefinition.Name: BetterPriceAssetEmperorRepresentatives
ValueDefinition.Description: An Asset that indicates that the participant which has unlocked it get better pricesnot trade with any emperor representative trader.

ValueDefinition.Name: BetterPriceItemBuyDiscountPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The bonus that is granted when a trader is buying items from the player which provided better prices through reputation

ValueDefinition.Name: BetterPriceItemSellDiscountPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The discount that is granted when buying items from traders which provided better prices through reputation

ValueDefinition.Name: BetterPriceGoodBuyDiscountPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The bonus that is granted when a trader is buying goods from the playeraders which provided better prices through reputation

ValueDefinition.Name: BetterPriceGoodSellDiscountPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The discount that is granted when buying goods from traders which provided better prices through reputation

ValueDefinition.Name: DestroyInvalidMoves
ValueDefinition.Description: Allow invalid moves. Without a multi move is blocked if one building is not valid

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxRectSize
ValueDefinition.Description: MultiMove/-Copy/Stamps allow a square of this size

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreBuildCosts
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for Scenarios to turn of build costs

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxHarbourAreaRenderCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum amount of harbour areas that will be rendered during placement of any coastal objects

ValueDefinition.Name: MultiPlaceGridRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: additional Grid radius for multi move / copy tools. The radius itself is based on the size of the rect, defined by the placed objects.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxCosmeticModuleCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum additional modules that can be built for factories. These cosmetic modules do not have any effect on the production.

ValueDefinition.Name: TreesBlockBuildings
ValueDefinition.Description: Experimental Mode: trees cannot be over built

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimapPingDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how long the minimap ping lasts

ValueDefinition.Name: LocalPingMarkerAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: ping marker used for the pings of the local player

ValueDefinition.Name: PingMarkerAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: ping marker used for the pings of other co-op players

ValueDefinition.Name: PingMarkerLifetime
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how long a ping marker stays before it is removed

ValueDefinition.Name: PingMarkerInfolayerOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: If a building is pinged, this value defines how far above (or below) the infolayer the marker will be placed

ValueDefinition.Name: PingMarkerGroundOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: If a location is pinged, this value defines how far above the ground the marker will be placed

ValueDefinition.Name: CoopMarker2DSound
ValueDefinition.Description: 2D sound for the markers of remote coop players

ValueDefinition.Name: LocalCoopMarker3DSound
ValueDefinition.Description: 3D sound for the marker of the local player

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultStartTime
ValueDefinition.Description: The default start time for the game

ValueDefinition.Name: Time
ValueDefinition.Description: Time from 0 to 24

ValueDefinition.Name: Icon
ValueDefinition.Description: UI Icon representing this time

ValueDefinition.Name: NightTimespans
ValueDefinition.Description: CAUTION: ASK CODER BEFORE CHANGING! (Effects multiple systems). Describes at which times Feedback/Audio & co start to change their behaviour. Should be in sync with what artistis define visually in ambient settings.

ValueDefinition.Name: GameDaytimeToRendererDaytimeMapInfo
ValueDefinition.Description: This is supposed to a temporary solution to be able to stretch day and night without changing all the curves. Should be removed once everything is in place.

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeInterpolationFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor that effects the speed the daytime changes when switching between times. (e.g. 4.0 = 4 ticks to pass one hour)

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandDilation
ValueDefinition.Description: How much we dilate the island shape to cover everything with fog?

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandDiscoverySpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how fast islands are discovered (radius increase per second)

ValueDefinition.Name: TileFadeOutDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the duration it takes to fade out one single tile (in seconds)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxFragmentSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Undiscovered shapes smaller than this value are fragments and will fade out automatically

ValueDefinition.Name: HistoryInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the interval between two economy snapshots. These snapshots are used to display graphs in the economy statistic UI

ValueDefinition.Name: HistoryLength
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how long we want to capture economy data. E.g. two hours means the user can see the data of the last two hours

ValueDefinition.Name: Updates
ValueDefinition.Description: Add new entries at the end (index is used to track which change has already been applied to a savegame)

ValueDefinition.Name: GlobalHighscoreFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: A global modifier. Every score is multipied with it. Usefull to change 100 to 1000

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductionFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the total production (t/m)

ValueDefinition.Name: StorageFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the total amount of stored goods in islands (t)

ValueDefinition.Name: TradeShipPointsFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the tradeship points.

ValueDefinition.Name: MilitaryShipPointsFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the militaryship points.

ValueDefinition.Name: AttractivenessFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the attractiveness value.

ValueDefinition.Name: CompletedSetFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the completed sets

ValueDefinition.Name: SocketedItemsFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the amount of socketed items

ValueDefinition.Name: DiscoveredItemsFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the amount of discovered items.

ValueDefinition.Name: BalanceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the income balance.

ValueDefinition.Name: GlobalPopulationFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Balancing modifier for all populations. Gets multiplied with every population score

ValueDefinition.Name: UrbanizationFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to calculate Highscore points out of the skyscrapers with the highes urbanization effect

ValueDefinition.Name: PopulationBalancing
ValueDefinition.Description: Contains all factors for the different populations. ! don't forget to add the new population and its balancing here, when creating a new one!

ValueDefinition.Name: Category
ValueDefinition.Description: In which category should this entry be shown?

ValueDefinition.Name: Text
ValueDefinition.Description: The GUID of the text next to the icon, Leave empty if we don't want to show a text here.

ValueDefinition.Name: IconPath
ValueDefinition.Description: The icon shown for this entry

ValueDefinition.Name: Infotip
ValueDefinition.Description: Infotip GUID for this entry

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededDLC
ValueDefinition.Description: This UI Entry gets only shown if the player has this dlc activated in the current session

ValueDefinition.Name: OrNeededDLC
ValueDefinition.Description: Alternative DLC to activate this Highscore element

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowScoreIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to true, the score icon will be displayed next to the score text

ValueDefinition.Name: ModdingIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: Filepath to the icon, which is shown in the highscore screen if the player has a modded game

ValueDefinition.Name: PlaytimeIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: Icon infront of the playtime in the highscore screen

ValueDefinition.Name: CurrencyIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: filepath for the icon

ValueDefinition.Name: DifficultyLabel
ValueDefinition.Description: Text guid for the difficulty label

ValueDefinition.Name: PlaytimeLabel
ValueDefinition.Description: Text guid for the playtime label

ValueDefinition.Name: PopulationInfotipGuid
ValueDefinition.Description: infotip for the population entries in the global population category

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionBalanceInfotipGuid
ValueDefinition.Description: infotip for the single session entries in the economic category

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowCategoryIcons
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, The score icon is displayed behind the category score of each category

ValueDefinition.Name: IrrigationSpreading
ValueDefinition.Description: define how water spreading works

ValueDefinition.Name: IrrigationSpreadRule
ValueDefinition.Description: which rule is used to spread the water

ValueDefinition.Name: IsIrrigationSpreadInstant
ValueDefinition.Description: Describes if the irrigation is set instant after a tile is watered or if it should spread out from the source delayed

ValueDefinition.Name: AmountTicksBetweenIrrigationSpread
ValueDefinition.Description: How many ticks need to be processed between the spreading from one tile to its neighbor

ValueDefinition.Name: IsPipeFillInstant
ValueDefinition.Description: Describes if all connected tiles should be filled at the same time or one by one delayed

ValueDefinition.Name: IrrigationTiles
ValueDefinition.Description: defines different tile types which influence water generation

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeBetweenFillSpread
ValueDefinition.Description: 1 = 100ms, 30 = 3s. How long does it take for one canal tile to spread its water to the next one.

ValueDefinition.Name: WaterPlaneFadeInDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Ob du bitte mal das Feld hier exportierst?!

ValueDefinition.Name: WaterPlaneFadeOutDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Ob du bitte mal das Feld hier exportierst?!

ValueDefinition.Name: ParticleFillPlaza
ValueDefinition.Description: If we simultanously fill a big canal plaza, the inner tiles of this frontline will use this particle effect instead

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeMoveOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: Height change for the water plane when fading in and fading out

ValueDefinition.Name: PlankCfg_Wall_Open
ValueDefinition.Description: Ob du bitte mal das Feld hier exportierst

ValueDefinition.Name: PlankCfg_Open_Open
ValueDefinition.Description: Ob du bitte mal das Feld hier exportierst

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeMoveOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: Height change for the plank when fading in and fading out

ValueDefinition.Name: FadingSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: 0.001 == super slow, 1 == immediately

ValueDefinition.Name: BlurRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: 0 = no blur at all

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeMoveOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: Height change for the dry wall when fading in and fading out

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredAmountIrrgatiedSubtilesToUpdateRenderEngine
ValueDefinition.Description: How many subtiles of a full tile must be set to irrigated before the render engine is supposed to consider the tile irrigated (needed because render engine stays on full tile basis while Game Code has subtile grid)

ValueDefinition.Name: StaticIrrigationRandomizerFrequency
ValueDefinition.Description: Frequency that alternates between MAX_SPREAD and MIN_SPREAD for randomized-spread-sources

ValueDefinition.Name: CanalDestroyConfirmationPopup
ValueDefinition.Description: A confirmation popup that triggers when destroying canals that would also lead to destroyed buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: CanalBuildConfirmationPopup
ValueDefinition.Description: A confirmation propup triggered when building canals that would lead to destroyed buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: KontorSlotMoveThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: If a kontor slot is too far away from the ship, it automatically changes its position

ValueDefinition.Name: KontorBuildDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Max distance in which a ship can build a kontor

ValueDefinition.Name: EconomyLevel
CashFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: EconomyLevel is calculated by taking (CurrentCash * CashFactor ) + (CurrentIncome * CurrentIncomeFactor)

ValueDefinition.Name: IncomeFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: EconomyLevel is calculated by taking (CurrentCash * CashFactor ) + (CurrentIncome * CurrentIncomeFactor)
EconomyLevel is calculated by taking (CurrentCash * CashFactor ) + (CurrentIncome * CurrentIncomeFactor)

ValueDefinition.Name: BalanceCalculationDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: The average balance gain is based on the buys/sells by passive trade of the last X minutes

ValueDefinition.Name: HistoryTrackTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long do we want to track trades? After which time we remove these trades from the history?

ValueDefinition.Name: PriceFactors
ValueDefinition.Description: Configuration for price factors which are applied to the trade prices

ValueDefinition.Name: GlobalProductSellPriceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: This factor is applied to the price of a PRODUCT which is SOLD by the trader

ValueDefinition.Name: GlobalProductBuyPriceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: This factor is applied to the price of a PRODUCT which is BOUGHT by the trader

ValueDefinition.Name: GlobalItemSellPriceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: This factor is applied to the price of an ITEM which is SOLD by the trader

ValueDefinition.Name: GlobalItemBuyPriceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: This factor is applied to the price of an ITEM which is BOUGHT by the trader

ValueDefinition.Name: ValueProgression
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how the values of the counter are progressing during the game

ValueDefinition.Name: Scope
ValueDefinition.Description: The counter will only be evaluated for these scopes

ValueDefinition.Name: MinValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The minimum value (including) that this counter may have. Is used for error checking.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum value (including) that this counter may have. Is used for error checking.

ValueDefinition.Name: ContextNeedsToBeZero
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if the context for this counter should always be 0. Will be checked by the game during runtime

ValueDefinition.Name: ContextNeedsToBeNonZero
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if the context for this counter should never be 0. Will be checked by the game during runtime

ValueDefinition.Name: ID
ValueDefinition.Description: The identifier by which the tracked counter can be identified in the platform service

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterType
ValueDefinition.Description: Type of player counter that should be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowAnyContext
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if all counters no matter the context should be summed up

ValueDefinition.Name: Context
ValueDefinition.Description: A context for the counter if needed, can also be a pool in which case all included guids will be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterValueType
ValueDefinition.Description: The counter value type

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterScope
ValueDefinition.Description: The scope where this counter should be checked

ValueDefinition.Name: ScopeContext
ValueDefinition.Description: A scope context to define the exact scope where you want to check for a counter, e.g. a session GUID

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeInNextSeasonWhenTimeLeft
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the time before end of season at which the next season is already faded in visually

ValueDefinition.Name: UnknownNextSeasonNameText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text that will be shown when we want to display the next season name but there is no next season

ValueDefinition.Name: UnknownNextSeasonTypeText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text that will be shown when we want to display the next season type but there is no next season

ValueDefinition.Name: VisualEffectConfiguration
ValueDefinition.Description: Describes the strength of the visual effects over the time in the season

ValueDefinition.Name: ActivateVisualEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: Whether this visual effect is active for this season

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalEffectStrengths
ValueDefinition.Description: !Please Sort! Does not require entries for t=0 and t=1. Specify additional points in time in the season at which a certain effect strength is reached

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeInSeason
ValueDefinition.Description: A point in the season at which a certain effect strength should be reached. [0; 1] 0 = start of season, 1 = start fade to next season, some seconds before end of season

ValueDefinition.Name: EffectStrength
ValueDefinition.Description: The effect strength to be reached at a given point in time in the season [0; 1]

ValueDefinition.Name: SeasonEffects
Effects
ValueDefinition.Description: The effect applied to the session if the season is active. Only Effects with Scope Session/ObjectsInSession make sense here
All effects get applied to the affected profiles if the seasion gets enabled

ValueDefinition.Name: PercentageModifier
ValueDefinition.Description: how much does the trade price change, e.g. -10 subtracts 10% or 50 increase prices by 50%

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetAssetOrPool
ValueDefinition.Description: target of the trade price change, can also be a pool with multiple GUIDs

ValueDefinition.Name: ChangeEveryProduct
ValueDefinition.Description: if set to true, this effect will be used for every product (not filtered by TargetAssetOrPool)

ValueDefinition.Name: TimerProgressColor
ValueDefinition.Description: sets the colour for the progress bar in Season UI

ValueDefinition.Name: IsSpecialSeason
ValueDefinition.Description: This makes a color gradient (color for it is controlled by BackgroundColor), deco pattern and thicker frame visible

ValueDefinition.Name: BackgroundColor
ValueDefinition.Description: sets color for the gradient when it is a special season

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultSelectionColor
ValueDefinition.Description: NOT USED

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultSelectionModuleColor
ValueDefinition.Description: NOT USED

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultSelectionModuleBorderColor
ValueDefinition.Description: NOT USED

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultWeakSelectionColor
ValueDefinition.Description: NOT USED

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultWeakSelectionBorderColor
ValueDefinition.Description: NOT USED

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultWeakSelectionColorWhileBuilding
ValueDefinition.Description: NOT USED

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultPickingBorderColor
ValueDefinition.Description: NOT USED

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultPickingModuleBorderColor
ValueDefinition.Description: NOT USED

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultCoopSelectionBorderColor
ValueDefinition.Description: NOT USED

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultSelectionModuleIrrigationMissingBorderColor
ValueDefinition.Description: NOT USED

ValueDefinition.Name: UpgradeLists
ValueDefinition.Description: Each entry represents on selection list the user can toggle through which contains more than one guid (especially needed if upgrades of a building should be part of the selection list)

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildingGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: Each building and all of it's upgrades in this group will be part of a common selection list. All upgrades will be added automatically to this list so please only add the base assets

ValueDefinition.Name: DestroyPumpConfirmationPopup
ValueDefinition.Description: The popup shown when destroying a marsh pump building

ValueDefinition.Name: NotAllowedToDestroyFlagshipInCampaignPopup
ValueDefinition.Description: The popup that is shown when the player tries to delete their flagship during the first act of campaign

ValueDefinition.Name: NotAllowedToDestroyVillaInCampaignPopup
ValueDefinition.Description: The popup that is shown when the player tries to delete their villa during campaign

ValueDefinition.Name: ReferenceUnitSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: A unit that has this base speed will take DefaultTransferTime to complete the session transfer. A unit that has a base speed that is twice as fast will transfer twice as fast

ValueDefinition.Name: PirateAvoidanceRange
ValueDefinition.Description: On a session transfer, the pirate island is tried to avoid by this range when ships are spawning or leaving the session

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxLeaveSessionDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: How far a ship should travel out of the playable area at most before starting the session transfer

ValueDefinition.Name: HappyDaySkins
ValueDefinition.Description: Configure skins to be used at special events (e.g. have a Xmas skin for marketplaces)

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectGuid
ValueDefinition.Description: guid of the building which should change its skin on a special day (e.g. market place)

ValueDefinition.Name: HappyDay
ValueDefinition.Description: The happy day at which the skin should be replaced

ValueDefinition.Name: SkinGuid
ValueDefinition.Description: The guid of the skin asset !make sure that the ObjectGuid has this skin configured!

ValueDefinition.Name: RenderOverlay
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this layer should be rendered

ValueDefinition.Name: MonoColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Not used in game

ValueDefinition.Name: PolyColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Not used in game

ValueDefinition.Name: InsideRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: e.g used for hacienda radius

ValueDefinition.Name: OutsideRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: e.g used for hacienda radius

ValueDefinition.Name: HeatMapGoodColor
ValueDefinition.Description: for residences with positive contribution of the picked need attribute

ValueDefinition.Name: HeatMapNeutralColor
ValueDefinition.Description: for residences with no contribution of the picked need attribute

ValueDefinition.Name: HeatMapBadColor
ValueDefinition.Description: for residences with negative contribution of the picked need attribute

ValueDefinition.Name: SameNeighborColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Holding shift while selecting a residence highlights all residences with same GUID in current area

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentResolverColor
ValueDefinition.Description: all incident resolver that are responsible

ValueDefinition.Name: PublicServiceColor
ValueDefinition.Description: all public service buildings that are requested by this residence

ValueDefinition.Name: UseAbsoluteGoodTransportByDefault
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the system uses absolute values in the good transportation by default. If false it uses relative values (percentages)

ValueDefinition.Name: EnqueueDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: When distance between the ship and the target (loading pier) is undershot, the ship will reserve a slot

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckBestCoastDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: If this distance is undershot, the ship will evaluate the best loading pier

ValueDefinition.Name: RestrictedGood
ValueDefinition.Description: Only the goods configured here can be transported by this kind of route. If the list is empty, all goods can be transported (beside the excluded goods)

ValueDefinition.Name: ExcludingGoods
ValueDefinition.Description: Goods which are configured here can never ever be transported by this kind of route

ValueDefinition.Name: Unlock
ValueDefinition.Description: Link to an unlock asset to lock/unlock this type of a route. If this value is empty, the type is always available

ValueDefinition.Name: DumpEverythingAtStation
ValueDefinition.Description: this route type does not allow delivering to different islands

ValueDefinition.Name: DeliverGood
ValueDefinition.Description: is executed at every station of the route

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionSwitch
ValueDefinition.Description: is executed when the ship leaves a session

ValueDefinition.Name: RouteChange
ValueDefinition.Description: Is executed when ship leaves the traderoute or the current station is changed

ValueDefinition.Name: DowngradedGood
ValueDefinition.Description: Leave at 0 if loaded product should vanish

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreMinimumLoadingTimes
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is true this type of trade route will ignore the min loading time from ship and pier for loading time calculation.

ValueDefinition.Name: LoadingTimeGoodFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor that is multiplied with the amount of loaded / unloaded goods for loading time calculation.

ValueDefinition.Name: HarborQueueDataPerLayer
ValueDefinition.Description: Array that defines the waiting queue settings per path planner layer

ValueDefinition.Name: QueueToConstructionAreaDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance between the end of the construction area and the beginn of the ellipsis on which ships are enqueued in harbours

ValueDefinition.Name: MinEllipsisWidth
ValueDefinition.Description: Harbor ellipsis width of a harbor with just a single pier

ValueDefinition.Name: EllipsisAngle
ValueDefinition.Description: Angle of the harbor ellipsis on which ships will wait. E.g. 30 would mean that ships could wait between -30ï¿½ & +30ï¿½ relative to the kontor to sea direction

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceBetweenWaitingRows
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance between two rows of the waiting queue of an harbor

ValueDefinition.Name: LongWaitingTimeError
ValueDefinition.Description: How long a ship has to wait at least before we trigger a warning

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxSecondThirdPartyQueueWaitingTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long should ships of second or third parties wait in a loading queue at most? When this time expires they will automatically skip the current station and go to the next station

ValueDefinition.Name: TravelTimeMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: When ship evaluates the best pier, all the travel times will be multiplied by this value to make moving more costly

ValueDefinition.Name: FolderDefaultName
ValueDefinition.Description: The default name for folders

ValueDefinition.Name: EnableFeatureTradeRoutes
ValueDefinition.Description: Also Disable Diplomacy and World Map to remove buttons under minimap.

ValueDefinition.Name: BailoutThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: when money is lower or equal and the bailout difficulty setting allows it, they player receives the Bailout Storyline

ValueDefinition.Name: BailoutMoney
ValueDefinition.Description: How much money the user gets by a single bailout, this value should be used by the BailoutStoryline to reward money if the player accepts the bailout

ValueDefinition.Name: BailoutStoryline
ValueDefinition.Description: The storyline that triggers for the human player that went below the bailout threshold

ValueDefinition.Name: BankruptcyThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The game is lost if the player has less or equal the money configured here and the timer has run out.

ValueDefinition.Name: BankruptcyTimer
ValueDefinition.Description: If below the Bankruptcy Threshold the player has a short time to come above again.

ValueDefinition.Name: BancruptcyWarningNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: A notification which will be triggered if the player has less cash then the bankruptcy threshold and tells the player about the timer.

ValueDefinition.Name: WarningThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Money theshold. If player comes below the BankruptcyWarningGovernorDecision will be triggered.

ValueDefinition.Name: BankruptcyWarningGovernorDecision
ValueDefinition.Description: A Storyline Asset, which gets triggered if the money value is below the warning threshold.

ValueDefinition.Name: BailoutCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: After a bailout was triggered, the player will not receive another bailout for this long Important: As long as the bailout storyline is still active, no further bailout will be tirggered. This includes the time for the "you nearly went bankrupt"-tutorial

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandsToHold
