ValueDefinition.Description: List of islands that leads to a defeat as soon as the player looses one of them. They don't have to be owned by the player at the beginning of the game

ValueDefinition.Name: IconAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: (by Andrea) The IconAsset is not used in the code at all, sadly you have to use the Icon with the direct file path instead.

ValueDefinition.Name: PrestigeTexts
ValueDefinition.Description: Texts that represent global prestige levels. Config needs to be in increasing threshold order. Lowest threshold first, highest threshold last.

ValueDefinition.Name: OrnamentPrestigeLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: used in ornament prestige calculation: limit / (-1 - steepness * ornment ratio) + limit

ValueDefinition.Name: OrnamentPrestigeSteepness
ValueDefinition.Description: used in ornament prestige calculation: limit / (-1 - steepness * ornment ratio) + limit

Property.Name: ConnectRewardConfig

ValueDefinition.Name: ConnectRewards
Guid
ValueDefinition.Description: Guid of the Connect Reward Asset
List of Connect Rewards, will be used as fallback if online list is not accessible

Property.Description: Balancing Asset for Connect Rewards.

ValueDefinition.Name: AqueductHeightVisualization
ValueDefinition.Description: THESE COLORS ARE NOT USED

ValueDefinition.Name: WaterFlowSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: How fast is the animation of water going down the aqueduct

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowBuildProblemsInWorld
ValueDefinition.Description: Which build problems should be shown in game above the end node when trying to place invalid edges

ValueDefinition.Name: OptionConfirmPopupTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Seconds the Confirm Popup is open

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationZones
ZoneLowerBound
ValueDefinition.Description: The lower bound of this zone. Bound is included in this zone!

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoneLowerInnerBound
ValueDefinition.Description: The lower bound of the inner part this zone. Bound is included in this zone! Inner Part is used to have deadzones between neighbor zones.

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoneUpperInnerBound
ValueDefinition.Description: The upper bound of the inner part this zone. Bound is included in this zone! Inner Part is used to have deadzones between neighbor zones.

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoneUpperBound
ValueDefinition.Description: The upper bound of this zone. Bound is included in this zone!

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoneEnteredFromBelowStoryline
ValueDefinition.Description: A GovernorDecision Storyline from the emperor explainingthe new zone. Triggered when coming from a lower zone

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoneEnteredFromAboveStoryline
ValueDefinition.Description: A GovernorDecision Storyline from the emperor explainingthe new zone. Triggered when coming from a higher zone.
Defines the reputation zones. !make sure the configuration is a continuous line!

ValueDefinition.Name: EmperorTraitsIntensityModifiers
Modifier
ValueDefinition.Description: Reputation gain from emperor traits will be modified with an intensity value. So if an action is tagged with trait aggressive low and the current emperor has +5 to the aggressive trait and the low modifier is *2 the total repuation gain will be 10 for taking this action.
Defines some intensity modifiers which will modify emperor traits reputation gain/loss

ValueDefinition.Name: PatienceThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: How much reptuation needs to be lost in one action to be cicked out of consul/pro-consul state (e.g. 25 means the player needs to lose 25 or more reputation in one go to lose the title)

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationAfterConsulTitleLoss
ValueDefinition.Description: How much reputation the participant has with the emperor after he lost the consul title

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationAfterProConsulTitleLoss
ValueDefinition.Description: How much reputation the participant has with the emperor after he lost the pro-consul title

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationAfterEmperorChange
FormerRebel
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of reputation a former rebel should have after the emperor got changed because of a rebellion (not a delta but a fixed reputation)

ValueDefinition.Name: FormerLoyalist
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of reputation a former loyalist should have after the emperor got changed because of a rebellion (not a delta but a fixed reputation)

ValueDefinition.Name: FormerNeutral
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of reputation a former neutral participant should have after the emperor got changed because of a rebellion (not a delta but a fixed reputation)
Configuration for the start reputation of participants after the emperor changed (won rebellion)

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationAfterProConsul
FormerRebel
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of reputation a former rebel (not leader but the allies) should have after the leader became pro consule because of a won rebellion (value can either be fixed new reputation or a reputation change, depending on "FormerRebelValueIsDelta")

ValueDefinition.Name: FormerRebelValueIsDelta
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the reputation value in "FormerRebel" is a delta and will be added to the current reputation of the participant, instead of setting the value directly as new reputation value

ValueDefinition.Name: FormerLoyalist
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of reputation a former loyalist should have after the rebellion leader became pro consule because of a won rebellion (value can either be fixed new reputation or a reputation change, depending on "FormerLoyalistValueIsDelta")

ValueDefinition.Name: FormerLoyalistValueIsDelta
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the reputation value in "FormerLoyalist" is a delta and will be added to the current reputation of the participant, instead of setting the value directly as new reputation value
Configuration of the reputation for rebellion partakers after the rebellion was won and the leader decided to become pro consul

ValueDefinition.Name: PamsyContextReputationUpAndPositive
ValueDefinition.Description: A asset used as context for the pamsy trigger "emperor reputation zone changed", to define if we did fall down a zone and are in a negative zone

ValueDefinition.Name: PamsyContextReputationDownAndPositive
ValueDefinition.Description: A asset used as context for the pamsy trigger "emperor reputation zone changed", to define if we did fall down a zone and are in a postive zone

ValueDefinition.Name: PamsyContextReputationUpAndNegative
ValueDefinition.Description: A asset used as context for the pamsy trigger "emperor reputation zone changed", to define if we did rise up a zone and are in a negative zone

ValueDefinition.Name: PamsyContextReputationDownAndNegative
ValueDefinition.Description: A asset used as context for the pamsy trigger "emperor reputation zone changed", to define if we did fall down a zone and are in a negative zone

ValueDefinition.Name: ChangeEmperorDecision
ValueDefinition.Description: The dynamic decision asset used as base for the emperor change decision after a won rebellion

ValueDefinition.Name: WarDeclareEmperorQuests
WarDeclareTargetParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: Declaring War to this participant will have fixed cost if the matching quest is active

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestReducingCostForWarDeclaration
ValueDefinition.Description: Declaring War to the matching participant will have fixed cost if this quest is active
Declaring War to these participants costs fixed reputation if the matching quests are active (because the quests demand from the player to declare war)

ValueDefinition.Name: WarDeclareEmperorQuestFixedCost
ValueDefinition.Description: This fixed value will be the cost of war declarations against participants with a running emperor declare war quest

ValueDefinition.Name: InvalidBuildReasonsFlyouts
InvalidBuildReasonText
ValueDefinition.Description: The text that should be displayed in the flyout

ValueDefinition.Name: TriggerForReasons
ValueDefinition.Description: The invalid build reasons for which to trigger the flyout text
Lists all flyout texts in descending priority (first element has higher priority than last) and the reasons they should trigger for.

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowedStepHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: Buildings walls outside the buildability grid is allowed as long as the tile terrain height delta to surrounding tiles is smaller than this value

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowedDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: How far outside off the construction area can walls be built

ValueDefinition.Name: WallBridgeSplitFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Split factor from start / end pos of bridges for wall splits

ValueDefinition.Name: EmptyConfig
ValueDefinition.Description: The cfg file that any object in ruin state is replaced with when entering the ruin state

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxRandomPlacementDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum distance each ruin cfg can be transposed when being placed

ValueDefinition.Name: GenericRuinBuildBlockerFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: How much should build blockers of generic ruin cfgs block each other

ValueDefinition.Name: HarborMaxRandomPlacementDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as MaxRandomPlacementDistance, but for harbor buildings, which use the full build blocker for ruin placement

ValueDefinition.Name: HarborGenericRuinBuildBlockerFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as GenericRuinBuildBlockerFactor, but for parts of harbor buildings which are in the water, which use the full build blocker for ruin placement

ValueDefinition.Name: MinFadeOutStart
ValueDefinition.Description: Min time until smoke particles fade out

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxFadeOutStart
ValueDefinition.Description: Max time until smoke particles fade out

ValueDefinition.Name: SingleTileBuildToolOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: How many additional tiles should be considered to the left and right of a mesh graph, which forbids full edge single click build tool actions

ValueDefinition.Name: NoMaintenanceBuff
ValueDefinition.Description: When spawning a starting fleet, this buff is applied to all ships

ValueDefinition.Name: CameraSpeedSteps
ValueDefinition.Description: When using the scroll wheel the speed increases/decreases by this amount

ValueDefinition.Name: Drag
ValueDefinition.Description: The lower the value, the longer the camera takes to decelerate/accelarate

ValueDefinition.Name: ExclusivePlayerColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Exclusive player color that can only be used by the player and no 2nd party

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestGiver
ValueDefinition.Description: Unit that spawns as quest giver.

ValueDefinition.Name: IntroductionMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Message that gets triggered when first talking to QuestGiver (Only Audio)

ValueDefinition.Name: TaskType
ValueDefinition.Description: What is your task? (Depending on this the ReferenceAsset is interpreted differently)

ValueDefinition.Name: ReferenceAssets
ValueDefinition.Description: For TaskType Building, the building you have to interact with. For TaskType Collect the FeedbackUnits that should be spawned. For TaskType Destroy the ThirdPersonCharacters that should be spawned.

ValueDefinition.Name: ReturnToQuestGiverMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Message that tells you, you have finished the task and should head back to the quest giver (Only Audio)

ValueDefinition.Name: CollectObjects_SpawnCount
ValueDefinition.Description: When TaskType == Collect, the amount of objects that should be spawned.

ValueDefinition.Name: CollectObjects_FindCount
ValueDefinition.Description: When TaskType == Collect, the amount of objects you have to find in order to complete the task

ValueDefinition.Name: CollectObjects_Moves
ValueDefinition.Description: When TaskType == Collect, tells the spawned objects whether they should be static or move around

ValueDefinition.Name: DestroyObjects_DestroyCount
ValueDefinition.Description: For DestroyObjects tasks: How many of the ReferenceAssets have to be destroyed

ValueDefinition.Name: SuccessMessage
ValueDefinition.Description: Message when the Quest succeeded (Only Audio)

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestInfo
ValueDefinition.Description: Export Plz

ValueDefinition.Name: ForceStartQuest_Debug
ValueDefinition.Description: -1 == dont force. When this is set, the StartNewQuests-Logic ignores all Quests but this one (index within the MiniQuest-Array). As there is no DebugInfoPage to start specific quests, this is your workaround. However the quests precondition still has to be met.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestIndicatorCfg
ValueDefinition.Description: The InfoLayer-Icon above the quest giver.

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsoleTextScale
ValueDefinition.Description: Scale applied to quest info texts in the top left of the screen

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardContext
ValueDefinition.Description: UnlockCharacter = CharacterGUID

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildingSpeedRtpc
ValueDefinition.Description: E.g. used for rollercoaster sound

ValueDefinition.Name: HidingCharacters
ValueDefinition.Description: List of Third PersonCharacter assets that can be used as hiding prop

ValueDefinition.Name: HidingEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: The vfx that is played when switching to/from hiding

ValueDefinition.Name: MinProjectileDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Only relevant for ballistic projectiles

ValueDefinition.Name: Campaign
ValueDefinition.Description: can this template be used as a campaign start map?

ValueDefinition.Name: AddDecorationIslands
ValueDefinition.Description: True = Small decoration islands will be added to the world in random spots

ValueDefinition.Name: MapTemplateType
ValueDefinition.Description: The asset defining the map type of this template. If the defined map type is the same as the difficulty setting map type this MapTemplate can be choosen by the map generator.

ValueDefinition.Name: EnlargeDLC
ValueDefinition.Description: Which DLC needs to be active to get the enlarged template

ValueDefinition.Name: EnlargedTemplateFilename
ValueDefinition.Description: this template is used instead if EnlargeDLC is active

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalDecoIslands
ValueDefinition.Description: this template requires more decoration islands than declared in MaxDecorationIslands of MapGenerator

ValueDefinition.Name: EnlargedAdditionalDecoIslands
ValueDefinition.Description: when enlarged template file is used, deco island amount is MaxDecorationIslands (from MapGenerator) + AdditionalDecoIslands + EnlargedAdditionalDecoIslands

ValueDefinition.Name: HorizonIslands
HorizonIslandFile
ValueDefinition.Description: The island file that should be used for the horizon island

ValueDefinition.Name: Position
ValueDefinition.Description: The position at which the island should be spawned - should not be inside the session

ValueDefinition.Name: Scale
ValueDefinition.Description: The scale of the horizon island

ValueDefinition.Name: Rotation
ValueDefinition.Description: Rotation in Degrees - rotation of the horizon island
Islands that should be rendered outside the session at the horizon of the map

ValueDefinition.Name: WiggleOnceWithoutAttraction
ValueDefinition.Description: each island is moved once (several directions are tried like in 1800), no attraction

ValueDefinition.Name: WiggleIterationCount
ValueDefinition.Description: How often are islands trying to wiggle towards their nearest attractionpoint. If set to 0 the islands will not move at all

ValueDefinition.Name: ShrinkWorld
ValueDefinition.Description: Session Size and Playable Area are automatically calculated as bounding box around the islands

ValueDefinition.Name: WiggleStartingIslands
ValueDefinition.Description: are starting islands included in the wiggle process?

ValueDefinition.Name: UseWorldCenterAsAttraction
ValueDefinition.Description: Either use middle of session as a single attraction or use all not movable islands as attraction point

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandBaseName
ValueDefinition.Description: To avoid using of too similar islands (e.g. with and without rivers)

ValueDefinition.Name: Priority
ValueDefinition.Description: Higher values have higher priority.

Property.Name: FertilityPool
Property.Description: consecutive usages of a fertilitypool ignore the previous picks until pool is empty. Next usage reshuffles the pool.

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildBuildingWhitelist
ValueDefinition.Description: All the buildings which should trigger a pamsy event BUILDING_BUILT if a human builds them or upgrades to them

ValueDefinition.Name: Participant
ValueDefinition.Description: Participant that would welcome the player in the diplomacy scene.

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: Weight of how likely it is that this participant is being chosen to welcome the player. Percentages are in comparison, and not capped to 100%.

ValueDefinition.Name: PamsyContextKontorGhostAffordable
ValueDefinition.Description: A pamsy context used to trigger specific reactions

ValueDefinition.Name: PamsyContextKontorGhostNotAffordable
ValueDefinition.Description: A pamsy context used to trigger specific reactions

ValueDefinition.Name: PamsyContextMonumentEventRunning
ValueDefinition.Description: A pamsy context used to trigger specific reactions

ValueDefinition.Name: PamsyContextAllNeedsFulfilled
ValueDefinition.Description: A pamsy context used to trigger specific reactions

ValueDefinition.Name: PamsyContextPeaceInterventionWarWon
ValueDefinition.Description: A pamsy context used to trigger specific reactions

ValueDefinition.Name: PamsyContextPeaceInterventionWarLost
ValueDefinition.Description: A pamsy context used to trigger specific reactions

ValueDefinition.Name: EnableFeatureDiplomacy
ValueDefinition.Description: Also Disable Trade routes and World Map to remove buttons under minimap.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumHistoryEntries
ValueDefinition.Description: How many reason updates will be stored in the history (per relation)

ValueDefinition.Name: PassiveWarScoreFactorAttacker
ValueDefinition.Description: When a defender unit is destroyed by external factors, the attackers still passively gain WarScore but reduced by this factor (~0.8)

ValueDefinition.Name: PassiveWarScoreFactorDefender
ValueDefinition.Description: When an attacker unit is destroyed by external factors, the defenders still gain passive war score but reduced by this factor (~0.25)

ValueDefinition.Name: CeasefireInterventionHighReputationThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Parties are considered worthy of emperors intervention if above this threshold in Reputation

ValueDefinition.Name: CeasefireInterventionLowReputationThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Parties are considered okay to interrupt by emperor intervention if below this reputation threshold

ValueDefinition.Name: CeasefireInterventionWarScoreLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: The emperor will intervene in a war that reaches this war score percentage if both parties are deemed worthy

ValueDefinition.Name: CeasefireInterventionWarScoreDeficitLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: The emperor will intervene if a worthy party is this far behind an interruptable party in war score (in percent relative to the target war score)

ValueDefinition.Name: CeasefireInterventionRandomDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: The emperor will wait between 0:00 and this time after intervention conditions have been met before actually forcing a ceasefire.

ValueDefinition.Name: CeasefireInterventionNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: The notification shown to players when one of their wars got interrupted by the emperor

ValueDefinition.Name: AnnihilationThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Wars become annihilation wars if war score is over this threshold.

ValueDefinition.Name: ProlongWarScoreFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Upon prolonging a war the target warscore grows by this percentage

ValueDefinition.Name: MinTimeBetweenToPeaceInterventions
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum time between two emperor peace/ceasefire interventions

ValueDefinition.Name: DominationThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: If a faction has this percent more war score, it will be counted as "dominating"

ValueDefinition.Name: CloseToWinThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: If a faction has this percent of the total war score, it will be marked as "close to winning"

ValueDefinition.Name: PamsyContextEnemiesOnIslandDuringWar
ValueDefinition.Description: An asset used as pamsy context when selecting residences and enemy units ar on the island during a war

ValueDefinition.Name: PamsyContextEnemiesOnIslandDuringFeud
ValueDefinition.Description: An asset used as pamsy context when selecting residences and enemy units ar on the island during a feud

ValueDefinition.Name: WarScoreLandFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: All Military Land Points are multiplied with this factor when calculating war score

ValueDefinition.Name: WarScoreShipFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: All Military Ship Points are multiplied with this factor when calculating war score

ValueDefinition.Name: WarScoreDefenseFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: All Military Defense Points are multiplied with this factor when calculating war score

ValueDefinition.Name: WarScoreFeudFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Accumulated Warscore Points are multiplied with this factor if the war is a feud

ValueDefinition.Name: WarScoreDefaultFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Accumulated Warscore Points are multiplied with this factor in a normal war

ValueDefinition.Name: WarScoreRebellionFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Accumulated Warscore Points are multiplied with this factor in a rebellion

ValueDefinition.Name: ParticipantDiscoveryCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: PARTICIPANT_DISCOVERED-Pamsys are delayed by this interval

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationCostAnnihilateRival
ValueDefinition.Description: Since this value goes both into the negative and positive, please use the actual value (minus for subtraction of reputation, plus for addition of reputation) per zone value.

ValueDefinition.Name: DifficultyLevel
ValueDefinition.Description: The difficulty level we expect to be calculated by points when using this preset. Choose "None" if you don't care

ValueDefinition.Name: SetupDistributionWorkforce
ValueDefinition.Description: Starting workforce per villa

ValueDefinition.Name: SetupMapTemplateType
ValueDefinition.Description: The map template type asset defining what map template should be choosen by default for this difficulty setup

ValueDefinition.Name: TutorialLevel
ValueDefinition.Description: The tutorial level that should be active during the game

ValueDefinition.Name: EnableScenario
ValueDefinition.Description: True indicates that this game setup refers to a scenario

ValueDefinition.Name: ActiveDLCs
ValueDefinition.Description: The DLCs which are active in this game

ValueDefinition.Name: InternalLoadAsScenarioSelection
ValueDefinition.Description: Internal Value! When set, removes some features not needed when loading the world map only to use it as a scenario selection

ValueDefinition.Name: SkipSetSailButton
ValueDefinition.Description: When loading a session, true will transition immidiate to ingame view once the loading is finished.

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultStartProvince
ValueDefinition.Description: Sets the default start province that can be overwritten by the player or the AI

ValueDefinition.Name: LockedAssets
ValueDefinition.Description: The list of assets that should be locked when the campaign starts

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockedAssets
ValueDefinition.Description: The list of assets that should be unlocked when the campaign starts

ValueDefinition.Name: NightStartHour
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines on which daytime the NightLightSetup should be started to use. Enter e.g. '19' for 7pm

ValueDefinition.Name: NightEndHour
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines on which daytime the NightLightSetup should be stopped to use. Enter e.g. '5.5' for 5:30 am

ValueDefinition.Name: Valid2DPortraits
ValueDefinition.Description: Portraits that are allowed to be 2D

ValueDefinition.Name: SuccessfulWarFestival
ValueDefinition.Description: Festival that will trigger on the most populated island if the player has won a war

ValueDefinition.Name: MonumentEventStartedFestival
ValueDefinition.Description: Festival that will trigger once a monument event starts

ValueDefinition.Name: DevotionThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of devotion that has to be reached for a festival to trigger

ValueDefinition.Name: Deity
ValueDefinition.Description: The Deity that needs to reach the required devotion threshold

ValueDefinition.Name: Festival
ValueDefinition.Description: Festival that is triggered once its deity has reached the required devotion threshold

ValueDefinition.Name: FestivalDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long will the festival last

ValueDefinition.Name: FestivalFeedbackDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long will the feedback for the festival last

ValueDefinition.Name: FestivalEffects
ValueDefinition.Description: The effects that are active while the festival is running

ValueDefinition.Name: FestivalDecision
ValueDefinition.Description: The decision that needs to be taken before the festival starts

ValueDefinition.Name: FestivalDecisionRefGuids
ValueDefinition.Description: All the configured assets will be added to the decisions TextSourceContext and can be accessed in the decisions via the tag "DynamicTextRefGuid{index}". index and the brackets are replaced by its position in the vector

ValueDefinition.Name: ReplaceFestivalByCurrentChosenDeityFestival
ValueDefinition.Description: If this festival is supposed to trigger it will be replaced by the current chosen deity festival, if a deity has been chosen

ValueDefinition.Name: ParadeSegments
ValueDefinition.Description: The sequence of wagons to spawn

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnTent
ValueDefinition.Description: If configured will be placed at the spawn and despawn location of the parade to hide the spawning of the wagons

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnTentRotationOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: If the tent is facing the wrong direction you can configure a rotation offset here

ValueDefinition.Name: HarbourBaseHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: Define the height of the building placed on a quay (coast and harbour building), And also the Quay Object. And define the coast height.

ValueDefinition.Name: HarbourFeedbackHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: The height used for feedback units which are on the Quay

ValueDefinition.Name: RenderHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: Height of inworld feedback (for example the blocker area in front of a building)

ValueDefinition.Name: HarbourBlockerPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: define how many of the harbour poles are displayed, e.g. 75 makes 75% visible and 25% hidden

ValueDefinition.Name: QuayHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: Determines the height of the quay polygon.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuayStreetHeightWIP
ValueDefinition.Description: Determines the terrain-threshold at water/coast to switch from street to quay-street. Its also the fixed-height to which the road-asset gets created at. For FPP we hack quay streets as a wood-bridge-asset with fixed height. Harbour base height is too high for our purposes and MinimumStreetHeight too low. As this is WIP anyways, we wont change semantics of the other values, but later we should remove this value here.

ValueDefinition.Name: TextColors
ValueDefinition.Description: Colors used in the UI

ValueDefinition.Name: Color
ValueDefinition.Description: A specific UI color

ValueDefinition.Name: SlotGhostColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Ghosts of Slot buildings per Region

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestOutlineColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Quest objects can have special outlines

ValueDefinition.Name: GridExtensionLinesColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Grid extension lines (overwritten in BuildModeBalancing:MajorGridLines if gamepad is active)

ValueDefinition.Name: GridExtensionLinesThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: Grid extension lines (overwritten in BuildModeBalancing:MajorGridLines if gamepad is active)

ValueDefinition.Name: GridTileBlockedVisible
Texture
ValueDefinition.Description: Blocked tiles under the preview are highlighted with texture
Preview Blocker use the color of GridTileDescription Blocked_Visible

ValueDefinition.Name: InvalidObjectBaseColor
ValueDefinition.Description: tint color for build mode, is used with dynamic functions (e.g. b and b value flashing when resources are missing or module limit reached)

ValueDefinition.Name: SelectionCircleColors
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the colors for the selection circle for different active build tools.

ValueDefinition.Name: GradientColor
ValueDefinition.Description: The color of the gradient along the street touching edge. (It fades to the same color with alpha a)

ValueDefinition.Name: GradientLength
ValueDefinition.Description: The length of gradient, measured from building-edge towards street center

ValueDefinition.Name: LineColor
ValueDefinition.Description: The color of the lines in between tiles

ValueDefinition.Name: LineWidth
ValueDefinition.Description: The width of the lines in between tiles

ValueDefinition.Name: LineLength
ValueDefinition.Description: The length of the lines in between tiles

ValueDefinition.Name: LineGlow
ValueDefinition.Description: Line Glow Value which is passed to render engine

ValueDefinition.Name: GraphActiveColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Color when the meshgraph is build and the tool to build this type of meshgraph is selected

ValueDefinition.Name: OtherGraphActiveColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Color when a tool to build other type of meshgraph is selected

ValueDefinition.Name: GraphPreviewColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Color of the meshgraph that the player is trying to build

ValueDefinition.Name: OtherBuildModeColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Color of the meshgraph when placing other building (not-meshgraph)

ValueDefinition.Name: StartNodeColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Color for the start attached to the mouse before building the mesh graph

ValueDefinition.Name: GraphInvalidElementColor
ValueDefinition.Description: The color of specific errors, that invalidate the graph

ValueDefinition.Name: MovingFlashColor
ValueDefinition.Description: The Color of the highlight that moves along the MeshGraph upon construction

ValueDefinition.Name: MovingFlashSpeed_TilesPerSecond
ValueDefinition.Description: Moving Flash duration is computed as Speed*Length.

ValueDefinition.Name: MovingFlashDurationMin
ValueDefinition.Description: For short segments, we'll have at least this duration.

ValueDefinition.Name: MovingFlashDurationMax
ValueDefinition.Description: For long segments, the duration will not exceed this value

ValueDefinition.Name: SecondFlashDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Duration of the second flash that affects all edges after the moving flash. 0 = no second flash

ValueDefinition.Name: DestructionEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: 1 == spawn on every tile, 2 == spawn on every second tile, ... 0 = Deactivate completely

ValueDefinition.Name: FlashColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Duration of the flash that affects all edges without moving. 0 = no second flash

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemsPerCost
ValueDefinition.Description: How many assets can I pay with one cost

ValueDefinition.Name: Interval
ValueDefinition.Description: Every X fields of movement we need to pay the costs

ValueDefinition.Name: FlatValue
ValueDefinition.Description: Used as base money value if the toMoved Buildings has no own money costs

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxSteps
ValueDefinition.Description: MoveDistance/Interval will be used to calculate how often we need to pay. With this setting we can cap that so at a certain point it will not cost more

ValueDefinition.Name: Percentage
ValueDefinition.Description: Percentage of the BaseCost we need to pay for every step. (Step is calculated by Distance/Interval)

ValueDefinition.Name: Taxes
LandTaxFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Multiplied to the land tax of an island
Modifies the amount of land taxes to pay

ValueDefinition.Name: Maintenance
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the maintenance costs of all non military objects.

ValueDefinition.Name: NegativeCityStatusAttributes
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the negative attributes provided by city status.

ValueDefinition.Name: SettlementCostFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Multiplied to the costs of settling an island

ValueDefinition.Name: Incidents
MinimumMajorIncidentCityStatus
ValueDefinition.Description: The Minimum City Status an island has to be to be considered in the major incident evaluation
For values based on incident difficulty check the Incident Configuration directly

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentPrevention
ValueDefinition.Description: This setting defines if we block incidents from happening if the player has x amount of attributes

ValueDefinition.Name: CooldownFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Cooldown factor for contracts. 1 = normal, 2 = double the time

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of start credits (money)

ValueDefinition.Name: Region
ValueDefinition.Description: Start goods for each region

ValueDefinition.Name: MapTemplateTypes
ValueDefinition.Description: All available Map template types the player can choose from

ValueDefinition.Name: TreeAmountBalancing
TreeAmountPerConstructionAreaTile
ValueDefinition.Description: only non marsh tiles are counted, the tree amount is the target amount which is respected by activating forest chunks

Target tree amount for tree chunk activation is tile count of construction area * TreeAmountPerContructionAreaTile (chose randomly tree chunks on each island until at least target tree amount is available) !Please discuss changes with Level Design!

ValueDefinition.Name: AvailableSecondParties
ValueDefinition.Description: These Second Parties can be chosen in Advanced Difficulty Settings

ValueDefinition.Name: AvailableThirdParties
ValueDefinition.Description: These Third Parties can be chosen in Advanced Difficulty Settings

ValueDefinition.Name: CampaignAutoParticipants
ValueDefinition.Description: These Profiles cannot be deactivated for campaign

ValueDefinition.Name: NormalAutoParticipants
ValueDefinition.Description: These Profiles cannot be deactivated for normal random game

ValueDefinition.Name: AnimalFrights
ValueDefinition.Description: Which cfgs to spawn on easter-egg-explosion-at-mouse-cursor

ValueDefinition.Name: FeedbackSequenceIDs
ValueDefinition.Description: Ids of FeedbackEditor Sequences

ValueDefinition.Name: RenderConditionIDs
ValueDefinition.Description: RenderCondition IDs to communicate with renderEngine when modifying CFG states

ValueDefinition.Name: MoveModeDragThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: When dragging at least x pixels in Move mode, the drag is executed

ValueDefinition.Name: ParticipantMessageCategories
ValueDefinition.Description: Needed by ToolOne GUI to display message view

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipItemDropCalculation
ValueDefinition.Description: Flotsam is generated for cargo of destroyed ship, content is reduced

ValueDefinition.Name: SequenceIDs
ValueDefinition.Description: SequenceDataset to RenderEngine sequence ID

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnAreaConfig
ValueDefinition.Description: Used in AnnoEditor to visualize different Spawn Areas

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The notification which should be triggered on this special day

ValueDefinition.Name: GuidPools
ValueDefinition.Description: Every list represents one pool of guids that will be handled as the same guid internally. Can be used to e.g. handle a ship skin as the same object as the original object

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowMultipleShortcuts
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this shortcut will not change if another binding has the same shortcut

ValueDefinition.Name: AvailableOnPlatforms
ValueDefinition.Description: This shortcut is only available on the given platforms.

ValueDefinition.Name: InputTypesAlternative
ValueDefinition.Description: Alternative keyboard / mouse button input types for given shortcut

ValueDefinition.Name: InvalidOnPlatforms
ValueDefinition.Description: This key binding will only be invalid for the given platforms

ValueDefinition.Name: InvalidMouseButtonBindings
ValueDefinition.Description: Mouse Buttons that are invalid to rebindings

ValueDefinition.Name: KeyAssetNames
ValueDefinition.Description: List of all keys that are using a special (non default) widget to display this key in a shortcut

ValueDefinition.Name: AssetGroupName
ValueDefinition.Description: The Tag of the associated widget in the asset group

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultKeyAssetName
ValueDefinition.Description: The Tag of the default widget in the asset group

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentResolverUnitTextMapping
ValueDefinition.Description: Maps multiple resolver units to a single resolver unit. This is done to prevent double entries for, for example, doctors in the infotip if the item affects hospitals in europe and africa (who have different resolver units)

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalText
ValueDefinition.Description: used for buildingUpgrade.AdditionalWorkforces

ValueDefinition.Name: AttributeInRange
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for additional functional effects, e.g. "Happiness in Range")

ValueDefinition.Name: TextWithSpecifiedProduct
ValueDefinition.Description: AdditionalOutput with specified product and AdditionalOutputCycle > 1

ValueDefinition.Name: TextWithSpecifiedProductEveryCycle
ValueDefinition.Description: AdditionalOutput with specified product and AdditionalOutputCycle = 1

ValueDefinition.Name: ForceProductSameAsFactoryOutputText
ValueDefinition.Description: AdditionalOutput with forced product and AdditionalOutputCycle > 1

ValueDefinition.Name: ForceProductSameAsFactoryOutputEveryCycleText
ValueDefinition.Description: AdditionalOutput with forced product and AdditionalOutputCycle = 1

ValueDefinition.Name: ForceProductSameAsFactoryOutputIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: Icon if product is forced

ValueDefinition.Name: Unpackable
ValueDefinition.Description: Is the asset unpackable for the player and will need additional interaction

ValueDefinition.Name: DLCDependency
ValueDefinition.Description: Enter the DLC asset here, if this asset is only available with a DLC

ValueDefinition.Name: Region
ValueDefinition.Description: for which Regions is GUID valid

ValueDefinition.Name: Progress
ValueDefinition.Description: Progress that configures how values are growing in defined steps

ValueDefinition.Name: Threshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Threshold that has to be exceeded to get this value

ValueDefinition.Name: Value
ValueDefinition.Description: Absolute value. Is not added to the previous value

ValueDefinition.Name: PostProgress
ValueDefinition.Description: This configuration is used AFTER all steps in the Progress exceeded the Thresold. The ValueIncrease is added to the Value of the last Value entry of the progress

ValueDefinition.Name: AbsoluteLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the absolute limit of the Value that can't be exceeded in any way. If 0, this will be ignored

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionContext
ValueDefinition.Description: If the session context is set, this progress will override the global progress for a specific session. If not set the progress will be set as global progress

ValueDefinition.Name: DynamicGovernorDecisionTemplateAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The storyline asset used as template for a dynamic governor decision.

ValueDefinition.Name: GovernorDecisionCostScaling
FactorForGoods
ValueDefinition.Description: The additional amount of a cost in a decision option will be multiplied with this factor depending on the current progress level of the participant. See the decision option cost secition for a exact formular. This factor will be used if the cost is a good.

ValueDefinition.Name: FactorForMoney
ValueDefinition.Description: The additional amount of a cost in a decision option will be multiplied with this factor depending on the current progress level of the participant. See the decision option cost secition for a exact formular. This factor will be used if the cost is money.

The additional amount of a cost in a decision option will be multiplied with this factor depending on the current progress level of the participant. See the decision option cost secition for a exact formular.

ValueDefinition.Name: MissingGoodsText
ValueDefinition.Description: The text displayed in the infotip of a decision option if the player cannot afford the option costs.

ValueDefinition.Name: CampaignCorporationNameMale
ValueDefinition.Description: Default name for the male protagonist

ValueDefinition.Name: CampaignPortraitMale
ValueDefinition.Description: Default portrait for the male protagonist

ValueDefinition.Name: CampaignPlayerLogoMale
ValueDefinition.Description: The logo/emblem of the player in the campaign if the player choose markus.

ValueDefinition.Name: CampaignCorporationNameFemale
ValueDefinition.Description: Default name for the female protagonist

ValueDefinition.Name: CampaignPortraitFemale
ValueDefinition.Description: Default portrait for the female protagonist

ValueDefinition.Name: CampaignPlayerLogoFemale
ValueDefinition.Description: The logo/emblem of the player in the campaign if the player choose marcia.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestInteractionWindowConfig
Buttons
Text
ValueDefinition.Description: The text on the button
List of Buttons in this QuestInteractionWindow. UI does not support more than 3. Do NOT change order or meaning, as buttons have hardcoded implemented logic.
Defines the Button Layout for QuestInteractionWindows

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestInteractionWindowNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: The notification that gets triggered if a new interaction is now possible in a QuestInteractionWindow

ValueDefinition.Name: TutorialStorylines
List
Storyline
ValueDefinition.Description: A storyline of this tutorial level
A list of all storylines of this tutorial level

ValueDefinition.Name: EndOfTutorialComponent
ValueDefinition.Description: Link the last component of a tutorial storyline here, to mark the tutorial as finished as soon as this component has ended
Defines all tutorial stoylines. Top tutorial levels also include all lower ones, e.g. "NewToLimestone" also includes everything from "NoTutorial"

ValueDefinition.Name: CampaignPowerStruggleUnlockAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: An asset that defines if the power struggle screen is visible or not during campaign.

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowedAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: Is taken into account if required permit is no set.

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationText
ValueDefinition.Description: The text / text pool that will be displayed with the notification

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationTextPool
ValueDefinition.Description: The text pool where the text is taken from. Any setting in NotificationText overwrites this one

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationTextGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: The text group where the text is taken from. Any setting in NotificationText or NotificationTextPool overwrites this one

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationBlockingTime
ValueDefinition.Description: The time interval how often this notification is allowed to occur

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationAudioAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: A sound that is played when the notification is triffereg (e.g. "Pling")

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: The priority for the notification queue. A higher value means higher priority to be displayed. A value of -1 means the notification will be forced to be shown and can interrupt other notification

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: If a new notification with a group gets triggered all notifications of the same group will be deleted from the notification queue and archive.

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationTone
ValueDefinition.Description: Tone of the notification (e.g Neutral, positive ...)

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationTopic
ValueDefinition.Description: Topic of a notification, used to filter or mute notification of the same topic. Use PaMSy for character reactions that should not be filtered out.

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationQueueTimeoutOverwrite
ValueDefinition.Description: How long the notification will be in the queue before it is discarded. If 0, the default queue timeout from the notification configuration asset will be used.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsUnique
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this notfication will not be queued, when a copy is already running or enqueued

ValueDefinition.Name: RestrictToSessionOrRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: Set to true if you want this notification only to be shown in a specific session or region. If the player is in a different session/region the notification will be postponed until the player enters the correct one. If you set this value then <DisplayTimeout> will be ignored. Handle with care!

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionOrRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: The session or region where this notification may only be shown

ValueDefinition.Name: ReEnterQueueIfInterrupted
ValueDefinition.Description: This notification will go back into the notification queue if it got interrupted while playing

ValueDefinition.Name: IsInvisible
ValueDefinition.Description: If true this notification is not shown in the UI while it is running. Audio and subtitle will still be played/visible

ValueDefinition.Name: IsArchivable
ValueDefinition.Description: If true this notification will put into archive after it played.

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardList
IconAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: An asset where the icon is taken from. Will also be used as refGUID for the Infotip. (e.g. this could be an item)

ValueDefinition.Name: Infotip
ValueDefinition.Description: The infotip for the icon. Leave empy for default infotip.

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount displayed next to the icon
List of Icons with infotips shown in the character notification

ValueDefinition.Name: CharacterNotificationText
ValueDefinition.Description: Summary of the notification. E.g. "Dorian says he likes that..."

ValueDefinition.Name: CharacterNotificationTextFemale
ValueDefinition.Description: Femal version of the summary. Useful if generic summaries are setup in a template asset, and then inherited to multiple specific characters.

ValueDefinition.Name: CharacterSubline
ValueDefinition.Description: Audio of the notification. E.g. "I like that..."

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationMainCallbackType
ValueDefinition.Description: The callback that will be triggered when this notification is clicked

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationMainDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Optional description line for the title text

ValueDefinition.Name: Subtitle
ValueDefinition.Description: An optional subtitle with audio for the notification.

ValueDefinition.Name: SubtitleGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: The subtitle text group where the subtitle is taken from. Any setting in Subtitle overwrites this one

ValueDefinition.Name: IconAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The icon that will be displayed with this message. Leave this empty if no icon should be shown.

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationSideTitle
ValueDefinition.Description: A title for the Notification

ValueDefinition.Name: IsArchivable
ValueDefinition.Description: If true this notification will put into archive after it played.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsSilent
ValueDefinition.Description: Silent notifications will not be shown, but directly moved into the archive

ValueDefinition.Name: IsWarning
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to true, this notification will be shown in the warnings tab in the notification archive. Can not be active at the same time as "IsEvent".

ValueDefinition.Name: ForceOpenArchive
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this notification will force the archive to show after the notification is played

ValueDefinition.Name: HasJumpLocation
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to false the side notification doesn't give the possibility to jump somewhere

ValueDefinition.Name: RequestDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Description text of this governor request

ValueDefinition.Name: RequestPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: Priority of this request. Higher means more important! GD guidelines: Normal Prio (50), Highest Prio (100), Low Prio (0), Emperor (90)

ValueDefinition.Name: RequestTimeout
ValueDefinition.Description: If not 0 the request will time out after this time.

ValueDefinition.Name: RequestWarningTime
ValueDefinition.Description: If the request time has only x time left it will show a warning. X can be configured here. Only used if RequestTimeout > 0

ValueDefinition.Name: RequestIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: The icon displayed on the governor request

ValueDefinition.Name: RequestParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The participant which requests this request. Will be used to show a portrait/icon in the UI. If left empty we try to find one via the RequestParticipantDynamic script.

ValueDefinition.Name: RequestParticipantDynamic
ValueDefinition.Description: A lua script which need to return a Participant GUID. If the RequestParticipant is empty this lua script will be evaluated and the result will be used as request participant. For example this could be get the Active Emperor with following script: "Participants.ActiveEmperor"

ValueDefinition.Name: IsRequestMandatory
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the request will automatically execute its interaction after timeout and it cannot be discarded.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsRequestSkippable
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the request can be discarded by the player. !This setting will be ignored if the request is mandatory!

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlyVisibleInProcessingProvince
ValueDefinition.Description: If true this request is only visible if the player is in the same province as the request was started in.

ValueDefinition.Name: TryInteractionForAllPeers
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is true and one peer interacts with the request all other coop peers also try to execute the interaction. E.g. If one player clicks a decision request the decision screen will open for the clicking peer and if the other peers do not have a fullscreen open also for the other peers. Will only work for Decision and Narrative Sequence requests.

ValueDefinition.Name: AppearSound
ValueDefinition.Description: Sound that is played when this request appears in the UI

ValueDefinition.Name: ConnectedFeature
ValueDefinition.Description: The feature connected to this notification

ValueDefinition.Name: Notifications
Notification
ValueDefinition.Description: One notification in a chain of notifications
List of Notifications that should be triggered directly after each other

ValueDefinition.Name: PostAudioTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Additional display time after the movie/audio has finished

ValueDefinition.Name: PostAudioTimeLong
ValueDefinition.Description: This time is used instead of the normal PostAudioTime if in gamepad mode

ValueDefinition.Name: Delay
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the delay after one notification of this type until the next notification can be shown (in ms)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinDisplayTime
ValueDefinition.Description: The minimum time this notification will be displayed

ValueDefinition.Name: QueueTimeout
ValueDefinition.Description: After what time in the queue without showing the notification gets discarded. Can be overwritten in individual notifications.

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalDisplayTime
ValueDefinition.Description: This time gets added to the display time of the current notification, after it gets focused by the player (gamepadmode only)

ValueDefinition.Name: PauseActive
ValueDefinition.Description: will this type be active in pause

ValueDefinition.Name: DelayInBuildMode
ValueDefinition.Description: Notification waits until buildmode has been ended, before it will activate.

ValueDefinition.Name: DelayInFullScreenMenu
ValueDefinition.Description: Notification waits until all fullscreen menus has been closed, before it will activate.

ValueDefinition.Name: SideNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: The silent side notification triggered along the normal banner

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxEntries
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum number of notification entries of this category

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationUnreadThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The minimum time that a notification needs to be displayed to the user until it is marked as read

ValueDefinition.Name: GameSessionStartupIgnoreNotificationTime
ValueDefinition.Description: No notifications will be shown during this time after start of a game. The queue will not be processed, so they will be shown later.

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultFlyoutHeightOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the default flyout starting height

ValueDefinition.Name: AudioNotificationYPos
ValueDefinition.Description: YPosition used to show AudioNotifications

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowedAutoFocusDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: A character notification gets automatically focused if triggered by player interaction and is shown on the screen in this amount of time after its creation. E.g. 00::00::05 means that after clicking on a quest giver object and the quest accept notification is shown in the next 5 seconds it will be automatically focused in the gamepad version.

ValueDefinition.Name: FallbackSubtitleDisplayTimePerChar
ValueDefinition.Description: Fallback Display Time calculated as sum of ms for each char.

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationDurationSettings
MinDisplayTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long sidenotifications will be minimum displayed on screen
The MinDisplayTime of sidenotification depending on the player settings

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationFilters
Filter
ValueDefinition.Description: A notification filter used to hide/mute notifications
List of all notification filters used in the game

ValueDefinition.Name: Topics
Topic
ValueDefinition.Description: Notifications with this topic will not be shown if this filter is active. !Topics are only allowed in one filter!
List of topics that will not be visible if this filter is active.

ValueDefinition.Name: FilterDescriptionAudioEnable
ValueDefinition.Description: Some text desrcibing the filter used in infotips. Used when the filter will be set to audible.

ValueDefinition.Name: FilterDescriptionAudioDisable
ValueDefinition.Description: Some text desrcibing the filter used in infotips. Used when the filter will be set to inaudible.

ValueDefinition.Name: FilterDescriptionVisibleEnable
ValueDefinition.Description: Some text desrcibing the filter used in infotips. Used when the filter will be set to visible

ValueDefinition.Name: FilterDescriptionVisibleDisable
ValueDefinition.Description: Some text desrcibing the filter used in infotips. Used when the filter will be set to invisible

ValueDefinition.Name: SceneToOpen
ValueDefinition.Description: The UI scene that should open if the governor request is clicked

ValueDefinition.Name: AvailableInBulk
ValueDefinition.Description: When set to true, this trade type is available for the bulk trade (all goods at once)

ValueDefinition.Name: SlotTypes
ValueDefinition.Description: Enter all buildings here that are available as build option for the regarding slot type. The menu will filter these buildings to the current region and show them in the order they appear here

ValueDefinition.Name: MixedSelectionSkin
ValueDefinition.Description: The skin the UI shows when we the player selected multiple objects that have different skins

ValueDefinition.Name: IsBaseCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: This category is considered as base category which means some arrows in the UI will indicate that other TierCategories depend on this category

ValueDefinition.Name: MaterialCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: The material category is displayed between the two pin bars and is always visible

ValueDefinition.Name: RadialMinSize
ValueDefinition.Description: How many buttons has a radial at least? If there are less elements in one category that defined here, the radial will be filled up by empty elements

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildSettings
ValueDefinition.Description: List of buildsettings. Order in this array defines order in UI. - NonBlueprint toggles Blueprint mode on and off - RectangularModuleMode toggles Farmfield brush mode on and off - Diagonal build toggles between 45° and forced 90° rotations - RegionalUpgrade toggles between the regional and the local upgrade

ValueDefinition.Name: RegionalUpgradeIcons
ValueDefinition.Description: Ignore Meta. Roman icon will be used for roman upgrade, other icon will be shown as local upgrade path depending on current region

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreUnlockStateForCategoryVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: when set to true, the unlock of this building is not enough to show the category

ValueDefinition.Name: AddSpaceAfterEntry
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to true, the UI will show a little gap to seperate this entry from the upcoming entries

ValueDefinition.Name: CategoryIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: Big image of the category (portrait of the tier resident)

ValueDefinition.Name: SecondaryIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: Small icon on the bottom of the category (e.g. roman number for the tier)

ValueDefinition.Name: IsDefaultSelection
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to true, this category will be selected initially on gamestart

ValueDefinition.Name: AmmunitionFeedbackOffsetX
ValueDefinition.Description: X Offset that is added to the ammunition text and icon

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeToProgressBar
ValueDefinition.Description: Time until the progress bar becomes visible

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedsDLC
ValueDefinition.Description: the fertility is only shown, if this DLC is active

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimapDotSortOrder
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the Z-Sorting of Minimap Dots.

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandColorAlpha
ValueDefinition.Description: The alpha of the player color that is used to colorize the islands on the minimap.

ValueDefinition.Name: SetsFilteredFlag
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the macromap will show a 'Map Is Filtered' text when this setting is turned off. Set this property to false for all settings that should not affect the 'IsFiltered' state e.g. Show wind

ValueDefinition.Name: StrategicMapFogOfWar
ValueDefinition.Description: Texture which is used on the strategic map

ValueDefinition.Name: MinViewFrustrumSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be used to clamp the size of the frustrum so it stays visible when zooming in. The value determines the minimum length of each line of the frustrum

ValueDefinition.Name: StartDistancePC
ValueDefinition.Description: Alpha is lerped between start and end distance. Alpha is 1 if distance is < that startdistance

ValueDefinition.Name: EndDistancePC
ValueDefinition.Description: Alpha is lerped between start and end distance. Alpha is 0 if distance is > that enddistance

ValueDefinition.Name: ButtonType
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the function of that button

ValueDefinition.Name: AddGap
ValueDefinition.Description: Adds a gap (visual space) underneath this button

ValueDefinition.Name: Text
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the text for this button

ValueDefinition.Name: InputMask
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines with which inputs this button is visible

ValueDefinition.Name: Name
ValueDefinition.Description: The name of the category

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandSelectionGlobal
ValueDefinition.Description: The name for the global tab inside the statistic menu

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandSelectionMulti
ValueDefinition.Description: Text that is shown if the user selects multiple islands

ValueDefinition.Name: AssetIgnoreList
ValueDefinition.Description: List of assets that should be ignored in the listing of items

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: Asset that shoud be ignored in the listing of item sources

ValueDefinition.Name: SpecialConstructionHighlights
ValueDefinition.Description: some production chains are interrupted by trade routes

ValueDefinition.Name: AqueductConnectionText
ValueDefinition.Description: Is shown on the left side of the requirements

ValueDefinition.Name: FunFactImage
ValueDefinition.Description: Image of size 400 x 180 that will be displayed behind the fun fact.

ValueDefinition.Name: FunFactTitle
ValueDefinition.Description: The title of the fun fact with at most 50 characters.

ValueDefinition.Name: FunFactDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: The description of the fun fact with at most 1000 characters

ValueDefinition.Name: AlwaysShowNeutral
ValueDefinition.Description: If enabled, this attribute will always be shown as neutral. StateThreshold configuration will be ignored

ValueDefinition.Name: Value
ValueDefinition.Description: Value has to be bigger or equal to show this state. No need to enter value for the worst state

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowWithNoSources
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this attribute will be shown even if it has no sources which affects it. If false, the attribute will be hidden if there are no sources.

ValueDefinition.Name: MandatoryGovernorRequestSound
ValueDefinition.Description: Sound that is played when a mandatory governor request appears

ValueDefinition.Name: StandartGovernorRequestSound
ValueDefinition.Description: Sound that is played when a standart (not mandatory) governor request appears in the UI

ValueDefinition.Name: TechConnectionLength
ValueDefinition.Description: Length of the connection between two techs

ValueDefinition.Name: GateConnectionLength
ValueDefinition.Description: Length of the connection between a tech and a gate

ValueDefinition.Name: RepeatableBadgeIcon
ValueDefinition.Category: Icon to indicate that the tech can be repeated (researched multiple times)

ValueDefinition.Name: LockedByResearchableTriggerIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: Icon to indicate that a special condition has to get resolved in order to unlock this tech

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestTechIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: Icon to indicate that a tech is part of a quest

ValueDefinition.Name: ShortcutPanningSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: How fast can the user move the camera with WASD. Value in pixels per second

ValueDefinition.Name: Headline
ValueDefinition.Description: The text that is shown at the top of the UI

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandBorder
ValueDefinition.Description: Images will be exported by the editor with a full transparent border around the island. This border has a fixed size to ensure the outline fits inside of the image

ValueDefinition.Name: GamepadPresetHeadline
ValueDefinition.Description: Appears next to the button that opens the gamepad preset selection

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxGoodsPreview
ValueDefinition.Description: How many goods should be displayed per route?

ValueDefinition.Name: NumOfRoutesToShowFilterButton
ValueDefinition.Description: How many routes the user has to have before we show the filter button

ValueDefinition.Name: Asset
ValueDefinition.Description: This can either be a building or a tool

ValueDefinition.Name: MinBorder
ValueDefinition.Description: Keep a minimum distance from screen border, so that popup cannot get unaccessible

ValueDefinition.Name: CityStatusNeedAttributeValueStyle
ValueDefinition.Description: Style that is applied to the values of need attributes shown in the city status notification

ValueDefinition.Name: ParticipantControlInfotip
ValueDefinition.Description: Left side of UI, the list of participants and how much seats they have

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetZoomOnIslandButtonClick
ValueDefinition.Description: How much too zoom in the macromap when clicking on the island

ValueDefinition.Name: ExtendedTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long the online notification should stay extended on the screen

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalPositionOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: The offset in worldcoordinates to the position of the bubble. Which direction this applies to depends on the Indicator direction of the bubble. If the Indicator direction is bottom middle, this is used as an Y Offset to the bounding box of the selected object.

ValueDefinition.Name: ProvinceTitle
ValueDefinition.Description: Subheader under the name

ValueDefinition.Name: ProvinceDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Fluff of the province

ValueDefinition.Name: ProvinceVideo
ValueDefinition.Description: Fullscreen artwork of the session

ValueDefinition.Name: ProvinceCardBackground
ValueDefinition.Description: Small artwork displayed on the interactable buttons

ValueDefinition.Name: ProvinceRegionalInfo
ValueDefinition.Description: List of gameplay mechanics or other infos

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowHealthBarsForLandUnits
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, healthbars will be shown for units. If false, healthbars will only be shown for ships, walls & buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: HealthbarMinDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Camera distance where we use HealthbarMinSize

ValueDefinition.Name: HealthbarMaxDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Camera distance where we use HealthbarMaxSize

ValueDefinition.Name: HealthbarMinSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Size of the healthbar when camera distance is at HealthbarMinDistance or smaller

ValueDefinition.Name: HealthbarMaxSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Size of the healthbar when camera distance is at HealthbarMaxDistance or greater

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeOutStartDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: If the distance between the camera and the object of a healthbar is > than this value, we will start to fade out the healthbar

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeOutEndDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Healthbar will reach an alpha of 0 if we reach this distance

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowHealthbarAfterReceiveDamageTime
ValueDefinition.Description: When an object that would otherwise not show a healthbar is damaged, it should show a healthbar for this long

ValueDefinition.Name: IsEmperorCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: If this flag is true, we show the chose emperor window. Content attribute should be empty when this flag is set to true

ValueDefinition.Name: HallOfFameMaxItemsShown
ValueDefinition.Description: How many hall of fame items should be shown in the overview?

ValueDefinition.Name: IsMirrored
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this portrait will be shown mirrored in the UI

ValueDefinition.Name: MinDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum Distance the banners are visible

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeInDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance between MinDistance and FadeInDistance will fade the Unit Banner in

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeOutDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance between FadeOutDistance and MaxDistance will fade the Unit Banner out

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: maximum DIstance the banners are visible

ValueDefinition.Name: BannerInfolayerPadding
ValueDefinition.Description: The worldspace height offset used to position the banner on top of the infolayer of units.

ValueDefinition.Name: EnableBannerRepulsion
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, banners repel each other

ValueDefinition.Name: CreditsSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how fast the credits are. Value in Pixels per second.

ValueDefinition.Name: ContextualCommands
ValueDefinition.Description: List of contextual commands that are possible on first level via a single button press. Order defines the priority as in theory multiple contextual commands could be executed but only one will be chosen. Element on position 0 has highest priority, last element in the list has lowest prio

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumDisplayTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Value in second

ValueDefinition.Name: TutorialAutoCompleteDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: Time it takes until an autocomplete tutorial as fulfilled

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: items need to have this category. you can filter by ItemType, by ItemCategory or both

ValueDefinition.Name: IncludeLocalItems
ValueDefinition.Description: include items from local storage

ValueDefinition.Name: IncludeGlobalItems
ValueDefinition.Description: include items from global storage

ValueDefinition.Name: MenuVisibility
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines in which menus this category is visible. Warehouse also implies kontors

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemFilterCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: CategoryAsset of the ItemFilter that is activated if a keyword of this category is chosen

ValueDefinition.Name: Text
ValueDefinition.Description: Text which is shown for this category in the UI

ValueDefinition.Name: SubCategories
ValueDefinition.Description: All Subcategories. Subcategories won't be shown if it's only 1 entry

ValueDefinition.Name: SubCategoryType
ValueDefinition.Description: Type that is used to identify subcategories in the code to add generated keywords

ValueDefinition.Name: Text
ValueDefinition.Description: Text that is shown in the UI for this subcategory

ValueDefinition.Name: Keywords
ValueDefinition.Description: All keywords that are shown within this subcategory

ValueDefinition.Name: Priority
ValueDefinition.Description: All keywords are first sorted on their priority and within a priority alphabetically. Keywords generated by code always have prio 0. Priority can also be negative. Higher priorities are shown at first

ValueDefinition.Name: AreaNotOwned
ValueDefinition.Description: construction area is not owned by current participant

ValueDefinition.Name: PopulationLevels
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines an order over all population levels used for sorting in UI (e.g. statistic screen)

ValueDefinition.Name: EnableAutoRotation
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the model will be rotated automatically until the user manually rotates the model.

ValueDefinition.Name: EffectInfotip
ValueDefinition.Description: Used in the incoming buffs OM, if this is a forward effect

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowPublicService
ValueDefinition.Description: Show public service products like faith?

ValueDefinition.Name: AbortContractText
ValueDefinition.Description: Questbook

ValueDefinition.Name: TrackQuestText
ValueDefinition.Description: Questbook

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoCloseEmptyQuestTrackerDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Time (in seconds) when an opened questtracker get's closed automatically after the last quest disappeared. Set it to something negative to deactivate this feature

ValueDefinition.Name: InfoLayerPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: Used if 2 or more Info-Layer Icons would be shown. Entries at the start of the List have priority over Entries below them. Icons that are not in the List are not being displayed in Game.

ValueDefinition.Name: MarketplaceEfficiencyWarning
ValueDefinition.Description: Shows a warning on residences if the MarketplaceEfficiency is below this threshold

ValueDefinition.Name: MissingAreaThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: show missing area infolayer if free area factor of woodcutter is less

ValueDefinition.Name: MissingFarmfieldThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: warning is shown if available farmfields provide less productivity than this factor

ValueDefinition.Name: PopupDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: if not 0, the icon does not appear instantly but only if the triggering condition is still active after this time

ValueDefinition.Name: IsQuestInfolayer
ValueDefinition.Description: Describes if this infolayer is quest related or not. If it is quest related it will not be hidden if the HideInfolayer option is on

ValueDefinition.Name: InfoTipMinWidth
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum width of an infotip. Infotips can get larger but not smaller

ValueDefinition.Name: InteractionCursor
ValueDefinition.Description: Which mousecursor is shown if interaction is possible?

ValueDefinition.Name: InteractionEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: Which effect is shown on the command ship as interaction feedback?

ValueDefinition.Name: InteractionTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long is the command ship blocked for interaction feedback?

ValueDefinition.Name: InteractionInfolayer
ValueDefinition.Description: infolayer shown on actor while interaction is running

ValueDefinition.Name: InteractionTargetInfolayer
ValueDefinition.Description: infolayer shown on target while interaction is running

ValueDefinition.Name: InteractionOnScreenText
ValueDefinition.Description: Which OnScreenText is shown at the end of the interaction?

ValueDefinition.Name: ForceIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: replace shown icon (for plus goods)

ValueDefinition.Name: ForceIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: replace shown icon (for plus goods)

ValueDefinition.Name: ForceIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: replace shown icon (for plus goods)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinEpilepsyWarningTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long should be the epilepsy time visible at least? If UI needs longer to load, epilepsy warning might be shown longer than this value

ValueDefinition.Name: IntroVideos
ValueDefinition.Description: List of videos that are shown as intro sequence

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipScaleFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Scaling of the ships and fleets

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipFleetDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Max distance between two ships on the worldmap to get merged into one fleet

ValueDefinition.Name: Camera
ValueDefinition.Description: Configuration for the camera of the worldmap. All changes will be reloaded at runtime

ValueDefinition.Name: MinZoom
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance from camera to map when max zoomed in

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxZoom
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance from camera to map when max zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: StartZoom
ValueDefinition.Description: How much is the camera zoomed in when starting the game (0-1). 0 means max zoomed in, 1 means max zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoomStep
ValueDefinition.Description: How much will be zoomed in when rotating the mouse wheel by one step. Value between 0 and 1. One means the camera gets fully zoomed in out with one step

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoomSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: How fast the camera zooms in/out in progress per second. 1 means the whole distance from min to max in one second. Bigger numbers means faster zooming

ValueDefinition.Name: FOV
ValueDefinition.Description: Field of view. Bigger value means we see more of the world

ValueDefinition.Name: CameraAngleFar
ValueDefinition.Description: Angle of the camera when max zoomed out. 0 means camera lies on ground/water, 90 means top down perspective

ValueDefinition.Name: CameraAngleNear
ValueDefinition.Description: Angle of the camera when max zoomed in. 0 means camera lies on ground/water, 90 means top down perspective

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxPanDistanceFar
ValueDefinition.Description: How much we can pan around when max zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxPanDistanceNear
ValueDefinition.Description: How much we can pan around when max zoomed in

ValueDefinition.Name: DragSpeedFar
ValueDefinition.Description: How fast the camera should be moved when panning around when max zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: DragSpeedNear
ValueDefinition.Description: How fast the camera should be moved when panning around when max zoomed in

ValueDefinition.Name: CenterX
ValueDefinition.Description: The X center of the world. Panning will be around this center.

ValueDefinition.Name: CenterY
ValueDefinition.Description: The Y center of the world. Panning will be around this center.

ValueDefinition.Name: StartX
ValueDefinition.Description: On this point the camera will be located when entering the world map the first time

ValueDefinition.Name: StartY
ValueDefinition.Description: On this point the camera will be located when entering the world map the first time

ValueDefinition.Name: ScrollSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for edge scrolling and arrow keys

ValueDefinition.Name: MovementFriction
ValueDefinition.Description: Friction that reduces the velocity of the camera slowly after user release right mouse button. Lower value means the camera stops faster

ValueDefinition.Name: VerticalMovementModifier
ValueDefinition.Description: Adjust to enhance the speed on the vertical axis

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipHeightOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: Y Position of the ships

ValueDefinition.Name: WindDirection
ValueDefinition.Description: Value in degrees

ValueDefinition.Name: Daytime
ValueDefinition.Description: Daytime on the worldmap. Range 0-1 where 0 is midnight, 0.5 is noon

ValueDefinition.Name: PromotedScenario
ValueDefinition.Description: The scenario that is promoted on the world map right when the patch goes live

ValueDefinition.Name: InfoPanelImage
ValueDefinition.Description: Image shown in the info panel when focusing/hovering over the entry. If nothing is entered for the current platform, PC will be used as fallback

ValueDefinition.Name: DragStartToleranceDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the distance the user has to move the mouse to start a drag after he pressed the left mouse button

ValueDefinition.Name: DragStartToleranceTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the time the user has to hold the left mouse button before a drag starts. Value in milliseconds

ValueDefinition.Name: IdleDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: Delay Timer for the basic MenuIdleMessage PaMSy trigger.

ValueDefinition.Name: NegotiationDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: Delay Timer for notifications in the Diplomacy Negotiation menu.

ValueDefinition.Name: ConversationDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: Delay Timer for the Conversations (Dialogue or Interjection) in the Diplomacy Overview menu.

ValueDefinition.Name: WelcomeInSceneDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: Delay Timer for the special Diplomacy Welcome messages that are used in the Diplomacy Overview menu.

ValueDefinition.Name: CopyToClipboardText
ValueDefinition.Description: For development only. Error popups add a button to copy the error code to the clipboard

ValueDefinition.Name: HeaderText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text that is shown in the headline of the popup

ValueDefinition.Name: BodyText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text that is shown in the body of the popup

ValueDefinition.Name: Text
ValueDefinition.Description: Text of the button

ValueDefinition.Name: GamepadAction
ValueDefinition.Description: Gamepad action which will trigger the button

ValueDefinition.Name: Shortcut
ValueDefinition.Description: Shortcut which will trigger the button

ValueDefinition.Name: CloseOnSelectionChange
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this popup will be closed automatically as soon as the selection changes e.g. the selected ship gets destroyed. Set this to true for all popups that directly reference the selected object e.g. 'Are you sure you want to destroy the selected ship?"

ValueDefinition.Name: StopModes
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the build- or toolmode will be stopped when this popup appears. Set this to FALSE for all popups that refer to the buildmode e.g. "Are you sure yuo want to destroy the monument?"

ValueDefinition.Name: IsUnique
