ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the popup can be only once in the stack. If false, multiple instances can be in the stack. Set this to FALSE when you explicitly want to have multiple instances of the same popup e.g. "Player XY has left the game" can occur multiple times in the stack

ValueDefinition.Name: ErrorCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: Set this to anything but None if this popup should inform the user about an error. Each error will show an individual error code based on the ErrorCategory and the error context given by the programmer

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductivityDependentMurmur
ValueDefinition.Description: The Murmur with the highest reached Productivity is added.

ValueDefinition.Name: ApplyMurmurAndMoodToModules
ValueDefinition.Description: if true the murmur for this building will also be applied to all it's Modules

ValueDefinition.Name: DynamicEnvironmentType
ValueDefinition.Description: When this building is placed it replaces the environment sound with this environment.

ValueDefinition.Name: MonumentNoEventMurmur
ValueDefinition.Description: Murmur that is used when this is a monument and has no event running

ValueDefinition.Name: ClusterRange
ValueDefinition.Description: The range in which similar events are clustered

ValueDefinition.Name: ClusterCount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of similar events which start to form a cluster.

ValueDefinition.Name: ActivationRangeOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: The Activation Range is calculated via MaxAttenuation + Offset. If an event is triggered outside of it's activation range it is not send to the soundengine to reduce calls to Wwise.

ValueDefinition.Name: StopEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: if defined this event is used instead of forcing the SoundEngine to stop the sound.

ValueDefinition.Name: OneShotCluster
ValueDefinition.Description: Please note that clustering of oneshots is actually just a supression of new oneshots! However we do play the cluster sound in addition to the oneshot if it suppressed enough other oneshots. The SoundEventType is still taken into account (so oneshots very close to the listener are never suppressed)

ValueDefinition.Name: OneShotClusterRange
ValueDefinition.Description: The range in which other oneshots are supressed

ValueDefinition.Name: OneShotSuppressionAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of other oneshots which can be suppressed by this one. So if a 5 is configured the suppression is removed after 5 other oneshots were supressed - so the sixth oneshot is triggered again. If -1 is configured there is no limit to the amount of suppressed sounds.

ValueDefinition.Name: OneShotClusterSuppressLength
ValueDefinition.Description: how long should the suppression be active? If this is 0 the duration of the oneshot is taken instead.

ValueDefinition.Name: OneShotSuppressionClusterAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The linked ClusterEvent is played when this many oneshots have been suppressed

ValueDefinition.Name: OneShotSupressAfterAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of oneshots that are played at first, before starting to supress following instances

Property.Name: AudioLink
Property.Description: Used for Clustering AutoCreateAsset to link a single event to the cluster

ValueDefinition.Name: ClusteringDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: The min distance between emitter and listener at which clusters may be created. If the distance falls below the threshold the cluster is disabled.

ValueDefinition.Name: GlobalAudioTimerRTPC
ValueDefinition.Description: An RTPC which is regulary set to values between [0,0 .. 23,99] representing a time.

ValueDefinition.Name: GlobalAudioTimerDayCycleTime
ValueDefinition.Description: The (real) time for the global audio timer to go from 0 - 24

ValueDefinition.Name: CommandQueueSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Currently set to 2MB

ValueDefinition.Name: MonitorQueueSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Currently set to 64KB

ValueDefinition.Name: VoiceChatVolumeRtpc
ValueDefinition.Description: This rtpc is used to modify the volume of the voice chat emitters

ValueDefinition.Name: SeasonGameModeState
ValueDefinition.Description: GameModeState that will be set based on season type that is active

ValueDefinition.Name: MusicStage1_StateChoice
ValueDefinition.Description: used for unescalated incidents / small fights

ValueDefinition.Name: MusicStage2_StateChoice
ValueDefinition.Description: used for escalated incidents / big battles

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentMusicStayTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long will the incident music stay even if we are looking away. Is not used when higher priority music is supposed to be played.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxWinProbabilityForLoose
ValueDefinition.Description: If the win probability after a fight is below this threshold the loose ending is played

ValueDefinition.Name: MinWinProbabilityForWin
ValueDefinition.Description: If the win probability after a fight is above this threshold the victory ending is played

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredAmountInvolvedObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: How many objects need to be involved before the music should switch to military music

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeoutAfterThirdPartyMusicPlay
ValueDefinition.Description: After a third party music starts to play the next can only start after this timeout.

ValueDefinition.Name: SelectionTickFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: A factor which is multiplied with the amount of ticks the player had a 3rd party object selected before adding it to the total score.

ValueDefinition.Name: AreaTickFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: A factor which is multiplied with the amount of ticks the player looked at a 3rd party island before adding it to the total score.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: The 3rd party needs to have reached this threshold before it's considered to be played. Note that looking 1 second at a 3rd party island results in the areaTickAmount to increase by 10 (so a factor of 10 is more or less equal to 1 second interaction)

ValueDefinition.Name: CurrentAreaFactorBonus
ValueDefinition.Description: the area the player is currently looking at gets a bonus on the factor to have it playing with a higher probability. if this is balanced to be >= MinFactor it's more or less sure that this song starts.

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockOtherFirstEncountersDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: After a first encounter is started other first encounters are blocked for the specified amount of time.

ValueDefinition.Name: StateBlockingTime
ValueDefinition.Description: This determines the time the 3rd party states are set and block any other changes from the music system. This should be as short as possible but as long as required to make sure the standard music properly switches to the 3rd party music.

ValueDefinition.Name: MusicPlaying_StateGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: Set to either true or false depending if the music is currently playing.

Property.Name: RequiredSoundBanks
Property.Description: Vector of all Soundbanks which are required by the corresponding Asset. These Soundbanks will then get loaded.

ValueDefinition.Name: SoundBanks
ValueDefinition.Description: This Sounbanks will always be loaded

ValueDefinition.Name: RFXRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: The area in which the emitter will be randomly placed. May further be constraint by AreaConstraints.

ValueDefinition.Name: InnerRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: When randomly position the emitter it's not allowed to be inside the inner circle.

ValueDefinition.Name: AngleMax
ValueDefinition.Description: The 0ï¿½ angle is always in the "forward" direction of the building. Use AngleMin and AngleMax to reduce the circle to a piece of cake. If angleMin and angleMax are equal a random angle in the range [0..370ï¿½] is choosen.

ValueDefinition.Name: ClampToTerrain
ValueDefinition.Description: If the emitter is below the earth surface it's height is set to the surface height.

ValueDefinition.Name: ClampToWater
ValueDefinition.Description: If the emitter is below the water it's height is set to water level. May only be used when ClampToTerrain is also true.

ValueDefinition.Name: TriggerRateMin
ValueDefinition.Description: The event is triggered with a random offset between the triggerRateMin and triggerRateMax

ValueDefinition.Name: TriggerRateMax
ValueDefinition.Description: The event is triggered with a random offset between the triggerRateMin and triggerRateMax

ValueDefinition.Name: TriggerEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: The event which is periodically repositioned and triggered.

Property.Name: RFXList
Property.Description: Used for clustering AutoCreateAsset to link potentially multiple RFX to a cluster

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalMurmurSectorAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: How many grid sectors in each direction should be added to evaluate the murmur

ValueDefinition.Name: EnvironmentTypePriorities
ValueDefinition.Description: This array defines the priority of the environment type therefore if you build a residence and a factory building on the same grid cell this priority determines which environment type will be applied

ValueDefinition.Name: Priority
ValueDefinition.Description: When a murmur is choosen only murmur with the highest priority is considered as option. higher = better

ValueDefinition.Name: ListenerPositionInterpolationValue
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor for the interpolation between lookAt and CameraPos for the Listener Position. 0 = Listener at CameraLookAt; 1.0 = Listener at CameraPosition

ValueDefinition.Name: ListenerPositionInterpolationValue_WorldMap
ValueDefinition.Description: InterpolationValue for the WorldMap. Note that this will not be changed depending on the camera angle as the camera can not be tilted. Further description see ListenerPositionInterpolationValue

ValueDefinition.Name: ListenerPositionExponent
ValueDefinition.Description: The exponent describing the curve the listener follows when lowering the camera angle

ValueDefinition.Name: ListenerMaxHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: The emitter will be clamped to this height (over terrain) whenever it's above

ValueDefinition.Name: SoundEmitterPositionOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: Sound Emitters are moved down by this amount - needed for Cone Attenuation

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipCommandConfirmationVoiceDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: Delay for Ship command confirmations (e.g. movement, attack commands)

ValueDefinition.Name: SelectionAudioFeedbackDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: When an object is selected sometimes audio Feedback is triggered. To prevent spam this delay is used to only trigger one feedback once every x seconds

ValueDefinition.Name: MurmurCellRange
ValueDefinition.Description: When a murmur is started in a certain cell this radius will be used to collect all cells within range to calculate the count and to ignore them for the next calculations

ValueDefinition.Name: EnvironmentMarshFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: the factor of an environment cell which needs to be irrigated in order for the whole cell to be treated as irrigated

ValueDefinition.Name: EnvironmentForestTreeFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: If in a environment cell (of type meadow) at least the given portion of fields is occupied by trees it's converted to a forest cell. As soon as this proportion is no longer met the cell is also demoted.

ValueDefinition.Name: DestructRectFallback
ValueDefinition.Description: This sound will be triggered as UI sound when the player draws a destruction rect without selecting a building or street first. Therefore the rect is either empty or contains vegetation.

ValueDefinition.Name: RiverSearchDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: The distance to the listener in which potential rivers are taken into account

ValueDefinition.Name: RiverSegmentDiscardThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: PERFORMANCE: For river segments which are smaller than this value only the end points are taken into consideration when finding a spot on the river

ValueDefinition.Name: RiverTestPositionOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: the offset for the testpositions around the listener which search for the closest river.

ValueDefinition.Name: RiverEmitterDiscardThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Emitter which would be closer together than this distance will be discarded,

ValueDefinition.Name: HitpointPercentageForDamageSelectionBark
ValueDefinition.Description: When below this percentage of health, an object with SoundEmitterCommandBarks will play SELECTION_DAMAGED instead of SELECTION barks

ValueDefinition.Name: MultiActionBuildingCountRTPC
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for multi actions (such as upgrade, delete, build) and represents the count of affected buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: MultiActionBlueprintCountRTPC
ValueDefinition.Description: Only used for the construction action represents the counts of the blueprints

ValueDefinition.Name: FeedbackDensityThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount of units in the FeedbackGrid needs to exceed this count in order for an emitter to get created

ValueDefinition.Name: FeedbackDensityDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: The distance around the listener in which emitter for the feedback grid are created

ValueDefinition.Name: FeedbackDensitySoundEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: The sound event which is triggered in the feedback grid

ValueDefinition.Name: FeedbackDensityCountRTPC
ValueDefinition.Description: The rtpc which is set to the feedback count within the cell

ValueDefinition.Name: DaytimeProgressRTPC
ValueDefinition.Description: The rtpc will go from [0 .. 1] and reset to 0 whenever the daytime period changes.

ValueDefinition.Name: DaylightPercentageRTPC
ValueDefinition.Description: 1 during day, 0 during night, linear increasing / decreasing during sunrise / sunset

ValueDefinition.Name: MonumentNoEventTypeSwitchChoice
ValueDefinition.Description: The monument event type switch group (used by monuments to set the switch depending on the running event)

ValueDefinition.Name: DelayBetweenMurmur
ValueDefinition.Description: After a murmur finished playing this is the time which is waited before the next murmur is triggered. If this time is negative the murmurs will overlapse

ValueDefinition.Name: GameSpeedChange_Normal
ValueDefinition.Description: Played when gamespeed changes to normal speed

ValueDefinition.Name: GameSpeedChange_Fast
ValueDefinition.Description: Played when gamespeed changes to fast speed

ValueDefinition.Name: GameSpeedChange_Fastest
ValueDefinition.Description: Played when gamespeed changes to fastest speed

ValueDefinition.Name: TreeFallSound
ValueDefinition.Description: Played when a worker from a building with PropertyFreeAreaProductivity cuts a tree

ValueDefinition.Name: RainRtpc
ValueDefinition.Description: This rtpc will be set according to the rain intensity [0..1] where 0 means that there is no rain at all. NOTE: we also have a weather were it's snowing and raining simultaniously so both rtpcs can be set at the same time.

ValueDefinition.Name: SnowRtpc
ValueDefinition.Description: This rtpc will be set according to the snow intensity [0..1] where 0 means that there is no snow at all. NOTE: we also have a weather were it's snowing and raining simultaniously so both rtpcs can be set at the same time.

ValueDefinition.Name: VisitorArrivalSwitchGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: Sound Switch group for arriving visitors at pier.

ValueDefinition.Name: VisitorArrivalSwitchOn
ValueDefinition.Description: Sound Switch for visitors at pier. If a certain threshold of visitors is reached this will be triggered.

ValueDefinition.Name: VisitorArrivalSwitchOff
ValueDefinition.Description: Sound Switch for visitors at pier. If there are less then a certain threshold of visitors on the pier this will be triggered.

ValueDefinition.Name: EmitterPoolSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Number of emitters in a pool per quadrant

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemBasedMurmur
ValueDefinition.Description: If one of these items is socketed the configured murmr type will be added

ValueDefinition.Name: MurmurIgnoreCyclesOverride
ValueDefinition.Description: How many murmur cycles should a specific murmur be ignored after it has been triggered. Default is 1. If wanted otherwise configure an override here.

ValueDefinition.Name: WaypointMarkerLand
ValueDefinition.Description: Played at the position of the waypoint when issuing land units to move

ValueDefinition.Name: WaypointMarkerShip
ValueDefinition.Description: Played at the position of the waypoint when issuing ship units to move

ValueDefinition.Name: MouseSpeedFactorInScreenWidths
ValueDefinition.Description: How many screen widths does the mouse need to move in one frame (0.1 seconds) to be considered at 100% move speed

ValueDefinition.Name: SoundBankLocalized
ValueDefinition.Description: Whether this Soundbank is a localized Soundbanks (and therefore contains localized sounds)

ValueDefinition.Name: BLD_BuildNewUnique
ValueDefinition.Description: Will be triggered at the same time as the BuildSuccessful sound but only once per Savegame (so e.g. if defined for a fisherhut this will only be played at the first ever build fisherhut)

ValueDefinition.Name: BLD_StreetWaypointAdd
ValueDefinition.Description: Triggered whenever a waypoint is added. This happens once in the very beginning and then whenever the player adds a waypoint by pressing SHIFT + LMB

ValueDefinition.Name: BLD_StreetWaypointCancel
ValueDefinition.Description: Triggered when a waypoint is removed by the player (clicking RMB). If it was the last waypoint the current street build try is canceled.

ValueDefinition.Name: ChargeStartCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: After starting the charge start sound, this unit will not trigger another charge start for this long

ValueDefinition.Name: ChargeImpactCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: After playing the charge impact sound, this unit will not trigger another charge impact for this long

ValueDefinition.Name: BLD_ExplosionOneShot
ValueDefinition.Description: Note: in contrast to the other incidentSounds the explosion sounds whould be oneshots!

ValueDefinition.Name: OBJ_ConnectedToStreet
ValueDefinition.Description: Triggered once a building receives its "street connection". Will not trigger for objects that do not require a street connection

ValueDefinition.Name: MultiplayerBuildingSounds
ValueDefinition.Description: Used in Multiplayer if the Action was triggered by another player. If nothing is defined we fallback to the "default" sounds.

ValueDefinition.Name: BLD_MP_Build
ValueDefinition.Description: Replacement for BLD_Build

ValueDefinition.Name: BLD_MP_MoveStart
ValueDefinition.Description: Replacement for BLD_MoveStart

ValueDefinition.Name: BLD_MP_MoveSuccess
ValueDefinition.Description: Replacement for BLD_MoveSuccess

ValueDefinition.Name: BLD_MP_Upgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Replacement for BLD_Upgrade

ValueDefinition.Name: BLD_MP_Destroy
ValueDefinition.Description: Replacement for OBJ_SelfDestroy

ValueDefinition.Name: BLD_MP_RuinRepaired
ValueDefinition.Description: Replacement for OBJ_Repaired

ValueDefinition.Name: BLD_MP_Downgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Replacement for BLD_Downgrade

ValueDefinition.Name: MaterialType
ValueDefinition.Description: Inserted in the MaterialGrid and sent to the sound engine when a sequence sound is played at this position

ValueDefinition.Name: UI_TRN_MapOut
ValueDefinition.Description: Played when leaving e.g. heartlands to e.g. enter the world map or wetlands (zoom animation)

ValueDefinition.Name: UI_TRN_MapIn
ValueDefinition.Description: Played when entering e.g. heartlands from e.g. the world map or wetlands (zoom animation)

ValueDefinition.Name: UI_TRN_WorldOut
ValueDefinition.Description: Played when leaving the worldmap to enter e.g. heartlands (zoom animation)

ValueDefinition.Name: UI_TRN_WorldIn
ValueDefinition.Description: Played when entering the worldmap from e.g. heartlands (zoom animation)

ValueDefinition.Name: SuppressDuringTransitions
ValueDefinition.Description: List of all sounds that should be suppressed when triggered by a scene during a scene animation or transition

ValueDefinition.Name: ModelRotationSound
ValueDefinition.Description: The sound that should be played when the player is rotating 3d models in the UI

ValueDefinition.Name: ModelRotationParameter
ValueDefinition.Description: The GameParameter / RTPC that should be used to communicate the rotation speed of the player rotating 3d models in the UI

Property.Name: WorldMapDynamicSoundEmitter
Property.Description: The sound which should be played by this emitter needs to be set dynamically in code. This property was created in order to deal with the DynamicVariation property...

ValueDefinition.Name: ActiveAudioEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: a loop playing persistently

ValueDefinition.Name: UIClickEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: Played when the matching worldmap object is clicked (as 2D sound for the UI emitter)

ValueDefinition.Name: System
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines to what sub system the storyline belongs. E.g. Contracts, GovernorDecisions or the normal quest system

ValueDefinition.Name: IsCampaign
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if this storyLine is part of the main story line

ValueDefinition.Name: StartConnector
ValueDefinition.Description: Connector to the first components inside the storyline.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxCreatedByPools
ValueDefinition.Description: A storyline counts as created when it is active + playable in the game, no matter how often the pool already triggered it. Denying a quest doesn't change this counter.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxStartedByPools
ValueDefinition.Description: A storyline counts as started when it is active + playable in the game. If the value is positive, it can only be started that many times during one cycle of its pool. Good for avoiding repeating the same storyline before others were picked from the pool. Use -1 to never check whether it was already started during one cycle of its pool. A storyline that can be denied by the player counts as not started after having denied it.

ValueDefinition.Name: StorylineVariables
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines Variables, which will only be accessable inside the storyline. Lifetime will also be scoped to the Storyline, so the variables only exist while the storyline exists

ValueDefinition.Name: UniqueAmongAllParticipants
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this storyline can only run for a single participant. As long as it is active, no other participant will trigger it. If false the storyline can trigger for every participant but still only once

ValueDefinition.Name: IsRepeatable
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this storyline gets its StartCount reset so that <MaxStartedByPools> can be fulfilled multiple times. The timing when it gets reset depends on the configuration in the pool

ValueDefinition.Name: EnableAutomaticBlockerDetection
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, automatic blocker detection will abort and reset the start counter of a storyline if an blocking issue was detected. Blocking issues are: - An object could not be spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: StartConnector
ValueDefinition.Description: Connector to the first components inside the questline.

ValueDefinition.Name: FunctionSuccessOutput
Component
ValueDefinition.Description: The next Component to activate after this current one is finished.
All outgoing connections if the function succeeded.

ValueDefinition.Name: FunctionFailureOutput
Component
ValueDefinition.Description: The next Component to activate after this current one is finished.
All outgoing connections if the function failed.

ValueDefinition.Name: ImmediateCheck
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, an immediate check on the condition is performed and the result returned immediately. If the condition did not succeed it will trigger the fail output. If ImmediateCheck is false, the function component will wait until the condition succeeds

ValueDefinition.Name: SequenceActions
Action
ValueDefinition.Description: Action that will be executed in this sequence

ValueDefinition.Name: Wait
ValueDefinition.Description: False, if the next action of the sequence should follow immediately after this one, True, if the next action should wait in case this one is one of the special cases where waiting makes sense, e.g. ActionDelayedActions, ActionTriggerNotification, ...
List of actions that should be executed one after another

ValueDefinition.Name: IsLooped
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the sequence will loop indefinitely and needs to be stopped by an external action

ValueDefinition.Name: Objective
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of objective the player needs to solve

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectiveTimeLimitVariable
ValueDefinition.Description: The name of a int variable which should be used as time limit for this objective. The "ObjectiveTimeLimit" will be ignored if a variable is used. Variable needs to be of type INT and time is meassured in miliseconds (ms)

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectiveTimeLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: If not 0, the player needs to solve the objective within this time limit, or the objective will time out

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectiveTimeLimitWarningTime
ValueDefinition.Description: If the objective has a time limit, this time will be how long we display the warning. E.g time limit 20 minutes and this value is 3 minutes will will display a warning about the time 3 minutes before the time runs out.

ValueDefinition.Name: SuccessOutput
Component
ValueDefinition.Description: The next Block after this Block finished.
All outgoing connections if the objective succeeded.

ValueDefinition.Name: FailureOutput
Component
ValueDefinition.Description: The next Component to activate after this current one is finished.
All outgoing connections if the objective failed.

ValueDefinition.Name: TimedOutOutput
Component
ValueDefinition.Description: The next Component to activate after this current one is finished.
All outgoing connections if the objective timed out.

ValueDefinition.Name: EnableTracking
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the beginning and the end of this component lifetime will be tracked

ValueDefinition.Name: InputCombination
ValueDefinition.Description: And (default): All inputs need to be fulfilled for this compnent to start. Or: If at least one input node is fulfilled this component gets activated. Other inputs are still valid and will continue to work. When another input of this component gets active, this component will NOT trigger a second time.

ValueDefinition.Name: Archived
ValueDefinition.Description: Tool only. Marks quest nodes as archived. This will exclude them from the validations.

Property.Name: QuestComponentConnector

ValueDefinition.Name: Output
Component
ValueDefinition.Description: The next Component to activate after this current one is finished.
All outgoing connections if the objective finished.

Property.Description: The Output Connectors for the Block

ValueDefinition.Name: StarterTimeLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: If not 0, the player needs to accept / decline the starter within this time limit, or the starter will take the timed out path

ValueDefinition.Name: StarterObjectConfig
ValueDefinition.Description: Configuration about the starter object

ValueDefinition.Name: AcceptOutput
Component
ValueDefinition.Description: The next Component to activate after this current one is finished.
All outgoing connections if the starter got accepted by the player.

ValueDefinition.Name: DeclineOutput
Component
ValueDefinition.Description: The next Component to activate after this current one is finished.
All outgoing connections if the starter got declined by the player.

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeOutOutput
Component
ValueDefinition.Description: The next Component to activate after this current one is finished.
All outgoing connections if the starter timed out.

ValueDefinition.Name: DecisionScreenConfig
EmbeddedInfotip
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is set we will show the infotip as embedded infotip on first level

ValueDefinition.Name: LeftParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The participant asset of the participant from which we will display its portrait on the left side.

ValueDefinition.Name: LeftParticipantDynamic
ValueDefinition.Description: A lua script which need to return a Participant GUID. If the LeftParticipant is empty this lua script will be evaluated and the result will be used as participant for the left portrait. For example this could be get the Active Emperor with following script: "Participants.ActiveEmperor" or the player participant with "Player"

ValueDefinition.Name: RightParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: The participant asset of the participant from which we will display its portrait on the right side.

ValueDefinition.Name: RightParticipantDynamic
ValueDefinition.Description: A lua script which need to return a Participant GUID. If the RightParticipant is empty this lua script will be evaluated and the result will be used as participant for the right portrait. For example this could be get the Active Emperor with following script: "Participants.ActiveEmperor" or the player participant with "Player"

ValueDefinition.Name: ForcedPortraitMood
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to other than invalid, the portraits in the UI will use this mood, otherwise mood will be calculated based on diplomatic relation
Configuration of the visuals of one screen in the Decision UI

ValueDefinition.Name: DecisionOptions
OptionText
ValueDefinition.Description: The text displayed on this decision option

ValueDefinition.Name: HasChallenge
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is true, the option has a success and a failure output. Inside the ChallengeData some challenge can be configured, which will lead the option to either fail or succeed.

ValueDefinition.Name: ChallengeData
StaticSuccessProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: Value between 0 and 1. Describes the chance of the option to be successfull. E.g 0.2 = 20% chance to succeed this option. If set to 0, the system will check DCType and CheckValue instead.

ValueDefinition.Name: DCType
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines what player stat is challenged. E.g. if this is set to GlobalBeliefAttribute the system will grab the global belief value and compare it against the CheckValue. If it is higher the option has a 100% success chance, if it is lower there is a chance to fail the challenge (half value equals 50% chance). Important: If the Type starts with AREA the value can only be obtained if the quest is linked to an quest area!

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The value of the DCType will be checked against this Value. If it is higher the option is a success. If it is lower there will be a chance of failure (half the value equals 50% chance)
Defines the challenge of the option. Only relevant if HasChallenge is true!

ValueDefinition.Name: HasCost
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is true, the option can only be taken by paying a cost. If the player cannot afford the cost the option will be locked

ValueDefinition.Name: CostData
Products
GUID
ValueDefinition.Description: The product asset, which is checked if the player can afford the option

List of products. The decision takes randomly one of the defined goods, which the player can afford as cost with the amount defined below. If none of the given goods can be afforded the option is locked

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: Default Amount needed to pay to select this choice. Additional amount will be added depending on player progress level.

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalAmountScaling
ValueDefinition.Description: This additional Amount will be multiplied with the progress level scaling factor configured in the QuestBalancing and added to the normal Amount. E.g Amount is 20, AmountScaling is 1.5 and the progress level is midgame so we take the scaling 2.5 the total amount will be : 20 + (20*1.5*2.5)=95

ValueDefinition.Name: ReadAreaTag
ValueDefinition.Description: An tag of an Area where the costs need to be. Can be left empty to use the location of the storyline, if the storyline also has no location all player islands are valid.
Defines the cost of the option. Only relevant if HasCost is true.

ValueDefinition.Name: Conditions
ValueDefinition.Description: The condition tree which needs to be resovled for the option to be unlocked.

ValueDefinition.Name: HideWhenLocked
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the option will not be visible for the player if the option is locked.

ValueDefinition.Name: LockedReasonText
ValueDefinition.Description: A text asset, which can be displayed to explain why this option is locked.

ValueDefinition.Name: Category
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the category icon displayed in front of the option.

ValueDefinition.Name: EmperorTrait
ValueDefinition.Description: The emperor trait associated to this option. Will automatically add/remove reputation after taking this option defined by the emperor balancing

ValueDefinition.Name: TraitIntensity
ValueDefinition.Description: Modifies the emperor trait reputation gain/loss

ValueDefinition.Name: Infotip
ValueDefinition.Description: The infotip displayed for this option

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalOutcomeText
ValueDefinition.Description: The generic infotip for the decision options tries to display the outcome of the decision. It will show all action from the next decision. If we want to show some additional text as outcome for this option we can add it in this text.

ValueDefinition.Name: CharacterNotificationOnDecisionTaken
ValueDefinition.Description: Used to configure what character notification should be triggered when this option is taken. If the default is on the left portrait participant will talk with the pamsy trigger GovernorDecisionTaken, if this decision option is a leaf (no follow up decision is happening). If the type is not NONE, this will trigger a character notification towards the peer who took the decision. The notification will come after the screen got closed.
The choices the player can take. Every entry in the vector is one choice/option

ValueDefinition.Name: OnDecisionScreenOpened
ValueDefinition.Description: Used to configure how portraits should talk when the decision screen is opened. If the default is on the left portrait will talk with the pamsy trigger GovernorDecisionOpened if this decision is the first inside a DecisionRoot

ValueDefinition.Name: States
StartConnectors
ValueDefinition.Description: Connector to the first components inside this path

ValueDefinition.Name: OutputConnectors
Component
ValueDefinition.Description: The next Component to activate after this current one is finished.
Outgoing connections to all follow up componets after this path finished first.

All different paths of an OR Component are active at the same time. As soon as one path is completed all other paths are aborted and cleaned up. The output is taken according to the path which finished.

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalEndStates
SuccessAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: Number of succeeded outcomes that would trigger this end state

ValueDefinition.Name: FailAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: Number of failed outcomes that would trigger this end state

ValueDefinition.Name: OutputConnectors
Component
ValueDefinition.Description: The next Component to activate after this current one is finished.
Outgoing connections to all follow up componets after this path finished first.
Additional combinations of outcomes apart from the single state output connectors can be defined here. They will trigger based on the outcome of multiple states

ValueDefinition.Name: States
PreCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: Condition that is checked to determine of the given state is allowed to become active

ValueDefinition.Name: StartConnectors
ValueDefinition.Description: Connector to the first components inside this state

ValueDefinition.Name: Component
ValueDefinition.Description: The next Component to activate after this current one is finished.
All different states of a state checker. Only one of those states is active at any time

ValueDefinition.Name: DecisionTimeLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: DO NOT USE!!! We do not want to put decision pressure on the player in Limestone! (If this is not 0 then the decision can time out and the timed out connector path is taken.)

ValueDefinition.Name: DecisionRootOutput
ValueDefinition.Description: Output path depends on the taken decision

ValueDefinition.Name: DecisionTimeOutOutput
ValueDefinition.Description: All outgoing connections if the decision timed out.

ValueDefinition.Name: DecisionRootStartComponent
ValueDefinition.Description: The first decision component inside the decision root

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoOpenNarrativeSequenceCampaignOnly
ValueDefinition.Description: Special flag to automatically open the narrative sequence UI for all peers. Only works in Campaign. Try to use it as little as possible

ValueDefinition.Name: UseInteractingPeerForUIOpening
ValueDefinition.Description: The given asset will be used to get the interacting peer of that objective and open the narrative sequence UI for this peer only. !Make sure the given asset is a component in the same storyline and it was completed and immideatly before this one! E.g. assign previous starter GUID to open directly on accept.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsFollowUpNarrativeSequence
ValueDefinition.Description: Use Carefully!! If this is true the NarrativeSequence UI, will stay open and display this decision. This will only work if the UI was already open, so in coop only the peer who actively did the previous narrative sequence will continue in the narrative sequence chain

ValueDefinition.Name: DecisionGovernorRequest
ValueDefinition.Description: The Request which is used to open the UI for the decisions

ValueDefinition.Name: UIType
ValueDefinition.Description: This setting can be used to define which UI should be shown when interacting with this decison.

ValueDefinition.Name: LinkedQuestEntry
ValueDefinition.Description: If an asset is given here this decision gets linked to the quest entry. This is usefull if the quest entry should show a button to open the decision screen.

ValueDefinition.Name: SpecialComponentType
ValueDefinition.Description: The special type that will be executed when this component gets triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: DecisionOutputs
SuccessOutput
Component
ValueDefinition.Description: The next Component to activate after this current one is finished.
All of the here listed components will get active once this decision component finishes and the taken option had a successful check (default)

ValueDefinition.Name: FailureOutput
Component
ValueDefinition.Description: The next Component to activate after this current one is finished.
All of the here listed components will get active once this decision component finishes and the taken option had a failed check

All outgoing connections once the decision component is finished. It will take the output with the index of the taken decision. E.g if the first decision was taken (index 0) it will also take the first output here (index 0)

ValueDefinition.Name: DecisionActions
Action
ValueDefinition.Description: Action that will be executed, once this decision gets active. !This is not necessarily the same time as the screen is displayed!
List of actions, which will be executed once this decision component gets active

ValueDefinition.Name: AvailableContracts
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of available contracts offers per participant

ValueDefinition.Name: RerollTimer
ValueDefinition.Description: After this time the available contract offers gets newly generated

ValueDefinition.Name: ContractCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: Time after a contract got completed/aborted until the next contracts are offered by a character

ValueDefinition.Name: MoneyRewardBase
ValueDefinition.Description: Base amount of money the playe will receive after completing the contract. There will be money on top depending on difficulty

ValueDefinition.Name: MoneyRewardFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: This factor will be multiplied with the contract score and added to the base reward money for the final money reward

ValueDefinition.Name: Factor
ValueDefinition.Description: Additional factor for the money reward. Will be used to multiply the (score * moneyfactor)

ValueDefinition.Name: DifficultyRating
Probability
ValueDefinition.Description: How likely the offered contract has this difficulty rating. If this is 1 and all others are also one they have all the same probability

ValueDefinition.Name: MinScore
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum score value the offer has if it has this difficulty rating

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxScore
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum score value the offer has if it has this difficulty rating
Each entry here defines a difficulty rating so having 5 entries means we have a 5 star rating system

ValueDefinition.Name: ScoreScaling
Factor
ValueDefinition.Description: The factor of the current progress level will be multiplicated with the score from the difficulty rating to build the final score
Factor for the score based on progress level

ValueDefinition.Name: GenerationTemplateConfigs
StorylineTemplateAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The storyline asset used as base to generate this type of contract

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestEntryAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The Quest Entry asset for this type of contract
Configuration for the template assets of the contracts

ValueDefinition.Name: ContractAvailableInfolayer
ValueDefinition.Description: The infolayer above the lighthouses if contracts are available

Property.Name: ContractProvider
Property.Description: Should only be added to profiles which can offer quest contracts to the players (2nd and 3rd parties)

ValueDefinition.Name: ObjectiveTypeWeighting
Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: The weighting of this contract type. 0 means this provider never offers this contract type
Weighting of contract types offered.

ValueDefinition.Name: DeliveryGoods
ValueDefinition.Description: An asset pool of goods describing what kind of products the delivery contracts asks for.

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemRewards
MinRange
ValueDefinition.Description: A contract chooses a random value between 0 and the contract score value. If this value is between MinRange and MaxRange (including both), the configured ItemRewardPool is choosen

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxRange
ValueDefinition.Description: A contract chooses a random value between 0 and the contract score value. If this value is between MinRange and MaxRange (including both), the configured ItemRewardPool is choosen

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemRewardPool
ValueDefinition.Description: A pool of items, which one will be picked and rewarded
Defines what items are rewarded after contract completion

ValueDefinition.Name: MinScore
ValueDefinition.Description: If the score is between MinScore and MaxScore this balancing is choosen. (Including both)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxScore
ValueDefinition.Description: If the score is between MinScore and MaxScore this balancing is choosen. (Including both)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: How many enemy ships are spawned at minimum.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: How many enemy ships are spawned at maximum

ValueDefinition.Name: DestroyShipsPool
ValueDefinition.Description: A AssetPool of ships used as enemy ships in the destroy contract. A random amount of ships [MinAmount, MaxAmount] is choosen out of this pool.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinScore
ValueDefinition.Description: If the score is between MinScore and MaxScore this balancing is choosen. (Including both)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxScore
ValueDefinition.Description: If the score is between MinScore and MaxScore this balancing is choosen. (Including both)

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortShipPool
ValueDefinition.Description: An AssetPool of ShipConfigurations used as escort ships in the escort contract (ships that need to be escorted and protected). One ship is choosen out of this pool and spawned [MinEscortShipAmount, MaxEscortShipAmount] times

ValueDefinition.Name: EnemyShips
SpawnTime
ValueDefinition.Description: At what time after the escort part started this wave spawns

ValueDefinition.Name: EnemyShipPool
ValueDefinition.Description: An AssetPool of shipConfigurations used as enemy ships in the escort contract. One ship is choosen and spawned [MinAmount, MaxAmount] for this wave.
Waves of enemy ships that attack the "to be escorted ships" !Max amount of 4 waves!

ValueDefinition.Name: MinScore
ValueDefinition.Description: If the score is between MinScore and MaxScore this balancing is choosen. (Including both)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxScore
ValueDefinition.Description: If the score is between MinScore and MaxScore this balancing is choosen. (Including both)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: How many ships needs to be sold. Contract will choose random value between min and max including both.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: How many ships needs to be sold. Contract will choose random value between min and max including both.

ValueDefinition.Name: SellShipPool
ValueDefinition.Description: An asset pool of ship configurations. One will be choosen as ship needed to be sold. Please only have one module as UI cant show more

ValueDefinition.Name: MinScore
ValueDefinition.Description: If the score is between MinScore and MaxScore this balancing is choosen. (Including both)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxScore
ValueDefinition.Description: If the score is between MinScore and MaxScore this balancing is choosen. (Including both)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: How many pickup objects are spawned. Random number between minAmount and maxAmount including both.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: How many pickup objects are spawned. Random number between minAmount and maxAmount including both.

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is not 0 the pickup contracts will have this time as timelimit and will fail if the player does not complete the contract in time

ValueDefinition.Name: PickUpObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: An asset pool of objects which defines the objects this character spawns for pick up contracts

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreSerializedPool
ValueDefinition.Description: Attention! Currently only for ConditionPlayerCounter considered!

ValueDefinition.Name: StoryLine
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of storylines that this pool can call

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: The probability that this storyline will be chosen among all storylines with the same prio.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: A list of quest groups that this pool can call

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: The probability that one of these quests will be chosen among all quests with the same prio.

ValueDefinition.Name: Priority
ValueDefinition.Description: Lower numbers come first! Defines a priority in the list of sub pools. Equal priorities will be selected randomly.

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: The probability that this pool will be chosen among all pools with the same prio.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsTopLevel
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this pool will be used directly to select quests and does not depent on a parent pool to be chosen.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: The max number of quests that this pool can call simultaneously

ValueDefinition.Name: PoolCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the time the pool is blocked after calling a quest

ValueDefinition.Name: AffectedByCooldownFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: DEPRECATED! NOT USED ANYMORE. When true, the cooldown will be affected by the cooldown multiplier of the quest frequencies in the difficulty settings

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionDependencies
ValueDefinition.Description: If any sessions will be linked here, than this pool does only select new quests if one of the given sessions is currently running

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionOrRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: Session or region(= list of sessions) allowed

ValueDefinition.Name: WillResetIfBelowThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the pool will reset the _started_ counter of all repeatable quests

ValueDefinition.Name: ResetThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: If the number of possible quests to trigger in this pool drops below this threshold, then a reset of the start count of all repeatable quests in it will be triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardAssets
Reward
ValueDefinition.Description: The reward asset. Can be Product;Item;RewardPool;RegionRewardPool;Session;BuildPermit

ValueDefinition.Name: SentToQuestArea
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates if the reward should be sent to the kontor of the quest area

ValueDefinition.Name: IsHidden
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this reward should not be shown as a reward preview upon quest invitation (i.e. Bonus Reward)

ValueDefinition.Name: IsDisguised
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this (item) reward is disguised as visible, but unknown reward to not give away the actual item earned upon invitation
List of rewards

ValueDefinition.Name: GenerateIgnoreUnlocks
ValueDefinition.Description: do not check unlocks when generating rewards

ValueDefinition.Name: GenerateRewardsUnique
ValueDefinition.Description: same Reward GUID is not chosen multiple times if a pool is listed as reward asset

ValueDefinition.Name: DistributionNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: A character notification displayed once the reward is distributed. It will include the rewards in the notification

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemLink
ValueDefinition.Description: The reward, can be a Item, Product, BuildPermit, RewardPool or RegionRewardPool

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: this folder is only used, if ItemLink is empty. All Items in the folder get the same weight

ValueDefinition.Name: MinAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount is ignored if ItemLink is a pool

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount is ignored if ItemLink is a pool

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreUnlocks
ValueDefinition.Description: is allowed to reward items/goods that are still locked

ValueDefinition.Name: GenerateUniqueRewards
ValueDefinition.Description: When this is set to true, Rewards defined in ItemLinks won't be generated multiple times (Resets after each generation)

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: An icon asset for the icon displayed next to the quest entry name

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestName
ValueDefinition.Description: The name of the quest entry/ name of the quest. Displayed in the UI.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestProvince
ValueDefinition.Description: The province asset to display the linked province in the quest entry

ValueDefinition.Name: Category
ValueDefinition.Description: The category this entry is part of

ValueDefinition.Name: ParentQuestEntry
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines if this is a nested quest entry. If empty it will be top level entry, if another quest entry is given it will be below it.

ValueDefinition.Name: SummaryText
ValueDefinition.Description: The summary text of this entry

ValueDefinition.Name: PortraitParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: A Participant Asset used to display a portrait in the quest entry. Use "ActiveEmperor" to display the active emperor portrait.

ValueDefinition.Name: BackgroundImage
ValueDefinition.Description: Path to the background image for this quest entry

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestHint
ValueDefinition.Description: A text that is displayed as quest hint.

ValueDefinition.Name: Image
ValueDefinition.Description: The quest entry has one reserved spot for an image

ValueDefinition.Name: VisibleInQuestTracker
ValueDefinition.Description: If true this Quest Entry is also visible in the quest tracker and can be tracked

ValueDefinition.Name: Audio
ValueDefinition.Description: An audio that is linked to the quest entry

ValueDefinition.Name: Type
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of a quest entry can be used to e.g. change appeareacne or sorting of the quest entry

ValueDefinition.Name: ExplainerPopup
ValueDefinition.Description: A quest entry can have a explainer popup set up. If this is set the player can open the explainer pop up inside the quest book again.

ValueDefinition.Name: OnStorylineCompleted
ValueDefinition.Description: If the quest entry is not already archived/removed once the storyline that created it ends, this fallback solution will apply. If a storyline gets aborted all created entries will always be deleted.

ValueDefinition.Name: UseSidePanel
ValueDefinition.Description: The sidepanel has a text description on the right side of the screen of the item currently in view

ValueDefinition.Name: Headline
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the Headline text of the QuestInteractionWindow

ValueDefinition.Name: Description
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the text below the headline of the QuestInteractionWindow

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowObjectiveText
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the quest interaction window will show the current objective text of the linked objective under the description

ValueDefinition.Name: Type
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of the QuestInteractionWindow defines the layout. How many buttons the window has and what they do.

ValueDefinition.Name: UseLinkedObjectOwnerForPortrait
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is true the PortraitParticipant will be ignored and the Owner of the linked object will be used as portrait.

ValueDefinition.Name: PortraitParticipant
ValueDefinition.Description: A participant used for the portrait icon in the ui.

ValueDefinition.Name: Image
ValueDefinition.Description: Ratio of the images should be 1:1.2 (600 x 720px)

ValueDefinition.Name: AnnoEditorAreaID
ValueDefinition.Description: Specify here which ConstructionArea when choosing an Island with more than one ContructionArea. The Value is the same as in the AnnoEditor used. 0 = Don't care use the first one you find

ValueDefinition.Name: KontorGhost
ValueDefinition.Description: Preview building that is placed along the coast when a ship is nearby

ValueDefinition.Name: Trees
ValueDefinition.Description: Lumberjacks automatically plant these trees

ValueDefinition.Name: Prio
ValueDefinition.Description: trees with higher prio steal tiles from low prio tree farms

ValueDefinition.Name: PlantPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: percent of grid that will be filled with trees

ValueDefinition.Name: Residence
ValueDefinition.Description: tier 1 residence of this region

ValueDefinition.Name: HasSkinTool
ValueDefinition.Description: if the region has skins, the skin tool should be available

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowedInRegionText
ValueDefinition.Description: construction option is only allowed in this region

ValueDefinition.Name: SettlementRight
ValueDefinition.Description: which product is needed to settle on islands of this region

ValueDefinition.Name: SecondProvinceSpawnNearKontor
ValueDefinition.Description: which trader kontor is the start point if province is entered as second province

ValueDefinition.Name: MapTemplate
ValueDefinition.Description: If left empty, Template will be chosen randomly (by criteria of GameSetup)

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnStartShipAndKontor
ValueDefinition.Description: Is this a start session? Depending on difficulty settings (and campaign) ship(s) and/or a kontor per player is spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableIslandDiscovery
ValueDefinition.Description: When true, an island will not be revealed when discovered by a ship

ValueDefinition.Name: RouteSessionAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: To reuse existing Session Routes in special Versions

ValueDefinition.Name: SecondPartyReferenceUnlock
ValueDefinition.Description: In order to allow the AI to enter this session this unlock needs to be reached (if any configured)

ValueDefinition.Name: SecondPartyForceFollowPlayer
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the AI will follow the player in the session as soon as possible (even if the AI doesn't need an island in the new session)

ValueDefinition.Name: SecondPartyMotivation
ValueDefinition.Description: If the AI settles this session because it followed the player the AI has nothing to reach there. The TargetPopulation and TargetAmount define the goal of the AI in the session.

ValueDefinition.Name: MapTemplateForMultiplayer
ValueDefinition.Description: When specified use this Template in Multiplayer

ValueDefinition.Name: Scenario
ValueDefinition.Description: invalid GUID/0 or the GUID of a scenario meta asset

ValueDefinition.Name: IntroMovie
ValueDefinition.Description: Intro movie or camera sequence that will be played automatically when the sesion is entered the first time

ValueDefinition.Name: Duration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long is the duration of the transition in seconds

ValueDefinition.Name: BlurCurve
ValueDefinition.Description: Curve of the blur. 1 means a linear fade. Higher values means the fade starts later and the intensity is increased slower

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxBlur
ValueDefinition.Description: The max blur intensity

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: The height of the camera at the end of the transition when zooming out of the session

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeCurve
ValueDefinition.Description: Curve of the blur. 1 means a linear fade. Higher values means the fade starts later and the intensity is increased slower

ValueDefinition.Name: Duration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long is the duration of the transition in seconds

ValueDefinition.Name: BlurCurve
ValueDefinition.Description: Curve of the blur. 1 means a linear fade. Higher values means the fade starts later and the intensity is increased slower

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxBlur
ValueDefinition.Description: The max blur intensity

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: The height of the camera at the end of the transition when zooming to a worldmap asset

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeCurve
ValueDefinition.Description: Curve of the blur. 1 means a linear fade. Higher values means the fade starts later and the intensity is increased slower

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeTransitionDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: General duration for all fade transitions

ValueDefinition.Name: VideoPath
ValueDefinition.Description: Path to the video

ValueDefinition.Name: Time
ValueDefinition.Description: Timestamp of the movie when this event will happen

ValueDefinition.Name: Type
ValueDefinition.Description: Choose the kind of event that should happen during the movie

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionRendering
ValueDefinition.Description: Activates or deactivates the session rendering during the movie

ValueDefinition.Name: Action
ValueDefinition.Description: Executes an action during the movie

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowSkipping
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this movie is allowed to be skipped by the player

ValueDefinition.Name: EconomyRules
Limit
ValueDefinition.Description: As soon as the amount of money for this budget reaches it's limit additional money will be split among all other budgets (-1 means unlimited)

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalMoneyIncomeRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Additional Money relative to the income which will be generated out of thin air

ValueDefinition.Name: MoneyTargetSavingDuration
ValueDefinition.Description:
The time the AI is willing to save money up. The AI tries to have an money delta high enough to pay reach it's MoneySaving goal within this time. The money saving goal currently is the highest cost queued public. If the required money amount is not already available the Rival sets it's money desire to save up the total money cost within this timeframe:
Example: A balancing of 20min with a 40'000 coin money saving goal in the queue results in the Rival wanting 2'000 coin balance. The special value 0 means this feature is disabled.

ValueDefinition.Name: Ratio
ValueDefinition.Description: 1 = Try to have exactly as much workforce as required. 2 = Try to have double as much workforce as required

ValueDefinition.Name: DesiredWorkforceRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: 1 = Try to have exactly as much workforce as required. 2 = Try to have double as much workforce as required

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumStartMoney
ValueDefinition.Description: StartMoney is Determined by other systems (Game Difficulty and shit), but it always amounts at least to

ValueDefinition.Name: MinTargetRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: 2.0 = "Enforce at least double as many buildings of PreferredCivLevel, compared to the ReferenceCivLevel". ReferenceCivLevel is the CivLevel with most buildings among all CivLevels higher than PreferredCivLevel.

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionMaterials
ProductivityFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: The production of this good is multiplied by the given factor (1.0 == no factor, 2.0 == double output)

ValueDefinition.Name: SmallIslandFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: If GameSetup says "SmallIslands", we multiply the balanced buildingAmount with this factor. We do the same for SmallFertilities and then take the minimum of what both checks say. When we have "medium island size", we take an interpolation of 1 and the small-factor.

ValueDefinition.Name: SmallFertilitiesFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as SmallIslandFactor, but for the GameSetup of Fertility Sparseness

ValueDefinition.Name: ProducerBuildingCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Desired Endproducer Building Count. Only built as soon as unlocked. Will be requested additionally to crafter needs.
Define the Construction Materials the AI should build per Region. This is independent from the starting Region

ValueDefinition.Name: ExpandForever
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the AI will continue to build the highest tier buildings when everything is unlocked.

ValueDefinition.Name: ProhibitedCivLevels
ValueDefinition.Description: For the Civ Levels defined here the Construction AI will never build any buildings. Note that this has a couple of implications: The levels above the prohibited CivLevels will also not be reached, also if you prohibit a CivLevel (like SA) which produces goods for other CivLevels those will also not be able to be built

ValueDefinition.Name: SecondaryDirectionReferenceUnlock
ValueDefinition.Description: This unlock is used for the AI to determine when the AI is allowed to build the secondary direction

ValueDefinition.Name: SecondaryDirectionStartUnlock
ValueDefinition.Description: As soon as this unlock is reached a secondary direction residence is added to the Construction Queue with higher priority

ValueDefinition.Name: FactoryInputModifier
ValueDefinition.Description: Modifies the consumption of input goods for certain factories

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsumptionFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: e.g. if a factory needs 2 Lumber per minute and we set this factor to 1.5 it then needs 3 Lumber per minute

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsumptionConfiguration
ValueDefinition.Description: Population Consumption Configuration per CivLevel. Use this to make certain civ levels consume more or less (or even nothing) of certain goods (or public services).

ValueDefinition.Name: GeneralOptionalSupply
ValueDefinition.Description: This factor is used to determine for all >optional< goods which are not overriden how much of this good is required. If zero this also impacts the public services

ValueDefinition.Name: SupplyOverwrite
ValueDefinition.Description: Note: this has precendence before the generalOptionalSupply. You may define optional goods as well as non optional goods / services here.

ValueDefinition.Name: TradeShipRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines in which ratio the AI constructs Trade Ships. Be aware that the AI tries only to produce unlocked ships. Note that when the AI needs a new ship it only takes ships (and their weight) into account if they are fulfill the requirements (e.g. the AI needs a ship to transport oil so only the oil ship weights are taken into account)

ValueDefinition.Name: Overproduction
ValueDefinition.Description: Which products should be produced more than needed

ValueDefinition.Name: Factor
ValueDefinition.Description: 1 = no overproduction. 2 = double the needed amount

ValueDefinition.Name: ActiveTrade
ValueDefinition.Description: These values are used per session not globally. The AI will try to have the defined ships per session,

ValueDefinition.Name: score
ValueDefinition.Description: Needs calculate a preference score as the sum of attribute values * AttributePreferenceScore. A Higher preference score means that the AI will favor to fulfill those. So a positive value means that this attribute is preferred and a negative that this attribute is neglected. You can see the final score for every need on the DebugInfopage.

ValueDefinition.Name: Need
ValueDefinition.Description: This Rival will never supply this Need whatever happens, this might make the AI stuck

ValueDefinition.Name: Need
ValueDefinition.Description: This Rival will always supply this Need whatever happens, this might make the AI stuck

ValueDefinition.Name: SupplyPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: When supplying needs the AI will aim to reach (minRequiredSupply * SupplyPercentage) supply per category with needs which are producable and have a positive preference score. Note that it's always possible for the Rival to overshoot the requiredSupply by some margin so don't expect that a difference between 120% and 130% is visible. We decided to have percentage value here mostly to prevent issues with future DLCs where a lot additional needs might come into play

ValueDefinition.Name: ProvideDelayed
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the Rivals start with providing only the required amount of needs until reaching a higher tier, then they provide the optional needs as well.

ValueDefinition.Name: MeshGraphMaintenanceFactor
Factor
ValueDefinition.Description: 0.5 means "AI only pays 50% of the necessary maintenance for this MeshGraphType"
If you set this to 0.5, the ai only pays 50% of the

ValueDefinition.Name: Factory
ValueDefinition.Description: This Factory will never be chosen as a FNC candidate.

ValueDefinition.Name: Factory
ValueDefinition.Description: If possible this factory is always selected as FNC. The "if possible" is pretty limiting here, if the factory is not required from economy side it will also not be used as FNC. Therefore to really make sure that it works you should combine this setting with an EverNeed which includes this factory in it's production chain.

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultTargetFNC
ValueDefinition.Description: If any CivLvl is not explicitly defined via the list PerCivLvl->TargetFNC this value is used.

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetFNC
ValueDefinition.Description: How many factories does this CivLvl aim to be covered by? The specific factories are choosen from factories actually needed to supply this civ lvl + the attribute effect is scored with the AttributePreferences from the OptionalNeed config

ValueDefinition.Name: MilitaryMaintenanceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: This factor is used when calculating the maintenance of military units or buildings. So a factor of 0.5 means the Rival provides only half the workforce and money is needed.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxMaterialReservationPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: Material Reservations (Walls, Aqueducts, Monuments, ...) compete over resources with buidlings. With this value you can clamp what percentage of resources they may spend

ValueDefinition.Name: WeightPerBudget
ValueDefinition.Description: The relative ratio of these weights determines, how the MaxMaterialReservationPercentage is distributed between the Reserving SubSystems.
Configuration for everything primary affecting the economy

ValueDefinition.Name: LookAndFeel
TryReplaceOrnamentsWithStreets
ValueDefinition.Description: Tries to place 1x1 streets instead of 1x1 ornaments

ValueDefinition.Name: AvenueOrnamental1x1End
ValueDefinition.Description: The Start-and-End of an ornamental-avenue-line. If you configured D and have middle-piece A, a 5-line looks like DAAAD

ValueDefinition.Name: Rotation
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount that the ornament is rotated when placed at start in a horizontal line. (for vertical lines +90degrees are added) (for end +180 degrees are added)

ValueDefinition.Name: AvenueOrnamentals1x1Middle
ValueDefinition.Description: The MidTiles of an ornamental-avenue-line. If you configured ABC and have end D, a 7-line will look like DABCABD. If you do not have an endpiece it will be ABCABCA

ValueDefinition.Name: Rotation
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount that the ornament is rotated when placed in a horizontal line. (for vertical lines +90degrees are added)

ValueDefinition.Name: Rotation
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount that the ornament is rotated when placed at an corner connecting the +z and +x direction

ValueDefinition.Name: Subtle1x1Ornament
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is set, we use it to try to avoid areas where 1x1 ornaments are wildly randomly scattered. (e.g. in a 2x4 diagonal ornamental block where 8 random 1x1 ornaments are spawned)

ValueDefinition.Name: Probability3x3In3x3
ValueDefinition.Description: If we have a 3x3 ornament area, how probable is it that we place a 3x3 ornamental within

ValueDefinition.Name: Probability2x2In3x3
ValueDefinition.Description: If we have a 3x3 ornament area and do not place a 3x3 ornamental, how probable is it that we place a 3x3 ornamental within

ValueDefinition.Name: Probability2x2In2x2
ValueDefinition.Description: If we have a 3x3 ornament area, how probable is it that we place a 2x2 ornamental within

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockScale
ValueDefinition.Description: 0 = only use small blocks. 1 = only use large blocks. 0.75 = use more large than small blocks

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockScale_SmallIslands
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as BlockScale, but used for small islands

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockTypeRatio_SmallIslands
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as BlockTypeRatio, but used for small islands

ValueDefinition.Name: SameVariationsAndRotationsWithinBlock
ValueDefinition.Description: Within the same city block, all residences have the same rotation and variation

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildsRectengularFreeformFields
ValueDefinition.Description: Adds an additional step to freeform-field-placement that tries to order them rectengularly instead of radial

ValueDefinition.Name: PreferredPatron
ValueDefinition.Description: Patron generally associated with this Rival, chosen on the main and if no AdditionalPatrons are defined on all other islands as well. (if no specific reason against it)

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalPatrons
ValueDefinition.Description: If empty all Islands will have the PreferredPatron. Otherwise secondary islands will in turn take the patrons from this list instead of the PreferredPatron

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionOrientation
ValueDefinition.Description: Limit in which orientation the AI will build

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildingDecorations
ValueDefinition.Description: Decorations will be applied at all stages to all buildings fitting the target pool. Multiple decorations for the same building are untested
Configuration for everything primary and significantly affecting the visual of the AI island

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildingsAndStreets
MinTimeBetweenBuilds
ValueDefinition.Description: Time between consecutive new Buildings if all resources are available

ValueDefinition.Name: RubberbandSpeedUp
ValueDefinition.Description: 0: No Rubberbanding --- 1: "Human is double as good: double speed" --- 2: "Human is double as good: speed x4"

ValueDefinition.Name: RubberbandSlowDown
ValueDefinition.Description: 0: No Rubberbanding --- 1: "Human is half as good: 1/2 speed" --- 2: "Human is half as good: speed 1/4"

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetProgressTimes
ValueDefinition.Description: If necessary Rivals will slow down significantly to not reach the given milestones earlier than the given time. This is a very hard limitation so use with care

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetProgressSlowDown
ValueDefinition.Description: If non 0 this SlowDown will be applied when the Rival is too quickly approaching the TargetProgressTimes If 0 the RubberbandSlowDown is used instead.

ValueDefinition.Name: EventsToStart
TimeBetweenEvents
ValueDefinition.Description: Will be modified with some randomness
Sorted by priority. Put those with harder conditions first.

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildingReplacements
ValueDefinition.Description: Replaces one building with another, the AI will only know of the replacement and use the balancing of the replacement. Warning: Currently it's not supported to change the balancing here for existing participants as this will impact current savegames in an undefined behaviour.

ValueDefinition.Name: LimitBuildingsPerIsland
ValueDefinition.Description: Limits Building Count of given guid in given Region to [TinyCount] on tiny islands and to [HugeCount] on huge islands

ValueDefinition.Name: HugeIslandRelative
ValueDefinition.Description: Which relative island size [0...1] does a huge island have

ValueDefinition.Name: TinyIslandRelative
ValueDefinition.Description: Which relative island size [0...1] does a tiny island have

ValueDefinition.Name: StreetUpgrade1
ValueDefinition.Description: Empty -> No upgrade 1+

ValueDefinition.Name: StreetUpgrade2
ValueDefinition.Description: Empty -> No upgrade 2

ValueDefinition.Name: StreetUpgradeCostFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Money and Material factor for costs payed for upgrading streets. A 0 means no costs are payed, a 2.0 means double costs are payed

ValueDefinition.Name: NetworkCountProduction
ValueDefinition.Description: Not Supported Yet

ValueDefinition.Name: FinalizeCooldownPerPiece
ValueDefinition.Description: Time that will be waited after every Piece (basin, cistern, edge), before building the next

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceModifiers
ValueDefinition.Description: Note: Every CityInstitution which is not entered here will have the default distance (which equals to factor 1)

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceModifier
ValueDefinition.Description: 2 means the station has double the range (which means a quadratic increase in the covered area). 0.5 means the distance is halfed.

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildingsAsPseudoPublics
DistanceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: 2 means the building has double the range (which means a quadratic increase in the covered area). 0.5 means the distance is halfed.
Buildings listed here are handled as pseudo publics for the AI City. This means the AI will try to reach a coverage of them on all City Blocks. Be Careful, this might not work with all buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: DrainPercentage_MainIsland
ValueDefinition.Description: Value between 0.0 and 1.0 the AI targets to drain this amount of marsh

ValueDefinition.Name: DrainPercentage_OtherIslands
ValueDefinition.Description: Value between 0.0 and 1.0 the AI targets to drain this amount of marsh

ValueDefinition.Name: FinalizeCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: Time that will be waited after every Canal, before building the next

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredCityBlocks
ValueDefinition.Description: How many City Blocks should be on an island before this Rival plans to build a Villa. Note: For islands with the Role "HardProtect" (currently only the main island) this condition is skipped.
Configuration for everything placement related but not primarily visual

ValueDefinition.Name: PerRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: When AI wants to outsource a production to another session and can chose between multiple regions, which will it try first. Higher Number means earlier trying

ValueDefinition.Name: CampaignChapter
ValueDefinition.Description: The AI will not enter a province while the campaign is in this chapter.

ValueDefinition.Name: StartProvince
ValueDefinition.Description: The Province this AI starts in. If left as "Meta" the AI will start in the same Province as the player

ValueDefinition.Name: FobiddenProvinces
ValueDefinition.Description: Flagged Regions will not be entered by this AI

ValueDefinition.Name: PreventSettleIslands
ValueDefinition.Description: Islands entered here will not be settled first by the AI (actually the AI will ignore the islands as long as they belong to nobody)

ValueDefinition.Name: SettleDelay
delayMin
ValueDefinition.Description: the actual delay is rand(delayMin, delayMax)

ValueDefinition.Name: delayMax
ValueDefinition.Description: the actual delay is rand(delayMin, delayMax)

The AI will wait at least time = rand(min, max) after the last settlement happens before settling the next island. When settling the nth island, min and max are received from the respective entry in this array, if this doesn't exist the time in the last existing entry is used instead. (for the 1st island the 1st entry is taken)

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandDiffToHumans
ValueDefinition.Description: The AI is allowed to settle [highest human islands count in this province] + X islands without caring about the SettleDelay

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandLimitOnHumanlessProvice
ValueDefinition.Description: The AI is allowed to settle X Islands in provinces without a Human

ValueDefinition.Name: ReactionTime
ValueDefinition.Description: If a player settles a new island tha AI will wait X until it is allowed to settle as well (this should be different for all AIs to prevent weird behaviour)

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandStartGoodsTransfer
ValueDefinition.Description: Whenever the AI settles a new island we tranfer this from the main Island to this Island. (To prevent an empty island for several minutes)

ValueDefinition.Name: AsksForSettlePermission
ValueDefinition.Description: Should AI Ask human if it is allowed to settle 2nd island? Caution: Special Treatment for Multiplayer

ValueDefinition.Name: PermissionStoryline
ValueDefinition.Description: Storyline that describes the GovernerDecision with the Accept- and Decline-Buttons

ValueDefinition.Name: NextAskCooldownTimes
ValueDefinition.Description: After a query was RJECTED, it will wait at least [Entry0] for next Query. After each consecutive REJECT by human, the next entry is taken. On further rejects, the last entry is taken agian. Please make sure to have some differences between rivals to avoid simultanous follow-up-questions

ValueDefinition.Name: OnTakeIsland
PayReputationIfReputationAtLeastAfterwards
ValueDefinition.Description: Ai will usually pay money. But if after paying reputation costs, it'll have at least this much left, it'll pay reputation instead.

ValueDefinition.Name: StartTimedDeletion
ValueDefinition.Description: After Takeover after this cooldown, AI will remove random buildings/meshgraphs/polygons

ValueDefinition.Name: FinishTimedDeletion
ValueDefinition.Description: After takeover after this time all Buildings/MeshGraphs/Polygons will have been deleted
What happens when we take an island of someone else?

ValueDefinition.Name: OnLoseIsland
Rewards
ValueDefinition.Description: Rewards given to a human that takes over an island of us
What happens if we lose an island
