ValueDefinition.Name: HarborDefenses
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the ratio of harbor defenses per coast

ValueDefinition.Name: MaintenanceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor that is muliplicated with the balanced money maintenance to change the impact the building will have on the AI military budgets

ValueDefinition.Name: SecurityFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: A factor influencing how much defense structure the AI wants to build in the course of a game.

ValueDefinition.Name: HighProtectIslandSecurityFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Islands which are flagged as "HighProtect" which is mainly the main island. Get their ground security requirement multiplied by this factor.

ValueDefinition.Name: RadiusProtectionFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: The Attack radius * this factor defines the radius in which the towers increase the protection value.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaintenanceDurationToPay
ValueDefinition.Description: The time for which the construction AI should pay the maintenance upfront for military ships (the AI will not pay maintenance for those ships)

ValueDefinition.Name: MilitaryBudgetBonusPerAlliance
ValueDefinition.Description: The bonus for the military budget. For example: If this value is 30% and the rival has 2 allies the military budget is 60% increased

ValueDefinition.Name: Shape
ValueDefinition.Description: The Shape of the inner City Ring. INVALID means no Ring should be placed.

ValueDefinition.Name: OrganicRandomStretching
ValueDefinition.Description: 0 = Perfectly Symmetric shape, 5 = every edge is up to 5 tiles randomly shifted

ValueDefinition.Name: Radius
ValueDefinition.Description: Radius of the approximate circle that the walls encapsulate

ValueDefinition.Name: WallUpgradeAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: Empty -> No Upgrades

ValueDefinition.Name: NetworkBuildCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: How much minimum waiting time after finishing a Wall Network (InnerRing, OuterRing, IslandSeparationWall, ...)

ValueDefinition.Name: CityRingFillsAllCorners
ValueDefinition.Description: Should every corner of the CityRing-Walls has a tower placed?

ValueDefinition.Name: BehindCityRingDensity
ValueDefinition.Description: How dense should towers be behind the city ring?

ValueDefinition.Name: BehindAdditionalSeparationDensity
ValueDefinition.Description: How dense should towers be placed for additional separation walls?

ValueDefinition.Name: AtHarborsWithoutWallDensity
ValueDefinition.Description: How dense should towers be placed at Harbors that have no separation walls

ValueDefinition.Name: RandomPlacesDensity
ValueDefinition.Description: How dense should randomly placed towers be placed

ValueDefinition.Name: TowerBuildCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: How much minimum waiting time after finishing a Tower

ValueDefinition.Name: UseBallistasNearCoast
ValueDefinition.Description: Should AI Replace Arrow Towers with Ballista towers near coast?

ValueDefinition.Name: UpgradesTowersNearUpgradedWalls
ValueDefinition.Description: Should all towers be upgraded that are placed upon upgraded walls?

ValueDefinition.Name: UpgradesTowersWithoutNearUpgradedWall
ValueDefinition.Description: Should all towers be upgraded that are not placed upon upgraded walls?

ValueDefinition.Name: DefenseConstructionMoneyCostFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Money cost for Walls and Towers is multiplied by this factor so 1.0 means normal costs 0.0 means no money cost

ValueDefinition.Name: DefenseConstructionMaterialCostFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Material Cost for Walls and Towers is multiplied by this factor so 1.0 means normal costs 0.0 means no materials are paid

ValueDefinition.Name: StrengthFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: A multiplicator used to calculate the budget for spawning ships. Highest players combat strength * this factor is the budget to spawn ships

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxMilitaryBudget
ValueDefinition.Description:
The Budget is calculated with the Strength Factor and will be limited to be at most the MaxMilitaryBudget to be able to limit the maximum amount of Ships Rivals will spawn on late entry.
The Budget is complicated, even if it's 0 quite some ships will be spawned. In general it corresponds to the MilitaryStrength of the spawned ships. If < 0 the maximum will be ignored.

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipList
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be a single ship configuration asset or an asset pool of ship configuration assets

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: The weight of this ship list. Defines the minium amount and the amount will be always a factor of this weight

ValueDefinition.Name: LandForces
ValueDefinition.Description: The target composition of land forces. Land units get spawned into the ships until the composition configured here is reached.

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredUnlock
ValueDefinition.Description: If left empty the Building will be added to the construction queue as soon as it's unlocked

ValueDefinition.Name: StrengthLevels
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the overall behaviour of the AI for different states (superior, inferior, equal).

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxStrengthRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the maximum strength ratio to be on this superiority level.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxAttackRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how many units should be used for attack purposes on this superiority threshold.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxEscortRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how many units should be used for escort purposes on this superiority threshold.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxDefendRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how many units should be used to defend yourself below this superiority threshold.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxPatrolRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how many units should be used for patrol purposes on this superiority threshold.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxDefendAllyRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how many units should be used to defend allies below this superiority threshold.

ValueDefinition.Name: BudgetThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The constructionAI contains military budgets that determine how much of the total budget may be used for military purposes. If the military strength of this AI is below this threshold, the AI considers itself to be threatened and will use the budget that is configured for this scenario.

ValueDefinition.Name: UpdateInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: How often is the strength level recalculated

ValueDefinition.Name: Attack
ValueDefinition.Description: Contains several parameters used to run an attack.

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalUnitsStrength
ValueDefinition.Description: Min strength of available units used for aditional attacking units. Important for targets with a strength of 0 like buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines intervals in which the AI will search for new targets (= attack frequency), Set to 0 if there should not be any targeted attacks.

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackTargetPrio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines allowed targets and their priority (a target not listed here will only be attacked by auto attack)

ValueDefinition.Name: SkipProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: Usually the AI would always go with the first target in this list that it finds. This value describes the percental likeliness that this criterion is skipped to make the AI less predictable (0-100) ; 0 = never skip

ValueDefinition.Name: SkipTargetWhenInHarbourArea
ValueDefinition.Description: defines if the target should be skipped if it is within a harbour area when trying to find something to attack

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumConsideredTargets
ValueDefinition.Description: (0 = consider all targets) The maximum amount of targets that will be considered for this priority. The targets are sorted based on the condition given

ValueDefinition.Name: MilitaryStrengthRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: 100 = enemy strength. If our squad has this value or less strength relative to the enemy, it is not a target ((PirateStrenght/opposingStrenght)<MilitaryStrenghtRation = no attack)

ValueDefinition.Name: RallyBeforeAttack
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines if the AI makes its units group up before launching an attack

ValueDefinition.Name: RallyCompletionFalloffInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: After every RallyCompletionFalloffInterval seconds after the first ship arrived the total needed amount of ships to continue should be decreased by 1%.

ValueDefinition.Name: OverkillAttackThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: if the attack target and it's surroundings are at least this much of the entire military strength of the target participant IN THE CURRENT SESSION, then the AI will send an overkill attack. Otherwise it will scale down its fleets and only send as much as necessary. (0 -100)

ValueDefinition.Name: Defend
ValueDefinition.Description: Contains several parameters used for defending own buildings/ships

ValueDefinition.Name: MinStrengthRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the minimum strength ratio trying to match for defend groups

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalUnits
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how many units will be added to a defend group.

ValueDefinition.Name: DefendInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines intervals in which the AI will search for points it has to defend (= defend frequency)

ValueDefinition.Name: Patrol
ValueDefinition.Description: Contains several parameters used to send a squad on patrol.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the minimum size of a military patrol.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the maximum size of a military patrol.

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckPatrolInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Interval to check for new patrols or update existing ones.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinDistanceToLand
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the minimum distance to land for patrol stations (in tiles).

ValueDefinition.Name: SquadLogic
ValueDefinition.Description: Handles support, flee, and attack behaviour for ship squads

ValueDefinition.Name: FleeStrengthRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: 100 = enemy strength. If our squad has this value or less strength relative to the enemy, start to flee ((PirateStrenght/opposingStrenght)<FleetStrenghtRatio = flee)

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetPriorities
ValueDefinition.Description: Attack: No need to flee, objects in range will be attacked according to this priority list

ValueDefinition.Name: SkipTargetWhenInHarbourArea
ValueDefinition.Description: defines if the target should be skipped if it is within a harbour area when trying to find something to attack

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumConsideredTargets
ValueDefinition.Description: (0 = consider all targets) The maximum amount of targets that will be considered for this priority. The targets are sorted based on the condition given

ValueDefinition.Name: ObservationRange
ValueDefinition.Description: General: The range around the center of the squad that is used to find things to support, flee from things, and attack things

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckSquadLogicInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: General: How frequently the squadLogic is executed

ValueDefinition.Name: MinSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the minimum size of a military patrol.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the maximum size of a military patrol.

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckEscortInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Interval to check whether there are any trade ships to escort.

ValueDefinition.Name: HPRatioCombat
ValueDefinition.Description: How much HP should a unit have while being in combat to start a repair command.

ValueDefinition.Name: HPRatioIdle
ValueDefinition.Description: How much HP should a unit have while being in idle state to start a repair command.

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionOverride
ValueDefinition.Description: override the values of a Shiplimits for a specific session

ValueDefinition.Name: SessionGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: which session guid should have seperate values

ValueDefinition.Name: Percentage
ValueDefinition.Description: how much is the value of the original value, e.g. 50% of original numbers

ValueDefinition.Name: CatchupFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: catchup feature for ship limit

ValueDefinition.Name: Enabled
ValueDefinition.Description: enable shiplimit catchup

ValueDefinition.Name: CatchupToPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: how much of the human ship count should AI catch up to

ValueDefinition.Name: SlowdownFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: slowdown feature for ship limit

ValueDefinition.Name: Enabled
ValueDefinition.Description: enable shiplimit slowdown

ValueDefinition.Name: SlowdownToPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: how much of the human ship count should AI slow down to

ValueDefinition.Name: MinSlowdown
ValueDefinition.Description: what the minimal percentage of the

ValueDefinition.Name: TransferIntelligence
ValueDefinition.Description: Parameters for transfering units through embark/disembark. How intelligent is the AI in selecting safer coasts. How intelligent units are allocated to ships during embarkment. Smarter settings are expected to embark quicker.

ValueDefinition.Name: LandAIDefaultPatience
ValueDefinition.Description: How patient is the AI per default during land invasios. More patient means less losses in combat, with potentially sacrificing production buildings in favor of military units.

ValueDefinition.Name: ClearBeachheadTimeout
ValueDefinition.Description: Timeout in seconds for clearing the beachhead during an invasion.

ValueDefinition.Name: MilitaryStrengthRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: How much of target beach's combat strength we try to match with our naval strength

ValueDefinition.Name: TransferCapacityRedundancyFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Multiply actually needed transfer capacity with this percentage to get desired transfer capacity (to pickup drowning units)

ValueDefinition.Name: CatchupFactor
Enabled
ValueDefinition.Description: enable shiplimit catchup

ValueDefinition.Name: CatchupToPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: how much of the human ship count should AI catch up to
catchup feature for ship limit

ValueDefinition.Name: SlowdownFactor
Enabled
ValueDefinition.Description: enable shiplimit slowdown

ValueDefinition.Name: SlowdownToPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: how much of the human ship count should AI slow down to

ValueDefinition.Name: MinSlowdown
ValueDefinition.Description: what the minimal percentage of the
slowdown feature for ship limit

ValueDefinition.Name: RaidInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: How often should the pirate attempt to raid someone

ValueDefinition.Name: RaidUnlock
ValueDefinition.Description: This has to be unlocked for the pirate before it will start to consider raids of any kind

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredRaidUnlocksTarget
ValueDefinition.Description: Unlocks the raid target must have reached before itt can become a valid raid taret

ValueDefinition.Name: PerformsLandRaids
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, land raids are tried to perform by this Pirate

ValueDefinition.Name: AmountOfLandRaids
ValueDefinition.Description: How many attempted land raids will there be in "OutOfTotalRaids"

ValueDefinition.Name: OutOfTotalRaids
ValueDefinition.Description: Raid amount in which "AmountOfLandRaids" will be distributed

ValueDefinition.Name: RaidsSkippedPerBribe
ValueDefinition.Description: How many raids will be skipped for a participant if they performed a bribe action towards the pirate

ValueDefinition.Name: RaidShipPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: How many percent of the current warship fleet should be used for a raid max.

ValueDefinition.Name: WarehouseDestructionPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: How many warehouses should be destroyed. 100 means all warehouses of the island should be destroyed.

ValueDefinition.Name: CollateralDestructionPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: How many buildings should be destroyed on the paths to warehouses. 100 Means all buildings will be destroyed.

ValueDefinition.Name: FleeLifeThresholdePercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: Life threshold (sum over all units) for when the raid be cancelled. 90 means the raid will be cancelled if units lose 10% of their summed up life.

ValueDefinition.Name: WarShipAmountFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor that is multiplied to the unlocked warship slots based on the pirate difficulty

ValueDefinition.Name: StartPirateZoneRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the starting radius of the pirates around their kontor

ValueDefinition.Name: PirateZoneIncreaseFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Difficulty based factor that is applied on area increases from unlocks

ValueDefinition.Name: ChaseRange
ValueDefinition.Description: A targeted ship must leave the current area of activity + this range for the pirates to stop attacking it

ValueDefinition.Name: Unlock
ValueDefinition.Description: Unlock one player has to reach for the radius to increase the defined amount

ValueDefinition.Name: PirateZoneIncrease
ValueDefinition.Description: Increase of the pirate zone for this unlock. Difficulty based factors will be applied to this

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalPatrolSquadSizePerMaxReachedShips
ValueDefinition.Description: Per default patrol squads have a size of 1. For every 1 reached max ship size the patrol squad size is increased by this value. Example: If this value is 0.1 and the biggest amount of ships this pirate ever reached is 12 the patrols would consist of 2 units (1 + 12* 0.1)

ValueDefinition.Name: FixCampaignPirateZoneRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: In campaign this fixed radius is used. Once the campaign is over or in sandbox, the calculated radius is used.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsNavalOnlyPirate
ValueDefinition.Description: Has to be set, if the pirate does not have an island that can be invaded by land units

ValueDefinition.Name: RecoveryDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: The duration the recovery mode is enabled if it is triggered by one of the causes

ValueDefinition.Name: RecoveryProductionFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: How much ship and unit production is affected by the Recovery. E.g. 3.0 makes it tripple

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandDamagedRecoveryThresholdPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: If pirate island is under attack and its total building health falls below this threshold percentage [0 - 100] health the recovery state will be triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: DefeatDestructionThresholdPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: What percentage of the pirates buildings need to be destroyed before it counts as defeated. If MainBuilding is set all objects of this type have to be destroyed before a defeat can happen

ValueDefinition.Name: MainBuilding
ValueDefinition.Description: If set then all of these buildings have to be destroyed before the pirate can be considered defeated. If not set, only the DefeatDestructionThresholdPercentage will be used.

ValueDefinition.Name: FleetSizeAllianceFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor to scale the pirate war fleet sice if the pirate is in an alliance

ValueDefinition.Name: DecoBuildings
ValueDefinition.Description: Buildings get invisible if kontor is destroyed

ValueDefinition.Name: GoodsTrader
ValueDefinition.Description: If this property is set to false, the participant can't trade with goods anymore. It won't be possible to create traderoutes to this participant or doing active trade but users can still buy ships if it's a ship trader. It will also not create trade routes anymore nor produce a trade fleet.

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be empty. Then it counts as always unlocked

ValueDefinition.Name: PreferredGoods
UnlockCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: Required unlock for this good with this price multipliert will be considerd. Can be empty, then it is always considered..
Goods can be duplicates. Mutlipliers will be added.

ValueDefinition.Name: AcceptAllGoods
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this traders buys all the goods. If false only preferred Goods are bought

ValueDefinition.Name: DeliverAllGoods
ValueDefinition.Description: If true this trader will sell all the goods on harbors they come by. If false it will only sell what it has in island storage.

ValueDefinition.Name: TradeBudgets
UnlockCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be empty. Then it counts as always unlocked

ValueDefinition.Name: BuyBudget
ValueDefinition.Description: Additional budget for buying that is available per trade once any player reached this unlock

ValueDefinition.Name: SellBudget
ValueDefinition.Description: Additional budget for selling that is available per trade once any player reached this unlock
Trade Budget for this trader based on player unlocks. Budgets are cumulative!

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemTrader
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is set to false no item trade will be available for this trader

ValueDefinition.Name: OfferedItems
ValueDefinition.Description: Requires a Pool of ALL Items this Trader can potentially be selling.

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemSlotUnlocks
UnlockCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be empty. Then it counts as always unlocked
If any human participant unlocks an unlock from this list the trader will generate one additional item slot to offer items from

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemPoolUnlocks
UnlockCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be empty. Then it counts as always unlocked
Allows Pools to be unlocked for this Trader sequentially. Always requires Pools that are subsets of the Pool in Offered Items.

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipTrader
ValueDefinition.Description: whether or not the trader BUYS ships (selling is defined by the ship production)

ValueDefinition.Name: SellShipCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: The Cooldown before a new sell ship is requested after one is bought.

ValueDefinition.Name: TraderDefaultItemRerollCosts
ValueDefinition.Description: Basic money costs to reroll the item default offerings of a third party trader

ValueDefinition.Name: TraderDefaultItemRerollCostIncrease
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of money the price for a default reroll increases by a manual reroll. An automatic reroll resets the increasing costs

ValueDefinition.Name: ProvidesShipReplacements
ValueDefinition.Description: For all types selected this trader will provide a replacement ship for sale to the player if he lost his.

ValueDefinition.Name: WarDutySlots
UnlockCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be empty. Then it counts as always unlocked
Slots dedicated for war ships. Each unlock will provide one slot. Con contain duplicates

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be empty. Then it counts as always unlocked

ValueDefinition.Name: TradeDutySlots
UnlockCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be empty. Then it counts as always unlocked
Slots dedicated for trade ships. Each unlock will provide one slot. Con contain duplicates

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be empty. Then it counts as always unlocked

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipOfferSlots
UnlockCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be empty. Then it counts as always unlocked
Slots dedicated for ships that this trader sells. Each unlock will provide one slot. Con contain duplicates

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be empty. Then it counts as always unlocked

ValueDefinition.Name: SellsTroops
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the trader is supposed to offer troops to the player

ValueDefinition.Name: TroopOfferSlots
UnlockCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be empty. Then it counts as always unlocked
Slots dedicated for troops this trader sells. Each unlock will provide one slot. Con contain duplicates

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: Can be empty. Then it counts as always unlocked

ValueDefinition.Name: UnitInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Interval in which new units (of all type) will be spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: WarJustificationCostThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The rival will declare a war if it costs at most this much reputation and tendency is at least 0

ValueDefinition.Name: WarJustificationTendencyThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The rival will declare war if the tendency is at least this, no matter the reptuation cost

ValueDefinition.Name: MoodImage
ValueDefinition.Description: Used in the Diplomacy UI to show a mood image for a diplomatic participant

Property.Name: Highscore
Property.Description: Highscore will be calculated for this player

ValueDefinition.Name: ReceivesStartGoods
ValueDefinition.Description: Determines if this participant should receive the configured start goods. Should be disabled for traders

Property.Name: ParticipantMessages
Property.Description: How does the Participant react to certain Triggers?

ValueDefinition.Name: Reactions
ValueDefinition.Description: The conditions for all Reactions will be checked from top to bottom. As soon as one is Fulfilled, The Reaction is triggered and the evaluation is stopped.

ValueDefinition.Name: DisabledForGameType
ValueDefinition.Description: If Campaign is selected this reaction will not trigger during an active campaign. If Sandbox is selected this reaction will not trigger during a non campaign game. Scenario is currently not supported!

ValueDefinition.Name: MyRole
ValueDefinition.Description: A trigger always has an Initiator and a Target, which is set by the coder. MyRole specifies if the participant that owns this asset shall only react in a certain role: Only when they are target, initiator, or observer to this trigger.

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredDiplomacyState
ValueDefinition.Description: Relation between the two participants needs to be in one of the selected states. Ignored if no states are set

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredDiplomacySubState
ValueDefinition.Description: Relation between the two participants needs to have at least one of the selected sub-states. Ignored if no sub-states are set

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredContextAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: Type of asset depends on trigger (e.g. the FertilityMissing infolayer over a production building). If a message has a required context asset, it will only be executed if the trigger relates to the same asset.

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredContextMenu
ValueDefinition.Description: Reaction is only executed when the given menu is currently opened

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredContextValueThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: -1 = Ignore this Requirement. Some Triggers are Fired with a ContextValue (e.g. "Propaganda" can be slight(0), medium(1), heavy(2), ...). If you set this value to X, than the reaction is triggered for all values <= X.

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiresVariableValue
ValueDefinition.Description: Set to true, if the reaction should depend on a variable value of the variable system

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckedVariable
ValueDefinition.Description: The variable name of the variable that is checked

ValueDefinition.Name: Operator
ValueDefinition.Description: Comparison operator that compares the checked variable and the target

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetValue
ValueDefinition.Description: Target value or variable which the checked vaariable gets compared to

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredUnlockedAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: This asset needs to be unlocked by the player for this reaction to trigger

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiresActiveEmperorTitle
ValueDefinition.Description: If set this reaction can only be used if the reactor is the active emperor. Use this if only the active emperor should react and not all possible emperors.

ValueDefinition.Name: Probability
ValueDefinition.Description: If this trigger occurs, how likely (0.0 = never, 1.0 = always) will the reaction be executed?

ValueDefinition.Name: ProbabilityIsOneForFirstOccurence
ValueDefinition.Description: Only Relevant when Probability != 1. Forces the Probability of a Reaction to 100% for first occurence of this trigger.

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreFirstOccurences
ValueDefinition.Description: How many Triggers should be ignored before the first Reaction is Executed? 0 = Execute on first Trigger Occurence

ValueDefinition.Name: CooldownOccurences
ValueDefinition.Description: After an Execution of this Reaction, how many Triggers are ignored before the next Reaction is Executed? 0 = Execute on every consecutive Trigger Occurence.

ValueDefinition.Name: CooldownTime
ValueDefinition.Description: After an Execution of this Reaction, how much time has to pass before this Reaction is allowed to be Executed again?

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: Notification that is executed by this Reaction

ValueDefinition.Name: Notification
ValueDefinition.Description: Notification that is executed by this Reaction (if NotificationGUID is not set)

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockAssets
UnlockAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: This Asset will be unlocked once the pamsy gets triggered
An asset can be unlocked once this reaction is executed.

ValueDefinition.Name: LockAssets
ValueDefinition.Description: An asset can be locked once this reaction is executed.

ValueDefinition.Name: ReactionsOnFulfilled
RequiredDiplomacyState
ValueDefinition.Description: Relation between the two participants needs to be in one of the selected states. Ignored if no states are set

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredDiplomacySubState
ValueDefinition.Description: Relation between the two participants needs to have at least one of the selected sub-states. Ignored if no sub-states are set
"You built the Colosseum, great."

ValueDefinition.Name: ReactionsOnUnlock
RequiredDiplomacyState
ValueDefinition.Description: Relation between the two participants needs to be in one of the selected states. Ignored if no states are set

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredDiplomacySubState
ValueDefinition.Description: Relation between the two participants needs to have at least one of the selected sub-states. Ignored if no sub-states are set
"You unlocked the Colosseum, please build it."

ValueDefinition.Name: ReactionsOnNoLongerFulfilled
RequiredDiplomacyState
ValueDefinition.Description: Relation between the two participants needs to be in one of the selected states. Ignored if no states are set

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredDiplomacySubState
ValueDefinition.Description: Relation between the two participants needs to have at least one of the selected sub-states. Ignored if no sub-states are set
"You had a Colosseum, but you destroyed it."

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredDiplomacyState
ValueDefinition.Description: Relation between the two participants needs to be in one of the selected states. Ignored if no states are set

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredDiplomacySubState
ValueDefinition.Description: Relation between the two participants needs to have at least one of the selected sub-states. Ignored if no sub-states are set

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredDiplomacyState
ValueDefinition.Description: Relation between the two participants needs to be in one of the selected states. Ignored if no states are set

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredDiplomacySubState
ValueDefinition.Description: Relation between the two participants needs to have at least one of the selected sub-states. Ignored if no sub-states are set

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredDiplomacyState
ValueDefinition.Description: Relation between the two participants needs to be in one of the selected states. Ignored if no states are set

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredDiplomacySubState
ValueDefinition.Description: Relation between the two participants needs to have at least one of the selected sub-states. Ignored if no sub-states are set

ValueDefinition.Name: ProfileType
ValueDefinition.Description: Virtual means "never owns any game objects". Pick ThirdParty otherwise.

ValueDefinition.Name: CreateModeMeta
ValueDefinition.Description: In which cases should the MetaParticipant be created?

ValueDefinition.Name: CreateModeSession
ValueDefinition.Description: In which cases should the session participant be created

ValueDefinition.Name: Portrait
ValueDefinition.Description: Portrait assigned to this profile

ValueDefinition.Name: ShortDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Short description of the participant. Used when there is not enogh place to show InfoCornerDescription

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationBackground
ValueDefinition.Description: A background picture that is used in the character notification menu

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestStarterObject
ValueDefinition.Description: This is the object where all quests triggered by this profile can be accepted

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestPoolList
ValueDefinition.Description: The list with all quest pools that are assigned to this character

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipDropRewardPool
ValueDefinition.Description: When a ship gets destroyed a flotsam may be generated

ValueDefinition.Name: AvoidIslandsOnEnterSession
ValueDefinition.Description: If this flag is set to true, ships that enter the session will try to avoid a spawnposition near to the islands of this participant

ValueDefinition.Name: AutomaticDiscovery
ValueDefinition.Description: Participant is discovered if it unlocks this or if the discoverer unlocks this

Property.Name: PlayerCounter
Property.Description: Statistics will be tracked for this player

Property.Name: TechHandler
Property.Description: this participant is capable of researching techs

ValueDefinition.Name: HasResearchedAll
ValueDefinition.Description: All non repeatable techs get unlocked and researched each time a participant is loaded

Property.Name: Emperor
Property.Description: This participant can be an emperor

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationFromLowerZone
ValueDefinition.Description: This notification will be triggered if the player entered this zone coming from a lower zone (so his reputation increased)

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationFromUpperZone
ValueDefinition.Description: This notification will be triggered if the player entered this zone coming from a upper zone (so his reputation decreased)

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoneEffects
ActiveEffects
Effect
ValueDefinition.Description: An effect that is active if the player is in this zone. All effects of other zones will be removed! Effect needs to have either Meta, ObjectsInMeta or AreasInMeta Scope.
An List of effects that are active if the player is in this zone. All effects of other zones will be removed! Effect needs to have either Meta, ObjectsInMeta or AreasInMeta Scope.

ValueDefinition.Name: AssetUnlocks
Asset
ValueDefinition.Description: An asset that will be unlocked if the player is in this zone. All other assets of other zones will be locked again! This is used to enable/disable some unique features/effects E.g. item reroll at traders

A list of assets that will be unlocked if the player is in this zone. All other assets of other zones will be locked again! This is used to enable/disable some unique features/effects E.g. item reroll at traders
Configuration what effects and features are enabled while the player is in this zone

ValueDefinition.Name: DeactivateZoneEffects
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, we will deactivate any zone effects while in this special state. This can be used to disable the negative effects of the lower zones while in the pro consul state.

ValueDefinition.Name: StateEffects
ActiveEffects
Effect
ValueDefinition.Description: An effect that is active if the player hast this special state. All effects of other states will be removed! Effect needs to have either Meta, ObjectsInMeta or AreasInMeta Scope.
An List of effects that are active if the playerhast this special state. All effects of other states will be removed! Effect needs to have either Meta, ObjectsInMeta or AreasInMeta Scope.

ValueDefinition.Name: AssetUnlocks
Asset
ValueDefinition.Description: An asset that will be unlocked if the player hast this special state. All other assets of other states will be locked again!

A list of assets that will be unlocked if the player hast this special state. All other assets of other states will be locked again! This is used to enable/disable some unique features/effects E.g. item reroll at traders
Configuration what effects and features are enabled while the player has this special state

ValueDefinition.Name: ContractReputationBalancing
ReputationPerProgressLevel
AmountOfContractsNeeded
ValueDefinition.Description: Needed amount of contracts for the ReputationReward to be given to the player

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationReward
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of reputation rewarded when the needed amounts of contracts are completed
Defines for every progress level how many contracts a player needs to complete until he gets reputation

ValueDefinition.Name: ContractProviders
Participant
ValueDefinition.Description: Contract Provider Asset (e.g. an Rival or ThirdParty)
List of contract rovider participants for which the emperor grants reputation
Balancing for the reputation reward of completing contracts for certain participants

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsulGovernorDecision
ValueDefinition.Description: A governor decision, which will be triggered when a participant reaches the Max Reputation.

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsulGovernorDecisionDuringCampaign
ValueDefinition.Description: A governor decision, which will be triggered when a participant reaches the Max Reputation. During campaign gameplay we want to trigger a different decision as the player cannot become consul

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsulLostGovernorDecision
ValueDefinition.Description: A Governor Decision if the player lost the consul title, because of reputation loss

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsulLostBecauseProConsulGovernorDecision
ValueDefinition.Description: A Governor Decision if the player lost the consul title, because somebody else became pro consul

ValueDefinition.Name: UltimatumGovernorDecision
ValueDefinition.Description: A storyline or a pool of storylines, which will be triggered when a participant reaches the Min Reputation. It should set the player to Rebellion or NoSpecialState after a decision!

ValueDefinition.Name: UltimatumGovernorDecisionDuringCampaign
ValueDefinition.Description: A governor decision, which will be triggered when a participant reaches the Min Reputation. During campaign we want to trigger a different one as the player should not be able to rebel

ValueDefinition.Name: RebellionAlternativeFailedStoryline
ValueDefinition.Description: A storyline telling the player that he is now in a rebellion. Will be triggered if the player reaches min rep again after he already reached it once and accepted an alterantive way out

ValueDefinition.Name: RebellionCapitulationStoryline
ValueDefinition.Description: A storyline or a pool of storylines, which will be triggered when a participant is the rebellion leader and the rebellion is losing. It should be a decision to capitulate the rebellion.

ValueDefinition.Name: ProConsulGovernorDecision
ValueDefinition.Description: A governor decision, which will be triggered if a participant wins the rebellion.

ValueDefinition.Name: ProConsulLostGovernorDecision
ValueDefinition.Description: A Governor decision triggered if the player lost the pro consul title

ValueDefinition.Name: EmperorTraits
ReputationValue
ValueDefinition.Description: The ReputationValue will be added to the current reputation if the player does something associated to this trait.
Describes the traits of this emperor.

ValueDefinition.Name: RequestInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: The time between emperor requests.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestPool
ValueDefinition.Description: A pool of quests where one gets chooses from if the interval time is up.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestPoolDuringCampaign
ValueDefinition.Description: During Campaign we use this pool as we want to have more control about the reputation gain

ValueDefinition.Name: RebellionLoyalistBonus
ValueDefinition.Description: A participant receives this much reputation with this emperor when they join a rebellion on their side.

ValueDefinition.Name: RebellionDefeatPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: If this percentage of the total war score is achieved by the emperor (and they are ahead in war score) they start to offer capitulation opportunities to the rebels.

ValueDefinition.Name: WaveStartedNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: The notification which is triggered if a new wave started

ValueDefinition.Name: WaveSourceSession
ValueDefinition.Description: The visual source session of the wave on the world map. Note the wave will be spawned in the target session and not in this given session

ValueDefinition.Name: RazeTakenIslandsOnWaveStart
ValueDefinition.Description: If true all take over islands will be razed/cleared when the next wave starts.

ValueDefinition.Name: RemoveOldShipsOnWaveStart
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, all old ships will be destroyed when the next wave starts.

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalWaveTimeMin
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for a random time wich is added to the wait time until the next wave

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalWaveTimeMax
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for a random time wich is added to the wait time until the next wave

ValueDefinition.Name: LastWaveWinThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: During the last wave, the wave spanwer ends if the military power of the spawned wave ships/units is less then this value.

ValueDefinition.Name: WaitTimeAfterSpawn
ValueDefinition.Description: How long until the next wave

ValueDefinition.Name: CombatStrengthFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: A multiplicator used to calculate the budget for spawning ships. Rebellion combat strength * this factor is the budget of the emperor to spawn ships

ValueDefinition.Name: IsPeak
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines if this wave is the peak wave

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackingForcesBudgetPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description:
How much of the total budget the attacker forces get. E.g. if 50 it means 50% of the total budget is allocated to the attacker.
!Note that if all 3 squads get 100% the total budget is tripled!

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackingNavalForces
ShipList
ValueDefinition.Description: Asset of the Attacker Squad configuration. The actual spawned units for the attacker squad are based on the weight and the enemy combat strength. The Attacker Forces will search for enemies and attack them.

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: The weight of this ship list. Defines the minium amount and the amount will be always a factor of this weight
Naval Forces which will get the task to drive arround and harras and attack other enemy ships

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortForcesBudgetPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description:
How much of the total budget the escort forces get. E.g. if 50 it means 50% of the total budget is allocated to the escort.
!Note that if all 3 squads get 100% the total budget is tripled!

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortNavalForces
ShipList
ValueDefinition.Description: Asset of the Escort Squad configuration. The actual spawned units for the squad are based on the weight and the enemy combat strength. The Escort Forces will escort and defend the landing forces .

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: The weight of this ship list. Defines the minium amount and the amount will be always a factor of this weight
Naval Forces which will get the task to support and escort the Landing Naval Forces

ValueDefinition.Name: LandingForcesBudgetPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description:
How much of the total budget the landing forces get. E.g. if 50 it means 50% of the total budget is allocated to the landing team.
!Note that if all 3 squads get 100% the total budget is tripled!

ValueDefinition.Name: LandingNavalForces
ShipList
ValueDefinition.Description: Asset of the Landing Squad configuration. The actual spawned units for the squad are based on the weight and the enemy combat strength. The Landing Forces will go to a enemy beach attack it and disembark any loaded land troops.

ValueDefinition.Name: Weight
ValueDefinition.Description: The weight of this ship list. Defines the minium amount and the amount will be always a factor of this weight
List of naval forces which will get the task to clear and land on a beach.

ValueDefinition.Name: LandForces
ValueDefinition.Description: The target composition of land forces for this wave. When the wave starts land units gets spawned into the ships until the composition configured here is reached. Already existing land units will be taken into account

ValueDefinition.Name: Emperor
ValueDefinition.Description: The emperor that needs to be active for this reputation config to be used

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationSteps
MinCurrentReputation
ValueDefinition.Description: We choose the step by checking the current reputation of the rival. The balancing of this step will be chosen if the rivals current reputation is between min and max (including)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxCurrentReputation
ValueDefinition.Description: We choose the step by checking the current reputation of the rival. The balancing of this step will be chosen if the rivals current reputation is between min and max (including)

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationGainChance
ValueDefinition.Description: Value used to decide if we should gain or lose reputation this time. 60 = 60% gain and 40% to lose reputation. The amount can be configured below.

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationGain
ValueDefinition.Description: How much reputation the rival should be gaining if the reputation change says we gain reputation. (Value needs to be positive)

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationLoss
ValueDefinition.Description: How much reputation the rival should be losing if the reputation change says we lose reputation. (Value needs to be negative)

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationChangeTimerMin
ValueDefinition.Description: After this step we add a timer until we check again. The time is random between ReputationChangeTimerMin & ReputationChangeTimerMax

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationChangeTimerMax
ValueDefinition.Description: After this step we add a timer until we check again. The time is random between ReputationChangeTimerMin & ReputationChangeTimerMax
Every X time we check the current reputation of a rival and use this configuration to roll if we should lose or gain reputation

ValueDefinition.Name: CanStartRebellion
ValueDefinition.Description: If true this rival will start a rebellion when at min reputation

ValueDefinition.Name: CanBecomeConsul
ValueDefinition.Description: If true this rival will accept consul title if at max reputation

ValueDefinition.Name: WelcomeMessagesPeace
ValueDefinition.Description: Vector of character notifications. If this participant is chosen to speak when opening the diplomacy scene, one of the notifications gets chosen at random to be played.

ValueDefinition.Name: NegotiationIdleMessages
ValueDefinition.Description: Vector of character notifications. Whenever this participant's negotiation scene is opened, one of the notifications gets chosen at random to be played after the negotiation idle timer has ran out.

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: This asset has to be unlocked by the current player participant in order for this conversation to be played. No set asset means the conversation is available from the start.

ValueDefinition.Name: MainPartner
ValueDefinition.Description: (Optional) Main partner of the conversation. Needs to be discovered and alive in order for this conversation to be played.

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedsMainPartner
ValueDefinition.Description: If there shouldn't be a partner for this conversation, please select this option.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsUnique
ValueDefinition.Description: If this conversation is unique, it won't be played again after it has successfully finished playing. If a unique conversation was interrupted by closing the diplomacy scene during its duration, the conversation has not successfully finished and will be available to be played again.

ValueDefinition.Name: ConversationType
ValueDefinition.Description: Please select the correct conversation type!! Also make sure that you put this asset into the correct conversation category in the "Diplomacy Messages" property!!

ValueDefinition.Name: ResearchingGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: the research is unlocked and the item is relocked if the item is crafted or rewarded. Ensures that the item is only craftable once.

ValueDefinition.Name: CreatesItem
ValueDefinition.Description: Set to false for research craftings that only unlock and do not generate an item instance. Leave at true for milestone items (that have a research guid to ensure uniqueness but still have a real item)

Property.Name: EffectContainer
Property.Description: Property which can hold multiple effects

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxStackSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Stacklimit for this item. 0 for unlimited. The StackLimit of the ItemContainer still has effect.

ValueDefinition.Name: Niche
ValueDefinition.Description: The niche of this item

ValueDefinition.Name: HasAction
ValueDefinition.Description: Has this Item an Action?

ValueDefinition.Name: ExclusiveGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: only one captain can be equipped, only one motor

ValueDefinition.Name: Flotsam
ValueDefinition.Description: if the item is thrown overboard, a flotsam of this type is spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: FlotsamTerrain
ValueDefinition.Description: if a flotsam is spawned on terrain, this is the asset that is spawned. If empty, a generic terrain flotsam asset is spawned

ValueDefinition.Name: TransferBlocked
ValueDefinition.Description: Used in campaign to block slots/sockets for user interaction

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlyEquippableOnce
ValueDefinition.Description: it is not allowed to have multiple items of this equipped in the same item container

ValueDefinition.Name: SocketOverwriteSound
ValueDefinition.Description: 3D sound which is triggered at the object this is socketed (overwrites the configuration within the object)

ValueDefinition.Name: UnsocketOverwriteSound
ValueDefinition.Description: 3D sound which is triggered at the object this is unsocketed (overwrites the configuration within the object)

ValueDefinition.Name: BroadcastMusicEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: This event is triggered if the broadcast button in the Music Pavillion is pressed

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemFilterCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: only needed for special item filter

ValueDefinition.Name: ScenarioFilter
ValueDefinition.Description: This item is only part of this scenario, leave empty for vanilla items. Used in StatisticScreen

ValueDefinition.Name: ScenarioUnique
ValueDefinition.Description: item can only exist once in the scenario

ValueDefinition.Name: IsMetaItem
ValueDefinition.Description: a meta item is rewarded in HallOfFame and is added to global item inventory on gamestart

ValueDefinition.Name: BarkPool
ValueDefinition.Description: Bark when equipping or activating the item

ValueDefinition.Name: ActionDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: maximal distance from ship to target position

ValueDefinition.Name: IsDestroyedAfterCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: Consumables are deleted after usage (slot is still blocked until cooldown is finished)

ValueDefinition.Name: Charges
ValueDefinition.Description: Consumables may have multiple charges until they are used up

ValueDefinition.Name: ActionDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: duration of an item action

ValueDefinition.Name: ActiveEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: The Effect which will activate on activation of the item. The Effect has to be not timed (time will be managed by item action), and the effect scope needs to match the scope of the socket the item can be socketed

ValueDefinition.Name: CanEndItemAction
ValueDefinition.Description: Can the duration be ended manually?

ValueDefinition.Name: StopMovementOnInteraction
ValueDefinition.Description: Vehicle stops when the item interaction starts

ValueDefinition.Name: ActivateActionSound
ValueDefinition.Description: Sound triggered when action is activated. It's expected to be a 2D sound which will be triggered, only plays for the triggering player.

ValueDefinition.Name: DeactivateActionSound
ValueDefinition.Description: Sound triggered when action is deactivated. It's expected to be a 2D sound which will be triggered, only plays for the triggering player.

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemSearchText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text that is used as keyword in the item search to find items with this allocation. If empty, Text is being used as keyword

ValueDefinition.Name: AllocationIcons
ValueDefinition.Description: a socket can allow multiple allocations, this vector decides which of the allocations is used for UI (first has highest prio)

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemGenCrateScale
ValueDefinition.Description: Uniform scale for the item crate asset

ValueDefinition.Name: SocketCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of sockets in which items can be equipped

ValueDefinition.Name: SocketAllocation
ValueDefinition.Description: What item allocation types are allowed in my sockets?

ValueDefinition.Name: SlotCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of slots in which items or goods can be stacked up to their stacklimit or the stacklimit of the ItemContainer. Items in slots are inactive (only items in sockets are equipped)

ValueDefinition.Name: StackLimit
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of goods or items which fit into one slot

ValueDefinition.Name: CanStoreProducts
ValueDefinition.Description: Ships can store products, Warehouses send products to their LogisticNode

ValueDefinition.Name: EmptySocketItemNonModifiable
ValueDefinition.Description: shown on empty sockets where no modification is allowed

ValueDefinition.Name: IsFlotsam
ValueDefinition.Description: True, if this asset is a flotsam

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnsFlotsam
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether this item container spawns flotsams on certain events (e.g. destruction)

ValueDefinition.Name: FlotsamNoRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Indiates whether the flotsam should exactly spawn at the object's position. If false, it will apply a random offset

ValueDefinition.Name: FixedSlotContent
ValueDefinition.Description: Coal ships can only transport coal

ValueDefinition.Name: SocketSound
ValueDefinition.Description: 3D Sound which is triggered when an item is socketed (note this sound can be overwritten by the item)

ValueDefinition.Name: UnsocketSound
ValueDefinition.Description: 3D Sound which is triggered when an item is unsocketed (note this sound can be overwritten by the item)

ValueDefinition.Name: CanBeEmbarked
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this object can be embarked by e.g. land units

ValueDefinition.Name: UnsustainedItemSocketInfolayer
ValueDefinition.Description: Infolayer that will be shown if at least one item socket is disabled

ValueDefinition.Name: ReplacementPools
ValueDefinition.Description: List of items which are replaced with a real reward from the ReplacementPool

ValueDefinition.Name: DestroyOnClick
ValueDefinition.Description: Item is consumed when click actions are executed

ValueDefinition.Name: UseEffectAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates whether a full asset should be used as an effect or a simple cfg (requires path)

ValueDefinition.Name: BarrageCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Number of Projectiles to launch

ValueDefinition.Name: ActionRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: radius of special actions (e.g. mortar can have an area where the projectiles land randomly)

ValueDefinition.Name: EffectFile
ValueDefinition.Description: Visual Effect that will be shown while the item is active

ValueDefinition.Name: EffectScope
ValueDefinition.Description: The scope of the Effect. Be Carefull with this as there can be some misconfiguration between buffs, targets and scope.

ValueDefinition.Name: Buffs
GUID
ValueDefinition.Description: Guid of the buff asset
The buffs which will be applied onto the targets

ValueDefinition.Name: Targets
GUID
ValueDefinition.Description: guid of the target object asset or an asset pool with name
List of objects which should be buffed with the provided buffs

ValueDefinition.Name: GUID
ValueDefinition.Description: Removes those guids from the valid target list. Usefull if the Target List is a big pool, and we want to exlude a small amount of guids from this pool

ValueDefinition.Name: ExcludeEffectSourceGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the guid of the source building of the effect will be ignored as target. This way a bakery with radius effect will not affect itself and other bakeries

ValueDefinition.Name: EffectIconCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: Used to determine what kind of icon should be used to show

ValueDefinition.Name: TimedEffect
EffectDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is > 0, this effect is timed and will run out. If = 0 the effect will be there until stopped manually

ValueDefinition.Name: NextEffectAfterDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: This effect will be applied after the duration of the original effect runs out. Used to make Effect Chains. Only Effects with durations are allowed to be part of Effect Chains!

ValueDefinition.Name: RestartEffectChainWithThisEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is true and this effect gets started it will remove all effects which are part of this effect chain. !Should only be used on the asset which will be the start of the effect chain!
All this configuration is only relevant if the Effect Duration is > 0

ValueDefinition.Name: HideInGovernorsBar
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to true, the effect won't be shown in the Governorsbar, even if active on island/session

ValueDefinition.Name: HideInStatisticScreen
ValueDefinition.Description: If set to true, the effect won't be shown in the Statistic Screen, even if active on island/session

ValueDefinition.Name: UiPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: The highest priority effects will be shown first in the UI

ValueDefinition.Name: BoostHint
ValueDefinition.Description: Hint text for boostable item

ValueDefinition.Name: CameraSequenceID
ValueDefinition.Description: The previously in the editor defined ID of the camera sequence

ValueDefinition.Name: CameraSequenceSession
ValueDefinition.Description: If given, the camera sequence is only allowed to take place in this session

ValueDefinition.Name: AdaptGameCamera
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the free game camera will be set at the same position as the last frame of the camera sequence

ValueDefinition.Name: AnimateLetterboxesOnStart
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the letterboxes will fade in via animation when starting the camera sequence

ValueDefinition.Name: AnimateLetterboxesOnEnd
ValueDefinition.Description: If false, the letterboxes will fade out via animation shortly before the camera sequence ends

ValueDefinition.Name: AchievementProgressText
ValueDefinition.Description: Is used to show the progress of an achievement, like "0/1"

ValueDefinition.Name: AchievementRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: Set a region here if this achievement is specific to that region. Those achievements might be shown slightly differently in the UI

ValueDefinition.Name: HideProgressBar
ValueDefinition.Description: Sometimes, the progress of an achievement can not be shown correctly. Use this flag to hide the progress bar of this achievement

ValueDefinition.Name: AchievementPS5ID
ValueDefinition.Description: "TrophyID" on the playstation servers. Gets automatically set by exporting the trophies.

ValueDefinition.Name: XBSIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: Icon for XBox achievement. Xbox needs a different Icon as it requires a different size compared to other platforms. Only used in export

ValueDefinition.Name: PlatinAchievement
ValueDefinition.Description: This is not used by the game, but needed to export achievements for PlayStation. DO NOT DELETE

ValueDefinition.Name: AchievementUnlockedNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: The notification that will be triggered when an achievement is unlocked

ValueDefinition.Name: AchievementList
Achievement
ValueDefinition.Description: Index in this list defines what is shown as expected next achievements in the UI
List of achievements in the expected order of fulfillment

ValueDefinition.Name: ChallengeEventID
ValueDefinition.Description: Choose the challenge event ID associated for this event.

ValueDefinition.Name: ChallengeProgressID
ValueDefinition.Description: Choose the challenge progress ID for this event. If there should be no progress, choose NoProgress.

ValueDefinition.Name: Asset
ValueDefinition.Description: AchievementSets consist of several Achievements or Challenges

ValueDefinition.Name: Reward
ValueDefinition.Description: A reward that is unlocked for the player once they claimed the set

ValueDefinition.Name: Rewards
Reward
ValueDefinition.Description: A reward that is unlocked for the player once they claimed the set
List of rewards that is unlocked for the player once they claimed the set

ValueDefinition.Name: Dlcs
ValueDefinition.Description: Link here all the DLCs that are communicated as'DLC' to the player e.g. in the MPLobby

ValueDefinition.Name: UpgradesSavegame
ValueDefinition.Description: True if this dlc can be activated for an existing game.
Icons that will be shown on DLC Promotion Popup

ValueDefinition.Name: ReplaceBuildingsWhenDLCisActive
IgnoreSecondParty
ValueDefinition.Description: Replacement is not done for AI

ValueDefinition.Name: ActivatePlayerPause
ValueDefinition.Description: Pause automatically after replacement
when a DLC gets activated or while it is active, NormalBuilding is replaced by ReplacementBuilding

ValueDefinition.Name: IsInstalled
ValueDefinition.Description: Flag to signal data of this DLC is included in the current game version

ValueDefinition.Name: UplayProductID
ValueDefinition.Description: Secondary store ownership ID aka Connect Addon ID

ValueDefinition.Name: XBSProductID
ValueDefinition.Description: Ownership ID

ValueDefinition.Name: PS5ProductID
ValueDefinition.Description: Ownership ID

ValueDefinition.Name: CardType
ValueDefinition.Description: DLC card style in the overview

ValueDefinition.Name: CardImage
ValueDefinition.Description: DLC card image in the overview

ValueDefinition.Name: UpcomingText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text label on unreleased DLC cards

ValueDefinition.Name: DetailsBackground
ValueDefinition.Description: Details page: background image

ValueDefinition.Name: DetailsContent
GUID
ValueDefinition.Description: Either use GUID or Icon+Headline+Description

ValueDefinition.Name: Icon
ValueDefinition.Description: Either use GUID or Icon+Headline+Description

ValueDefinition.Name: Headline
ValueDefinition.Description: Either use GUID or Icon+Headline+Description

ValueDefinition.Name: Description
ValueDefinition.Description: Either use GUID or Icon+Headline+Description

ValueDefinition.Name: Preview
ValueDefinition.Description: 2D or 3D preview asset

ValueDefinition.Name: Background
ValueDefinition.Description: Optional: replaces the details page background image with this
Details page: (tabbed) bullet points with icon and text

ValueDefinition.Name: UplayShopProductID_UAT
ValueDefinition.Description: ID for Connect Overlay etc. aka Package ID

ValueDefinition.Name: UplayShopProductID_PROD
ValueDefinition.Description: ID for Connect Overlay etc. aka Package ID

ValueDefinition.Name: XBSShopProductID
ValueDefinition.Description: XBS shop ID can be same as the ownership ID

ValueDefinition.Name: PS5ShopProductID
ValueDefinition.Description: PS5 shop ID can be same as ownership ID

ValueDefinition.Name: UplayRewardPoints
ValueDefinition.Description: unlocking this reward costs Uplay Points (value is only for ingame UI, does not change the real balancing)

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandSizes
ValueDefinition.Description: size of place holders on a template map, needs to be multiple of 16

ValueDefinition.Name: RecipeUnlockConditionText
ValueDefinition.Description: Unlock hint text that will be used if the OptionalUnlockAsset is either not set or not unlocked.

ValueDefinition.Name: RecipeUnlockConditionTextOptional
ValueDefinition.Description: If an OptionalUnlockAsset is set and is unlocked this text will be shown.

ValueDefinition.Name: OptionalUnlockAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: Asset that needs to be unlocked to use the Optional Unlock Text

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductivityDeltaSpeedPos
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the speed of positive saturation changes in percent per second

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductivityDeltaSpeedNeg
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the speed of negative saturation changes in percent per second

ValueDefinition.Name: StartOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of population of population level on island needed to activate metropolis factor

ValueDefinition.Name: Interval
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of additional employees for next tax interval

ValueDefinition.Name: IntervalIncreasePercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: percentile increase of interval per interval (e.g. 10%, to make it 1.100 investors for the second interval)

ValueDefinition.Name: EffectPerInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of tax cuts for each interval (e.g. 1%)

ValueDefinition.Name: EffectIncrease
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of increase for each additional threshold reached (e.g. +0,5%)

ValueDefinition.Name: EffectMaximum
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum effect strength

ValueDefinition.Name: WorkforceThresholdInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the threshold of the notification. 10 means the user is missing 10% of his currently available workforce e.g. has 700 farmer but more than 770 needed

ValueDefinition.Name: EmergencyWorkforceThresholdPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the threshold of the emergency notification. This is the same as the regular notification but will ignore the configured intervals and max triggers. 10 means the user is missing 10% of his currently available workforce e.g. has 700 farmer but more than 770 needed

ValueDefinition.Name: Interval
ValueDefinition.Description: Required duration of WorkforceThresholdInPercent to be true before the notification is triggered

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxTriggers
ValueDefinition.Description: How often does this notification will be triggered at most (when workforce becomes stable, this counter gets resetted)

ValueDefinition.Name: AreaProductShortageNotifications
ValueDefinition.Description: Note: Since there was no use anymore the code for this is currently commented out. Talk to swenz if you want to reactivate it. Notifications that can trigger when the storage amount for a product falls below a certain threshold on an island

ValueDefinition.Name: Product
ValueDefinition.Description: The product we want to check to trigger the notification

ValueDefinition.Name: Notification
ValueDefinition.Description: The notification asset

ValueDefinition.Name: ExcludedRegions
ValueDefinition.Description: The notification will not be triggered if the area is in one of this regions

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount af goods the storage has to fall below to trigger the notification

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlyTriggerWhenTrendIsNegative
ValueDefinition.Description: Determines if the notification should only be triggered when the current trend for the product is negative

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredBuildingOnIsland
ValueDefinition.Description: Triggers only if at least one of this buildings is on the island

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableMaintenance
ValueDefinition.Description: Building and Ship maintenance can be disabled for scenarios

ValueDefinition.Name: SaturationTrackingDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the time interval that is looked at for calculating the consumption saturation

ValueDefinition.Name: SaturationDeltaSpeedPos
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the speed of positive saturation changes in percent per second

ValueDefinition.Name: SaturationDeltaSpeedNeg
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the speed of negative saturation changes in percent per second

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredPopulation
ValueDefinition.Description: The City Status is reached if one of these population counts have been reached

ValueDefinition.Name: Products
FuelProduct
ValueDefinition.Description: which product can be used as fuel

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductionTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long does 1t of this product activate a production
For Vanilla, only the first entry is used!

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionAreaSizes
MaxTiles
ValueDefinition.Description: up to which amount of tiles is a construction area considered to be this size?

ValueDefinition.Name: LandTaxPerRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: When owning an island of this size, how many land tax has to be paid per minute?

ValueDefinition.Name: SettlementRightsCost
ValueDefinition.Description: how many settlement rights are needed for a construction area of this size?
oder from low to high amount of tiles

ValueDefinition.Name: ScalingCosts
Product
ValueDefinition.Description: Product that can be bought with rising costs

ValueDefinition.Name: BaseCost
ValueDefinition.Description: Cost of first product

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalCost
ValueDefinition.Description: Cost of one product is BaseCost * AdditionalCost^BoughtCount

ValueDefinition.Name: LastScalingNr
ValueDefinition.Description: Which is the last product number with rising costs?
Products that have rising costs (e.g. settlement rights)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxTransporterLoadingTimesFallback
ValueDefinition.Description: Used as a MaxLoading time. If calculated loading time would be longer than this or invalid, because of no loading speed (caused by effects) this fallback will be used,

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount consumed per cycle

ValueDefinition.Name: StorageAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum stored amount, excluding anything currently being consumed.

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: The amount produced at the end of each cycle.

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedsFuelInput
ValueDefinition.Description: A production cycle can only start if enough fuel is present

ValueDefinition.Name: FuelStorageAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum stored amount, excluding anything currently being consumed.

ValueDefinition.Name: CycleTime
ValueDefinition.Description: processing time in seconds

ValueDefinition.Name: BaseProductivity
ValueDefinition.Description: Productivity in %

ValueDefinition.Name: OutputAmountFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor on amount of all output goods

ValueDefinition.Name: IsMainFactory
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for calculating good export values. When setting this to true, the space, workforce and region of this factory will be used for the calculations

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandProductivityFactors
BuildingOnIsland
ValueDefinition.Description: which building has an effect on the productivity

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductivityFactorPerBuilding
ValueDefinition.Description: per building built on this island the productivity factor is increased
productivity of unique factories can scale by a different building count

ValueDefinition.Name: TeleportProducedGoodsIntoAreaStorage
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the produced goods are teleported to the area storage immediately and will not be transported via carts

ValueDefinition.Name: OverrideMaxTransporterRange
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the configured max transporter range is used instead of the calculated one

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxTransporterRange
ValueDefinition.Description: Is used to overwrite calculated transporter Range for this building if "OverrideMaxTransporterRange" is set to true

ValueDefinition.Name: TransporterRangeEffectivePercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: Percentage of the MaxTransporterRange (calculated or overwritten by the OverrideMaxTransporterRange Attribute) that is actually used by the factory in game. Buffs can then increase this number up to 100 (the actual maximum).

ValueDefinition.Name: WaterFertility
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this fertility is considered to be in the water. If false, the fertility is on the land. This has no impact on gameplay but is used in the UI

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedsSlot
ValueDefinition.Description: a fertility is only allowed to be present on an island if there is a slot of this type

Property.Name: FreeAreaProductivity
Property.Description: Lumberjacks have reduced productivity if they do not have enough free forest area in their influence

ValueDefinition.Name: InfluenceRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Be careful with high values, this has impact on performance

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededArea
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of tiles needed 10 have 100% productivity. Lumberjacks have reduced productivity if they do not have enough free forest area in their influence

ValueDefinition.Name: MinProductivityFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: if there is no free space, this productivity factor is used

ValueDefinition.Name: FreeAreaType
ValueDefinition.Description: only FreeAreas of same type have influence on each other (sharing overlapping tiles)

ValueDefinition.Name: CutTree
ValueDefinition.Description: Feedbackunit cut its trees or shows collect feedback

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalTreePropPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: how many trees should show the AdditionalTreeProp

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalTreeProp
ValueDefinition.Description: Prop that is shown at tree when a collector is working

ValueDefinition.Name: HideGrassInRange
ValueDefinition.Description: After destroying the building, the grass gets restored

Property.Name: IrrigationSource
Property.Description: If Set, lets the BuildBlocker Area act as a source/sink. E.g. if SourceBig is chosen, it acts as a river.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsSourceForPiping
ValueDefinition.Description: Can Fertilize-Pipes (e.g. Canal) be connected to this building to pipe Fertilization (e.g. Irrigation)?

ValueDefinition.Name: PipeFillCapacity
ValueDefinition.Description: How many pipes can this Source fill

ValueDefinition.Name: CanBeFilledDynamically
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the capacity can be increased dynamically by events

ValueDefinition.Name: LoadingSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Transporter loading / unloading speed in tons / second

ValueDefinition.Name: PathLayers
ValueDefinition.Description: connection in these layers are interesting for the building

ValueDefinition.Name: ResetOnGUIDChange
ValueDefinition.Description: If true the object will do a full cleanup of transporters and storage on guid change

ValueDefinition.Name: HideTransportersBeforeTheyMove
ValueDefinition.Description: Initially transporters are not visible

ValueDefinition.Name: ShutdownThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: if delta maintenance saturation is below this threshold, the building pauses automatically

ValueDefinition.Name: PerUnitLengths
ValueDefinition.Description: Divides the maintenance amount by this value, so that there is a maintance per X amount of units.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaintenanceAmountFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Base Value for maintenance upgrades

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsumerPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: Priority of demands coming from this consumer. Only applies to delta products. Highest value has highest priority and will always be served before low prio.

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsumerPriorityAlarmed
ValueDefinition.Description: Priority of demands coming from this consumer when alarm is active. Only applies to delta products. Value needs to be > ConsumerPriority if alarm should work

ValueDefinition.Name: WorkforceAmountFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Base value for workforce upgrades

ValueDefinition.Name: WorkforceDeficitBuffs
ValueDefinition.Description: if workforce percentage is lower than availableWorkforce, Buff is applied. Start vector with lowest available workforce = worst buff

ValueDefinition.Name: EncampedUnitScalingFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Any maintenance will be multiplied with this value if this asset is an encamped unit

ValueDefinition.Name: ConnectedWorkforce
ValueDefinition.Description: The kind of workforce that is linked to this population level and will be generated by it

ValueDefinition.Name: MoodText
ValueDefinition.Description: Text that is shown in the residence object menu

ValueDefinition.Name: PopulationTier
ValueDefinition.Description: tier 1 can be build from build menu, higher tiers are upgraded. There can be multiple population levels with same tier in a province

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: Category name

ValueDefinition.Name: IsAbstract
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, this product is never represented in the game world as a physical object. Public Services use these.

ValueDefinition.Name: PathLayer
ValueDefinition.Description: Which path planner layer is used to transport this product

ValueDefinition.Name: IsStrategicResource
ValueDefinition.Description: Strategic resources can not be transported on a normal ship, unless the FixedSlotContent in the itemcontainer points on a strategic resource

ValueDefinition.Name: AssociatedRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: Not Producing regions! Can also be consuming regions. Is used for Statistic Screen

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededAttractiveness
ValueDefinition.Description: a bus need that is supplied by a culture building is only fully supplied if the building has at least this attractiveness

ValueDefinition.Name: ProductionRegions
ValueDefinition.Description: Regions in which this product can be produced (not considering item effects). Used for RecipeBookUI and TradRouteUI

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockTransfer
ValueDefinition.Description: Block slots for user interaction (drag/dump/transfer)

ValueDefinition.Name: HighscoreValueModifier
ValueDefinition.Description: If no factory produces this product, this value can be used to manually modify the highscore of this product. The Highscore Value is then calcualted: BasePrice * GlobalModifier * ProductModifier

ValueDefinition.Name: HideInUI
ValueDefinition.Description: This product should not be visible in UI

ValueDefinition.Name: FunctionDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: used in object menu

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedsList
NeedConsumptionRate
ValueDefinition.Description: Consumption rate of this good for the whole residence in tons per minute
Links to all needs of this residence

ValueDefinition.Name: MinDecayHitpoints
ValueDefinition.Description: an abandoned residence looses health to this level

ValueDefinition.Name: DecayHitpointsPerSecond
ValueDefinition.Description: rate in which abandoned residences loose hitpoints

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeBeforeDecay
ValueDefinition.Description: Decay timer starts after abandoning residence

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeBeforeDecayNewlyBuilt
ValueDefinition.Description: Decay timer starts after residence stays empty after building it

ValueDefinition.Name: StorageMin
ValueDefinition.Description: Storage when in ruin state

ValueDefinition.Name: OverflowFlotsam
