ValueDefinition.Description: Configuration of flotsam generation when this building is destroyed and storage amount now exceeds storage capacity.

ValueDefinition.Name: OverflowSpawnPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: Of all the products that are overflowing, take only a percentage of them for flotsam. Example: 10 products overflowing, 10% percentage, results in one flotsam crate.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxFlotsamCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum number of spawned flotsam crates. Do not increase too much, will clutter the harbour.

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Base time interval for incident schedulers for incidents to happen on this city level

ValueDefinition.Name: AssemblySeatPrice
ValueDefinition.Description: Price per Seat

ValueDefinition.Name: AttributeEffectsRoman
ValueDefinition.Description: This city status attribute effect if it is fully roman (romanization value 1.0)

ValueDefinition.Name: AttributeEffectsMixed
ValueDefinition.Description: This city status attribute effect if it is evenly mixed (romanization value 0.5)

ValueDefinition.Name: AttributeEffectsRegional
ValueDefinition.Description: This city status attribute effect if it is fully regional (romanization value 0.0)

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedAttributeUpperBound
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum need attribute value for this pool to be used. Included in range

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedAttributeLowerBound
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum need attribute value for this pool to be used. Not included in range

ValueDefinition.Name: RivalGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: this group is used when starting an incident for a Rival

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowWarning
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the infotip will display the text of this range as warning

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentPamsyContext
ValueDefinition.Description: An asset used as context to fire the correct pamsy message when clicking a infected residence building.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinorIncidentRangeDescriptionText
ValueDefinition.Description: {} will be replaced by the actual building amount

ValueDefinition.Name: MajorIncidentRangeDescriptionText
ValueDefinition.Description: {} will be replaced by the max infected buildings at once

ValueDefinition.Name: MinAttributeIntervalFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Clamping Value that limits the factor by which Island Attributes can shorten or extend the Interval lengths at most

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxAttributeIntervalFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Clamping Value that limits the factor by which Island Attributes can shorten or extend the Interval lengths at most

ValueDefinition.Name: SchedulerUpdateInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Interval in which the incident schedulers will update the current scheduler intervals

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxDistanceToPreviousTriggerRatio
ValueDefinition.Description: Trigger ratio of a scheduler can only appear in this range compared to previous trigger ratio. Like if previous trigger was at 0.2 and this value is 0.5, then the trigger can only be in range of 0 - 0.7.

ValueDefinition.Name: ImmunityDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long should an infectable object stay immune after an infection on it stopped

ValueDefinition.Name: Colors
HeatThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: If the heat value for this incident type is below or equal this threshold this color will be used on the heatmap
Thresholds for colors to be used in the heat map. Make sure, that the entries are in increasing threshold order!!

ValueDefinition.Name: CanRepairRuins
ValueDefinition.Description: If a resolver unit of this type is generally able to able to repair ruins

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredTechUnlock
ValueDefinition.Description: If unit is able to repair units this tech needs to be unlocked first. If no tech is configured here it can be per default (if "CanRepairRuins" is set)

ValueDefinition.Name: Enabled
ValueDefinition.Description: Should the mirage effect on burning objects be enabled

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxCameraHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: If the camera is above this height the effect will always be disabled

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxCameraDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: How far is a fire source allowed to be away from the camera position to be considered for the effect

ValueDefinition.Name: CroppedScreenBorderXInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: Screen border on the X axis in which objects are not considered for the effect (we might only want to trigger it if it is somewhat centered on the screen)

ValueDefinition.Name: CroppedScreenBorderYInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: Screen border on the Y axis in which objects are not considered for the effect (we might only want to trigger it if it is somewhat centered on the screen)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinAffectedTilesRequired
ValueDefinition.Description: How many tiles minumum have to be covered by burning things to trigger the effect

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxIntensityTilesRequired
ValueDefinition.Description: How many tiles need to be covered by fire to reach the effects max intensity

ValueDefinition.Name: MinEffectIntensity
ValueDefinition.Description: Effect Intensity when the MinAffectedTilesRequired is reached

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxEffectIntensity
ValueDefinition.Description: Effect Intensity when MaxIntensityTilesRequired is reached

ValueDefinition.Name: BurstVfXCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: How much time to we want to have between 2 visual burst effects so they are triggered as separate visual. If multipl bursts happen in less than this time only the first burst will trigger a visual effect

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: When the need attribute related to this incident is below or equal to this threshold we will send out a notification

ValueDefinition.Name: DamageUnitsRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: The radius around infected buildings in which units take damage

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxInfectionsAtOnce
ValueDefinition.Description: How many objects can be infected at the same time max. 0 = unlimited

ValueDefinition.Name: ForceInitialBurst
ValueDefinition.Description: If the incident triggers an inital burst. If the incident has a start duration it will be triggered once escalated, otherwise it will trigger on the inital infection.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinInitalBurstInfections
ValueDefinition.Description: If ForceInitialBurst is set we try to infect at least that amount of objects with the initial burst. It will ignore the InfectionChance (if not 0) and MaxInfectionsPerBurst. If 0, then the regular infection rules will apply.

ValueDefinition.Name: StarterObjects
ValueDefinition.Description: Objects it is valid to start this incident on

ValueDefinition.Name: Weights
ValueDefinition.Description: Describes how likely this incident is chosen compared to other ones

ValueDefinition.Name: EscalationEffects
ValueDefinition.Description: Effects that are applied once the incident escalates

ValueDefinition.Name: StartDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Time after which an incidents switches from "started" to "escalated" state.

ValueDefinition.Name: EscalationDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Time after which an incidents switches from "escalated" to "de-escalated" state.

ValueDefinition.Name: MusicType
ValueDefinition.Description: The type of music that should be triggered by this incident

ValueDefinition.Name: CounterMeasuerGovernorDecisionsPool
ValueDefinition.Description: A QuestPool of Governor Decisions, which are used to counter the incident. One of those gets selected when the incident escalates. The pool will check preconditions! Make sure the pool is not empty, is not a global pool and idealy there should be always one decision without preconditions.

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestStoryLine
ValueDefinition.Description: A quest storyline that is started once the major incidents escalates

ValueDefinition.Name: QuestStoryLine_Rivals
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as QuestStoryLine but started for the player when a Rival has an incident

ValueDefinition.Name: Notification
InitNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: Notification that is triggered on incident start if no resolver building is in range

ValueDefinition.Name: InitNotificationSilent
ValueDefinition.Description: Notification that is triggered on incident start if any resolver building is in range

ValueDefinition.Name: OutOfRangeNotification
ValueDefinition.Description: Notification that is triggered during an incident if a newly infected object is not in resolver range and has not triggered the InitNotification before
Notification this incident will trigger manually (inluding information like area etc)

ValueDefinition.Name: DamageUnits
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this incident damages units that are close to infected buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: DamageUnitsEvery
ValueDefinition.Description: Units are damaged every n milliseconds, where n is this value

ValueDefinition.Name: DamageUnitsPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: Everytime units are damaged, they received this percentage of their maximum health as damage

ValueDefinition.Name: PickRandomCFG
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, only one of the provided CFGs will be chosen at random. If false, all CFGs will be spawned together at the same position

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ScaleWithObjectSize
ValueDefinition.Description: If true we will scale with the objects size and interpret the values for min and max as reference for a 3x3 building
How many of these CFGs should be spawned per building. Min and Max are included in the range

ValueDefinition.Name: MinDummyHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: If > 0 the dummy must have at least that local height before it is considered used

ValueDefinition.Name: SpawnBlockSize
ValueDefinition.Description: size of the blocks in which the building is divided in order to spawn effects (one effect per block). If set to zero, one block with the size of the building will be used

ValueDefinition.Name: RandomBoundsPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: This shrinks the area where the effect is placed to prevent spawining on edges. If set to zero the effect will be centered

ValueDefinition.Name: HeightOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: This offsets the height of the placed effect based on the buildings bounding box. If set to zero the effect will be on the ground

ValueDefinition.Name: MoveOutInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: The interval the population of residences moves out when they are ill

ValueDefinition.Name: HeatValue
ValueDefinition.Description: Controls how likely the Object is to start an incident compared to others. 0 means this building can never be infected

ValueDefinition.Name: InfectionChance
ValueDefinition.Description: How likely this object is to be infected from neighbor incidents (Range 0 -1)

ValueDefinition.Name: BurstDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Limits how far the Object can spread its Infection to neighbours

ValueDefinition.Name: BurstCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Specifies how often the Object will attempt to spread its Infection after it reaches its BurstThresholdPercenage

ValueDefinition.Name: BurstThresholdPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: Bursts will only appear if the infected object is below the configured Hitpoints percentage

ValueDefinition.Name: ResistanceThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Limits at what amount of Hitpoints Infections stop to damage this building

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreBurstEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: when true, burst effects will not be spawned when this object spreads it's infection (e.g because farmfield should not trigger an explosion..)

Property.Name: IncidentResolver
Property.Description: The parameters starting with resolver_ configure the units which are send by default from the building to resolve incidents. The properties starting with special_ are responsible for the special forces which might be send by user action

ValueDefinition.Name: RuinRepairDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long does it take to repair ruins, when a resolver unit of this building repairs it (0 means units will not help to repair ruins at all)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxLowWorkforceResolveFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: The max amount of factor that is applied to resolve and ruin repair durations if workforce is lacking

ValueDefinition.Name: MobSizeIncreaseRate
ValueDefinition.Description: amount of people which join the protest mob for every additional infected building after the initial amount (so e.g. the mob spawns at 10 infected buildings and currently 13 are infected => 3 * thisValue additional riotors join the mob)

ValueDefinition.Name: MobInfectionTime
ValueDefinition.Description: the time the mob gathers around a not infected building before it gets infected (also the time a mob stays infront of an already infected building when idle moving)

ValueDefinition.Name: MobAvgInfectionTime
ValueDefinition.Description: The average time a mob tries to infect new buildings. This is never accurate as the mob has to move to the different buildings first.

ValueDefinition.Name: InfectedBuildingsSpawn
ValueDefinition.Description: when this amount of buildings is actively infected a new mob will spawn

ValueDefinition.Name: InfectedBuildingsDespawn
ValueDefinition.Description: after the mob was spawned it gets despawned when this amount of buildings is actively infected (this should be a smaller amount of buildings to make sure that a mob doesn't spawn and immediately despawns again)

ValueDefinition.Name: RiotMoveOutInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: The interval the population of residences moves out when they are rioting

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandWarFirstCheckPercentPoint
ValueDefinition.Description: During an island war, when morale drops below this threshold [0..100] a first additional riot check is executed.

ValueDefinition.Name: IslandWarAdditionalCheckCount
ValueDefinition.Description: After the IslandWarFristCheckPercentPoint is reached this amount of additional riot checks is executed on certain, evenly distributed morale percentages

ValueDefinition.Name: MobInfectFactors
ValueDefinition.Description: Modify the probability of different incidents getting triggered by the mob. Note this list contains all incidents even though the mob can only trigger a subset of them.

ValueDefinition.Name: Factor
ValueDefinition.Description: To determine which incident a mob should start at the target building the chances of that building are taken into account and one is chosen by weighted random. This factor changes the chance for this incident. Note: Not only the chances are taken into consideration but the incident limits as well so if the island limit is reached no new incident type can be started.

ValueDefinition.Name: Damage
ValueDefinition.Description: How much damage a building will get when infected with this incident

ValueDefinition.Name: MinDamagerTimerMS
ValueDefinition.Description: How often a building will get damage when infected with this incident (in milliseconds)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxDamageTimerMS
ValueDefinition.Description: How often a building will get damage when infected with this incident (in milliseconds)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumInfectionsPerBurst
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum buildings that can be infected per burst

ValueDefinition.Name: ReplacePropagatedInfection
ValueDefinition.Description: If a guid is set, bursts of this infection will spread the replacement infection instead

ValueDefinition.Name: RemovalInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Once the incidents destruction limit is reached, the building will stay infected for this time time

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentMurmur
ValueDefinition.Description: Murmur that will be added on infection

ValueDefinition.Name: IncidentSoundEmitter
ValueDefinition.Description: Soundemitter that will be triggered on infection

ValueDefinition.Name: LuckyRemovalChanceInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: If an incident has reached its destruction limit each burst trigger instead tries to roll for lucky removal chance to see if its infection should end

ValueDefinition.Name: SoundEnvironmentType
ValueDefinition.Description: If the object is infected it will replace its environement type by this one during the infection

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreImmunites
ValueDefinition.Description: If true object immunites are ignored. Used for forced incidents from Narrative or Trailers.

ValueDefinition.Name: BaseHealthUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Modifies the Maximum Hitpoints of the Attackable Object. Use 100 to increase by 100 HP. Use 100% to double. - { 15% / 35% / 60% / 100% }

ValueDefinition.Name: SelfHealUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [Attackable] Modifies the Attackable's Amount of Hitpoints regained per second, when damaged but not ruined. Use 1 to increase by 1 HP/increase. Use +100% to double. - { 50% / 100% / 150% / 200% }

ValueDefinition.Name: SelfHealPausedTimeIfAttackedUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [Attackable] Modifies the Time before the Attackable starts its SelfHeal process. ~CurrentlyUnused

ValueDefinition.Name: PassiveRuinRepairSpeedUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [Attackable] Modifies the Attackable's Ruin Repair Time. Use +1 to increase by 1 Second. Use +100% to double. ~CurrentlyUnused (ISSUE: Values do not work as expected, why?)

ValueDefinition.Name: EncampedUnitSelfHealMultiplierUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [Encampments] How much the SelHealSpeed while encamped is increased. ~ { 50% / 100% / 150% / 200% } -CHECK

ValueDefinition.Name: SourceCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: A category describing where this buff comes from

ValueDefinition.Name: ShouldBeShownInForeignObjectMenu
ValueDefinition.Description: If true this buff will be shown in the foreign object menu when selecting AI / other players.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsStackable
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is true the buff can be applied multiple times on the same object. If false only one buff with the same GUID can be active on a building at the same time

ValueDefinition.Name: BlocksOtherBuffs
BlockedBuff
ValueDefinition.Description: Another buff that will not be active even if it is applied at the same time
A list of buffs that will be blocked from activation if this buff applied.

ValueDefinition.Name: AddedInfolayer
ValueDefinition.Description: If the buff is active on a object it will show this infolayer.

ValueDefinition.Name: BuildingDecoration
ValueDefinition.Description: affected Buildings are decorated using this configuration. If multiple item effects provide decoration only the first one is used.

ValueDefinition.Name: UiPriority
ValueDefinition.Description: The highest priority buffs will be shown first in the UI

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalFunctionalEffect
ValueDefinition.Description: Adds another functional effect on target buildings, should use same scope and targets as base functional effect!

ValueDefinition.Name: AttributeModifierInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: modifies all need attribute outputs

ValueDefinition.Name: WorkforceModifierInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: How much the workforce output should increase in percent. (0 = no increase, 100 = double the workforce, etc.)

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalWorkforces
ValueDefinition.Description: population generates the same amount of workforce for other workforce types

ValueDefinition.Name: AddDeltas
ValueDefinition.Description: Makes the Building a Producer of the Product. Requires Distribution Property.

ValueDefinition.Name: ForceProductSameAsFactoryOutput
ValueDefinition.Description: When this is set, the set product will be ignored and the output good of the affected factory will be used instead.

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalOutputCycle
ValueDefinition.Description: The Nth cycle will produce the specified good. Use "1" for every cycle, "2" for every second, etc.

ValueDefinition.Name: Amount
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount by which the input of the factory should be changed. Multiple upgrades get summed up first, then applied. Amount here can be negative. The total input amount can not be negative.

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededAreaUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: changes the tolerance of free area buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: CanUseMarsh
ValueDefinition.Description: free area building can now use marsh tiles even if their free area type normally requires land

ValueDefinition.Name: CanUseForest
ValueDefinition.Description: free area building can now use forest tiles even if their free area type normally requires meadow or marsh

ValueDefinition.Name: CanUseMeadow
ValueDefinition.Description: free area building can now use meadow tiles even if their free area type normally requires forest or marsh (will plant trees if normal type is forest)

ValueDefinition.Name: FuelDurationPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: 100 doubles the efficiency of fuel

ValueDefinition.Name: InfluenceRadiusUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: if NeededArea is a Percental, this is a debuff! Resulting radius is hard limited by 20

ValueDefinition.Name: SocketCountUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [Guesthouses] How many Specialist Sockets are added. ~ { - / - / 1 / 2 }

ValueDefinition.Name: SlotCountUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [Ships] How many Cargo Slots are added. ~ { - / 1 / 2 / 3 }

ValueDefinition.Name: ModuleLimitPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: can only be positive and increases the productivity if new limit is fulfilled

ValueDefinition.Name: GenProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: How probable is it that an additional good gets generated (0-100)

ValueDefinition.Name: PierSpeedUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: tons per second, should affect pier and kotors

ValueDefinition.Name: HealRadiusUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Increases the Repair Radius by ~ { 25% / 50% / 75% / 100% }

ValueDefinition.Name: HealPerMinuteUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Modifies the Speed at which Ships are repaired. ~ { 25% / 50% / 75% / 100% }

ValueDefinition.Name: HealBuildingsPerMinuteUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Modifies the Speed at which Ships are repaired. ~ { 25% / 50% / 75% / 100% }

ValueDefinition.Name: ProvidedNeedUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Saturation of public service need ProvidedNeed is always at 100%

ValueDefinition.Name: ProvidedNeed
ValueDefinition.Description: only public service needs are allowed

ValueDefinition.Name: GoodConsumptionUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Reduces the need for a specific good by X%

ValueDefinition.Name: AmountInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: The corresponding PopulationInput value in the Population Level is affected by this value. Meaning the max required input is reduced and therefore it's not displayed in the UI. Only negative Amounts are allowed

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsumptionModifierInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: Modifies the consumption rate of ALL needs of the building (does NOT affect saturation)

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedProvidedNeedAttributes
ProvidedProduct
ValueDefinition.Description: which need has to be provided?

ValueDefinition.Name: AmountOrPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: value is either absolute or relative to base attribute of provided need
need attributes are only modified, if the ProvidedNeed is available

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionCostInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: How much the construction costs should increase in percent. (-100 = fee, 0 = no increase, 100 = double the cost, etc.)

ValueDefinition.Name: ConstructionSpeedInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: How much the construction speed should increase in percent. (-50 = half speed -> double time, 0 = no increase, 100 = twice as fast -> half the time, etc.)

ValueDefinition.Name: RecruitmentCostInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: same as ConstructionCostInPercent, but shows text for troops in buff infoptip

ValueDefinition.Name: RecruitmentSpeedInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: same as ConstructionSpeedInPercent, but shows text for troops in buff infoptip

ValueDefinition.Name: OnlyBuffSingleAssemblyOption
ValueDefinition.Description: if set to something != 0, cost and speed buffs only effect the recruitment of this unit

ValueDefinition.Name: ReplaceAssemblyOptions
ValueDefinition.Description: Replaces assembly options in the construction menu of a shipyard

ValueDefinition.Name: AddAssemblyOptions
ValueDefinition.Description: Adds new assembly options to the construction menu of a shipyard

ValueDefinition.Name: ActiveTradePriceInPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: [Ships] How much discount the player gets when trading. 80 would be -20%. (effectively 120 would mean the product costs 20% extra). ~ { 95 / 90 / 85 / 80 }

ValueDefinition.Name: LoadingSpeedUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [ShipsOnRoute] Actual Loading Speed consists of two factors: Loading speed of LoadingPier of building and Loading speed of trade route ship. ~ { 25% / 50% / 75% / 100% }

ValueDefinition.Name: ActivateWhiteFlag
ValueDefinition.Description: Activates white flag. The ship can not attack and can not be attacked by others (only hijacked or plundered). ~CurrentlyUnused

ValueDefinition.Name: ActivatePirateFlag
ValueDefinition.Description: Activates Assassin's Creed Black Flag mode that lets your ship attack ships with whose owner you're not at war with. ~CurrentlyUnused

Property.Name: Buffable

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultBuffGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: The guid of the default buff. Will be applied automatically to the object

Property.Description: object can be buffed

ValueDefinition.Name: BonusAttributes
ValueOrPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: The Attribute score added or removed. (+100% doubles the base value)
Modifies the final Balance of the Need Attribute for this Area

ValueDefinition.Name: SettlementRightsCostIncreasePercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: Changes the cost of buying settlement rights with money. This way takeover and setlling on islands can be made cheaper/more expensive. 0 = same cost as normal, 100 = double the cost, 20 = 20% more costs

ValueDefinition.Name: AddedAreaFertility
ValueDefinition.Description: Adds the Fertility to this Area. (Currently Broken)

ValueDefinition.Name: FactoryRangePercentageUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: Buffs the economy (cart) range of all factories on this island by X%

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffBaseSpeedUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 100] [Units] Additional movement speed in percentage - { 5% / 10% / 15% / 20% }

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffReduceCargoImpactUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 100] [Ships] By how much the impact of cargo on movement speed is reduced. ~ { 20 / 40 / 60 / 80 }

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffReduceDamageImpactUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 100] [Ships] By how much the impact of dmage on movement speed is reduced. ~ { 20 / 40 / 60 / 80 }

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffReduceNegativeWindImpactUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 100] [Ships] By how much the negative impact of wind on movement speed is reduced. ~ { 20 / 40 / 60 / 80 }

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffReducePositiveWindImpactUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 100] [Ships] By how much the positive impact of wind on movement speed is reduced. ~CurrentlyUnused

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffFavorableWindAngle
ValueDefinition.Description: [Ships] How much the cone increases, in which the Ship benefits from Wind direction. ~ { 15 / 25 / 35 / 45 }

ValueDefinition.Name: BuffTransferSpeedUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 100] [Ships] Additional Session Transfer speed in percentage. ~ { 10 / 20 / 35 / 50 }

ValueDefinition.Name: MaintenanceFactorUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [All] Modifies the Maintenance. Only percentage values supported! (Example: use 100% to double the maintenance costs) ~ { -40% / -60% / -80% / -100% }

ValueDefinition.Name: WorkforceMaintenanceFactorUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [All] Modifies the Workforce Maintenance. Only percentage values supported! (Example: use 100% to double the workforce costs) ~ { -25% / -50% / -75% / -100% }

ValueDefinition.Name: ReplaceWorkforce
ValueDefinition.Description: Overrides the consumed Workforce Type

ValueDefinition.Name: EncampedUnitScalingFactorUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [Troops] How much the Maintenance reduction while encamped is increased. Absolute value added to scaling factor (default is 0.5) ~ { 0.1 / 0.2 / 0.3 / 0.4 }

ValueDefinition.Name: PassiveTradeProfitModifier
ValueDefinition.Description: 25 means the player gains 25% increased money for selling goods passively to the AI. (Only works for AI passive trades and the money will be generated from nothing, so the prices of the goods are not actually increased)

ValueDefinition.Name: SoldAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: for every given amount of the SoldProduct sold in one transaction, the RewardAmount of RewardProduct is generated

ValueDefinition.Name: RadiusDistanceCalculation
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how the radius effect range is calculated. If default it will use the distance configured, if something else the code will overwrite the distance accordingly.

ValueDefinition.Name: RadiusDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: The distance used for radius effects with this object as source.

ValueDefinition.Name: StreetDistanceCalculation
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how the street effect range is calculated. If default it will use the distance configured, if something else the code will overwrite the distance accordingly.

ValueDefinition.Name: StreetDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: The distance used for street effects with this object as source.

ValueDefinition.Name: AqueductConsumedWaterUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: affects AqueductConsumer

ValueDefinition.Name: AqueductWaterSupplyUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: affects AqueductBuildings (basins)

ValueDefinition.Name: DiscoveryRadiusUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [Ships] How much of the covered Map is uncovered by this Ship. ~ { 50% / 100% / 150% / 200% }

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardMoneyPerDestroyedBuildingUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [All] Money rewarded if this Unit deals the finishing blow on a Building. ~ { 10 / 20 / 35 / 50 }

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardMoneyPerDestroyedShipUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [All] Money rewarded if this Unit deals the finishing blow on a Ship. ~ { 500 / 1000 / 1500 / 2000 }

ValueDefinition.Name: DefenseUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [Troops] Value will be added on absolute terms to DefenseValue of elements of the troop. ~ { 1 / 2 / 3 / 4 }

ValueDefinition.Name: ArmorUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [Troops] Value will be added on absolute terms to ArmorValue of elements of the troop. ~ { 1 / 2 / 3 / 4 }

ValueDefinition.Name: ShieldUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [Troops] Value will be added on absolute terms to ShieldValue of elements of the troop

ValueDefinition.Name: AccuracyUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [All] Value will be added on absolute terms to the accuracy value of the elements of the unit. Since the accruacy is already a percentage, a "+5 (absolute)" here means "5% more accurate" ~ { 10 / 15 / 20 / 30 }

ValueDefinition.Name: AccuracyArcherModuleUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [ArcherModule] Value will be added on absolute terms to the accuracy value of the elements of the unit. Since the accruacy is already a percentage, a "+5 (absolute)" here means "5% more accurate". ~ { 10 / 15 / 20 / 30 }

ValueDefinition.Name: AccuracyCatapultModuleUpgrage
ValueDefinition.Description: [CatapultModule] Value will be added on absolute terms to the accuracy value of the elements of the unit. Since the accruacy is already a percentage, a "+5 (absolute)" here means "5% more accurate" ~ { 10 / 15 / 20 / 30 }

ValueDefinition.Name: AccuracyBallistaModuleUpgrage
ValueDefinition.Description: [BallistaModule] Value will be added on absolute terms to the accuracy value of the elements of the unit. Since the accruacy is already a percentage, a "+5 (absolute)" here means "5% more accurate" ~ { 10 / 15 / 20 / 30 }

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceAttackRangePercentualUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [All] Value will be applied percentually to the attack ranged of ranged and torch attacks. A 5 here means "5% more attack range". ~ { 15 / 25 / 35 / 50 }

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceAttackRangeArcherModulePercentualUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [ArcherModule] Value will be applied percentually to the attack ranges of ranged and torch attacks. A 5 here means "5% more attack range". ~ { 10 / 20 / 35 / 50 }

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceAttackRangeCatapultModulePercentualUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [CatapultModule] Value will be applied percentually to the attack ranges of ranged attacks. A 5 here means "5% more attack range". ~ { 5 / 10 / 15 / 20 }

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceAttackRangeBallistaModulePercentualUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [BallistaModule] Value will be applied percentually to the attack ranges of ranged attacks. A 5 here means "5% more attack range". ~ { 10 / 15 / 25 / 35 }

ValueDefinition.Name: OffenseMeleeUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [Troops] Value will be added on absolute terms to melee offense value of elements of the troop. ~ { 1 / 2 / 3 / 4 }

ValueDefinition.Name: OffenseChargeUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [Troops] Value will be added on absolute terms to charge offense value of elements of the troop. ~ { 1 / 2 / 3 / 4 }

ValueDefinition.Name: OffenseRangedUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [Archer-, Slinger-, ChariotTroops] Value will be added on absolute terms to ranged offense value of elements of the unit.. ~ { 1 / 2 / 3 / 4 }

ValueDefinition.Name: OffenseArcherModuleRangedUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [ArcherModule] Value will be added on absolute terms to ranged offense value of archer module elements of the unit. ~ { 1 / 2 / 3 / 4 }

ValueDefinition.Name: OffenseCatapultModuleRangedUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [CatapultModule] Value will be added on absolute terms to ranged offense value of catapult module elements of the unit. ~ { 10 / 20 / 30 / 40 }

ValueDefinition.Name: OffenseBallistaModuleRangedUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [BallistaModule] Value will be added on absolute terms to ranged offense value of mallista module elements of the unit. ~ { 2 / 4 / 6 / 8 }

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackSpeedArcherModulePercentualUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [ArcherModule] Value applied percentually to the attack speed of ranged and torch attacks of the unit. A "+5" here means "Ranged & Torch attacks happen 5% faster/more often" ~ { 15 / 25 / 35 / 50 }

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackSpeedCatapultModulePercentualUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [CatapultModule] Value applied percentually to the attack speed of ranged attacks of the unit. A "+5" here means "Ranged attacks happen 5% faster/more often" ~ { 15 / 25 / 35 / 50 }

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackSpeedBallistaModulePercentualUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [BallistaModule] Value applied percentually to the attack speed of ranged attacks of the unit. A "+5" here means "Ranged attacks happen 5% faster/more often" ~ { 15 / 25 / 35 / 50 }

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackSpeedTorchPercentualUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [Infantry + ArcherModuleVsShips&Buildings] Value applied percentually to the attack speed of torch attacks of the troop. A "+5" here means "Torch attacks happen 5% faster/more often" ~ { 15 / 25 / 35 / 50 }

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackSpeedRangedPercentualUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [All - ArcherModuleVsShips&Buildings] Value applied percentually to the attack speed of ranged attacks of the troop. A "+5" here means "Ranged attacks happen 5% faster/more often" ~ { 15 / 25 / 35 / 50 }

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumMoraleUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [Troops] Added to the Morale. Default Morale is between 350 and 700. ~ { 50 / 150 / 250 / 350 }

ValueDefinition.Name: SellPriceFactorUpgrade
ValueDefinition.Description: [Ships] How much the players earns when selling this ship. ~CurrentlyUnused

ValueDefinition.Name: MinDistanceBetweenTowersBuff
ValueDefinition.Description: Reduces the min distance between towers by x%

Property.Name: Decimal

ValueDefinition.Name: DecimalPlaces
ValueDefinition.Description: How many decimal places you want to show?

ValueDefinition.Name: DecimalPlacesIfReduced
ValueDefinition.Description: How many decimal places you want to show, if the number has been reduced by a preceeding DigitLimit Rule

ValueDefinition.Name: Rounding
ValueDefinition.Description: How to round the decimal places that get cut off (1.15 -> 1.2)

ValueDefinition.Name: Reduction
ValueDefinition.Description: Remove trailing zeroes (1.10 -> 1.1)

Property.Description: Defines the decimal precision with an parameter. Applies different kinds of rounding

Property.Name: Localization
Property.Description: Formats the number using language dependent formatting (thousand and comma separators).

Property.Name: Sign
Property.Description: Forces a sign before the value

Property.Name: Absolute
Property.Description: Computes the absolute value

Property.Name: Invert
Property.Description: Inverts the value

Property.Name: Multiply

ValueDefinition.Name: Multiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: How much to multiply the the value by.

Property.Description: Multiplies the value by a given parameter

Property.Name: Time
Property.Description: Formats the given value as a time ISO: HH:MM:SS

Property.Name: Percentage
Property.Description: Multiplies the given value by 100 and adds a percent sign

Property.Name: AbsoluteColor
Property.Description: Colorizes the output based on the sign of the value. The colors are defined in T9 (GUID 140577)

Property.Name: DigitLimit

ValueDefinition.Name: Limit
ValueDefinition.Description: What the maximum number of digits you want to show is. This number includes integral and decimal places

Property.Description: Shortens values that are larger then a set limit by using short forms: (K = Thousand, M = Million, B = Billion).

Property.Name: Approx
Property.Description: Adds an Approximation prefix to the number

Property.Name: Round
Property.Description: Commonly used short version of Decimals(0, Round, No Reduction).

Property.Name: Duration
Property.Description: Formats the given value as a time duration with up to two most significat units

ValueDefinition.Name: GamepadModeOverrides
Original
ValueDefinition.Description: The text asset that should be overridden

ValueDefinition.Name: Override
ValueDefinition.Description: The text that overrides the original in case the gamepad mode is active
List of text overrides that occur when the gamepad mode gets active

ValueDefinition.Name: PlatformOverrides
Original
ValueDefinition.Description: The text asset that should be overridden

ValueDefinition.Name: XboxOverride
ValueDefinition.Description: The text that overrides the original in case the game is played on Xbox
List of text overrides depending on the platform

Property.Name: RatingAdjacentBlocks

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockLayoutTypes
ValueDefinition.Description: The BlockLayoutTypes which provide a bonus.

ValueDefinition.Name: CountOrnamentalBlocks
ValueDefinition.Description: If false ornamental blocks don't count towards a higher score. If true they do.

Property.Description: Adjacent Blocks = Good

Property.Name: RatingBlockRegularity
Property.Description: StreetsCrossings in Corners = Good

Property.Name: RatingBuildableWithinRadius
Property.Description: Coast / Buildable Tiles in Radius = Good

ValueDefinition.Name: _ZeroTo
ValueDefinition.Description: For every distance < this value the rating is 0. Between ZeroUntil to OneFrom the rating is interpolated.

ValueDefinition.Name: _OneFrom
ValueDefinition.Description: For values OneTo >= x >= OneFrom the rating is 1

ValueDefinition.Name: _ZeroFrom
ValueDefinition.Description: For every value > this value the rating is 0. Between OneTo to ZeroFrom the rating is interpolated.

ValueDefinition.Name: _DisableUpperBorders
ValueDefinition.Description: If you don't need the upper borders (e.g. for a range request like from distance 10 on everything is fine) check this bool.

ValueDefinition.Name: ValuesArePercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: e.g. for coastal points we want n coastal points independent of radius. for buildable tiles, we want p% of the whole area.

Property.Name: RatingCityBlockOverride
Property.Description: See Also: RatingOverwrittenBlocks. Gives a negative rating if a city block is overriden. The rating is even more negative the more public buildings are destroyed by this action (as they need to be rebuild and need to be able to reach the city buildings in the center)

Property.Name: RatingCompactness
Property.Description: Compounds only. Good Rating is given if the BoundingBox of the compound has equal width and height and has as few tiles as possible which don't belong to a compound element

Property.Name: RatingDistance
Property.Description: Rates the distance to a specific position

ValueDefinition.Name: ZeroTo
ValueDefinition.Description: For every distance < this value the rating is 0. Between ZeroUntil to OneFrom the rating is interpolated.

ValueDefinition.Name: OneFrom
ValueDefinition.Description: For values OneFrom <= x <= OneTo the rating is 1

ValueDefinition.Name: ZeroFrom
ValueDefinition.Description: For every value > this value the rating is 0. Between OneTo to ZeroFrom the rating is interpolated.

ValueDefinition.Name: DisableUpperBorders
ValueDefinition.Description: If you don't need the upper borders (e.g. for a range request like from distance 10 on everything is fine) check this bool.

ValueDefinition.Name: SquareScore
ValueDefinition.Description: If you want more resolution near 1 and consider everything below 0.5 "almost equally bad"

Property.Name: RatingFragmentation
Property.Description: Only for City Blocks: When placing this Building here, how many 3x3 blocks for residences do i lose?

Property.Name: RatingFreeAreaRatio
Property.Description: Ratio of Free (Forest/Marsh/Grass) tiles in BlockRect. This only works for requests of Blocks placed for FreeAreaBuildings

Property.Name: RatingFreeformInnerRatio
Property.Description: 0 = no static blocker within, 1 = only static blockers within. Depends on blockingPercentage within context (to avoid recalculation by FreeformFarmFields)

Property.Name: RatingFreeStanding
Property.Description: A lot of Free (Reserved_Block) to every side = Good

Property.Name: RatingHarborConnected
Property.Description: Position within connected harbor = Good

Property.Name: RatingHarborDefense
Property.Description: Only available for harbor defenses. Does This Harbor need more protection?

Property.Name: RatingHindersBlockExpansions
Property.Description: Not Hindering Any Block from Expansion = Good

Property.Name: RatingInsideTiles
Property.Description: Rates the AIFineGrid-TileStates inside the rect. ((Maybe sometimes the inner area is already filled with a preview state or something ...?))

Property.Name: RatingIsInRange
Property.Description: If this building/blockCenter is within the range of the nearest given RangeType-Building: Score = 1 otherwise Score = 0

Property.Name: RatingNearestBuilding
Property.Description: Checks Distance to nearest other Building within the same Block

ValueDefinition.Name: IgnoreFreeAreaProductivityBuildings
ValueDefinition.Description: Ignores FreeAreaProductivityBuildings when checking neighbor buildings

ValueDefinition.Name: NearIsGood
ValueDefinition.Description: True: Near = GoodScore. False: Near = Bad Score.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxDist
ValueDefinition.Description: Maps Score Distance [0,MaxDist] to score [0,1] (or [1,0] )

Property.Name: RatingNeighborTiles
Property.Description: Rates the neighbor FineGridTiles with the given score.

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredNeighborCategories
ValueDefinition.Description: Every set flag means: The associated Category needs to have atleast a count of 1 otherwise te whole try is cancelled.

Property.Name: RatingOverwrittenBlocks
Property.Description: Intersecting Existing Blocks = Bad. See Also: RatingCityBlockOverride.

Property.Name: RatingProductionChainProximity
Property.Description: Block: Near related production block = Good. Building: Related production in same block = Good, unrealted production in same block = Bad.

Property.Name: RatingProvideLogisticCoverage
Property.Description: How Many Not-Logistic-Connected-Buildings will this Warehouse connect?

Property.Name: RatingProvidePublicCoverage
Property.Description: How many Residences will i provide Public Service for?

Property.Name: RatingPublicCoverage
Property.Description: Use for resident buildings. This rates how much of the needs of this and upgraded stages are covered.

Property.Name: RatingPublicOverlap
Property.Description: Near Provider of same Public = Bad

Property.Name: RatingStreetPointsToWarehouse
Property.Description: The Additional-Street-Rect of our Place Try should point towards the next warehouse

Property.Name: RatingSubRect
Property.Description: A single placement try may consist of different elements. E.g. when placing a water building there is the rect of the building itself, the shippath and the water blocker which might all need to be rated differenty. Therefore if such rects are provided you may define a PlacementScore for such sub rects here.

Property.Name: RatingUseVolatileArea
Property.Description: Higher score if we have high overlap with volatile area (e.g. Colloseum Area). Only active, if the requesting building wants to be within volatile area.

Property.Name: RatingOverlapAreas

ValueDefinition.Name: OverlapAreaType
ValueDefinition.Description: Against which Type of area do we check

Property.Description: Usually, Discards due to overlaps already happen OUTSIDE of the scoring system for performance reasons. So this is only relevant for those buildings that are allowed to overlap.

ValueDefinition.Name: TakeoverForce
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of Resiliance that will be substracted per Update Interval

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockingImpact
ValueDefinition.Description: How much impact does a single diagonal / orthogonal blocked tile have on the decision of the cell direction

ValueDefinition.Name: BlockingDiagonalImpact
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as BlockingImpact but allows different balancing for diagonal cases

ValueDefinition.Name: CoastPointImpact
ValueDefinition.Description: How much impact does a single coast point direction have on the decision of the cell direction => if very high the coastline will be the main factor to decide the cell direction

ValueDefinition.Name: CoastPointDiagonalImpact
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as CoastPointImpact but allows different balancing for diagonal cases

ValueDefinition.Name: SlotImpact
ValueDefinition.Description: How much impact does a single river / mountain slot direction have on the decision of the cell direction. => if very high a single slot will decide the direction of the cell

ValueDefinition.Name: SlotDiagonalImpact
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as SlotImpact but allows different balancing for diagonal cases

ValueDefinition.Name: BlurKernelSize
ValueDefinition.Description: The undecided directions will be determined by applying a blur filter on the decided tiles. The size of the kernel can be defined here. 1 means it's 1 in every direction around the current cell (so the resulting matrix is 3x3)

ValueDefinition.Name: BlurBeforeAnyDecision
ValueDefinition.Description: If false cells which have sufficient direction preference (as defined with the MinImpact* attributes here) will fix their direction. Blur is applied afterwards to determine the undecided cell directions.

ValueDefinition.Name: MinImpactToConsider
ValueDefinition.Description: The summed impact in either direction needs to at least be as big as this value to be considered at all. Otherwise the cell will be marked undecided until deduced

ValueDefinition.Name: MinImpactDeltaToConsider
ValueDefinition.Description: The difference between both directions needs to at least this big to decide on a direction. Otherwise the cell will be marked undecided until deduced e.g. for a cell with diagonal impact = 10 orthogonal impact = 8 the cell will be marked as diagonal if this value is < 2 otherwise it will be marked undecided

ValueDefinition.Name: Rating
ValueDefinition.Description: Rating will always be in the range [0..1]

ValueDefinition.Name: RelativeWeight
ValueDefinition.Description: The relative weight of this subscore to the

ValueDefinition.Name: DiscardThresholdScore
ValueDefinition.Description: If this Subscore is below-or-equal the threshold the whole placement try will be discarded.

ValueDefinition.Name: Comment
ValueDefinition.Description: This is just to leave some notes about what this specific score is supposed to do it has no impact whatsoever on the game

ValueDefinition.Name: MovementFormationOrder
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the unit move order when multiple units are moving together towards a target

ValueDefinition.Name: MinDetourDistanceToBreach
ValueDefinition.Description: What is the minium distance of a detour from the optimal route for land AI to try to breach

ValueDefinition.Name: CasualtyCheckDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum distance between potential casualties and coast line center

ValueDefinition.Name: CoastTargetsCheckDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum distance between potential coast attack targets and coast line center

ValueDefinition.Name: MinRequiredAttackDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum Avail distance of coast targets, aka torch range

ValueDefinition.Name: RatingFactorMilitaryStrength
ValueDefinition.Description: Rating factor of military targets between coast line and invade target

ValueDefinition.Name: RatingFactorCoastTargetCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Rating factor of coast attack targets

ValueDefinition.Name: RatingFactorCasualtyMilitaryStrengthDelta
ValueDefinition.Description: Rating factor of coast casualties

ValueDefinition.Name: RatingMalusCutoffCoasts
ValueDefinition.Description: Absolute value added to the rating, if a coast is completely cut off from the target, e.g. in Albion

ValueDefinition.Name: CasualtyTrackingDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: How long should casualties be considered in ratings

ValueDefinition.Name: ConsideredCoastLineCount
ValueDefinition.Description: The AI sorts all coast lines by safety and randomly choses one of the safest ones, chosing any of the X safest coast lines, defined by this

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeBetweenCivilTargetUpdates
ValueDefinition.Description: After how much time do riot units discard their civil target and find a new one

ValueDefinition.Name: SkipCivilTargetsOnPath
ValueDefinition.Description: How many civil targets are skipped on their path when finding a new one

ValueDefinition.Name: ArtilleryOutrangePatience
ValueDefinition.Description: How long should units wait at artillery range before engaging in a battle with a disadvantage

ValueDefinition.Name: DefensiveRestrainThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Below which enemy cluster advantage should units on their own island stay at the closest defending building, when the enemy cluster has no artillery

ValueDefinition.Name: PreparationTime
ValueDefinition.Description: preparation time to fetch requested preparation goods

ValueDefinition.Name: EventDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: during this time, the event is running (visitors generate money) and at the end, rewards are generated

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededWorkforce
ValueDefinition.Description: workforce level 5

ValueDefinition.Name: NeededWorkforceAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: unlock threshold (event can only be started if the condition is currently fulfilled)

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxUsableWorkforceAmount
ValueDefinition.Description: This amount is used while preparation. Set to 0 if no GoodsReduction should be allowed

ValueDefinition.Name: SelectionText
ValueDefinition.Description: Investor response to selection of this event in monument event screen

ValueDefinition.Name: RunningText
ValueDefinition.Description: Investor text monument event screen while event is running

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardText
ValueDefinition.Description: Investor text monument event screen when event has finished

ValueDefinition.Name: PotentialEventReward
ValueDefinition.Description: Text and Icon is shown when chosing the monument event

ValueDefinition.Name: GoodsOrPool
ValueDefinition.Description: only Products or RewardPools containing Products are allowed as input for the preparation

ValueDefinition.Name: ShortSizeName
ValueDefinition.Description: the size of the event without the event name

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxGoodsReductionPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: Requested preparation goods can be reduced by this percentage with workforce (if MaxUsableWorkforceAmount is available)

ValueDefinition.Name: CommentatorTexts
ValueDefinition.Description: while event is running, visitors leave comments on the event

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: Commentator texts are added in a steady interval to fill the time until the next variation switch

ValueDefinition.Name: DialogGroup
ValueDefinition.Description: commentator dialog text is picked randomly from this group

ValueDefinition.Name: MonumentEventTypeSwitch
ValueDefinition.Description: When this event is running this switch is set for the monument object emitter in the switchgroup defined in the SessionSoundConfig

ValueDefinition.Name: CooldownAfterEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: After receiving the rewards of an event, this cooldown blocks events in the whole session for the hosting player

ValueDefinition.Name: IsBlockingEvent
ValueDefinition.Description: only one event can be active in a session per player

ValueDefinition.Name: MonumentVariations
VariationIndex
ValueDefinition.Description: variation of the monument is chosen randomly from this list

ValueDefinition.Name: MinDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: event sometimes changes variation, this happens randomly between MinDuration and MaxDuration (or forced by GovernorDecision)
which variations of the monument are allowed for this event? One of them is chosen randomly

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardEffectLevelMin
ValueDefinition.Description: finishing the event will increase the reward level to at least this reward level

ValueDefinition.Name: RewardEffectLevelMax
ValueDefinition.Description: finishing the event will increase the reward level to at max this reward level

ValueDefinition.Name: MinPreparationFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: This factor is applied to buff reward duration if no preparation goods are supplied in preparation phase (100% = preparation goods have no effect on buff duration)

ValueDefinition.Name: NeedsAqueductConnection
ValueDefinition.Description: does this event need water

ValueDefinition.Name: MinAqueductFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: this factor is applied to buff reward duration if no aqueduct connection is available in preparation and running phase (100%=aqueduct has no effect on buff duration)

ValueDefinition.Name: BannedByList
Asset
ValueDefinition.Description: If this asset is unlocked this monument event cannot be started!
A list of assets that block this event from being startable if one of the assets is unlocked.

ValueDefinition.Name: AlternativeDecisionPool
ValueDefinition.Description: When StoryDecisionPool cannot generate a decision (story has finished), this pool is used instead

ValueDefinition.Name: ForceVariation
ValueDefinition.Description: when governor decision triggers, this variation is started. Set to -1 to keep the current variation

ValueDefinition.Name: MinStartPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: When does the governor decision trigger? In percent of the EventDuration. A random value between MinStartPercent and MaxStartPercent is used

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalDecisionChance
ValueDefinition.Description: How likely is a second decision?

ValueDefinition.Name: PotentialCategoryReward
ValueDefinition.Description: Text and Icon is shown when chosing the monument event category

ValueDefinition.Name: CategoryBackground
ValueDefinition.Description: Categroy button shows this background image

ValueDefinition.Name: SizeSelectionBackground
ValueDefinition.Description: When selecting the size of the event, this background is shown

ValueDefinition.Name: Prerequisite
MinPreparationFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: how well prepared was the monument event (delivered goods)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinAqueductFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: How well was the aqueduct connection (in preparation and in running phase)
a previous commentor or a specific governor decision that happened in the same monument event

ValueDefinition.Name: RenderingConfig
ValueDefinition.Description: Color of the grid radius

ValueDefinition.Name: GridLineFadeoutStart
ValueDefinition.Description: The percentage of the length of minor grid lines, after which they start to fade out

ValueDefinition.Name: GridLineLengthMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: The length of minor grid lines will be multiplied with this value

ValueDefinition.Name: GridLineFadeoutStart
ValueDefinition.Description: The percentage of the length of major grid lines, after which they start to fade out

ValueDefinition.Name: GridLineLengthMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: The length of major grid lines will be multiplied with this value

ValueDefinition.Name: GridLineDepthBias
ValueDefinition.Description: The z-depth bias, that the grid lines are rendered with

ValueDefinition.Name: OutlineMinThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: The outlining ground line thickness in build mode will get closer to this value, if the camera is zoomed in

ValueDefinition.Name: OutlineMaxThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: The outlining ground line thickness in build mode will get closer to this value, if the camera is zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: OutlineTexture
ValueDefinition.Description: The outlining ground line in build mode will be rendered with this texture

ValueDefinition.Name: OutlineTextureScrollSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Animation speed of the outline texture

ValueDefinition.Name: OutlineDepthBias
ValueDefinition.Description: The z-depth bias, that the outlines are rendered with

ValueDefinition.Name: PrebuiltLineColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Line color of preview outlines of prebuilt objects, e.g. in street and railway build mode

ValueDefinition.Name: SingleTileCursorPath
ValueDefinition.Description: CFG that is rendered at the cursor position during module placement

ValueDefinition.Name: OutlineOffsetY
ValueDefinition.Description: Y Offset of the animated line during move mode

ValueDefinition.Name: GroundOutlineColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Color of the animated line on the ground during move mode

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoZoomOutBorder
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines an area, which is used to auto zoom out the camera automatically during module placement

ValueDefinition.Name: LeftBorderWidthAbs
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance to the left side of the screen in pixels

ValueDefinition.Name: RightBorderWidthAbs
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance to the right side of the screen in pixels

ValueDefinition.Name: TopBorderWidthAbs
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance to the top side of the screen in pixels

ValueDefinition.Name: BottomBorderWidthAbs
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance to the bottom side of the screen in pixels

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoZoomInBorder
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines an area, which is used to auto zoom in the camera automatically during module placement

ValueDefinition.Name: LeftBorderWidthPerc
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance to the left side of the zoom out area in percent

ValueDefinition.Name: RightBorderWidthPerc
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance to the right side of the zoom out area in percent

ValueDefinition.Name: TopBorderWidthPerc
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance to the top side of the zoom out area in percent

ValueDefinition.Name: BottomBorderWidthPerc
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance to the bottom side of the zoom out area in percent

ValueDefinition.Name: MinAutoZoomSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Zoom steps in s that the drag module camera can zoom in / out automatically.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxAutoZoomSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Zoom steps in s that the drag module camera can zoom in / out automatically.

ValueDefinition.Name: DebugRenderAutoZoomAreas
ValueDefinition.Description: If enabled, the Auto Zoom Areas are rendered during active build modes

ValueDefinition.Name: CursorSpeedZoomFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor between 0.0 and 1.0 for linear interpolation between start zoom level and current zoom level. 0 = Only start and 1 = only current zoom level is used to calculate the cursor speed.

ValueDefinition.Name: CosmeticModuleIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: Displayed at the cursor during cosmetic module placement

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxBuildingBlockerDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum distance between the end of a building block and the current build position. If the distance is greater, the street might be incomplete.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxBuildBlockerTileCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum number of tiles of a building block. If the number of tiles of the current build blocker is greater than this value, the algorithm will stop and no streets will be added.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxTileTraverseCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum number of tiles that can be traversed to find the street tiles around the building block

ValueDefinition.Name: EnterHybridDragThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Object dragging during hybrid mode is only possible, if the camera speed (world units per second) is below this threshold during button press

ValueDefinition.Name: MinRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: The radius will get closer to this value, when camera is zoomed in

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: The radius will get closer to this value, when camera is zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: MinInnerDotRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as MinRadius but for the inner dot

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxInnerDotRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: The radius will get closer to this value, when camera is zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: CameraDistanceForMinRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: When the camera distance is lower than this value, we use the MinSelectionRadius

ValueDefinition.Name: CameraDistanceForMaxRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: When the camera distance is greater than this value, we use the MaxSelectionRadius

ValueDefinition.Name: ScaleDownSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Time it takes (in seconds) for the selection circle to be scaled down if it picked an object with a build tool.

ValueDefinition.Name: LineThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: Thickness of the circle

ValueDefinition.Name: BorderRenderTechnique
ValueDefinition.Description: Technique that is used to render the circle

ValueDefinition.Name: WorldMapMinRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as MinRadius, but for the World Map

ValueDefinition.Name: WorldMapMaxRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as MaxRadius, but for the World Map

ValueDefinition.Name: WorldMapInnerDotMinRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as WorldMapMinRadius but for the inner dot

ValueDefinition.Name: WorldMapInnerDotMaxRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as WorldMapMaxRadius but for the inner dot

ValueDefinition.Name: WorldMapCameraDistanceForMinRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as CameraDistanceForMinRadius, but for the world map

ValueDefinition.Name: WorldMapCameraDistanceForMaxRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Same as CameraDistanceForMaxRadius, but for the world map

ValueDefinition.Name: ModulePlacementCircleRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: Selection circle radius multplier during module placement, during which also a beam is rendered

ValueDefinition.Name: ModulePlacementCircleCenterVisible
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, a small dot is rendered at the cursor position during module placement

ValueDefinition.Name: LineTexturePath
ValueDefinition.Description: The texture that is used to render the rectangle

ValueDefinition.Name: MinThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: The thickness will get closer to this value, when camera is zoomed in

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: The thickness will get closer to this value, when camera is zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: GapPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The size of the gap in between the rectangle brackets in percent / 100

ValueDefinition.Name: SelectionOrder
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines, how objects inside the SelectionCircle are sorted and which gets picked and snapped to, fist. Size: Choses building with max blocker size. Distance: Choses buildings closest to the selectionCircle first. SizeAndDistance: Choses buildings closest to the circleDistance and with the smallest blocker size first.

ValueDefinition.Name: SizeDistanceSortFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Only for SizeAndDistance sorting:; Value from 0.0 - 1.0, with 0.0 only using size and 1.0 not using size at all

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxBuildBlockerArea
ValueDefinition.Description: Only used for size and distance sorting comparisons: the max blocker size a building can have, every building with a greater blocker size will be treated the same.

ValueDefinition.Name: MarkerPylonSize
ValueDefinition.Description: This value will be multiplied with the size of the pylons that are shown, when a ship is moved

ValueDefinition.Name: CameraFollowShipSafeRadiusMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: If other objects are nearer than this value multiplied with the current selection circle radius, the camera will not start following an object

ValueDefinition.Name: OutlineMinThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: The line thickness will get closer to this value, when camera is zoomed in

ValueDefinition.Name: OutlineMaxThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: The line thickness will get closer to this value, when camera is zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: OutlineDepthBias
ValueDefinition.Description: Z-Depth bias for the outline lines

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipItemLineRendering
ValueDefinition.Description: Line width of the dashes

ValueDefinition.Name: DashSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Size of the line dashes

ValueDefinition.Name: GapSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Size of the gaps betweem line dashes

ValueDefinition.Name: DepthBias
ValueDefinition.Description: Depth bias of both lines

ValueDefinition.Name: DirectLineColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Color of the direct line

ValueDefinition.Name: CurveLineColor
ValueDefinition.Description: Color of the curve line

ValueDefinition.Name: AnimateGroundLine
ValueDefinition.Category: If true, the direct projectile line will also be animated

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeOutEasing
ValueDefinition.Description: Applied to the circle tail radius over time

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeOutStrength
ValueDefinition.Description: Strength between 0.0 and 1.0 of the tail radius fade out

ValueDefinition.Name: TickLifetime
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of Time in ms the brush tail is visible

ValueDefinition.Name: TimeBetweenCircles
ValueDefinition.Description: Amount of time in ms between filled circles being rendered in the tail

ValueDefinition.Name: MinStartCameraSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Min camera speed (world units per second) required to start the brush mode

ValueDefinition.Name: RenderItemTargetAtPrediction
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines if ship item target feedback should be rendered at the predicted enemy position, instead of the camera position

ValueDefinition.Name: DragObjectDistanceThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: When dragging at least x world units in Move mode during gamepad mode, the drag is executed

ValueDefinition.Name: EnterDragObjectThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Move Mode via drag only starts when the current camera movement (world units per second) is lower than this value

ValueDefinition.Name: PredictedItemPositionPrecision
ValueDefinition.Description: Used for calculating the predicted target positions when items are used while following an object. The higher the value the more precise the target position, but also the more expensive the calculation.

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoomDeceleration
ValueDefinition.Description: Time in seconds it takes to to stop camera zoom on world map

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoomAcceleration
ValueDefinition.Description: Time in seconds to reach max zoom speed on world map

ValueDefinition.Name: PanDeceleration
ValueDefinition.Description: Time in seconds it takes to stop camera pan movement on world map

ValueDefinition.Name: PanAcceleration
ValueDefinition.Description: Time in seconds to reach max pan speed on world map

ValueDefinition.Name: PanSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Max pan speed in tiles per second

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoomSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Max zoom speed

ValueDefinition.Name: CircleLineThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: The thickness of the selection circle on the world map

ValueDefinition.Name: InfotipMinBottomDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Mininum distance in pixels between infotips and the bottom of the screen

ValueDefinition.Name: InfotipScreenOffsetX
ValueDefinition.Description: X Offset in pixels of infotips. Zero means that the infotip is located at the border of the objects bounding box.

ValueDefinition.Name: InfotipScreenOffsetY
ValueDefinition.Description: Y Offset in pixels of infotips. Zero means that the infotip will be at the y position of the selected object

ValueDefinition.Name: WorldMapZoomDelayInSec
ValueDefinition.Description: Time in seconds the user has to hold the zoom out button until the jump to worldmap sequence is initialized

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipScaleMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: Scale multiplier for ship objects and route paths

ValueDefinition.Name: WorldMapZoomEasingStrength
ValueDefinition.Description: Easing factor of the zoom to world map. A lower value means faster acceleration.

ValueDefinition.Name: WorldMapZoomCancelSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: Speed in ms per tick it takes the camera to return to the max zoom, when the zoom to world map is cancelled

ValueDefinition.Name: WorldMapTargetAngleTolerance
ValueDefinition.Description: The tolerance range in degrees that is still considered as worldmap zoom. When setting to 10, the range of the right stick that triggers the worldmap zoom goes from 170 to 190 degrees

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumCharacterInput
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum character input for virtual keyboard text requests. If a value of zero or less is defined, the DefaultMaximumCharacterCount is used instead.

ValueDefinition.Name: LanguagePerRegion
TextLanguage
ValueDefinition.Description: Available Text languages in this region

ValueDefinition.Name: AudioLanguage
ValueDefinition.Description: Available audio languages in this region
Defines what languages are available for what regions

ValueDefinition.Name: EventType
ValueDefinition.Description: The event type that triggers this action. ShortRelease is only intended for very specific situations, please use Release events in regular cases.

ValueDefinition.Name: DisplayMoveType
ValueDefinition.Description: Stick or Dpad Movement that is displayed in the UI for this action. The action won't be triggered without additional PRG support. Don't set up ButtonTypes when using DisplayMoveType

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowedContext
ValueDefinition.Description: A GamepadAction is only triggered, if the current GamepadActionContext of the game is checked.

ValueDefinition.Name: IsGlobal
ValueDefinition.Description: Global events will be executed at first and can't get blocked by FocusGroups

ValueDefinition.Name: ModifierButtonType
ValueDefinition.Description: A GamepadAction is triggered. if all checked ButtonTypes are in the right state, defined by the EventTypes. If OnAnyDefinedButtonType is checked, only one of the buttons has to be in the correct ButtonState.

ValueDefinition.Name: RemappableButtonTypes
ValueDefinition.Description: Set of buttons that can be remapped to session gamepad actions

ValueDefinition.Name: RequiredMappedButtonActions
ValueDefinition.Description: These gamepad action always have to be mapped. If the user tries to unmap them, the remapping request will be canceled and a warning will be shown.

ValueDefinition.Name: InnerStickDeadzoneLeft
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum stick input between 0.0 and 1.0 for the left stick. Any stick input below that value will not be procesed in the game.

ValueDefinition.Name: InnerStickDeadzoneRight
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum stick input between 0.0 and 1.0 for the right stick. Any stick input below that value will not be procesed in the game.

ValueDefinition.Name: OuterStickDeadzoneLeft
ValueDefinition.Description: Outer deadzone value for the left stick. Stick input will reach its maximum once it reaches the outer deadzone.

ValueDefinition.Name: OuterStickDeadzoneRight
ValueDefinition.Description: Outer deadzone value for the right stick. Stick input will reach its maximum once it reaches the outer deadzone.

ValueDefinition.Name: StickCurveStrength
ValueDefinition.Description: Curve factor for easing camera movement input. A higher value means slower camera movement for smaller stick input.

ValueDefinition.Name: HoldTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Time in ms a gamepad button has to be pressed to trigger a hold event

ValueDefinition.Name: DoubleTapTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Time in ms between two gamepad button presses to trigger a double tap event

ValueDefinition.Name: ShortReleaseTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum allowed time in ms between press and release events for short release events to trigger

ValueDefinition.Name: TriggerThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: The threshold between 0.0 and 1.0 for trigger buttons before a press event is fired

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumReleaseDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: In ms the minimum release duration that can be configured in the options

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumReleaseDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: In ms the maximum release duration that can be configured in the options

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumHoldDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: In ms the minimum hold duration that can be configured in the options

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumHoldDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: In ms the maximum hold duration that can be configured in the options

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumTriggerThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Between 0.0 and 1.0 the minimum trigger threshold that can be configured in the options

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumTriggerThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Between 0.0 and 1.0 the maximum trigger threshold that can be configured in the options

ValueDefinition.Name: RadialMenuMinimumStickInput
ValueDefinition.Description: Threshold value between 0.0 - 1.0. Radial menus only select entries when stick input is above this value.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumInnerDeadzone
ValueDefinition.Description: Maxmium value between 0.0 and 1.0 that the player can assign to the inner deadzone

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumOuterDeadzone
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum value between 0.0 and 1.0 that the player can assign to the outer deadzone

ValueDefinition.Name: InitialNavigationDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: The delay between the first input event and the continous navigation events. Value in MS

ValueDefinition.Name: HighestContinuousNavigationDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: Continuous navigation event with the highest delay. This is used for the first continuous navigation event after the InitialNavigationDelay. Value in MS

ValueDefinition.Name: LowestContinuousNavigationDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: Lowest/Fastest delay between two continuous navigation events. Is used after the ContinuousNavigationAccelerationDuration has exceeded. Value in MS

ValueDefinition.Name: ContinuousNavigationAccelerationDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: The time in which the delay between two continuous navigation events shrinks from HighestContinuousNavigationDelay to LowestContinuousNavigationDelay. Use this to accelerate the moving of the focus during the duration that the user holds the button. Value in MS

ValueDefinition.Name: ThumbStickDeadzone
ValueDefinition.Description: Deadzone that is used to determine navigation events. Value between 0 and 1

ValueDefinition.Name: SelectionWheelStickThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Stick length threshold between 0.0 and 1.0, regarding normalized stick input after substraction of deadzones. Values in radial selection wheels are only selected if the normalized stick length is greater than this value.

ValueDefinition.Name: FastScrollLinearAccelerationStickThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines to which point of right stick movement the linear acceleration is used

ValueDefinition.Name: FastScrollLinearAccelerationMaxSpeedPx
ValueDefinition.Description: Max speed that is used in linear linear acceleration

ValueDefinition.Name: FastScrollSineAccelerationStartDelayMs
ValueDefinition.Description: When stick movement is > FastScrollLinearAccelerationStickThreshold we stay for this time at the FastScrollLinearAccelerationMaxSpeedInPx before we go over to the sine acceleration

ValueDefinition.Name: FastScrollSineAccelerationEndTimeMs
ValueDefinition.Description: How long the sine acceleration takes to reach the max speed after the activation

ValueDefinition.Name: FastScrollSineAccelerationEndSpeedPx
ValueDefinition.Description: The max speed in the sine acceleration

ValueDefinition.Name: DpadAccelerationStartStep
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines after how many steps triggered by the Dpad the acceleration starts

ValueDefinition.Name: DpadStartStepIntervalMs
ValueDefinition.Description: Interval in which the steps triggered by the Dpad before the acceleration starts

ValueDefinition.Name: DpadEndStepIntervalMs
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum interval in which the steps are done when the slider is fully accelerated

ValueDefinition.Name: DpadStepAccelerationMs
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the time the interval will be reduced on every step

ValueDefinition.Name: DpadDefaultStepSize
ValueDefinition.Description: The value that is added to sliders without step configuration when Dpad is pressed. Range 0-1

ValueDefinition.Name: StickValueChangeSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: The value a slider gains per second when the stick is fully pressed. 0.5 means half of the slider is moved per second

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumPanSpeedMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum pan speed multiplier in the options configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumPanSpeedMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum pan speed multiplier in the options configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumFastMoveSpeedMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum fast move speed multiplier in the options configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumFastMoveSpeedMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum fast move speed multiplier in the options configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumRotateSpeedMultiplier
