ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum rotate speed multiplier in the options configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumRotateSpeedMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum rotate speed multiplier in the options configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumZoomSpeedMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum zoom speed multiplier in the options configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumZoomSpeedMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum zoom speed multiplier in the options configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultBuildModePanSpeedMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: Default camera pan speed multiplier that is applied during active build modes

ValueDefinition.Name: AutoFastMoveConfig
MinimumStickDirectionLength
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum stick input between 0.0 and 1.0 for which auto fast move is activated

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumAccelerationDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum configurable time in s for auto fast move acceleration delay

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumAccelerationDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum configurable time in s for auto fast move acceleration delay

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumAccelerationDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum configurable time in s for auto fast move acceleration duration

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumAccelerationDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum configurable time in s for auto fast move acceleration duration

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultAccelerationDelay
ValueDefinition.Description: Default time in s until auto fast move acceleration starts

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultAccelerationDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Default time in s until auto fast move acceleration top speed is reached
Configuration of the automatic cursor speed acceleration of the free session camera

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultVibrationIntensity
ValueDefinition.Description: Default gamepad vibration intensity between 0.0 and 1.0

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumHapticRadiusZoomedIn
ValueDefinition.Description: Radius in world units around the cursor where the player can feel the event at 100% of their strength when zoomed in

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumHapticRadiusZoomedOut
ValueDefinition.Description: Radius in world units around the cursor where the player can feel the event at 100% of their strength when zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: HapticRadiusZoomedIn
ValueDefinition.Description: Radius around the cursor where the player can feel some feedback when zoomed in

ValueDefinition.Name: HapticRadiusZoomedOut
ValueDefinition.Description: Radius around the cursor where the player can feel some feedback when zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceIntensityEasing
ValueDefinition.Description: Easing applied to the distance vibration intensity (0 = closest, 1 = farthest)

ValueDefinition.Name: MinZoomLevelIntensity
ValueDefinition.Description: Vibration Intensity (0 - 1) when the player is zoomed in

ValueDefinition.Name: MaxZoomLevelIntensity
ValueDefinition.Description: Vibration Intensity (0 - 1) when the player is zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: ZoomIntensityEasing
ValueDefinition.Description: Easing applied to the zoom vibration intensity (0 = zoomed in, 1 = zoomed out)

ValueDefinition.Name: RadialMenuMaxEntriesConfig
MaxEntries
ValueDefinition.Description: The max amount of entries displayed in construction/ship radial menu
Configuration for the option to change the max entries of the construction/ship radial menu

ValueDefinition.Name: VibrationDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Duration in ms of the vibration effect

ValueDefinition.Name: VibrationIntensityLeft
ValueDefinition.Description: Vibration Intensity between 0.0 and 1.0 of the left vibration motor. If the controller does not differentiate between left and right vibrations, the greater value of both will be used.

ValueDefinition.Name: VibrationIntensityRight
ValueDefinition.Description: Vibration Intensity between 0.0 and 1.0 of the right vibration motor. If the controller does not differentiate between left and right vibrations, the greater value of both will be used.

ValueDefinition.Name: VibrationEasing
ValueDefinition.Description: The easing that will be applied to the intensity over the duration.

ValueDefinition.Name: Effect_StartPosition
ValueDefinition.Description: Position where the stiffness of triger start changing(2~7)

ValueDefinition.Name: Effect_EndPosition
ValueDefinition.Description: Position where the stiffness of trigger finish changing(startPosition+1~8)

ValueDefinition.Name: Effect_StartStrength
ValueDefinition.Description: Strength of gun trigger(0~8 (0: Same as Off mode))

ValueDefinition.Name: ScenariosEnabled
ValueDefinition.Description: Whether or not the game should display scenarios. Note that as of 01/2022, we do not yet incorporate the main menu text scenarios into this.

ValueDefinition.Name: ExcludedFolders
ValueDefinition.Description: These Folders can not have scenario items below them and will even in scenarios always be the vanilla folder

ValueDefinition.Name: ExcludedFolder
ValueDefinition.Description: In scenarios this folder will stay a vanilla folder. Useful for texts, audio, e.g.

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultGameSetup
ValueDefinition.Description: the default game setup activated when starting a session with this scenario

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultPlayerProfile
ValueDefinition.Description: the default player profile when starting a session with this scenario

ValueDefinition.Name: ScenarioTexts
ValueDefinition.Description: The short description shown when hovering the scenario on the world map

ValueDefinition.Name: MedalUnlockRewards
ValueDefinition.Description: only the first reward is shown with icon

ValueDefinition.Name: BadgeAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: TODO: use this to link to unlocked badges, e.g. via account unlocks

ValueDefinition.Name: ScenarioPreVictoryData
ValueDefinition.Description: Texts and Audio to show in the pre victory screen. List is checked from top to bottom to find the first unlocked entry which then will be used.

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockCondition
ValueDefinition.Description: If this asset is unlocked the associated texts and audio will be used. If emtpy it will be used as well.

ValueDefinition.Name: AccountLockScope
ValueDefinition.Description: Wich lockscope is used in the scenario to add new account unlocks?

ValueDefinition.Name: ProjectTrigger
ValueDefinition.Description: A trigger that is being registered on scenario start and might be satisfied if it was uinlocked before. Please use template TriggerScenarioProject or TriggerScenarioProjectStartupTrigger depending on the flag IsStartupTrigger

ValueDefinition.Name: ProjectGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: A context guid needed for the project. Currently only used for GGJ

ValueDefinition.Name: IsStartupTrigger
ValueDefinition.Description: False: ProjectTrigger gets registered and if already unlocked executes its actions immediately. True: Trigger only gets registered at startup if it was not yet unlocked

ValueDefinition.Name: ChargeAttackTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long elements need to charge for the charge attack to become ready

ValueDefinition.Name: ChargeMinDistanceToStart
ValueDefinition.Description: Elements need to be at least this far away from a target particle to attempt to charge at the target particle

ValueDefinition.Name: CheerTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long units will cheer after winning a fight

ValueDefinition.Name: DesertationInvincibilityTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Once a unit starts to desert, it will be invincible for this long before becoming targetable/chaseable again

ValueDefinition.Name: DesertationFadeOutTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Once a deserting unit fails to recover, it will take this long for the elements and banner of the unit to fade out

ValueDefinition.Name: SpreadRadius_LowAccuracyMinRange
ValueDefinition.Description: The spread radius used in accuracy calculations for attackers with accuracy = 0, while they are at their minimum attack range

ValueDefinition.Name: SpreadRadius_LowAccuracyMaxRange
ValueDefinition.Description: The spread radius used in accuracy calculations for attackers with accuracy = 0, while they are at their maximum attack range

ValueDefinition.Name: SpreadRadius_HighAccuracyMinRange
ValueDefinition.Description: The spread radius used in accuracy calculations for attackers with accuracy = 100, while they are at their minimum attack range

ValueDefinition.Name: SpreadRadius_HighAccuracyMaxRange
ValueDefinition.Description: The spread radius used in accuracy calculations for attackers with accuracy = 100, while they are at their maximumattack range

ValueDefinition.Name: MainTargetWeightFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor that is multiplied with the area covered by the main target to get the probability to hit the main target. Increasing this increases probability to hit the main target while decreasing probability to hit a stray target or miss.

ValueDefinition.Name: StrayTargetWeightFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor that is multiplied with the area covered by a stray target to get the probability to hit it. Reducing this decreases probability to hit a stray target while increasing probability to hit the main target or miss.

ValueDefinition.Name: MissTargetWeightFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor that is multiplied with the uncovered in around a target to get the probability to miss it. Reducing this decreases probability to miss while increasing probability to hit the main target or a stray target.

ValueDefinition.Name: MeleeAttackHitProbabilities
CurveLowerBoundary
ValueDefinition.Description: Lower boundary probabilities are applied to deltas with this value or lower

ValueDefinition.Name: OrderedProbabilities
HitProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: [0.0 - 100.0], Hit probability for n = delta - CurveLowerBoundary
Hit probabilities for n = delta - CurveLowerBoundary. If n > the size of OrderedProbabilities, the UpperBoundaryProbability is used

ValueDefinition.Name: LowerBoundaryProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: [0.0 - 100.0] Lower curve boundary hit probability

ValueDefinition.Name: UpperBoundaryProbability
ValueDefinition.Description: [0.0 - 100.0] Upper curve boundary hit probability
Probabilities are calculated based on the delta between an attack and a defense value

ValueDefinition.Name: BreakFormationDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: The centermost element of a composite unit needs to be at least this close to the units target to allow all elements of the unit to break formation and act individually

ValueDefinition.Name: MeleeMaximumAwayFromFormationDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance in world space units that this particle can move away from its formation spot for melee attacks. If a target moves out of that range, it is discarded.

ValueDefinition.Name: UnderAttackDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: The time a unit counts as in-combat, after it performed or was hit by an attack

ValueDefinition.Name: DamageReductionFromBlock
ValueDefinition.Description: How much damage is prevented from blocking. 30% means 30% of damage is prevented so only 70% is applied.

ValueDefinition.Name: DamageFalloffEasing
ValueDefinition.Description: Easing function for damage falloff, starting at 100% damage for the first hit unit and 0% for every hit unit above MaximumHitElements

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumHitElements
ValueDefinition.Description: How many elements can be hit at maximum

ValueDefinition.Name: ApproachRangeFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 1] Factor multiplied with the attack range of a unit to get the range a unit will prefer to move to when attacking.

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortRangeSingle
ValueDefinition.Description: The escort range of units with a single unit actor

ValueDefinition.Name: EscortRangeComposite
ValueDefinition.Description: The escort range of units with a composite unit actor

ValueDefinition.Name: BattleTrackerAdditionalKeepAliveTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long should battles stay active including this value and the max cooldown of any unit in the game

ValueDefinition.Name: LowestWorkforceHPReduction
ValueDefinition.Description: What is the lowest percentag of head count from unfulfilled workforce reduction

ValueDefinition.Name: Generic
ArrowHeadTexture
ValueDefinition.Description: Arrow head texture used for all kinds of directional inworld visualizations

ValueDefinition.Name: PathTexture
ValueDefinition.Description: The texture that will be used for the unit path indicators

ValueDefinition.Name: LineTexture
ValueDefinition.Description: The texture that will be used for generic unit related lines

ValueDefinition.Name: PathThickness
ValueDefinition.Description: The thickness of the unit path indicators

ValueDefinition.Name: PathTiling
ValueDefinition.Description: The tiling of the unit path indicators

ValueDefinition.Name: PathArrowHeadScale
ValueDefinition.Description: If a path shows an arrow head, this is the scale it will use
The scroll speed of the unit path indicators

ValueDefinition.Name: MarkerDefaultScaleOnLandUnits
ValueDefinition.Description: If a land unit does not override the scale of attack & escort markers, this scale will be used

ValueDefinition.Name: OuterCircleBorderFadeOutPercent
ValueDefinition.Description: relative to radius (e.g. 100 doubles the radius)

ValueDefinition.Name: SectionOutlineFade
ValueDefinition.Description: Length of the section line fade

ValueDefinition.Name: SectionOutlineWidth
ValueDefinition.Description: Line width of the section

ValueDefinition.Name: SectionOutlineFadeOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance at which the section fade starts

ValueDefinition.Name: VisibilityTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long the movement indicators will be visible in total

ValueDefinition.Name: FadeOutTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long before the end of VisibilityTime the movement indicators start to fade out

ValueDefinition.Name: StartFadeInTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Time after selection / new command after which we start to fade in the movement indicators

ValueDefinition.Name: EndFadeInTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Time after selection / new command after which we end fading in the movement indicators

ValueDefinition.Name: FormationSpotTexture
ValueDefinition.Description: The texture that will be used for the spots of the unit formation indicator

ValueDefinition.Name: FormationDirectionTexture
ValueDefinition.Description: The texture that will be used for the direction arrow of the unit formation indicator

ValueDefinition.Name: FormationSpotRadiusFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Factor for how big spots of a formation are displayed in the unit formation movement indicator. At 1.0, spots of the formation will have the size that the soldiers of the formation have in terms of gameplay.

ValueDefinition.Name: FormationDirectionMarkerSize
ValueDefinition.Description: Absolute world space size that the direction marker part of the formation indicator should have

ValueDefinition.Name: FormationDirectionMarkerDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Absolute world space distance the direction marker part of the formation indicator is displayed in front of the formation spots

ValueDefinition.Name: FormationMarkerGlow
ValueDefinition.Description: Configures the glow of unit movement indicators

ValueDefinition.Name: ArcHeightPerLength
ValueDefinition.Description: For every unit of the length of the arc, add this much height to the arcs apex

ValueDefinition.Name: ArcMaximumHeight
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum height a preview arc can have

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowLineForRallyPoint
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, we show a line from the recruitment building to the rally point

ValueDefinition.Name: CivilBuildingBigThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: What is the minimum height a civil building hitbox requires to count as CivilBuildingBig

ValueDefinition.Name: PickingColor
ValueDefinition.Description: The color of the picking highlight on detached elements

ValueDefinition.Name: ScaleZoomedIn
ValueDefinition.Description: Unit Banner scale when the camer is completely zoomed in

ValueDefinition.Name: ScaleZoomedOut
ValueDefinition.Description: Unit Banner scale when the camer is completely zoomed out

ValueDefinition.Name: SelectionHighlightRadiusFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: For units that use selection highlights (e.g. ships), this factor is multiplied on top of the collider radius to find the highlight radius

ValueDefinition.Name: Opacity
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 1]. How opaque should the hidelights of elements be? 0 means hidelights are fully transparent, 1 means hidelights are fully opaque

ValueDefinition.Name: LerpToWhite
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 1]. How much the player color is lerped to white for the hidelights? 0 means fully take player color, 1 means fully take white

ValueDefinition.Name: StartFadeInAtDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: If the camera is this far away from the what it is looking at, we start to fade in the hidelight

ValueDefinition.Name: FinishFadeInAtDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: If the camera is this far away from the what it is looking at, the hidelight is fully faded in

ValueDefinition.Name: FormationMinSpeedAtDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: If an element is this close or closer to its formation spot, it will use its minimum move in formation speed

ValueDefinition.Name: FormationMaxSpeedAtDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: If an element is this far or farther from its formation spot, it will use its maximum move in formation speed

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceUnitToUnitInLineFormation_Land
ValueDefinition.Description: When dragging a formation, this is the distance that is left free between two land units

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceUnitToUnitInLineFormation_Water
ValueDefinition.Description: When dragging a formation, this is the distance that is left free between two naval units

ValueDefinition.Name: FillSpaceFormation
InUnitTotalSamples
ValueDefinition.Description: How many sample circles one unit will check to reserve enough space for itself

ValueDefinition.Name: InUnitSamplesPerRow
ValueDefinition.Description: How many sample circles one unit will check in a row at maximum before starting a new row

ValueDefinition.Name: UnitDesiredWidth
ValueDefinition.Description: How much world space units one unit wants to use in the formation

ValueDefinition.Name: InUnitDistanceBetweenRows
ValueDefinition.Description: How many world units behind the previous row the next row of samples will be placed

ValueDefinition.Name: InUnitHeightOfRows
ValueDefinition.Description: How much space in world units must be free on the front/back axis for a sample of a row to be considered free.

ValueDefinition.Name: UnitToUnitDistance_Sideways
ValueDefinition.Description: How much space sideways (in world space units) should there be between two units in this formation?

ValueDefinition.Name: UnitToUnitDistance_FrontBack
ValueDefinition.Description: How much space front/back (in world space units) should there be between two units in this formation?
See miro https://miro.com/app/board/uXjVPHuXqNI=/?moveToWidget=3458764627044634667&cot=14

ValueDefinition.Name: ForceDamping
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 1] defines how much we mix forces of last tick into the forces of this tick. 1 = take only this ticks forces, 0 = take only last ticks forces

ValueDefinition.Name: RestingRange
ValueDefinition.Description: In WorldUnits. Defines how far an element can be pushed from its desired position when he unit is standing still without directly moving back

ValueDefinition.Name: TargetThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: In WorldUnits. If an element is this close to its desired target position, it may stop moving.

ValueDefinition.Name: RotateInPlaceThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: In degrees; Elements need to be facing the direction they want to walk in within this epsilon to be able to walk. If they don't they just rotate in place

ValueDefinition.Name: MoraleThresholds
ValueDefinition.Description: Morale thresholds for fleeing are interpolated based on the data points of this vector

ValueDefinition.Name: StartDelayTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How much time has to pass, for the situational threat to have an impact.

ValueDefinition.Name: AreaSizeInDegree
ValueDefinition.Description: Circular angle size in degrees, that is considered as flank attack

ValueDefinition.Name: AreaSizeInDegree
ValueDefinition.Description: Circular angle size in degrees, that is considered as rear attack

ValueDefinition.Name: ShockEventDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum distance at which this shock event can be applied

ValueDefinition.Name: AddMoraleAbsolute
ValueDefinition.Description: Value that is added to the current morale. Can be negative.

ValueDefinition.Name: AddMoralePercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: Relative morale to maximum that is added to current morale. Can be negative.

ValueDefinition.Name: UseFalloffFactors
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the morale impact might be reduced with other nearby units defined by the ShockEventFalloffFactors

ValueDefinition.Name: WaveringMoraleThresholdMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: The absolute morale value of the fleeing threshold is multiplied with this value to determine the wavering threshold

ValueDefinition.Name: AnimationDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Duration of the banner blinking going from white back to the players color

ValueDefinition.Name: AnimationPauseDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: Pause time between blinking animations

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumMoraleDropModifierCount
ValueDefinition.Description: What is the maximum multiplier of recent death modifiers for morale drops

ValueDefinition.Name: MoraleDropFactorRecentDeaths
ValueDefinition.Description: Multiplicator for moral drops per recent element death

ValueDefinition.Name: SpeedFactorDuringDesertation
ValueDefinition.Description: While a unit is deserting, this is the speedfactor is uses

ValueDefinition.Name: MoraleRegenerationFactorFleeingThreatened
ValueDefinition.Description: Gets multiplied with the amount of morale regenerated per tick, when the unit is fleeing and in threatened area

ValueDefinition.Name: MoraleRegenerationFactorFleeingUnthreatened
ValueDefinition.Description: Gets multiplied with the amount of morale regenerated per tick, when the unit is fleeing and in unthreatened area

ValueDefinition.Name: EmbarkmentDistanceShip
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance at which units can embark ships

ValueDefinition.Name: EmbarkmentDistanceUnitCamp
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance at which units can embark unit camps

ValueDefinition.Name: DisembarkDistance
ValueDefinition.Description: Distance at which units can disembark ships

ValueDefinition.Name: RelayedDamageThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Percentage of ship damage that is relayed to embarked units. 50% means units health can be lowered up to 50% if being embarked, 100% means they can die when taking damage. 0% means they take no damage at all.

ValueDefinition.Name: AllowStartAtRandomOffset
ValueDefinition.Description: For all sequence events in here, we allow that they get started with a random time offset into the animation to make everything look more organic

ValueDefinition.Name: CorpseFadeOutTime_LandUnits
ValueDefinition.Description: How long should land unit corpses be visually visible

ValueDefinition.Name: CorpseFadeOutTime_LandUnits_TrailerFront
ValueDefinition.Description: How long should land unit corpses of trailer fronts be visually visible? Trailers themselv use the regular land units value

ValueDefinition.Name: CorpseFadeOutTime_BuildingUnits
ValueDefinition.Description: How long should corpses of units on buildings be visually visible

ValueDefinition.Name: ShortenSailsWhenIdleTime
ValueDefinition.Description: When ships are idle for longer than this time, they will shorten their sails

ValueDefinition.Name: LocationTargetAimHeightPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 100] At 0, aim at the foundation of the target. At 100, aim at the highest impact dummy of the target.

ValueDefinition.Name: PlunderedMoneyPerHealth
ValueDefinition.Description: How much money is plundered per damaged hitpoint

ValueDefinition.Name: PlunderingMaterialStepsPerWarehouse
ValueDefinition.Description: How often are materials plundered during the destruction of a warehouse

ValueDefinition.Name: ShowFlyoutPerPlunderedMoney
ValueDefinition.Description: Steps in which flyouts are shown for plundered money

ValueDefinition.Name: Value
ValueDefinition.Description: At which distance ships will get clipped based on the quality setting

ValueDefinition.Name: Value
ValueDefinition.Description: At which distance elements (on land, towers & ships) will get clipped based on the quality setting

ValueDefinition.Name: Barritus_DetectRange
ValueDefinition.Description: The range in which there must be a targetable enemy land unit to start a barritus chant

ValueDefinition.Name: Barritus_RequiredIdleTime
ValueDefinition.Description: For how long a unit must be idle and close to a target unit before the barritus chant starts

ValueDefinition.Name: Barritus_MaximumChantDuration
ValueDefinition.Description: For how long a unit will chant during the barritus chant

ValueDefinition.Name: Barritus_ChantCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: For how lng a unit will not trigger another barritus chant after being done chanting

ValueDefinition.Name: PreConfiguredElements
ElementAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The element that is linked to this unit

ValueDefinition.Name: DummyName
ValueDefinition.Description: The name of the dummy this pre-configured element is linked to

ValueDefinition.Name: AlwaysHide
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the element will always be hidden, even in combat
List of linked elements that are pre configued for this unit

ValueDefinition.Name: ElementCountHealthThresholds
HealthPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The health percentage this threshold is applied at

ValueDefinition.Name: AliveElementCount
ValueDefinition.Description: The element count will be reduced to this amount at this threshold

Element counts will be reduced linearly between these thresholds based on the units health percentage. Maximum and Minimum thresholds will automatically be included if any threshold is set. There will be no changes to element counts if no value is set here.

ValueDefinition.Name: HidesElementsWhenOutOfCombat
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, elements of this units are hidden while this unit is not in combat.

ValueDefinition.Name: AssociatedRegion
ValueDefinition.Description: The region this composite unit is associated with

ValueDefinition.Name: ElementAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: The element this unit is made up from

ValueDefinition.Name: Elements
ValueDefinition.Description: How many elements this unit has

ValueDefinition.Name: ElementsPerRowDefault
ValueDefinition.Description: How many elements each row of this unit has per default

ValueDefinition.Name: ElementsPerRowMinimumCommandable
ValueDefinition.Description: When the user overrides the desired elements per row, this is the minimum they can command

ValueDefinition.Name: ElementsPerRowMaximumCommandable
ValueDefinition.Description: When the user overrides the desired elements per row, this is the maximumthey can command

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceSpotToSpotInRowBtB
ValueDefinition.Description: The border-to-border distance between two spots of the formation

ValueDefinition.Name: DistanceRowToRowBtB
ValueDefinition.Description: The border-to-border distance between two rows of the formation

ValueDefinition.Name: Jaggedness
ValueDefinition.Description: By how much every spot in the formation is offset (depending on the jaggedness type)

ValueDefinition.Name: FormationLeadTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How much ahead the formation will be placed on the path. This can be usefull to avoid elements having to turn around for a tick on path start but should be used with caution as it allows the player to cheat a bit of speed by spamclicking

ValueDefinition.Name: ElementLayerFriendly
ValueDefinition.Description: The path planner layer used by this units elements when on friendly territory

ValueDefinition.Name: ElementLayerHostile
ValueDefinition.Description: The path planner layer used by this units elements when on enemy territory

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumMorale
ValueDefinition.Description: The maximum morale this unit has initially

ValueDefinition.Name: PassiveRegenerationRate
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines how often the morale increases by passive regeneration

ValueDefinition.Name: PassiveRegenerationValue
ValueDefinition.Description: Defines the absolute value (0 - Maximum) that will be added to the current morale due to passive regeneration

ValueDefinition.Name: PauseTimeIfAttacked
ValueDefinition.Description: Regeneration pause duration after this unit was attacked

ValueDefinition.Name: EncampedRegenerationMultiplier
ValueDefinition.Description: Is multiplied with the regeneration value while this unit is encamped

ValueDefinition.Name: InitialSurrenderChance
ValueDefinition.Description: Probability (0.0 - 1.0) of the troop to surrender on another morale loss, when the morale is equal to the Low Morale Threshold

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumSurrenderChance
ValueDefinition.Description: Probability (0.0 - 1.0) of the troop to surrender on another morale loss, when the morale is equal to the Surrender Morale Threshold

ValueDefinition.Name: ThresholdMoraleRecover
ValueDefinition.Description: If the morale reaches above this absolute value (0 - Maximum), the deserting troop will recover

ValueDefinition.Name: MoraleGainOnReachSafety
ValueDefinition.Description: When a deserting troop reaches safety (no enemies around), it gains this much morale instantly

ValueDefinition.Name: DesertationMaximumFleeTime
ValueDefinition.Description: Once a deserting unit becomes targetable, it will at maximum flee for this long. If it has not recovered until then, it will die.

ValueDefinition.Name: CanGetEntangled
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this unit can get entangled

ValueDefinition.Name: RadiusElementCollision
ValueDefinition.Description: The collision radius of an element; used to test whether the element collides with another element

ValueDefinition.Name: RadiusElementCollisionEnemy
ValueDefinition.Description: The collision radius of an element; used to test whether the element collides with another element that is not part of the same unit

ValueDefinition.Name: RadiusBlockingCollision
ValueDefinition.Description: The collision radius of an element when testing whether the element collides with blocking, e.g. buildings. Should be smaller or equal to the collision radius

ValueDefinition.Name: UseCustomProjectileCollider
ValueDefinition.Description: If activated, this elements "RadiusProjectileCollision" will be used instead of "RadiusElementCollision" when it comes to the questions "Does this AOE projectile hit me?" and "What accuracy does this targrted projectile has against me?"

ValueDefinition.Name: RadiusProjectileCollision
ValueDefinition.Description: The collision radius of an element when testing whether the element collides with a projectile (also affects accuracy calculations). Should be same or bigger than the element collision radius.

ValueDefinition.Name: RangeProximity_BtB
ValueDefinition.Description: BorderToBorder; Distance in which this element considers other elements as occupying their flank

ValueDefinition.Name: RangeSlowedRetreat_BtB
ValueDefinition.Description: BorderToBorder; Distance in which this element considers other elements as so close that it is slowed when retreating

ValueDefinition.Name: SpeedFormation_Minimum
ValueDefinition.Description: Percentage of unit speed; Minimum element speed, used when close to the formation position

ValueDefinition.Name: SpeedFormation_Maximum
ValueDefinition.Description: Percentage of unit speed; Maximum element speed, used when far from the formation position

ValueDefinition.Name: CapturedWhenSurroundedByEnemyCount
ValueDefinition.Description: [Supports fractions] How many enemy elements need to be closeby and looking at this element for that element to be considered captured, which means that it can not retreat. Lower values make this element easier to capture, higher make it harder. Advised range is ~2.5 (very easy capture) to 4 (very hard capture)

ValueDefinition.Name: TurnSpeed
ValueDefinition.Description: [1; 360] How many degrees we may turn per second

ValueDefinition.Name: DragIdle
ValueDefinition.Description: World-Space-Units the element can be pushed per tick due to collisions, while idling

ValueDefinition.Name: TurnInPlace
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this element is required to complete its rotation before it can move into the direction it wants to move in

ValueDefinition.Name: Height
ValueDefinition.Description: How tall this detached element is in world units. Used for detection whether a projectile hits

ValueDefinition.Name: HighlightRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: The radius in world units at which we draw selection & picking borders around this element

ValueDefinition.Name: SelectionRadius
ValueDefinition.Description: The radius in world units around this element in which we can pick and select it.

ValueDefinition.Name: SelectionRadiusZoomedOut
ValueDefinition.Description: The radius in world units around this element in which we can pick and select it, when zoomed out far

ValueDefinition.Name: ThresholdSpeedWalk
ValueDefinition.Description: Absolute speed in units per second. If the element moves faster than this speed, it will use it's walking sequence

ValueDefinition.Name: ThresholdSpeedJog
ValueDefinition.Description: Absolute speed in units per second. If the element moves faster than this speed, it will use it's jogging sequence

ValueDefinition.Name: ThresholdSpeedRun
ValueDefinition.Description: Absolute speed in units per second. If the element moves faster than this speed, it will use it's running sequence

ValueDefinition.Name: HasTrailer
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this detached elements comes with a trailer

ValueDefinition.Name: ModelPath
ValueDefinition.Description: The model path of the trailer of this detached element

ValueDefinition.Name: Stiffness
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 1], how stiff the joint of the trailer is. 0 = not stiff at all, 1 = very stiff

ValueDefinition.Name: HasLeader
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, we treat one of the models in a special way to place it a position in the formation in which the leader should stand

ValueDefinition.Name: LeaderIndex
ValueDefinition.Description: The index into the Models array that holds the leader model path. Starts at 0.

ValueDefinition.Name: UseTurnSequences
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this element uses the sequence events MilitaryTurnLeft and MilitaryTurnRight while turning

ValueDefinition.Name: SequenceSwitchCooldown
ValueDefinition.Description: After switching a sequence, do not switch to another one for this long, except for one shot events like performing an attack or being hit

ValueDefinition.Name: SequenceBlendTime
ValueDefinition.Description: How long it takes to blend from one sequence to another when switching sequences

ValueDefinition.Name: SequenceBlendTimeOverride
FromSequences
ValueDefinition.Description: The sequence events the element has to be in for this override to affect the blending

ValueDefinition.Name: ToSequences
ValueDefinition.Description: The sequence events the element has to switch toward for this override to affect the blending

ValueDefinition.Name: BlendTimeOverride
ValueDefinition.Description: The overriden blending time
Allows to define pairs of sequence events that define a custom blending time

ValueDefinition.Name: CombineAttackRangeConeRendering
ValueDefinition.Description: Elements with this flag set will only draw one single cone instead of one for each element

ValueDefinition.Name: UseSimplifiedSequences
ValueDefinition.Description: If set, this skin will use simplified sequencess instead of the regular military sequences

ValueDefinition.Name: AttackCone
ValueDefinition.Description: Angle (0 - 360) of the elements attack cone. 0 or 360 means there are no restrictions regarding attack cones

ValueDefinition.Name: PrebuiltShip
ValueDefinition.Description: If this a single cfg prebuilt ship with all visual modules already attached. Module effects and unit elements will be added dynamically based on their maximum amounts.

ValueDefinition.Name: HullPlacements
ShipBoneLink
ValueDefinition.Description: To which bone should this hull part be linked. Required for destruction animations
Sorted from nose to rear

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumModuleCount
ValueDefinition.Description: Maximum amount of modules the player can place additionally to the preplaced module count

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultModuleCount
ValueDefinition.Description: How many modules will be installed per default, if this ship is spawned without a ship configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: PreplacedVisualModules
AtHullIndex
ValueDefinition.Description: Hull Index [0 - X] where this module should be preplaced at
Visual modules that should be preplaed at specific hull positions. These will not have any effect

ValueDefinition.Name: LinkedUnitDummies
ValueDefinition.Description: If true, the element will always be hidden, even in combat

ValueDefinition.Name: ElementCountHealthThresholds
HealthPercentage
ValueDefinition.Description: The health percentage this threshold is applied at

ValueDefinition.Name: AliveElementCount
ValueDefinition.Description: The element count will be reduced to this amount at this threshold

Element counts will be reduced linearly between these thresholds based on the units health percentage. Maximum and Minimum thresholds will automatically be included if any threshold is set. There will be no changes to element counts if no value is set here.

ValueDefinition.Name: UseAssetIcon
ValueDefinition.Description: When this is set to true, the UI will show the icon of this asset. When this is set to false, it will use the UnitShipGroupCategory to use a generic icon for the hull.

ValueDefinition.Name: UnitShipGroupCategory
ValueDefinition.Description: Used by the UI to categories multiple selection of ships.

ValueDefinition.Name: CriticalChance100
ValueDefinition.Description: [0; 100] Change that instead of BaseDamage, CriticalDamage is dealt

ValueDefinition.Name: ArcherModuleElements
ValueDefinition.Description: [Ship only] All archer module elements

ValueDefinition.Name: CatapultModuleElements
ValueDefinition.Description: [Ship only] All catapult module elements

ValueDefinition.Name: BallistaModuleElements
ValueDefinition.Description: [Ship only] All ballista module elements

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipHullGUID
ValueDefinition.Description: Which Ship Hull is used for this configuration

ValueDefinition.Name: ShipModules
ModuleCount
ValueDefinition.Description: How many modules are placed of this ship module type
Configuration per ship module type

ValueDefinition.Name: DefaultConfigurationName
ValueDefinition.Description: This is e.g. displayed to the player as the default name of this shipyard config, which get created when building a new shipyard

ValueDefinition.Name: CategoryOrder
ValueDefinition.Description: normal sorting order of techs (by categories)

ValueDefinition.Name: WarningKnowledgeThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: If the global knowledge value is equal or bigger than the configured value, the game will start to show warnings for the tech tree

ValueDefinition.Name: WarningEmptyQueueInterval
ValueDefinition.Description: For how long has the queue to be empty until a warning is shown

ValueDefinition.Name: FeatureUnlockThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum of global knowledge to unlock the feature and the UI

ValueDefinition.Name: VisibleTechName
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the tech when it is visible but not yet researchable (tech is locked)

ValueDefinition.Name: VisibleTechDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Description of the tech when it is visible but not yet researchable (tech is locked)

ValueDefinition.Name: ResearchableTechName
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the tech while it can be researched (tech is unlocked)

ValueDefinition.Name: ResearchableTechDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Description of the tech while it can be researched (tech is unlocked)

ValueDefinition.Name: TechName
ValueDefinition.Description: Name of the tech after it has been researched

ValueDefinition.Name: TechDescription
ValueDefinition.Description: Description of the tech after it has been researched

ValueDefinition.Name: TechVisibilityTrigger
ValueDefinition.Description: which trigger unhides the tech?

ValueDefinition.Name: IsRepeatable
ValueDefinition.Description: tech can never reach researched state, rewards can be earned multiple times

ValueDefinition.Name: KnowledgeNeeded
ValueDefinition.Description: how much knowledge is needed to research this tech

ValueDefinition.Name: RepeatableCostFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: Repeatable techs can increase their costs (KnowledgeNeeded * RepeatableCostFactor^TimesFinished)

ValueDefinition.Name: Rewards
Resources
ValueDefinition.Description: Only Meta Resources are allowed

ValueDefinition.Name: Effects
EffectAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: Only Effects with scope Meta or Objects in Meta are allowed. And not timed Effects.
Effects will be active on research

ValueDefinition.Name: ItemAsset
ValueDefinition.Description: Item is added to global inventory
when the research progress reaches 100% these rewards are generated

ValueDefinition.Name: IsGate
ValueDefinition.Description: When set to true, this tech is shown as a gate in the UI. Gates have special unlock conditions to unlock the surrounding techs

ValueDefinition.Name: InfoTipOverride
ValueDefinition.Description: If an infotip is configured here, it will be used instead of the usual infotip configured in the techtreescene

ValueDefinition.Name: TechInfoImage
ValueDefinition.Description: icon is shown as image in infotip of tech

ValueDefinition.Name: NotificationBannerImage
ValueDefinition.Description: Image that shows the unlock or referenced building as a nice 3D asset in the notification

ValueDefinition.Name: Culture
ValueDefinition.Description: Indicates if this is a roman or celtic tech. Only used for different decorations in the UI

Property.Name: UnlockNextList
Property.Description: used as reward to unlock the next not yet unlocked entry in a sorted list

ValueDefinition.Name: UnlockOrder
ValueDefinition.Description: sorted list of rewards that are unlocked in this order

ValueDefinition.Name: LocalEffects
ValueDefinition.Description: Local effects that get activated when this deity is chosen as patron. UI will only show the first two effects!

ValueDefinition.Name: AssignmentSound
ValueDefinition.Description: Sound that is played when the deity is being assigned to an area

ValueDefinition.Name: RomanizationType
ValueDefinition.Description: What type of romanization will be strengthened by choosing this parton

ValueDefinition.Name: WarningBeliefThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: If the local belief of an island is bigger or equal to this value and there is no deity set, the feature bar will show an error

ValueDefinition.Name: FeatureUnlockThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: Minimum of global belief to unlock the feature and the UI

ValueDefinition.Name: CompareWithEvaluator
ValueDefinition.Description: Overwrite the comparisonParticipant of the condition with the Evaluator

ValueDefinition.Name: CheckOnEvaluator
ValueDefinition.Description: Check the condition on the Evaluator instead of the Initiator

ValueDefinition.Name: IsBasicMood
ValueDefinition.Description: BasicMood impacts are shown in a separate list at the top of the infotip

ValueDefinition.Name: TrackAsHeroReason
ValueDefinition.Description: If this is true, this reason will reveive a special tracking signal for fulfilling or not fulfilling this reason

ValueDefinition.Name: PerformSound
ValueDefinition.Description: Sound that is played when the player is performing this action through the UI

ValueDefinition.Name: GovernorDecisionToAccept
ValueDefinition.Description: The governor decision that will be triggered for humans, to accept the treaty request

ValueDefinition.Name: OverrideGovernorDecisionToAcceptForPirates
ValueDefinition.Description: If set and the request is coming from a pirate, this governor decision that will be triggered for humans, to accept the treaty request insteda

ValueDefinition.Name: BreakThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: If this threshold value is negatively reached, then the break action will start its countdown until it is performed by.

ValueDefinition.Name: InstantBreakThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: If the diplomacy value for this break action falls below this threshold, then the break action will be immediately performed.

ValueDefinition.Name: BreakThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: If this threshold value is negatively reached, then the break action will start its countdown until it is performed by.

ValueDefinition.Name: InstantBreakThreshold
ValueDefinition.Description: If the diplomacy value for this break action falls below this threshold, then the break action will be immediately performed.

ValueDefinition.Name: OverrideGovernorDecisionToAcceptForPirates
ValueDefinition.Description: If set and the request is coming from a pirate, this governor decision that will be triggered for humans, to accept the treaty request insteda

ValueDefinition.Name: GovernorRequestForAllies
ValueDefinition.Description: The governor request that will be started for all allies being asked to join the war

ValueDefinition.Name: ActionWhenAllyAccepts
ValueDefinition.Description: The action that will be performed if the ally accepts the call to war

ValueDefinition.Name: ActionWhenAllyDeclines
ValueDefinition.Description: The action that will be performed if the ally declines the call to war

ValueDefinition.Name: GovernorDecisionWarThreatPirates
ValueDefinition.Description: The governor request that will be started when a pirate threatens for war instead of declaring war immediately

ValueDefinition.Name: GovernorDecisionToAccept
ValueDefinition.Description: The governor decision that will be triggered for humans, to accept the subjugation

Property.Name: AssemblyFaction

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumSeats
ValueDefinition.Description: Each Faction has a min amount of Seats.

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumSeat
ValueDefinition.Description: Each Faction has a max. amount of seats

ValueDefinition.Name: MinimumPresence
ValueDefinition.Description: each faction should have a min. amount or percentage of the Assembly

ValueDefinition.Name: MaximumPresence
ValueDefinition.Description: each faction should have a max. amount or percentage of the Assembly

ValueDefinition.Name: ProvidedBonus
ValueDefinition.Description: The bonus the faction provided

ValueDefinition.Name: BaseBonus
ValueDefinition.Description: the base amount of bonus the faction provided

ValueDefinition.Name: AdditionalBonus
ValueDefinition.Description: amount of additional bonus per needed seats

ValueDefinition.Name: FactionProviderBuildings
ValueDefinition.Category: Building that provide seats for the faction

Property.Description: Defines an Assembly Faction, part of the corresponding Template

ValueDefinition.Name: ReputationCostFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: The factor to calculate Reputation Cost together with SettlementRights for the Island.

ValueDefinition.Name: MoneyCostFactor
ValueDefinition.Description: This will multiplied with the normal Kontor costs of that island
